Text

Not less lustily than elsewhere is the spruce and jocund Spring revelling in [the Grosse Garten]1-the grosse garten at [Dresden]2-dresden on this May Day . And though there is still in [her]348-her very frolic a disposition to pinch sharply , a certain tartness in [her]348-her green smile , yet [many glad subjects]349-many glad subjects have come forth to do homage to [[her]348-her new Queendom]350-her new queendom . Yes , [many]351-many ; for to - day [the Dresdeners]132-the dresdeners — as [I]0-i am told is [their]132-the dresdeners custom on each fresh May Day — have issued out on foot and in [carriage]352-carriage to welcome [the year 's new sovereign]353-the year 's new sovereign . [They]132-the dresdeners are holding a sort of flower - feast ; [everybody]354-everybody is throwing bouquets to [everybody else]355-everybody else . Above [their]132-the dresdeners heads the trees are breaking into little leaf ; upon [the side - paths]356-the side - paths throng [the foot - passengers]357-the foot - passengers ; along the drives the carriages gaily roll . Here is a very smart turn - out . Surely this must be [the King]358-the king and [the Queen]359-the queen ? Not at all ! It is only [Graf von S.]133-graf von s. reclining with a self - satisfied air alone in [a barouche]360-a barouche , richly filled with choice nosegays , and drawn by four chestnut horses , with a crimson velvet postilion jigging up and down in front , and a crimson velvet outrider trotting bravely behind . [An Englishman]361-an englishman would feel a fool in such a position , but far indeed from a like frame of mind is that of [this splendid and happy German]362-this splendid and happy german . Well , here come [the King]358-the king and [Queen]364-queen really now , with [their]132-the dresdeners mouse - coloured liveries ; come , bowing and smiling with as much affability as if [they]132-the dresdeners were real big royalties ; [no one]365-no one troubling [himself]365-no one to get out of [their]132-the dresdeners way ; not [a policeman to be seen]366-a policeman to be seen ; no open space imperatively cleared , as when [the Princess of [Wales]3-wales]367-the princess of wales comes trotting serenely down [the drive]368-the drive . Here are [soldiers]369-soldiers in plenty ; but [soldiers thinking for the most part neither of war nor beer]370-soldiers thinking for the most part neither of war nor beer ; [soldiers with [their]371-soldiers with their martial hands full of innocent daffodillies and fresh sweet nancies martial hands full of innocent daffodillies and fresh sweet Nancies]371-soldiers with their martial hands full of innocent daffodillies and fresh sweet nancies . Gardereiters in [their]371-soldiers with their martial hands full of innocent daffodillies and fresh sweet nancies light blue uniforms and flat blue caps , pricking hither and thither on [their]371-soldiers with their martial hands full of innocent daffodillies and fresh sweet nancies sleek horses , carrying bouquets of roses , azaleas , deutzias , hyacinths , and seeking here and there with grave gray eyes for [the happy fair ones for whom [they]371-soldiers with their martial hands full of innocent daffodillies and fresh sweet nancies are destined]372-the happy fair ones for whom they are destined . Two bands are clashing merrily out ; a great booming thump on the big drum makes the horses start and fidget . Now , for a change , comes a real English turn - out . [One]373-one need not look twice to decide its nationality . [The square - sitting , bolt - upright servants]374-the square - sitting , bolt - upright servants in [their]374-the square - sitting , bolt - upright servants quiet liveries ; the plain but shining harness ; the great glossy - coated bays stepping together like one horse — who can doubt concerning [them]132-the dresdeners ? Now more English in [hired carriages]375-hired carriages ; but do not judge [us]376-we by these , [O kind Saxons]377-o kind saxons ; these are not [our]376-we best ! And yet it is in one of [these very hired carriages]378-these very hired carriages that are sitting [a pair of young women , of whom [[their]379-a pair of young women , of whom their england has no need to be ashamed , and who are not at all ashamed of themselves England]380-their england has no need to be ashamed , and who are not at all ashamed of [themselves]379-a pair of young women , of whom their england has no need to be ashamed , and who are not at all ashamed of themselves]379-a pair of young women , of whom their england has no need to be ashamed , and who are not at all ashamed of themselves . Not that the present is [their]379-a pair of young women , of whom their england has no need to be ashamed , and who are not at all ashamed of themselves happiest moment , for the expression of one face is cross , and of the other anxious . " Shall [we]376-we go [home]2345-home , [Belinda]134-belinda ? "[381-the cross one] asks [the cross one]381-the cross one morosely . " Why , [we]376-we have only just come ! "[134-belinda] objects [Belinda]134-belinda . [A Russian carriage]382-a russian carriage passes ; a coachman with a hat like a beefeater and a long cloth frock pulled in with gathers at the waist . Then [more Germans]383-more germans , with bunches of narcissus at [their]383-more germans horses ' ears , and in [[their]383-more germans [servants]385-servants]384-their servants ' breasts . Now a Gardereiter perched on the box of [a coach]386-a coach , driving six - in - hand , and with [a confiding lady in a pink bonnet beside [him]388-him tranquilly enjoying [her]389-her position nor any wise distrubed by the hopeless muddle into which [[her]389-her hero]390-her hero has got [his]390-her hero innumerable reins]387-a confiding lady in a pink bonnet beside him tranquilly enjoying her position nor any wise distrubed by the hopeless muddle into which her hero has got his innumerable reins . [Another blue Gardereiter]391-another blue gardereiter flings [her]391-another blue gardereiter a bouquet , but it is ill - aimed , falls upon [the road]392-the road , and the wheels pass over it . This sight is too much for the fortitude of [[Belinda]134-belinda 's sister]393-belinda 's sister . " [I]391-another blue gardereiter must take some desperate step to attract attention , "[391-another blue gardereiter] [she]391-another blue gardereiter says crossly , yet with a vein of humor streaking [her]391-another blue gardereiter ill- temper ; " what do [you]390-her hero recommend ? Shall [I]391-another blue gardereiter be frightened at the big drum , and give a loud shriek , or will [you]390-her hero ? "[391-another blue gardereiter] " Certainly not [I]391-another blue gardereiter ! "[391-another blue gardereiter] " [I]391-another blue gardereiter can not think what has happened to [them]2346-they ! [they]2346-they must be wrong in [their]2346-they heads . Are [you]390-her hero aware that [not one of [them]2346-they]2347-not one of them has thrown [us]2348-us a single bouquet ? "[391-another blue gardereiter] " Why should [they]2346-they ? "[134-belinda] answers [Belinda]134-belinda ; " [we]2348-us know [none of [them]2346-they]2349-none of them . "[134-belinda] " Even though [they]2346-they do not know [us]2348-us , [they]2346-they might toss [us]2348-us a handful of flowers , "[135-sarah] says [Sarah]135-sarah grumblingly . " [I]135-sarah am sure [we]2348-us look wistful enough , and that requires no great amount of acquaintance ! "[135-sarah] " [I]134-belinda should think it extremely impertinent if [they]2346-they did ! "[134-belinda] replies [Belinda]134-belinda loftily . The other pouts . " For [my]134-belinda part , [them]2346-they , [I]134-belinda wish that [they]2346-they would begin to be impertinent at once ! "[134-belinda] But for such insolence [the Saxon army]394-the saxon army appears to have no sort of bent . In silence [the neglected girls]395-the neglected girls drive on . And the sun shines , and the east wind blows , and the big drum booms , and the great brass instruments blare , and still [they]395-the neglected girls trot round the bit of dull water , up [the straight drives]396-the straight drives , past [the Museum of Antiquities]397-the museum of antiquities . A rain of spring nosegays falls around [them]395-the neglected girls , but not one is aimed at [[their]395-the neglected girls humble landau]398-their humble landau ; not one drops , even by accident , into [their]395-the neglected girls empty laps . Here come [the King]358-the king and [Queen]364-queen again ; [the mouse - coloured and silver outriders]401-the mouse - coloured and silver outriders ; [the suave and middle - aged pair of little royalties]402-the suave and middle - aged pair of little royalties . The gloom on [Sarah]135-sarah 's face deepens , and even in [Belinda]134-belinda 's eyes the anxious , seeking look has grown intensified . If [they]395-the neglected girls know [no one in this gay foreign throng]403-no one in this gay foreign throng , whom is [she]134-belinda seeking ? " After all , "[134-belinda] [she]134-belinda presently says , " [you]135-sarah knew , [Sarah]135-sarah , when [you]135-sarah were so anxious to come , that [we]395-the neglected girls should meet [no acquaintance]2350-no acquaintance [here]2351-here except [Professor Forth]136-professor forth , and — "[134-belinda] Well , and why is not [he]404-his here , pray ? " cries [Sarah]135-sarah , with a burst of genuine ill- humour that seems sensibly to ease [her]135-sarah . "[134-belinda] Did not [I]0-i order [him]404-his to be punctual to the moment ? Even [he]404-his would be better than nothing ! " [Belinda]134-belinda smiles ironically . "[134-belinda] That is an enthusiastic form of encomium upon [the man that [you]0-i are going to marry]405-the man that you are going to marry ! " But [Sarah]135-sarah does not heed . [Her]135-sarah eyes are directed to the side walk , where [the brisk foot - passengers]2352-the brisk foot - passengers pass and repass . "[404-his] There [he]404-his is ! " [she]135-sarah cries in a disgusted voice ; "[404-his] certainly there is no mistaking [him]404-his ! Did [you]0-i ever see such a gait in [your]0-i life ? Look at [him]404-his slouching along on [his]404-his great flat feet ! " [Belinda]134-belinda looks as directed ; and sure enough , amid [the strapping soldiers erect and tall]2353-the strapping soldiers erect and tall , detects without difficulty a slovenly middle - aged figure , clerical , if [you]0-i judge by its coat ; scholarly , if [you]0-i decide by its spectacles . With [his]404-his hands behind [him]404-his , and [his]404-his hat set somewhat on the back of [his]404-his head , [he]404-his is mooning absently along . "[404-his] Is it possible ? " cries [Sarah]135-sarah , half - rising from [her]135-sarah seat , and in a tone that is almost awful from its ire . "[404-his] Yes ; it is monstrous ; it is unbelievable ! but it is nevertheless true that [he]404-his has not brought [me]0-i a bouquet after all ! " "[404-his] Yes , [he]404-his has , " replies [Belinda]134-belinda quietly , "[404-his] only it is so small that it requires a keen sight to perceive it . " As [they]2354-their speak , the object of [their]2354-their observation becomes aware of [their]2354-their vicinity , and turning [his]404-his moony scholar 's gaze towards [them]2354-their , awkwardly aims at [them]2354-their a tiny bunch of not particularly fresh violets . It falls into [[his]404-his betrothed]2355-his betrothed 's lap , but not long does it remain there . With an angry gesture , and before [Belinda]134-belinda can stop [her]135-sarah , [she]135-sarah has tossed it out into [the road]392-the road ; and [the Gardereiter]2357-the gardereiter , with [his]2357-the gardereiter six black horses , and [[his]2357-the gardereiter confiding companion]2358-his confiding companion , who are just in the act of again passing , drive over [it]2359-it , and grind it into the dust . Thanks , however , to [his]404-his near - sight [the donor]2360-the donor is saved from witnessing this humbling spectacle . "[0-i] [I]0-i am afraid that [my]0-i aim was not good , " [he]404-his says innocently , as [the carriage]2361-the carriage draws up at the side - walk , exploring , as [he]404-his speaks , the interior through [his]404-his spectacles in search of [his]404-his missing posy . "[0-i] [I]0-i fear that the nosegay [I]0-i directed towards [you]406-you must have fallen short , and never reached [you]406-you . " "[0-i] Oh yes , it did , " replies [Sarah]135-sarah , with a sort of ferocious playfulness ; "[0-i] but as it was too large for [me]0-i to carry , [I]0-i put it outside . " "[0-i] How late [you]406-you are ! " cries [Belinda]134-belinda hastily , trying by a rapid change of subject , and a sweet , good - natured smile , to erase the traces of this suave speech . "[406-you] After playing [us]407-us so false , [you]406-you can not expect to find [us]407-us in a very good humor . " "[0-i] [I]0-i was delayed by an accident , " replies [the lover]2362-the lover irritably . "[0-i] [I]0-i found the east wind so very much keener than [I]0-i was aware of"—shivering a little and buttoning [his]2362-the lover coat more tightly over [his]2362-the lover narrow chest—"that[0-i] , as [I]0-i am extremely susceptible to cold , [I]0-i was compelled to return to [[my]0-i lodgings]408-my lodgings for a second overcoat . [Sarah]135-sarah knows"—with a rather resentful glance at [his]2362-the lover fiancée — "[135-sarah] that [I]0-i am extremely susceptible to cold . " But [Sarah]135-sarah heeds [him]2362-the lover no more than [she]135-sarah does the east wind of which [he]2362-the lover complains . "[0-i] Ah ! Bravo ! " [she]135-sarah is crying joyfully , as another bouquet — a real one this time — large as a Cheshire cheese , fragrant as a hot - house , choice and costly as should be young [Love]137-love 's tribute , come flying into [the carriage]2361-the carriage . [She]135-sarah has stretched out both hands to grasp it ; no doubt as to its destination troubling [her]135-sarah triumph , although to a looker - on it would have seemed as if it were aimed more at [the other sister]2364-the other sister , at [Belinda]134-belinda , who has also half - stretched out [her]134-belinda hands , but has quickly withdrawn them , and turned with patient attention , though with something of a blank look on [her]134-belinda face , to [the Professor]2365-the professor 's fretful sarcasms on the absurdity of an al fresco entertainment in such weather . But though [he]2362-the lover misses nothing in [her]134-belinda civil listening , though [her]134-belinda head is turned towards [him]2362-the lover , and quite averted from [[her]134-belinda sister]2366-her sister , yet [her]134-belinda ears miss no one syllable of [that sister]2367-that sister 's exuberant thanks . "[0-i] Come near , that [I]0-i may bless [you]409-you ! " [she]134-belinda hears [her]134-belinda cry coquettishly . "[409-you] [You]409-you see [I]0-i have not a hand to give [you]409-you ; but [you]409-you must blame [yourself]409-you for that . What a giant it is ! How fresh ! How good ! " — evidently smelling it . "[409-you] It has quite put [me]0-i into good - humour again with this odious entertainment . [I]0-i assure [you]409-you [I]0-i never was so flouted in [my]0-i life . What boors [they]410-they are ! How different it would have been if [they]410-they had been [Frenchmen]411-frenchmen ! " etc . ,etc . Perhaps it is that [her]134-belinda volubility leaves no space for answers from [the person [she]134-belinda addresses]2368-the person she addresses . Certain it is that [he]2368-the person she addresses is strangely silent . Is it not odd to accept gratitude so bounteous with so entire a dumbness ? In pondering on this problem , [Belinda]134-belinda presently loses the thread of [the Professor]2365-the professor 's plaints ; awakes from [her]134-belinda musing to find [him]2368-the person she addresses first gazing at [her]134-belinda with surprised offence , then gone ; then succeeded in [his]2368-the person she addresses station at the carriage - door by [some one]2370-some one ; [some one else who has no spectacles , who does not stoop nor cower before the east wind]2371-some one else who has no spectacles , who does not stoop nor cower before the east wind ; [some one young]2372-some one young , in short — word of splendid compass ! [He]2368-the person she addresses is young : not with the conventional youth loosely assigned by [society]2373-society to [any unmarried male under eighty , but really young]2374-any unmarried male under eighty , but really young ; [some one who three - and - twenty years ago]2375-some one who three - and - twenty years ago did not exist . [Who that was not young and callow]2376-who that was not young and callow would be staring at [her]134-belinda with all [his]2368-the person she addresses eyes , and saying aggrievedly under [his]2368-the person she addresses breath : "[412-you] Why did [you]412-you not catch it ? [You]412-you knew [I]0-i meant it for [you]412-you ! " [She]134-belinda looks back at [him]2368-the person she addresses : a happy , red smile warming the face that [men]2377-men have often blamed as chill and high . "[0-i] [I]0-i did [my]0-i best ! " "[0-i] What are [you]413-you two gabbling about ? " cries [Sarah]135-sarah restlessly , cutting ruthlessly short a sentence of [[her]135-sarah betrothed]2378-her betrothed 's . "[413-you] Are [you]413-you saying anything about [me]0-i ? Ah ! [I]0-i see [you]413-you both look guilty ! " Neither undeceives [her]134-belinda . A quarter of an hour later [the two girls]2379-the two girls are bowling homewards to [[their]2379-the two girls grand - mamma]2380-their grand - mamma and [[their]2379-the two girls apartment in [the Lüttichau Strasse]4-the lüttichau strasse]2381-their apartment in the lüttichau strasse , leaving behind [them]2379-the two girls [the King]358-the king , [the Queen]359-the queen , [the Graf von S.]133-graf von s. in [his]133-graf von s. barouche , and [the brave soldiers]2384-the brave soldiers , both blue and green . [Belinda]134-belinda has bent [her]134-belinda delicate head , and is laying [her]134-belinda cheek most tenderly against the blossoms in [[her]134-belinda sister]2366-her sister 's lap . "[413-you] Let [me]0-i beg of [you]413-you not to mumble them , " cries [Sarah]135-sarah politely , interposing a prohibitory hand . "[0-i] [You]413-you always seem to have an idea that flowers ought to be eaten . " Then , seeing a quite unaccountable flash of indignation in [[her]134-belinda sister]2366-her sister 's eyes , adds generously : "[413-you] If they were not all wired , as [I]0-i see they are , [I]0-i would spare [you]413-you an orchid or two . " "[0-i] Would [you]0-i indeed ! " replies [Belinda]134-belinda ironically . But further than this [her]134-belinda magnanimous silence does not give way . A night has passed since [the Professor]2365-the professor 's damaged violets bit the dust . It is now morning , and at the window of [[her]134-belinda bedroom]2388-her bedroom in [the Lüttichau Strasse]2389-the lüttichau strasse , with the sash flung high ( to the deep astonishment of the German Dienstmädchen , to whom the smell of [an unaired room]2390-an unaired room , further flavoured with departed sausages and old beer , is as dear as to the rest of [[her]134-belinda nation]2391-her nation ) , [Belinda]134-belinda sits , the sun warming [her]134-belinda hair , and the tart air freshening [her]134-belinda face . [She]134-belinda is looking fixedly out on the pear - tree in [the garden - scrap below]2392-the garden - scrap below — the pear - tree that a week ago was pinchedly struggling into flower , that has been daily whitening ever since , and now seems to stagger under its burden of blossom - snow . Yet [I]0-i doubt whether [she]134-belinda sees it . "[0-i] Is it possible ? " [she]134-belinda is saying to [herself]134-belinda , almost with awe — the awe that a great joy gives—"is[0-i] it possible ? " A slight noise makes [her]134-belinda turn [her]134-belinda head and see the tall white door open to admit [[her]134-belinda sister]2366-her sister . "[0-i] Are [you]414-you alone ? " says [the latter]2394-the latter , cautiously peeping . "[414-you] Of course [I]0-i am alone , " replies [Belinda]134-belinda crossly . "[0-i] Am [I]0-i in the habit of receiving in [[my]0-i bedroom]415-my bedroom ? " This not particularly gracious answer is , however , quite enough for [Sarah]135-sarah , who forthwith enters , and steps friskily across the sunshiny parquet , looking as clean as a cherry , as pink and white as a May - bush . "[0-i] The moment is apparently not a propitious one , " [she]134-belinda says , laughing , and drawing a chair close up to [[her]134-belinda sister]2366-her sister 's kness ; "[0-i] but as [my]0-i need is sore , [I]0-i am afraid [I]0-i can not afford to wait for a better . [I]0-i have come , [[my]0-i Belinda]416-my belinda , to ask a favour of [you]414-you . " "[0-i] Then [you]414-you may go away again at once , " replies [Belinda]134-belinda with surly decision , "[414-you] for [I]0-i tell [you]414-you , once for all , [I]0-i will not grant it ! " "[0-i] What ! refuse even before [you]414-you hear what it is ? " cries [the other]2396-the other , lifting those brows which nature , slightly abetted , perhaps , by a pair of tweezers , has drawn in the thinnest straight line across [her]2396-the other wrinkleless forehead . "[414-you] Do [you]414-you think [I]0-i do not recognise that well - known formula ? " asks [Belinda]134-belinda severely . "[414-you] [I]0-i am sure that [I]0-i have heard it often enough . It means that [you]414-you expect [me]0-i to tell [Professor Forth]136-professor forth that [you]414-you have every intention of jilting [him]136-professor forth ! " "[0-i] [You]0-i word it coarsely , " replies [Sarah]135-sarah composedly ; "[0-i] but [I]0-i have heard worse guesses . " "[0-i] Then [I]0-i absolutely and flatly refuse [the office]417-the office ! " rejoins [Belinda]134-belinda firmly . "[0-i] Why [you]414-you engaged [yourself]414-you to [him]136-professor forth in the first instance — " "[414-you] Why indeed ? " interrupts [the other]2396-the other , casting up both eyes and hands to heaven . "[0-i] [You]0-i may well ask ! " "[0-i] And yet , " pursues [Belinda]134-belinda , regarding [[her]134-belinda sister]2366-her sister with an air of stern wonder , "[414-you] when [you]414-you wrote to announce [your]414-you engagement to [me]0-i , [you]414-you said that [you]414-you did not know what [you]414-you had done to deserve such happiness ! " "[414-you] [I]0-i did not — [I]0-i did not ! " cries [Sarah]135-sarah , reddening for once with genuine shame , and putting [her]135-sarah fingers before [her]135-sarah face . "[0-i] Do not say it ; it is not true ! It was not about [him]136-professor forth ; it was one of [the others]418-the others ! " "[418-the others] One of [the others]418-the others ! " echoes [Belinda]134-belinda , scornfully curling up [her]135-sarah fine nose . "[418-the others] How pleasant and dignified to be bandied about ! [One of [the others]418-the others]420-one of the others ! " "[418-the others] It may not be dignified , " replies [Sarah]135-sarah impudently , though under the lash of [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister 's words even [her]135-sarah throat has crimsoned , "[418-the others] but it is not so very unpleasant ! " "[0-i] [You]0-i know , " continues [Belinda]134-belinda sternly , "[0-i] that [I]0-i took a solemn oath to wash [my]0-i hands of [your]0-i affairs , last time , when [I]0-i had that painful scene with poor young Manners , and [he]136-professor forth walked round [the room]422-the room on [his]136-professor forth knees after [me]0-i , clutching [my]0-i skirts and sobbing ! " "[136-professor forth] [He]136-professor forth always sobbed ! " interjects [Sarah]135-sarah hard - heartedly . "[136-professor forth] [I]0-i have seen [him]136-professor forth cry like a pump ! " "[136-professor forth] [I]0-i have already told [six men]423-six men that [you]0-i had only been making fools of [them]423-six men , " continues [the elder sister]2400-the elder sister , contemptuously passing by [[her]0-i junior]2401-her junior 's lame attempt at palliation . "[138-six] [Six]138-six ! Come now , gently . " "[0-i] [I]0-i repeat , six ! In fact , [I]0-i think [I]0-i am rather understating it ; and [I]0-i will not tell a seventh ! " "[0-i] A seventh ! ! ! " "[0-i] If [you]0-i imply that [I]0-i am exaggerating , [I]0-i am quite willing to count . First"—checking off on [her]0-i long white fingers , beginning with the thumb—"first[139-young manners] , [young Manners]139-young manners ! " "[139-young manners] [We]424-we have had [him]136-professor forth once already ! " "[139-young manners] Second"—travelling on to the forefinger — "[140-colonel greene] [Colonel Greene]140-colonel greene . [Poor fellow]425-poor fellow ! [he]136-professor forth sobbed too ! " "[136-professor forth] More shame for him!"—brazenly . "[139-young manners] Third , [the young clergyman whom [you]0-i picked up at the seaside , and whose name [I]0-i never can remember]426-the young clergyman whom you picked up at the seaside , and whose name i never can remember . " "[0-i] No more can [I]0-i ! " cries [Sarah]135-sarah , with animation . "[0-i] How strange ! Pooh ! What was it again ? Did it begin with a B ? " "[141-old lord blucher] Fourth , " continues [Belinda]134-belinda relentlessly , arriving at [her]134-belinda third finger — "[141-old lord blucher] fourth , [old Lord Blucher]141-old lord blucher , who was so deaf that [I]0-i could not get [him]141-old lord blucher to understand what [I]0-i meant . " But [Sarah]135-sarah 's light mind is still on the track of [[her]135-sarah lover]2402-her lover 's lost initial . "[0-i] [I]0-i am almost sure that it began with an L ! " [she]0-i says thoughtfully . "[0-i] Fifth"—extending [her]0-i little finger — "[142-mr. brabazon] [Mr. Brabazon]142-mr. brabazon . " "[142-mr. brabazon] [You]0-i counted [him]142-mr. brabazon before ! " "[0-i] [I]0-i did not ! " "[0-i] [I]0-i think [you]0-i did . " "[0-i] [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i did not ; but , to make certain , [we]427-we will begin all over again . First"—returning to [her]0-i thumb—"poor[427-we] young Manners — " "[427-we] Stop ! " cries [Sarah]135-sarah loudly , putting [her]135-sarah fingers in [her]135-sarah ears , and abandoning the search for [the young clergyman]2403-the young clergyman 's name . "[0-i] [I]0-i will grant that there were six , sixteen , sixty — anything to put an end to that intolerable arithmetic of [yours]428-you ! " [Belinda]134-belinda is preparing to begin on [her]134-belinda other hand , but at this concession [she]134-belinda lets [them]2404-them both drop in [her]134-belinda lap , and ceases counting . There is a silence . [Sarah]135-sarah 's roving eyes are despondently fastened on the white earthenware stove , and [Belinda]134-belinda 's large grave gaze is straying through the window , taking in at once the poetry of the blooming pear - tree and the prose of [the Bohemian railway]2405-the bohemian railway , and [the ugly straight stuccoed houses beyond [it]2405-the bohemian railway]2406-the ugly straight stuccoed houses beyond it . "[428-you] What could have been [your]428-you inducement in this case , " [she]0-i says presently , turning with a judicial air to [the offender]2407-the offender , "[428-you] [I]0-i am quite at a loss to conjecture ; it certainly could have been neither pleasure nor profit ! " "[428-you] It certainly could not , " answers [Sarah]135-sarah , sighing profoundly , and wagging [her]135-sarah head from side to side ; "[428-you] anyone who saw [him]429-him would exonerate [me]0-i from the suspicion of either motive ! " "[428-you] Such a conquest could not have even gratified [your]428-you vanity ! " pursues [Belinda]134-belinda relentlessly . "[428-you] Yes , but it did ! " replies [Sarah]135-sarah , abandoning [her]135-sarah dispirited pose , and speaking with an animation which shows that [she]135-sarah does not altogether relish this wholesale depreciation of [[her]135-sarah latest victim]2408-her latest victim ; "[428-you] [you]428-you may not think much of [him]429-him , but [I]0-i can assure [you]428-you that [he]429-him is considered [a great luminary at [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge]430-a great luminary at oxbridge . At [the house where [I]0-i met [him]429-him [they]432-they could not make enough of [him]429-him]431-the house where i met him they could not make enough of him ; it seems [he]429-him has written a book upon the Digamma ! " "[429-him] And what is the Digamma ? " asks [Belinda]134-belinda curtly , totally unmoved by this evidence of erudition . "[0-i] [You]0-i do not know what [the Digamma]6-the digamma is ? " cries [Sarah]135-sarah , lifting [her]135-sarah eyebrows , and speaking with an air of pompous astonishment . "[0-i] Well , then , " breaking into a laugh , and even demeaning [herself]0-i so far as to be guilty of the faintest possible shadow of a wink , "[429-him] to tell [you]428-you a secret , no more do [I]0-i ! " "[0-i] [You]428-you can not live upon [the Digamma]6-the digamma , [I]0-i suppose ! " says [Belinda]134-belinda grimly , not much infected by [[her]134-belinda sister]2366-her sister 's mirth . "[0-i] [I]0-i should be very sorry to try ! " still laughing . "[0-i] Then [I]0-i am quite as much in the dark as ever ! " rejoins [the other]2396-the other , inexorably grave . "[0-i] Well , it was not only [the Digamma]6-the digamma , of course , " says [Sarah]135-sarah , frowning in reluctant retrospect ; "[0-i] though , as far as [I]0-i could make out , that appeared to be [his]433-his cheval de bataille ; but [he]433-his was looked upon as [a genius]434-a genius generally . [You]428-you should have seen how [they]435-they all sat at [his]433-his feet — such feet ! — and hung on [his]433-his words . There was [one girl]436-one girl — [she]436-one girl was at [Girton]7-girton — who waited on [him]433-his hand and foot ; [she]436-one girl always warmed [his]433-his great - coat for [him]433-his , and helped [him]433-his on with [his]433-his goloshes ! " "[436-one girl] Well ? " "[436-one girl] Well , [you]428-you know , " impatiently , as if stating something too obvious to be contradicted , "[436-one girl] [one]373-one would not have been human if [one]373-one could have stood calmly by , and looked on . [I]0-i rushed into the fray . [I]0-i too warmed [his]433-his great - coat and put on [his]433-his goloshes . Ugh ! what a size [they]439-they were ! [I]0-i could have lived roomily and commodiously in one of [them]439-they ! " "[0-i] Well ? " "[0-i] Well , indeed ! [I]0-i do not call it at all well ! [I]0-i call it very ill ! " "[0-i] There [I]0-i have the good fortune thoroughly to agree with [you]428-you . " "[0-i] Well , as [I]0-i was saying , " resuming the thread of [her]0-i narrative with a heavy sigh , "[0-i] [I]0-i rushed into the fray . [I]0-i was successful , dreadfully successful ! [You]428-you know the sequel , as [they]439-they say in books . " "[428-you] [I]0-i do not know the sequel , " replies [Belinda]134-belinda sternly ; "[428-you] all [I]0-i know is that [I]0-i will have neither part nor lot in it ! " "[439-they] No ? and yet , " fawningly , "[439-they] it would come so much better from [you]428-you . " "[428-you] Better or worse , it will not come from [me]0-i . " "[428-you] When [you]428-you break it to [them]439-they , " sidling up with a cajoling air , "[428-you] it does not hurt [them]439-they nearly so much ! [I]0-i declare [I]0-i think [they]439-they almost like it ! " No answer . A silence cut into only by the uncouth shriek of [a departing engine]2411-a departing engine . "[0-i] Why at least did [you]428-you drag [him]440-you [here]2351-here ? " asks [Belinda]134-belinda presently , still opposing a front of granite to [[her]134-belinda sister]2366-her sister 's blandishments . "[428-you] [I]0-i am afraid [I]0-i can not quite defend it , " replies [Sarah]135-sarah , in a small voice , and again hanging [her]0-i head ; "[428-you] but , to tell the truth — which indeed [I]0-i always try to do — times were slack ! There was [nobody else]442-nobody else much just then , and [I]0-i thought [I]0-i could at least make [him]440-you fetch and carry ! " Then , with an acute change of key and access of emotion : "[0-i] [I]0-i was grossly deceived ; [he]440-you is too disobliging to fetch , and too much afraid of over - fatiguing [himself]440-you to carry ! " Another pause . A quick wind - whiff tosses through the window a little strom of pear - petals , and throws them on [Belinda]134-belinda 's lap . "[440-you] Now if the cases were reversed , " says [Sarah]135-sarah , kneeling down at [[her]135-sarah senior]2413-her senior 's elbow , and folding [her]135-sarah hands with an extremely insinuating gesture of supplication , "[440-you] if [you]440-you were in difficulties — " "[0-i] [I]0-i never am in difficulties . " [I]0-i do not see much to brag of in that , for [my]0-i part ! "[0-i] springing to [her]0-i feet again . " No more do [I]134-belinda , "[134-belinda] replies [Belinda]134-belinda drily . " [I]134-belinda am never in difficulties , as [you]440-you call [them]2414-them , because [I]134-belinda never have any temptation to be ; perhaps if [I]134-belinda had [I]134-belinda might ; but as [you]440-you are well aware , "[134-belinda] stifling a sigh , " [I]134-belinda have not , and never had , any charm for [men]2377-men ! "[134-belinda] " It is very odd , is not it ? "[135-sarah] says [Sarah]135-sarah , not attempting to combat this assertion , but looking at [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister with an expression of compassionate curiosity . " [I]134-belinda can not think why it is . [I]134-belinda have often wondered what the reason could be ; sometimes [I]134-belinda think it is [your]2366-her sister nose ! "[134-belinda] " [My]134-belinda nose ? "[134-belinda] repeats [Belinda]134-belinda hastily , involuntarily glancing round in search of a mirror , and putting up [her]134-belinda hand to [her]134-belinda face ; " what is the matter with [my]134-belinda nose ? "[134-belinda] " There is nothing the matter with it , "[135-sarah] rejoins [Sarah]135-sarah , still speculatively gauging [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister 's attractions ; " perhaps it would be better for [you]2366-her sister if there were ; it is only too good ! [I]135-sarah can not fancy [any man venturing to love such a nose]2416-any man venturing to love such a nose ; it looks too high and mighty to inspire anything short of veneration ! "[135-sarah] " It is not so very high either ! "[134-belinda] cries [Belinda]134-belinda hurriedly , drawing from [her]134-belinda pocket a very fine handkerchief , and applying a corner of it in careful measurement to [her]134-belinda traduced feature . " There ! "[134-belinda] marking off a small portion with [her]134-belinda thumb ; " only that much . "[134-belinda] " It is not a case of measurement , "[135-sarah] says [Sarah]135-sarah gravely ; " [I]135-sarah have seen noses several hands higher that were not nearly so alarming . It is a case of feeling ; somehow [yours]2366-her sister makes [them]2417-them feel small . Take [my]135-sarah word for it , "[135-sarah] with a shrewd look , " the one thing that [they]2417-them never can either forgive or forget is to be made to feel small . "[134-belinda] [Belinda]134-belinda laughs , a little bitterly . " It is clear , then that nothing short of amputation could make [me]134-belinda attractive , and [I]134-belinda am afraid even that might fail ; but [I]134-belinda do not know why [we]2418-we digressed to [me]134-belinda at all . "[134-belinda] " [I]135-sarah had a little plan , "[135-sarah] says [Sarah]135-sarah , [her]135-sarah airy gaiety giving sudden place again to gloom at the returning thought of [her]135-sarah own sorrows ; " but [you]134-belinda have frightened it away . "[135-sarah] " What is it ? "[134-belinda] very shortly . " Well , [you]134-belinda know , "[135-sarah] instantly resuming [her]135-sarah wheedling air and [her]135-sarah coaxing posture at [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister 's knees , " that [we]2418-we are going to drive to [Moritzburg]8-moritzburg to - day , [you]134-belinda and [I.]134-belinda Of course [Professor Forth]136-professor forth , "[135-sarah] with a slight grimace , " will be on duty there to meet [us]2418-we ; equally of course , [young Rivers]143-rivers , who seems to have contracted a not altogether reprehensible habit of dogging [our]2418-we steps , will be [there]2419-there too , "[135-sarah] " Well ? "[135-sarah] averting [her]135-sarah head a little . " Well , [I]135-sarah thought — but [you]134-belinda are not [a pleasant person]2420-a pleasant person to unfold one 's little schemes to — [I]135-sarah thought that for once [you]134-belinda might be obliging , and pair off casually with [[my]135-sarah dear]2421-my dear , and take an opportunity of softly breathing to [him]2421-my dear that [nobody]2422-nobody — [I]135-sarah least of all — will try to stop [him]2421-my dear if [he]2421-my dear effects a graceful retreat to [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge and [the Digamma]6-the digamma ! "[135-sarah] " And meanwhile [you]134-belinda ? "[135-sarah] in a rather low and suppressed voice , and with face still turned away . " And meanwhile [I]135-sarah , "[135-sarah] replies [Sarah]135-sarah , jovially , " killing two birds with one stone — keeping [the coast]2423-the coast clear , that is to say , and marking [my]135-sarah gratitude for that haystack of gardenias — shall be straying hand - in - hand through [the vernal woods]2424-the vernal woods with — "[135-sarah] But that sentence is destined never to be ended . [Belinda]134-belinda has risen from [her]134-belinda seat with a gesture so sudden and violent as almost to destroy the equilibrium of [the girl]446-the girl so caressingly propped against [her]134-belinda , and has thrust head and neck out of the window , as if , even in [this fresh room]447-this fresh room , [she]134-belinda gasped for air . It is a moment before [she]134-belinda speaks ; and even then [her]134-belinda voice sounds odd . " [I]134-belinda have already told [you]134-belinda that [I]134-belinda utterly decline to be mixed up in [your]134-belinda entanglements . [I]134-belinda forbid [you]134-belinda to mention the subject to [me]134-belinda again . "[134-belinda] " Whew - w - w - w ! "[135-sarah] says [Sarah]135-sarah by - and - by , in a low key , when [she]135-sarah has recovered the breath reft from [her]135-sarah by stupefaction at [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister 's procedure , enough to speak at all ; remaining seated meanwhile in stunned isolation on [her]135-sarah lonely stool . " Forbid ! What an ugly word ! After all , "[134-belinda] speculatively , " [I]134-belinda am not much surprised that [men]2377-men are frightened at [you]134-belinda . [I]134-belinda am frightened at [you]134-belinda [myself]134-belinda sometimes ; and so no wonder that [they]2377-men shake in [their]2377-men shoes , and dare not call [their]2377-men harmless souls [their]2377-men own . "[134-belinda] " How many times are [you]134-belinda going to tell [me]134-belinda that ? "[134-belinda] cries [Belinda]134-belinda , veering round in sudden passion . " Do [you]134-belinda think that it can be very pleasant to hear that [I]134-belinda can never inspire anything but alarm and aversion ? [I]134-belinda am as well aware of it as [you]134-belinda can be ; but [I]134-belinda am a little tired of hearing it . "[134-belinda] " And [you]134-belinda might inspire such different feelings , "[135-sarah] says [Sarah]135-sarah , in a tone of the purest artistic regret ; " it is a pity to see advantages which would have made [me]135-sarah famous if [I]135-sarah had them , absolutely thrown away upon [you]134-belinda ! [I]135-sarah suppose , "[135-sarah] with a sigh , " that it is the old story of [the people with large appetites and nothing to eat]2426-the people with large appetites and nothing to eat , and [the people with plenty to eat and no appetities]2427-the people with plenty to eat and no appetities . "[135-sarah] A way [they]449-they go to [Moritzburg]8-moritzburg , when the noon sun is warm and high ; away [they]449-they go , handsome , gay , and chaperonless . There is no reason why [[their]449-they grandmother]450-their grandmother , who is [a perfectly able - bodied old lady]451-a perfectly able - bodied old lady , should not escort [them]449-they ; but as [she]450-their grandmother is sixty - five years of age , has no expectation of meeting [a lover]452-a lover , and is quite indifferent to spring tints and [German Schlosses]144-german schlosses , [she]450-their grandmother wisely chooses to stay at [home]2345-home . " If [you]134-belinda can not behave like [young gentle - women]2428-young gentle - women without having [me]450-their grandmother always at [your]134-belinda heels , why , all [I]450-their grandmother can say , [[my]450-their grandmother dears]2429-my dears , is that [I]450-their grandmother am sorry for [you]134-belinda , "[450-their grandmother] is the formula with which [she]450-their grandmother mostly salves [her]450-their grandmother own conscience and dismisses [them]449-they . The result is perhaps not worse than that of more pretentious exhortations ; for [the girls , having a sense of being on parole]454-the girls , having a sense of being on parole , do behave like [young gentlewomen]455-young gentlewomen : at least [Belinda]134-belinda always does , and [Sarah]135-sarah very often . [They]454-the girls , having a sense of being on parole get into [[their]454-the girls , having a sense of being on parole carriage]456-their carriage in a quick and cautious manner ; casting , meanwhile , apprehensive glances towards [a house]457-a house a good deal lower down [the street]458-the street , and which [they]454-the girls , having a sense of being on parole will be obliged to pass . " [Sarah]135-sarah , "[134-belinda] says [Belinda]134-belinda impressively , unconsciously speaking half under [her]134-belinda breath , " if [you]135-sarah hear a window open , mind [you]135-sarah do not look that way . [She]450-their grandmother is quite capable of bawling at [us]454-the girls , having a sense of being on parole from [the balcony]2430-the balcony ; and if [she]450-their grandmother finds out where [we]454-the girls , having a sense of being on parole are going to , [she]450-their grandmother is certain to insist on coming too . "[134-belinda] " If [she]450-their grandmother gets into [this carriage]2431-this carriage to - day , "[135-sarah] replies [Sarah]135-sarah firmly , " it will be over [my]135-sarah dead body ! "[135-sarah] and away [they]454-the girls , having a sense of being on parole go . With lowered parasols and held breath , [they]454-the girls , having a sense of being on parole pass [the dreaded house]459-the dreaded house — pass [it]459-the dreaded house in safety . Not a sound issues from [its]459-the dreaded house silent casements . Away [they]454-the girls , having a sense of being on parole go , across [the Elbe]9-the elbe , over the many - arched bridge , where [the people]460-the people , more leisurely than in [[our]461-our breathless [London]10-london]462-our breathless london , are standing to watch the rafts floating down [the river]463-the river , and guided between the piles ; through [the Neustadt]11-the neustadt , where the Strong August for ever prances in bronze ; past [the Leipzig Railway Station]464-the leipzig railway station , under [the Acacia alley]465-the acacia alley , leaving on [their]454-the girls , having a sense of being on parole right [the great , new , dreary barracks]466-the great , new , dreary barracks , backed by [the pine - wood]467-the pine - wood ; along , along , between the young birches that , silver - turnked , baby - leaved , stand on each side of the way ; off a - pleasuring into [the country]468-the country . [They]454-the girls , having a sense of being on parole do not talk much — at least to [each other]469-each other . To [herself]470-her , [Belinda]134-belinda is saying over and over the same one thing continuously : " [He]2432-he will not be there ! [I]470-her do not at all expect [him]2432-he . "[470-her] [She]470-her says it superstitiously , in the trembling hope that if [she]470-her can cajole [the envious gods]471-the envious gods into believing that [she]470-her does not count upon it , [they]471-the envious gods may let [her]470-her have [her]470-her wish . " [He]2432-he will not be there ! "[471-the envious gods] But [her]470-her racing pulse and [her]470-her flushing cheeks say differently ; differently too say the wedded birds and the springing grasses and the opening buds . [They]454-the girls , having a sense of being on parole say all together : " [He]2432-he will be there ! [He]2432-he will — [he]2432-he will ! "[454-the girls , having a sense of being on parole] But perhaps , besides [him]472-him , there may be [some one else]473-some one else , not quite so eagerly desired . [They]454-the girls , having a sense of being on parole are not far beyond [the town]474-the town , and are joggling tranquilly along in the sunshine , when [Belinda]134-belinda is roused with a start from [her]134-belinda love - musings by an agitated series of ejaculations from [Sarah]135-sarah . " [Belinda]134-belinda ! [She]134-belinda is there ! On [your]134-belinda side . Quick ! Hold down [your]134-belinda parasol ! Perhaps [she]134-belinda may not see [us]454-the girls , having a sense of being on parole . "[135-sarah] Swift as lightning [Belinda]134-belinda has obeyed . Totally irrespective of the sun 's position , [her]134-belinda en - tout - cas stoops till it shields — imperviously , one would think — the inmates of [the carriage]2361-the carriage from [all passers - by on that side]476-all passers - by on that side . But there are eyes , hard , horny , and inquisitive , to which an en - tout - cas — nay , a stone wall , if need be — is as glass . [The coachman]477-the coachman checks [his]477-the coachman horses ; and [Sarah]135-sarah , leaning angrily out to bid [him]477-the coachman drive quicker , perceives that [he]477-the coachman has no alternative , if [he]477-the coachman would not drive over [a burly , middle - aged figure gesticulating with raised arms and waved umbrella in mid - road]478-a burly , middle - aged figure gesticulating with raised arms and waved umbrella in mid - road , and crying : " Halt , [Kutscher]145-kutscher ! "[478-a burly , middle - aged figure gesticulating with raised arms and waved umbrella in mid - road] with all the power of a strong pair of lungs . " It is no use ! "[446-the girl] says [the girl]446-the girl , sinking back in disgusted resignation on the cushions . " It never is any use ! "[446-the girl] The next moment [the lady to whom [she]446-the girl alludes]480-the lady to whom she alludes is presenting a hot , red face , a grizzled fringe of hair , and a large - patterned black and white plaid gown , at the carriage - door . " [I]480-the lady to whom she alludes was afraid [you]134-belinda might not see [me]480-the lady to whom she alludes ! "[480-the lady to whom she alludes] [she]480-the lady to whom she alludes says , shaking hands warmly . " How are [you]134-belinda ? Where are [you]134-belinda going to ? To [Moritzburg]8-moritzburg ? How pleasant ! [I]480-the lady to whom she alludes wish [I]480-the lady to whom she alludes were going to [Moritzburg]8-moritzburg too ! "[480-the lady to whom she alludes] Then , as no invitation follows this very broad hint : " [I]480-the lady to whom she alludes dare say , now , as [you]134-belinda seem to have plenty of room , [you]134-belinda would not mind giving [me]480-the lady to whom she alludes a lift . "[480-the lady to whom she alludes] " It would be delightful ! "[134-belinda] says [Belinda]134-belinda , with suspicious precipitancy ; " but [I]134-belinda am afraid — "[134-belinda] " [I]480-the lady to whom she alludes do not in the least mind sitting back , if that is what [you]134-belinda are going to say . If [you]134-belinda had travelled as much as [I]480-the lady to whom she alludes , it would be all one to [you]134-belinda ! "[480-the lady to whom she alludes] " If [Belinda]134-belinda had travelled as much as [you]134-belinda , "[135-sarah] says [Sarah]135-sarah sarcastically , " [I]135-sarah am sure that [her]134-belinda one hope and prayer would be to be allowed to stay at [home]2345-home for the rest of [her]134-belinda life . Well , "[135-sarah] with a would - be valedictory wave of the hand , " it is too unlucky ; but as [we]2434-we have unfortunately promised to meet [some people]2435-some people — "[135-sarah] " [Some people]2435-some people ! " A form of thanksgiving to be used on [land]2441-land ! "[135-sarah] says [Sarah]135-sarah , drawing a long breath , and blowing a kiss in ironical adieu to [the lessening figure of [[their]484-they baffled friend]485-their baffled friend]483-the lessening figure of their baffled friend . [They]484-they are nearing [their]484-they goal now . Along the straight avenue of young horse - chestnuts and limes [they]484-they trot ; the wind - swept flat plain on either hand , and the long vista of [tree - shaded road]486-tree - shaded road , ended by [the Schloss]17-the schloss . [They]484-they are driving up to [the Gasthof Au Bon Morché]487-the gasthof au bon morché . [Belinda]134-belinda shuts [her]134-belinda eyes . If [he]485-their baffled friend is here , [he]485-their baffled friend will be to be seen at once , or not at all . If [he]485-their baffled friend is not [here]2351-here , [she]134-belinda will be ignorant of it for yet one moment more . [She]134-belinda shuts [her]134-belinda eyes ; but in an instant [Sarah]135-sarah 's sarcastic ejaculation , obviously called forth by the first sight of [[her]135-sarah betrothed]2378-her betrothed , " [[My]134-belinda king]2442-my king ! "[135-sarah] A quarter of an hour later [they]491-them are all seated on deal chairs at a deal table under [a primitive shed]492-a primitive shed that does duty as an arbour , waited on by a civil , homely Dienstmädchen in [a blue bib]493-a blue bib , and eating beefsteaks . At least two of [them]491-them are . Two of [them]491-them are past eating . For [them]491-them the beefsteak cuts juicily ; for [them]491-them the schnitzel swims greasily ; for [them]491-them the excellent light lager - bier foams in lidded mugs — in vain . It is indeed dubious whether [anyone]494-anyone except [Sarah]135-sarah enjoys the luncheon quâ luncheon . [The Professor]2365-the professor is doubtful as to the digestibility of the schnitzel , and more than doubtful as to the prudence of lunching out of doors in a high wind on the 2nd of May. [He]2365-the professor had indeed gone so far as to have luncheon laid in [the little beer - and - smoke - stained [inn parlour]497-inn parlour]496-the little beer - and - smoke - stained inn parlour ; but [[his]2365-the professor betrothed]2355-his betrothed has explained to [him]2365-the professor so kindly yet firmly that if [he]2365-the professor lunches indoors [he]2365-the professor will lunch alone , that [he]2365-the professor has sullenly submitted , merely putting on ostentatiously , one atop of another , the two overcoats which , as [Miss Watson]147-miss watson faithfully reported , [he]2365-the professor had providently brought with [him]2365-the professor . And yet , though the wind is high , it is not spiteful . It rocks playfully the tall oleanders in pots , and swings the little wooden boxes hung in the trees to oblige the birds , who find them a quite satisfactory substitute for [nests]499-nests , judging , at least , by the easy cheerfulness with which the short - tailed , wise - faced starlings go in and out of the tiny apertures . Whether or not it has pleased or been digestible , luncheon is now ended , and [Professor Forth]136-professor forth is surveying the bill through [his]136-professor forth spectacles . " Six marks , sixty pfennigs ! "[136-professor forth] [he]136-professor forth says , proclaiming the total in a tone which announces how very far from content [he]136-professor forth is with it ; " one mark , sixty - five pfennigs a head ! A very high charge , [I]136-professor forth should say ; undoubtedly prices in [Germany]18-germany have doubled since the war ! [Viermal Bifstek]148-viermal bifstek ! "[136-professor forth] reading aloud the items—"as it turned out , zweimal would have been ample . [Zweimal Kartoffeln]149-zweimal kartoffeln — "[136-professor forth] [He]136-professor forth breaks off suddenly , for [Sarah]135-sarah has twitched the paper out of [his]136-professor forth hand . " In mercy spare [us]500-they ! "[135-sarah] [she]135-sarah cries . " What can be more dreadful than the recapitulation of the items of the food one has just swallowed ? It is like beginning luncheon all over again , to which , with [my]135-sarah present feelings , death would be preferable . "[135-sarah] By - and - by [they]500-they set off to visit [the Schloss]17-the schloss — [the four - towered Schloss]501-the four - towered schloss , with [its]17-the schloss round red domes , and all [its]17-the schloss little pinnacles and dormer windows — falling , as [they]500-they go , into [two couples]502-two couples , though this is not accomplished without a slight manoeuvring on the part of [one]373-one . "[143-rivers] " Are [you]143-rivers so sure that [they]500-they are anxious to get a good start ? " [I]134-belinda doubt it ! "[134-belinda] [They]505-they have reached [the Schloss]17-the schloss and [[its]17-the schloss broad slabbed terrace]506-its broad slabbed terrace . [Belinda]134-belinda is leaning on the old stone balustrade , low and weather - worn , that runs round [it]17-the schloss . ' " [The poor boy]2450-the poor boy looks terribly thrown back ; and indeed what [ardent young lover]2451-ardent young lover would not , at such a turn given to a tender speech ? And yet in [her]134-belinda heart [she]134-belinda had felt as tender as [he]2450-the poor boy , though [no human being]2452-no human being could have guessed it . [Both]2453-both now lean [their]2453-both elbows on the balustrade , and look down on the garden grass , and the stiff fir - trees cut into prim yew - shapes ; so that unless [you]2454-you look at [them]2453-both very closely [you]2454-you would swear that they were yews . And beyond the grass and the firs comes the ruffled blue water , which like a broad moat girds [the Schloss]17-the schloss around . The water is running to - day into little waves and ridges ; and trees just greening are verdantly bordering its brim . In [the garden]2455-the garden , beneath the fir - trees a pair of figures are seen soberly pacing . "[508-a wholesome minded and bodied boy of twenty - two] There they are ! " cries [Belinda]134-belinda , pointing to [them]2453-both , and thankful for a safe subject with which to break the strained silence ; "[512-she] is it possible that [she]512-she has taken [his]508-a wholesome minded and bodied boy of twenty - two arm ? " "[508-a wholesome minded and bodied boy of twenty - two] In every well - conditioned stripling , as [I]0-i conjecture , there already blooms [a certain prospective Paradise]514-a certain prospective paradise , cheered by some fairest Eve . " Presently [they]2456-their move , and passing down the slabbed incline , and across [the water]2457-the water into [[the King]358-the king 's garden]2459-the king 's garden , tread very slowly the fine gravel of the broad walk , as sentinels on either hand of which stand heaven - high firs , that yet have been clipped out of all fir semblance , and , like [[their]2456-their brothers]2460-their brothers round [the Schloss]17-the schloss , wear the likeness of yews , cut into such tall narrow sugar - loafs that [[their]2456-their forest kin]2461-their forest kin would disown [them]2456-their . Silently [they]2456-their step along . Perhaps the utter repose , the absence of progress and hurry , the sober stillness of all around , tells sleepily upon [their]2456-their young spirits . Perhaps to [them]2456-their speech is not so easy as it was a month ago . It is [Belinda]134-belinda who resumes the conversation . "[0-i] [I]0-i suppose that it will devolve upon [me]0-i after all ? " [she]0-i says with a sigh . "[0-i] That what will devolve upon [you]0-i ? " asks [Rivers]143-rivers dreamily . [He]143-rivers has forgotten all about [Professor Forth]136-professor forth , and is lost in a sea of speculation as to whether ever woman in [this world]2462-this world before had such a short upper lip . " "[0-i] [You]0-i mean , [I]0-i suppose , " [he]143-rivers says , reddening , "[0-i] that [I]0-i had no business to ask about [them]516-the victims ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i mean what [I]0-i say , neither more nor less : [they]516-the victims do not exist ! " [Her]0-i tone is cold and trenchant , as of one who would check a displeasing topic . In point of fact it is intense shyness — the shyness of hearing [herself]0-i talked about , and talked about by [him]143-rivers — that makes it so ; but to [a listener]2464-a listener it has all the effect of a freezing haughtiness , repressing impudent intrusion . [She]0-i hears it [herself]0-i with bitterness . "[0-i] Is it any wonder that [no one]365-no one has ever loved [me]0-i ? " [she]0-i says internally . It is clear that [he]143-rivers hears it too . "[0-i] [You]0-i are offended , " [he]143-rivers cries miserably . "[0-i] [I]0-i wish to heaven that [I]0-i had never come to - day ! Everything has gone wrong ! "[136-professor forth] On the contrary : [he]136-professor forth recommended [me]0-i not to take any ; [he]136-professor forth said [they]522-they were rancid ! " "[0-i] [You]0-i let [him]136-professor forth pick up [your]0-i pocket - handkerchief ! " Again [she]0-i smiles more broadly . "[0-i] [He]136-professor forth certainly did not avail [himself]136-professor forth of the permission . [I]0-i think that [his]136-professor forth knees are scarcely supple enough for [him]136-professor forth to be very anxious to pick up even [Sarah]135-sarah 's . " As [she]0-i speaks [she]0-i puts up [her]0-i hand and carelessly pushes back [her]0-i wandering love- lock ; but one little tendril still escapes and frisks in the breeze . [He]136-professor forth thrusts [his]136-professor forth hands hard down into [his]136-professor forth pockets to resist the intense though monstrous temptation to aid [her]0-i in its recapture . "[136-professor forth] If [you]0-i knew , " [he]136-professor forth says hurriedly , "[0-i] what [I]0-i felt when [you]0-i drove up to [the Gasthof]19-the gasthof to - day ; in what an agony of dread lest [you]0-i should think [me]0-i presumptuous for having forced [myself]0-i into [your]0-i party — lest [you]0-i should murder [me]0-i with one of those terrible frozen looks of [yours]0-i — " "[0-i] One of those terrible frozen looks of [mine]0-i ? " repeats [she]0-i with a puzzled air . "[0-i] It is very odd ! [I]0-i wonder how [I]0-i do them ? " "[0-i] [You]0-i may think [me]0-i as great an ass as [you]0-i please , " pursues [he]2465-he rapidly—"and[0-i] , indeed , [you]0-i would not be human if [you]0-i did not — but [I]0-i give [you]0-i [my]0-i word of honour , for the first moment [I]0-i dared not look . [I]0-i shut [my]0-i eyes ! " At that [she]0-i smiles subtilely . "[0-i] How , in [Heaven]153-heaven 's name , have [you]0-i managed to make [me]0-i so much afraid of [you]0-i ? " continues [the lad]2466-the lad , with gathering agitation . "[0-i] [You]0-i are never rude ; [you]0-i are not sarcastic ; nothing makes [you]0-i angry ; [you]0-i speak most softly ; and yet — " "[0-i] And yet , " [she]0-i says , finishing [his]2466-the lad sentence for [him]2466-the lad with a rather bitter smile , "[0-i] and yet [you]0-i shake in [your]0-i shoes before [me]0-i ! [I]0-i know [you]0-i all do . Ever since [I]0-i grew up — nay , before ; [I]0-i think that at fourteen [I]0-i began to inspire dread — [I]0-i have always been hearing how frightened [people]523-people are of [me]0-i . It is so pleasant ! No doubt [you]0-i had been told it before [you]0-i came to know [me]0-i , had not [you]0-i ? " In the eagerness of that query [she]0-i has stopped and faced [him]2466-the lad , the colour hurrying up to [her]0-i cheeks , and [her]0-i eyes fastened in imperative asking on [his]2466-the lad . [He]2466-the lad does not answer for a moment . [He]2466-the lad is dizzily marvelling whether blood of so wondrous a tint had ever flooded lily cheek before . [She]0-i repeats [her]0-i question with emphasis : "[0-i] Had not [you]0-i ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i — [I]0-i — had heard that [you]0-i snubbed [people]523-people ! " "[0-i] Have [you]0-i found it true ? " [she]0-i says , in a low and rather anxious voice . "[0-i] Have [I]0-i — have [I]0-i — " hesitating , "[0-i] snubbed [you]0-i ? " To this question [she]0-i has honestly expected a reply in the negative , and is proportionately startled by the virile energy of the affirmative that instead follows . "[0-i] That [you]0-i have — times out of mind ! " "[0-i] Have [I]0-i ? " [she]0-i says , in a key of genuine bewilderment . "[0-i] How ? when ? where ? What is it that [I]0-i do ? " [He]2467-he does not answer . "[0-i] Is it , " [she]0-i goes on diffidently , [Sarah]135-sarah 's dictum as to the one unforgivable sin committible by [women]2468-women against [men]2377-men flashing across [her]0-i mind , sinister and appropriate — "[0-i] is it that [I]0-i make [you]0-i feel small ? " "[0-i] Small ! Yes , " assents [he]2467-he , with pungent emphasis ; "[0-i] [I]0-i should think [you]0-i did ! invisibly , imperceptibly small . But that is not the worst . [I]0-i was prepared for that . [I]0-i had heard it was [your]0-i way ! " [She]0-i laughs grimly . "[0-i] What a pleasant way ! " "[0-i] There are days on which — [I]0-i do not know how [you]0-i do it — [you]0-i make [me]0-i feel as aloof from [you]0-i as if — " "[0-i] As if what ? " "[0-i] As if [I]0-i were down here , and [you]0-i were — " "[0-i] And [I]0-i were what ? " with an accent of sincere and puzzled curiosity . "[0-i] And [you]0-i were — and [you]0-i were — one of [the heavenly host up there]525-the heavenly host up there ! " ends [the young man , baldly and stammering]2470-the young man , baldly and stammering . But love is no brightener of the wits . "[0-i] [One of the heavenly host]526-one of the heavenly host ? " repeats [she]0-i , justly infuriate at this stale comparison . "[527-an angel] [An angel]527-an angel , in short ! Must [I]0-i always be an angle , or [a goddess]528-a goddess ? If [anyone]494-anyone knew how sick [I]0-i am of being [a goddess]528-a goddess ! [I]0-i declare [I]0-i should be thankful to be called [a Fury]531-a fury , or even [a Ghoul]532-a ghoul , for a change ! " So saying , [she]0-i turns [her]0-i shoulder peevishly to [him]2470-the young man , baldly and stammering ; and leaving [the garden]2455-the garden , begins to walk quickly along [the road]392-the road by [the water]2457-the water , as if to make up for [her]0-i late loitering . [He]2470-the young man , baldly and stammering keeps pace with [her]0-i , dumb in snubbed contrition , stupefied by love and , unhappily for [himself]2470-the young man , baldly and stammering , fully conscious of it ; burningly aware of the hopeless flatness of [his]2470-the young man , baldly and stammering last simile , and rendered by [his]2470-the young man , baldly and stammering situation quite incapable of redeeming it by any brighter sally . Presently [they]2474-they leave [the water]2457-the water and all its rioting wavelets , and pace through [the fir - wood]2476-the fir - wood towards the little Schloss — [the big one 's quaint baby - brother]2477-the big one 's quaint baby - brother . Beneath the fir - trees the blue hepaticas flower plentiful and late , and [the young stitchworts]2478-the young stitchworts open [their]2478-the young stitchworts fresh eyes to the spring . Regardless of ten - groschen penalties , [Belinda]134-belinda leaves [the road]392-the road , and stoops to pick the little blossoms . Docilely following [her]0-i motions , [he]2470-the young man , baldly and stammering stoops and picks too . [He]2470-the young man , baldly and stammering picks to more purpose than [she]0-i , indeed ; for when , by - and - by , [they]2474-they straighten [themselves]2474-they again and compare results , [his]2470-the young man , baldly and stammering is by far the largest nosegay . "[0-i] Will [you]533-you take them ? " [he]2470-the young man , baldly and stammering says , timidly proffering them , for [her]0-i tart speech has robbed [him]2470-the young man , baldly and stammering of [his]2470-the young man , baldly and stammering last barleycorn of courage ; "[533-you] or shall [I]0-i — shall [I]0-i — carry them for [you]533-you ? " What would not [he]2470-the young man , baldly and stammering carry for [her]0-i ? A newspaper parcel down [St. James 's Street]20-st. james 's street ; a bulging carpet - bag through [Rotten Row]21-rotten row ! "[0-i] Thank [you]0-i , [I]0-i will carry them [myself]0-i , " [she]0-i answers , stretching out [her]0-i pretty , bare hand for [them]534-them . "[0-i] [They]534-them shall make up to [me]0-i , " smiling , "[534-them] for the gardenias of which [I]0-i was deprived by — an accident . Do [you]0-i know that [I]0-i was not allowed even to smell them ? Did not [I]0-i bear [my]0-i loss like [a Trojan]535-a trojan ? " Then , hesitating a little , [she]0-i steps a pace or so nearer to [him]2480-he , and , half shyly holding out [her]0-i own little bunch , "[535-a trojan] Exchange is no robbery , " [she]0-i says with a soft look . "[0-i] Will [you]0-i , " gently mocking [his]2480-he frightened tone , "[0-i] will [you]0-i take them ? or shall [I]0-i — shall [I]0-i — carry them for [you]0-i ? " [He]2480-he makes [her]0-i no answer ; [he]2480-he is quite unable . The tears have sprung to [his]2480-he eyes . [He]2480-he is very young , has never loved before ; and it seems to [him]2480-he that at that fair hand holding out its little blue bunch Heaven opens to [him]2480-he . There are days on which [Heaven]153-heaven opens to [us]2481-us all , but to most of [us]2481-us next day it shuts again . Above [them]2482-their the pines lay [their]2482-their dark heads stilly together against the fair sky , that looks austere , yet not unkind . Here the loud wind is kept at bay , and whispers scarcely more noisily than [they]2482-their [themselves]2482-their are doing in [their]2482-their safe retreat . With what halting words of lame ecstasy [he]2480-he would have thanked [her]0-i will never now be known . Dumbly [he]2480-he has received [her]0-i gift , refraining , by what iron constraint put upon [himself]2480-he , from any least detention of those cool , pale fingers that just unintentionally touch [his]2480-he , and then innocently withdraw . The labouring syllables that are struggling to [his]2480-he lips are for ever driven thence by the sound of a high- pitched young voice calling clearly through [the still wood]2483-the still wood : "[0-i] Where are [you]536-you ? What has become of [you]536-you ? [We]537-us have been searching high and low for [you]536-you . Have [you]536-you been searching high and low for [us]537-us ? Ah ! evidently [you]536-you have ! " laughing ironically . "[536-you] Well , now [you]536-you have had the good fortune to find [us]537-us ! " Ere the end of this sentence , [Sarah]135-sarah has frisked up to [them]537-us , and , for the time , [Heaven]153-heaven 's door shuts in [their]537-us faces , and [Earth]23-earth 's dull portals reopen for [them]537-us . "[536-you] Are [you]536-you aware that there is a fine of ten groschen for leaving [the road]392-the road ? " calls out [the Professor]2365-the professor from the distance , but [nobody]2422-nobody heeds [him]2365-the professor . "[536-you] Are [you]536-you picking flowers ? " asks [Sarah]135-sarah demurely . "[536-you] How nice ! Pick [me]0-i some . " Then , turning to [Rivers]143-rivers , [she]135-sarah adds maliciously : "[0-i] [I]0-i am not greedy ; [I]0-i shall be quite content with that miserable little bunch that [you]536-you are clutching so tightly . Give it [me]0-i ! " But at that [he]536-you finds [his]536-you tongue again . "[0-i] Not if [you]536-you were to go down on [your]536-you knees to [me]0-i for it ! " [he]536-you cries tragically , lifting [his]536-you right hand and holding [his]536-you poor little prize high above [her]135-sarah restless , small head . "[536-you] Not if [I]0-i were to go down on [my]0-i knees ? " repeats [she]135-sarah in accents of the deepest incredulity . "[0-i] Come , that is [trop fort]539-trop fort ! It is worth putting to the test . " As [she]135-sarah speaks , [she]135-sarah sinks at once upon [her]135-sarah knees on the crushed herbage , and , joining [her]135-sarah hands as in prayer , looks up at [him]536-you , and says , in a small , childish voice , whose alluring properties [she]135-sarah has tested on many a hard - fought field , "[536-you] Please ! " [She]135-sarah might as well have knelt to and [allured one of the solemn straight pines]2486-allured one of the solemn straight pines . [He]536-you does not even avert [his]536-you eyes from [her]135-sarah , as though , if [he]536-you saw [her]135-sarah , [he]536-you must yield . [He]536-you looks [her]135-sarah full in the face , and says doggedly : "[536-you] Not if [you]0-i knelt there till the Day of Judgment ! " "[0-i] What are [you]0-i about , [Sarah]135-sarah ? " comes [the Professor]2365-the professor 's voice again , from [the road]392-the road , where the ten - groschen penalty still keeps [him]536-you . "[0-i] Are not [you]0-i aware that although the grass may appear dry on the surface , the ground still contains a great deal of latent moisture ! " But a second time [he]536-you speaks to the wind . "[0-i] Not if [I]0-i knelt here till the Day of Judgment ? " repeats [Sarah]135-sarah , still hardly believing [her]135-sarah own ears ; then , wisely taking the only course left open to [her]135-sarah , with as good a grace as may be : "[0-i] If that is the case , of course [I]0-i will get up again at once ! " So saying [she]135-sarah rises , apparently not at all put out of countenance , and flicks the bits of grass from the knees that had bent in vain . "[0-i] Do not [you]0-i wish to see [the King]358-the king 's boars fed ? [I]0-i understood [you]0-i to say that [you]0-i wished to see [the King]358-the king 's boars fed ! " shouts [the Professor]2365-the professor , striking in snappishly the third time , the contumely with which [his]2365-the professor remarks have been treated beginning to tell very perceptibly upon [his]2365-the professor tone . "[358-the king] [The King]358-the king 's boars ? " repeats [Sarah]135-sarah , sotto voce , descending to a degrading pun , and accompanying it with a wink that is worthy of it . "[358-the king] Do [you]0-i think [the King]358-the king has room for one more in [[his]358-the king menagerie]544-his menagerie ? if so , [I]0-i might be permitted to offer [him]358-the king [mine]0-i ! Yes , " raising [her]0-i voice , and beginning to trip back towards [[her]0-i betrothed]2378-her betrothed , "[358-the king] of course [we]545-we are coming ! " [She]0-i has not gone two steps , however , before [she]0-i bethinks [herself]0-i ; and , turning back , tucks [her]0-i arm determinately under [[her]0-i sister]2366-her sister 's . "[134-belinda] [Belinda]134-belinda , " [she]0-i says resolutely , "[134-belinda] [you]134-belinda have not seen [the Little Schloss]546-the little schloss ! [you]134-belinda have not seen [the lighthouse]547-the lighthouse ! [you]134-belinda have not seen the pheasantries ! [you]134-belinda shall see the boars ! " So saying [she]0-i sweeps [her]0-i off hurriedly ahead ; and [Rivers]143-rivers , cursing fearfully , is compelled to follow with [the Professor]2365-the professor , with whom [he]2365-the professor has about as much in common as [a non - reading , hard - rowing , foot - balling , cricketing undergraduate]2493-a non - reading , hard - rowing , foot - balling , cricketing undergraduate mostly has with [an exceptionally stiff - backed and donnish Don]2494-an exceptionally stiff - backed and donnish don .
