" A charming flickering smile breaks like moonlight on water over [Belinda]134-belinda 's face . "[0-i] [I]0-i give [you]134-belinda leave ! " [she]0-i says in a voice that , though low and tremulous , is distinct . Then , vanquishing all [[her]0-i junior]2401-her junior 's efforts to detain [her]0-i , pushing indeed impetuously past [her]0-i , [she]0-i flies to [[her]0-i own room]2768-her own room and double - locks [herself]0-i in ; nor do all [Sarah]135-sarah 's plaintive pipings through the key - hole and angry rattlings of the lock avail to dislodge [her]0-i . Had [Miss Watson]147-miss watson 's eye been glued to [her]147-miss watson spy - glass , as for six or eight out of the twenty - four hours it invariably is , and as , strange to say , it is not about four o'clock in the ensuing afternoon , [she]147-miss watson would have seen [Belinda Churchill]134-belinda setting off for a walk alone . Humanly speaking , not thirty seconds would have elapsed before [that lady]2769-that lady would have been across [the street]458-the street and down [it]458-the street to ask why alone ? why not with [[her]2769-that lady sister]2366-her sister ? and why not with the dogs ? The dogs ask the same question . A Dresden walk indeed , with [their]2772-their poor little snouts embedded in muzzles , is not by any means the same thing as an English one — free to dogs and [men]2377-men as English air ; but such as it is , it is better than nothing . With a muzzle [one]373-one can still scamper , and even give mutilated sniffs here and there . The prospect of a walk is the one thing that restores to its pristine hyacinthine curl Slutty 's tail , which ever since the arrival of [Punch]186-punch has limply drooped in envy and dejection ; and as for [Punch]186-punch , there is no number of times that [he]186-punch would not bark for [the Queen]359-the queen , for [Mr. Gladstone]201-mr. gladstone , for the devil if required , in order to attain it . To - day [they]2776-they both meet with an abstracted yet peremptory refusal . "[0-i] [I]0-i am going to [the Grosse Garten]1-the grosse garten , [Sarah]135-sarah , " says [Belinda]134-belinda , giving this piece of information in a not very assured voice , and apparently grateful to the numberless buttons of [her]0-i gloves for giving [her]0-i an excuse for bending [her]0-i head over them . "[135-sarah] Are [you]135-sarah ? " answers [the other]2396-the other carelessly ; then , as something in [[her]0-i sister]2366-her sister 's manner reveals to [her]0-i how pregnant with import is the walk of which [she]0-i speaks , adds in quite another tone , and with an accent of the liveliest sympathy : "[0-i] [My]0-i blessing go with [you]135-sarah . How [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could be behind a tree to hear how [he]919-he does it ! But , after all , " with a shrug , "[920-they] in these cases there is never much variety ; [they]920-they all say pretty much the same thing ; [they]920-they have no imagination . " As [Belinda]134-belinda reaches the door it is opened by [Tommy]163-tommy , for whom [Sarah]135-sarah has just rung . "[920-they] Now , [Tommy]163-tommy , " says [she]0-i , addressing [the boy]2509-the boy with an extremely admonitory air , "[920-they] if [three German gentlemen]921-three german gentlemen come to call this afternoon , mind that [you]163-tommy do not admit [them]921-three german gentlemen all at once . If a second comes before the first is gone , [you]163-tommy must tell [him]919-he that [I]0-i am engaged , and that [he]919-he must call again later . Do [you]163-tommy understand?—one at a time . " [She]0-i is still impressing upon [the page]2780-the page 's ductile mind the all - importance of letting in [[her]0-i admirers]2781-her admirers singly , when [Belinda]134-belinda passes out of hearing . Along [the street]458-the street [she]134-belinda goes . One side of [it]458-the street is in burning sunshine , the other in deep shadow . It seems to [her]134-belinda an emblem of the difference between [her]134-belinda life before and after yesterday . Why did not [she]134-belinda bring the dogs ? So royally rich in happiness [herself]134-belinda , why should not [she]134-belinda toss what crumbs [she]134-belinda can to [any such of [God]184-god 's poor creatures]2783-any such of god 's poor creatures as ask [her]134-belinda ? The memory of [Slutty]157-slutty 's eyes imploringly bulging , and of [Punch]186-punch 's disappointed back as [he]186-punch trotted tamely away to [his]186-punch cushion , returns to [her]134-belinda with a sort of remorse . [She]134-belinda is glad when [she]134-belinda has passed through [the town]474-the town and reached [the Grosse Garten]1-the grosse garten ; glad to see the long , broad , green drives quietly stretching away ; glad to have left the city noises behind [her]134-belinda . And yet even [they]2785-they have sounded melodiously to [her]134-belinda to - day . There is perhaps only one sound in [the whole world]2786-the whole world that would not now echo agreeably on [her]134-belinda ear — viz . , [Miss Watson]147-miss watson 's voice ; and even toward [Miss Watson]147-miss watson how faint and lessening is [her]134-belinda ill - will . It is true that [she]134-belinda continued to bestow [her]134-belinda company upon [them]2787-them yesterday for the remainder of the afternoon ; it is true that by [her]134-belinda tyrannic overruling [they]2787-them were sent [home]2345-home in [different vehicles]2789-different vehicles ; but could even [she]134-belinda prevent [their]2787-them one moment snatched at parting , with time for but a sentence in it — and that sentence such a prayer to [her]134-belinda to meet [him]2790-him here to - day ? After to - day [she]134-belinda will give [Miss Watson]147-miss watson leave to thrust [herself]134-belinda and [her]134-belinda importunities between [them]2787-them if [she]134-belinda can . As [she]134-belinda makes this reflection [she]134-belinda smiles . [I]163-tommy think [she]134-belinda walks along smiling . [The Grosse Garten]1-the grosse garten is not very frequented ; but now and then [she]134-belinda passes [a couple of loiterers]2791-a couple of loiterers , [a single man]2792-a single man or [woman]2793-woman , [a nurse]2794-a nurse and [child]732-child . [She]134-belinda pities [them]2791-a couple of loiterers all from the bottom of [her]134-belinda heart : [not one of [them]2791-a couple of loiterers]2347-not one of them is going to a tryst with [Rivers]162-rivers . [She]134-belinda has reached [the rendezvous]2797-the rendezvous now , a bench beside [the Teich]45-the teich ; [the dull and stagnant pool where the swans]2798-the dull and stagnant pool where the swans are royally riding in the sunshine . [He]162-rivers is not here , [he]162-rivers has not come yet . [She]134-belinda is [the first at the tryst]2799-the first at the tryst . A slight pang of disappointment shoots across [her]134-belinda ; but in a moment is stilled again . Probably in [her]134-belinda eagerness [she]134-belinda has walked more quickly than is usual with [her]134-belinda . Probably [she]134-belinda has taken less time than [she]134-belinda calculated for . [She]134-belinda looks at [her]134-belinda watch . It still wants five minutes to the appointed hour . [She]134-belinda sits down on the bench to wait , and [her]134-belinda eyes fall on the pool . How crowded with green reflections it is ; how different from the weak and pinched leafage of three weeks ago , when [she]134-belinda and [Sarah]135-sarah last sat [here]2351-here ! [It]2351-here has gathered all the horse - chestnuts into its bosom ; fans and bloom - spikes , [you]2801-you can see them all again as plainly as , sometimes more plainly than in the reality ; wherever , that is to say , the swans ' webs ' oaring has not broken up the mirror into bright shivers . The remembrance of [her]134-belinda last walk here with [Sarah]135-sarah brings back also the remembrance of [their]2802-their talk ; of [Sarah]135-sarah 's advice to [her]134-belinda to hurry the pace . The recollection brings a smile of happiness , and of pride too , over [her]134-belinda face . [She]134-belinda has used no manoeuvres , [she]134-belinda has descended to no tricky coquetries ; and yet could even [Sarah]135-sarah have won [him]2803-he more wholly than [she]134-belinda ? It must be half - past four now . Again [she]134-belinda takes out [her]134-belinda watch . Yes , it is now five minutes over the half - hour ; but then probably [her]134-belinda watch is fast . It always gains . Reassured afresh , [she]134-belinda patiently resumes [her]134-belinda waiting . The bench on which [she]134-belinda is sitting is almost exactly opposite the spot where on the first of May [he]2803-he had thrown [her]134-belinda [his]2803-he intercepted nosegay . At the thought [she]134-belinda smiles again ; and this time it must be broadly , for [a stranger passing by]2804-a stranger passing by looks hard and inquiringly at [her]134-belinda , as though imagining that [her]134-belinda smile was a recognition of and greeting to [himself]2803-he . In a second [she]134-belinda is grave again . [This place]2805-this place is too public ; when [he]2803-he comes [they]2806-they will seek one of [the more private paths]2807-the more private paths . When [he]2803-he comes ? But [he]2803-he is not come yet ! . Why does not [he]2803-he come ? [She]134-belinda turns [her]134-belinda head anxiously in the direction whence [she]134-belinda expects [him]2803-he to appear , a creeping disquietude beginning , despite [herself]134-belinda , to invade [her]134-belinda heart . Is it possible that [she]134-belinda can have mistaken [his]2803-he directions ? Is it possible that , as [she]134-belinda is waiting expectantly for [him]2803-he here , so may [he]2803-he be waiting expectantly for [her]134-belinda in [some other corner of [the large pleasure - gardens]2809-the large pleasure - gardens]2808-some other corner of the large pleasure - gardens ? But [she]134-belinda dismisses the idea . Did not [his]2803-he few words drop , distinct and clear as articulate words could do , into [her]134-belinda ear ? Has not [she]134-belinda been saying them over to [herself]134-belinda ever since ? There is nothing for it but patience . Again [she]134-belinda fixes [her]134-belinda eyes , not so untroubled as at first , upon [the Teich]45-the teich , [the swan - house]2810-the swan - house , the swans . To [the latter]2394-the latter [a child]2812-a child is throwing bread ; [a homely burgher couple]2813-a homely burgher couple have stopped to applaud . In the fostering sunshine the horse - chestnut leaves seem to grow momently larger and greener as [she]134-belinda looks . Why does not [he]2803-he come ? A sense of hurt maiden dignity , of hot and cruel shame at being thus made to appear so far the more eager of [the two]2814-the two , at being kept thus long and unworthily waiting at [her]134-belinda first love - rendezvous , has come to complicate and intensify [her]134-belinda anxiety . In all the mental pictures that through [her]134-belinda disturbed and tossing night [she]134-belinda has drawn of this meeting , the one contingency that has never crossed [her]134-belinda mind as most distantly possible , is that [he]2803-he should be [a defaulter from it]2815-a defaulter from it ; [he]2803-he , whose mad over - eagerness to fulfil any engagement in which [she]134-belinda is to have a part , has over and over again kept [him]2803-he raging up and down [the Lüttichau Strasse]4-the lüttichau strasse for hours and hours in rain and shine , in fervid waiting , until the time has come when [he]2803-he may decently make [his]2803-he appearance . And to - day [he]2803-he is already half an hour late ! It is impossible — incredible ! And yet if any untoward accident had occurred to prevent [him]2803-he , surely [he]2803-he would have written ! Perhaps even now there is a note awaiting [her]134-belinda at [home]2345-home . Goaded by this thought , [she]134-belinda takes two feverish steps in the direction of a return ; then , arrested by the reflection that [he]2803-he may arrive in [her]134-belinda absence and find [her]134-belinda gone , [she]134-belinda stops in painful irresolution . To sit still and look at the swans any longer is at all events impossible . [She]134-belinda walks — but with how different a tread to that with which [she]134-belinda had at first approached the spot!—she walks a little away ; not so far as to lose the bench , to which [her]134-belinda hopes still cling , from sight , but far enough to get a good view down [the great main drive]2817-the great main drive . With [her]134-belinda trembling hand lifted to shield [her]134-belinda eyes , [she]134-belinda strains [her]134-belinda gaze eagerly down it . Oh , if [she]134-belinda could but catch the most distant glimpse of [him]2803-he ! Under the trees spreads in glory the dazzling strong spring grass , with its brightness toned down here and there by the shadows of the dark tree - trunks , that in their afternoon quiet lie stilly on it . There is nothing ! With a sort of sob in [her]134-belinda throat that shocks [herself]134-belinda , [she]134-belinda is turning away , when , at the very other end of [the avenue]2818-the avenue , [she]134-belinda becomes aware of [a man]2618-a man 's figure that has suddenly come within eye - range . It is so distant that it is no taller than a pin ; but surely it has something of [his]2803-he walk and gait . Catching at this new hope , [she]134-belinda advances quickly to meet [the figure]2820-the figure . Yes ; it certainly has a look of [him]2803-he . Well , [she]134-belinda will not upbraid [him]2803-he . No hurt self - love nor petty sulks shall be permitted to mar the heavenly harmony of the first outpouring of [their]2821-their hearts into each other . [She]134-belinda will not even ask [him]2803-he why [he]2803-he is late . No doubt [he]2803-he has some good reason , which in [his]2803-he own time [he]2803-he will tell [her]134-belinda . But , alas ! [she]134-belinda may keep [her]134-belinda high resolves for another occasion . [She]134-belinda will not need [them]2822-them now . It requires no very near approach to [the stranger]2823-the stranger to reveal that [he]2803-he is not [Rivers]162-rivers ; that [he]2803-he is not even , when [you]2824-you come close to [him]2803-he , in the very least like [him]2803-he . It is such a bitter disappointment that [she]134-belinda turns into [a side alley]2825-a side alley to hide [her]134-belinda tears ; but quickly drying them again , hastily returns to [the meeting - place]2826-the meeting - place , in the panic fear that [he]2803-he may have appeared [there]2419-there from some unexpected point of the compass . But [he]2803-he is not there ; and as [she]134-belinda ascertains this , with a blank heart - sinking , the city clocks strike the half - hour . It is half - past five ! For a whole hour [she]134-belinda has been dancing attendance on [his]2803-he pleasure ; waiting here , ridiculous and befooled . With a movement of strong indignation [she]134-belinda begin to walk swiftly homewards ; but before [she]134-belinda has gone five yards , [her]134-belinda purpose slacks . [She]134-belinda can not yet bear to face the fact that this is what [her]134-belinda day 's splendid and apparently so sure promises are to end in — [this humiliated , baulked ,]2828-this humiliated , baulked , back- coming ! [She]134-belinda will give [him]2803-he five minutes more . Possibly , not very improbably even , [he]2803-he may have mistaken the appointed hour , and have thought that it was half - past five instead of half - past four . In that case [he]2803-he would be scarcely at all late , even now . A little recovered by this new flicker of hope , [she]134-belinda sits down . Yes ; [she]134-belinda will give [him]2803-he five minutes more , and during all these five [she]134-belinda will not look round once , or send [her]134-belinda eyes in search of [him]2803-he . Perhaps that will bring [her]134-belinda luck . But it does not . The five minutes are gone , and [he]2803-he is not [here]2351-here . [She]134-belinda gives [him]2803-he ten more , and then five again . Twice [she]134-belinda repeats [her]134-belinda little feverish excursion to the head of [the main avenue]2830-the main avenue ; these times [she]134-belinda is not even deluded by the will - of - the - wisp of a possible resemblance in any of the few saunterers that occupy it , to [him]2803-he whom [she]134-belinda , with a now so evident hopelessness , seeks . It is only the clocks striking six that at length makes [her]134-belinda really and desperately turn homewards . Each one of [their]2831-their tranquil strokes seems to [her]134-belinda the beat of a cruel hammer on [her]134-belinda heart . But putting out of the question the bootlessness of any further delay , self - respect , at length aroused , forbids [her]134-belinda to add any more moments to the humiliating and miserable hour and a half [she]134-belinda has already spent . "[163-tommy] If [I]0-i had had any proper pride , [I]0-i should have gone [home]2345-home an hour ago , " [she]134-belinda says to [herself]134-belinda in bitterest dejection , as [she]134-belinda passes along . [She]134-belinda holds [her]134-belinda head , usually carried a little loftily , well down . It seems to [her]134-belinda as if everybody who meets [her]134-belinda must read in [her]134-belinda face [her]134-belinda deep discomfiture , and [the fool]2832-the fool 's errand on which [she]134-belinda has been . [She]134-belinda quickens [her]134-belinda pace to get away from [them]2833-them ; to be safe out of [the streets so full of gaudy light]2834-the streets so full of gaudy light , where at any time [she]134-belinda may meet [an acquaintance]2835-an acquaintance — worse still , [one of [their]2833-them yesterday 's party]2836-one of their yesterday 's party ; worst of all , [Miss Watson]147-miss watson . As [she]134-belinda nears the Lüttichau Strasse [her]134-belinda distress lightens a little ; the hope of finding there a note , a message , some solving of this most inhuman riddle , buoys up [her]134-belinda steps and gives life again to [her]134-belinda looks . It can not be but that there must be some clearing up of this wretched contretemps . It will have , as [she]134-belinda says to [herself]134-belinda , to be a very bright clearing up indeed , to indemnify [her]134-belinda for the sufferings of the afternoon — that very afternoon whose anticipated joys [she]134-belinda had pitied every chance passer - by that [she]134-belinda met , for not being about to share . "[0-i] Well , " cries [Sarah]135-sarah , standing in the open salon door , and looking expectantly beyond [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister 's figure for another , "[924-you] where is [he]923-he ? what have [you]924-you done with [him]923-he ? [I]0-i want to fall on [his]923-he neck and kiss [him]923-he . [I]0-i have long , " laughing , "[924-you] been wishing for an excuse to do it , and now [I]0-i have an excellent one . " [Belinda]134-belinda had not meant to have entered [the salon]2683-the salon . [She]134-belinda had hoped to have slunk unperceived to [[her]134-belinda room]2688-her room ; for has not [Tommy]163-tommy , in answer to [her]134-belinda fevered questions , philosophically assured [her]134-belinda that there has been neither note nor message left for [her]134-belinda in [her]134-belinda absence ? "[0-i] Do not , " [she]0-i says hoarsely ; "[0-i] do not laugh . [I]0-i can not bear it . [He]923-he was not [there]2419-there ; [he]923-he never came . " "[923-he] Never came ! " echoes [Sarah]135-sarah in a tone of bottomless wonder , [her]135-sarah pretty eyes and mouth opening with a stare and a gape . "[923-he] Then , " gradually recovering the power of speech , "[923-he] then where have [you]0-i been , may [I]0-i ask — what have [you]0-i been doing all this time ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i have been waiting for [him]923-he , " answers [Belinda]134-belinda , trying to speak steadily , though at that humiliating confession such a tide of crimson rushes over [her]134-belinda poor proud face as [one]373-one would think must leave all the rest of [her]134-belinda body bloodless . "[0-i] But it is monstrous ! " cries [the other]2396-the other in a tone of the wildest excitement ; "[923-he] ca n'a pas de nom ; there is some mistake . [He]923-he is [a man]2618-a man , [he]923-he is [a gentleman]927-a gentleman ; of course [he]923-he has written — [he]923-he has sent ? " [Belinda]134-belinda shakes [her]134-belinda head . "[923-he] No ; [I]0-i asked [Tommy]163-tommy . " "[163-tommy] [Tommy]163-tommy ! " repeats [Sarah]135-sarah in a tone of the most contemptuous indignation . "[163-tommy] [Tommy]163-tommy , indeed ! [That boy]928-that boy is ripening for the tread - mill or the gallows , or both , as fast as [he]928-that boy can . [You]929-you will hardly believe that after what [I]0-i said to [him]928-that boy — [you]929-you heard [me]0-i — [he]928-that boy showed [them]930-them all up at once . " Then , ringing the bell violently , "[163-tommy] [Tommy]163-tommy , " [she]0-i says very sharply , "[163-tommy] how dare [you]163-tommy say that there is not a note for [Miss Churchill]152-miss churchill ? Of course there is a note . Go this moment to look for it , and do not come back without it ! " Paying no attention whatever to [his]163-tommy asseverations , [she]0-i waves [him]163-tommy from [the room]422-the room ; and then follow a few moments of painful waiting . At the end of [them]2843-them [Tommy]163-tommy returns with , sure enough , a missive of some kind on a salver . "[0-i] [I]0-i told [you]163-tommy how it would be ! " exclaims [Sarah]135-sarah , triumphantly pouncing upon it and [the unlucky child]2844-the unlucky child at once . "[0-i] How dare [you]163-tommy tell such a story , [[you]163-tommy naughty boy]931-you naughty boy ? Do [you]163-tommy know where [liars]932-liars go to ? " And [he]163-tommy may pour into [her]0-i unheeding ear [his]163-tommy faltering attempt to lay the blame on [Gustel]158-gustel , who answers the bell when [he]163-tommy is out ; [she]0-i does not hear a word [he]163-tommy says . In a fury of impatient anxiety , [she]0-i is stooping over [Belinda]134-belinda 's shoulder : [Belinda]134-belinda , whose shaking fingers can scarcely tear the envelope asunder . A thin blue paper falls out . It is the bill from a Porzellan Handlung for a couple of Meissen figures purchased [there]2419-there a week ago . In an uncontrollable spasm of misery , [she]0-i throws it on the floor and bursts into tears . "[933-they] Still at dinner , are [they]933-they ? [I]0-i shall not detain [them]933-they a moment ; [I]0-i am sure [they]933-they will admit [me]0-i ; [they]933-they always admit [me]0-i . No , [I]0-i will not wait in [the salon]2683-the salon ; [I]0-i will join [them]933-they in [the dining - room]935-the dining - room . " Such are the sentences uttered by [Miss Watson]147-miss watson 's voice , and plainly audible through the door on that same evening , as addressed to [Tommy]163-tommy , who is opposing [his]163-tommy puny infant strength to the forcible breaking in upon [[his]163-tommy mistresses]2846-his mistresses at [their]933-they dessert by [the before - mentioned lady]2847-the before - mentioned lady . With what result may readily be guessed . "[0-i] Have [you]936-you heard about [young Rivers]162-rivers ? " cries [she]147-miss watson , thrusting [the boy]2509-the boy aside and bursting in upon [them]933-they . [They]933-they are sitting , as [they]933-they have sat upon so many happier evenings , [the one old woman]2849-the one old woman and [the two young ones]2850-the two young ones , in [their]2850-the two young ones pretty soigné evening dresses . For the last three quarters of an hour [Belinda]134-belinda has been struggling to solve the problem how to swallow . It is dreadful to eat , but it is still more dreadful to have [your]2851-your lack of appetite noticed and wondered at . [Grapes]202-grapes are perhaps less difficult than most other things for [an unwilling palate to deal with]2852-an unwilling palate to deal with ; and [she]147-miss watson has taken a few Muscats , and is holding a small bunch between [her]147-miss watson hot and listless fingers at the time of [Miss Watson]147-miss watson 's bouncing entrance . Instantly they fall with a slight patter upon [her]147-miss watson plate . "[936-you] What about [him]162-rivers ? " asks [Sarah]135-sarah eagerly , jumping up and running towards [the intruder]2853-the intruder , while [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill drops the little red Alpine strawberry [she]185-mrs. churchill is in the act of lifting to [her]185-mrs. churchill lips , and says in an amazed voice : "[162-rivers] Dear [me]0-i , [Miss Watson]147-miss watson ! how [you]147-miss watson startle one ! " "[147-miss watson] [You]147-miss watson have not heard , then ? " says [the other]2396-the other loudly , in a voice of relief . "[147-miss watson] [I]0-i am the first to tell [you]147-miss watson ? " "[0-i] Yes , yes ; of course . What is there to tell ? " As [she]147-miss watson speaks , [Sarah]135-sarah places [herself]135-sarah adroitly between [[their]2855-their visitor]2856-their visitor and [her]135-sarah view of [Belinda]134-belinda , and mentally thanks [[her]135-sarah gods]2857-her gods for the failing light and the unkindled gas . "[0-i] [I]0-i was at [the station]937-the station this evening , " begins [the other]2396-the other , only too happy to embark upon [her]0-i tale ; "[0-i] indeed , [I]0-i have come almost straight thence . " [She]2396-the other is in rather dishevelled morning dress . "[0-i] [I]0-i went to see [the Rays]938-the rays off . [You]147-miss watson know how much [we]939-we have been together ; [they]940-they would never have forgiven [me]0-i if [I]0-i had not ! " Despite [her]135-sarah anxious suspense , [Sarah]135-sarah can not avoid a sardonic smile . It is the open secret of [the whole English colony]2859-the whole english colony that [the Ray family]2860-the ray family has been compelled , by [Watson]147-miss watson assiduities , regretfully and at great personal inconvenience , to curtail [their]940-they stay in [the Saxon capital]2861-the saxon capital . "[0-i] [I]0-i took [their]940-they tickets for [them]940-they , " pursues the unconscious narrator—"I[0-i] never mind trouble — indeed , [I]0-i insisted upon it . To tell truth , [I]0-i was a little glad of the opportunity to find out where [they]940-they were going to book to , about which [they]940-they had made rather a foolish mystery , when , just as [I]0-i was counting [my]0-i change , whom should [I]0-i see coming up to [the ticket - office]941-the ticket - office but [young Rivers]162-rivers ! " "[162-rivers] Well ? " Even [Sarah]135-sarah is a little breathless . "[162-rivers] ' And what brings [you]942-you [here]2351-here , pray ? ' [I]0-i said . ' Are [you]942-you come , too , to see [the Rays]938-the rays off ? ' [He]162-rivers did not hear [me]0-i . [I]0-i was prepared for that ; [you]945-you know [you]945-you explained to [me]0-i that [he]162-rivers was a little deaf . By - the - way , that deafness should be seen to at once , and so [I]0-i shall tell [him]162-rivers , if [I]0-i ever meet [him]162-rivers again . " If [she]0-i ever meets [him]162-rivers again ! [Belinda]134-belinda is leaning forward in an attitude of the acutest strained listening ; [her]134-belinda heart is beating against the edge of the table with loud , hard blows . "[162-rivers] [He]162-rivers evidently could not have heard [me]0-i , " pursues [Miss Watson]147-miss watson fluently ; "[162-rivers] nor seen [me]0-i either , for the matter of that , as [he]162-rivers turned sharp round and walked off in the other direction . Of course , as soon as [the Rays]203-the rays could spare [me]0-i , [I]0-i went after [him]162-rivers and overtook [him]162-rivers . " "[0-i] Of course ! " murmurs [Sarah]135-sarah , under [her]135-sarah breath . "[0-i] [I]0-i put [my]0-i hand on [his]162-rivers arm . ' Come , now , where are [you]162-rivers off to ? ' just like that . [He]162-rivers shook [my]0-i hand off - [you]946-you know [he]162-rivers never had any manners — that is why [I]0-i think [he]162-rivers must be related to [the Stukeley Rivers]166-the stukeley rivers ; [they]947-they are proverbially rude , as [a family]948-a family . ' What do [you]0-i want ? ' [he]162-rivers said , just as if [he]162-rivers had not heard [my]0-i question . ' [I]0-i want to know where [you]162-rivers are off to ? ' [I]0-i said . ' Where are [you]162-rivers off to ? ' [He]162-rivers hesitated for a moment , and then seeing , [I]0-i suppose , that [I]0-i was not to be trifled with , that [I]0-i was determined to have an answer of some kind , [he]162-rivers turned [his]162-rivers head quite away , and said so low that [I]0-i could hardly hear [him]162-rivers , ' [I]0-i am going back to [England]25-england to - night . ' Then [he]162-rivers was away like a shot , and what with the confusion of [the train]949-the train coming in , and seeing that [the Rays]938-the rays had all [their]938-the rays parcels right in [the carriage]2361-the carriage — of course at the last moment one was missing — [I]0-i never caught another glimpse of [him]162-rivers . " [She]0-i stops , out of breath , [her]0-i narrative ended ; nor , for a moment , does [any one of [[her]0-i three auditors]2863-her three auditors]2862-any one of her three auditors comment upon it . [Belinda]134-belinda has sunk back in [her]134-belinda chair , and round [her]134-belinda [the room]422-the room is spinning . [Sarah]135-sarah , [Miss Watson]147-miss watson , [granny]721-granny , the dogs , all are whirling . [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill is the first to speak . "[0-i] [I]0-i suppose , " [she]0-i says , in a voice still somewhat ruffled by [Miss Watson]147-miss watson 's inroad , and picking up the sugar - sifter in [her]0-i delicate old fingers , "[0-i] that [he]162-rivers was tired of [Dresden]2-dresden . There is nothing very wonderful in that . [Punch]186-punch , take [your]186-punch hands off the table this instant . " "[186-punch] But it is so sudden ! " cries [Miss Watson]147-miss watson , in a loud aggrieved tone , as if [Rivers]166-the stukeley rivers ' departure were a personal injury . "[186-punch] Why did not [he]162-rivers tell [us]952-us ? [He]162-rivers never told [me]0-i ; did [he]162-rivers ever tell [you]186-punch [he]162-rivers was going ? " [Nobody]2422-nobody takes the trouble to answer . "[162-rivers] [I]0-i am sure that yesterday , at [Wesenstein]15-wesenstein , [nobody]2422-nobody would have said that [he]162-rivers had such an idea in [his]162-rivers head , would [they]2422-nobody now ? " turning directly to [Belinda]134-belinda . By a great exertion of the powers of the mind over [[their]952-us weaker brothers]2867-their weaker brothers of the body , [Belinda]134-belinda has forced [the room]422-the room and [the people]460-the people to stand steady and still again . By a like exertion [she]134-belinda frames a sentence , which , though short , is not conspicuously tremulous . "[2422-nobody] No ; [I]0-i think not . " "[2422-nobody] Probably [he]162-rivers was telegraphed for [home]2345-home , " says [Sarah]135-sarah , coming hastily to [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister 's rescue , and trying to divert from [her]134-belinda the brunt of [Miss Watson]147-miss watson 's eyes and speech . "[162-rivers] Probably [he]162-rivers had bad news ! " "[0-i] [I]0-i should not wonder , " answers [Miss Watson]147-miss watson , looking down on the floor for a moment in inquisitive reflection . "[0-i] [I]0-i should not at all wonder . [He]162-rivers looked like [a man who had had bad news]955-a man who had had bad news . In point of fact , [he]162-rivers looked shockingly ill . [I]0-i never saw [a man so changed]956-a man so changed in so short a time . [I]0-i am so annoyed with [myself]0-i , " in a tone of the sincerest vexation , "[0-i] for not having asked [him]162-rivers point - blank ! " "[0-i] [I]0-i should have thought that [you]957-you might have spared [yourself]957-you that reproach , " says [Sarah]135-sarah ; adding , as [she]135-sarah casts an oblique glance in the friendly dusk towards [Belinda]134-belinda , to see how [she]134-belinda is holding up , "[957-you] Most likely [one of [[his]162-rivers relations]959-his relations]958-one of his relations is dead . " "[0-i] [I]0-i hope it is not even worse than that , " answers [the other]2396-the other , in a voice of mysterious curiosity . "[0-i] [I]0-i hope that [none of [[his]162-rivers sisters]766-his sisters]960-none of his sisters have got into a disagreeable scrape . [You]957-you know that , in [the world]643-the world , [the Rivers women]963-the rivers women have the character of being un peu leste . " It is not till every possible conjecture has been exhausted , till the few facts known have been worn bare and shiny by turning and handling , that [Miss Watson]147-miss watson at length withdraws . [She]147-miss watson would not have gone then , had not the idea suddenly presented itself , that , if [she]147-miss watson make haste , [she]147-miss watson will be able before bedtime to force [herself]147-miss watson and [her]147-miss watson news upon [three or four more households]2872-three or four more households . No sooner is the outer door safely shut upon [her]964-that woman , than — "[163-tommy] [Tommy]163-tommy is incorrigible ! " says [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill , in a tone of irritation . "[163-tommy] The number of times that [I]0-i have impressed upon [him]163-tommy not to admit [that woman]964-that woman on any pretext whatever , while [we]965-we are at dinner ! " "[721-granny] Pooh , [granny]721-granny ! what nonsense [you]721-granny talk ! " replies [Sarah]135-sarah , disrespectfully . "[721-granny] When that great galleon bears down upon [him]163-tommy , what can [a poor little skiff]967-a poor little skiff like [Tommy]163-tommy do ? Of course [she]964-that woman will come to breakfast and luncheon and dinner , and [we]965-we may think [ourselves]965-we very lucky if [she]964-that woman does not insist on thrusting [herself]964-that woman upon [us]965-we in [our]965-we baths . " As [she]0-i speaks , [she]0-i puts [her]0-i hand under [[her]0-i sister]2366-her sister 's heavy hanging , limp arm , and draws [her]2366-her sister away towards [the salon]2683-the salon . "[964-that woman] If [you]721-granny will be so slow , [granny]721-granny , " [she]0-i says , with a parting laugh , "[721-granny] [we]965-we must leave [you]721-granny to carouse alone . [I]0-i believe [you]721-granny enjoy [yourself]721-granny more when [you]721-granny have [no witnesses of [your]721-granny gourmandise]969-no witnesses of your gourmandise . " But arrived in [the salon]2683-the salon , [she]0-i no longer laughs . [Belinda]134-belinda has thrown [herself]134-belinda flaccidly into a chair . The curtains are undrawn , and through them [her]134-belinda eyes stare out upon [the street]458-the street — [the street where , through the deepening gloom , the lit lamps , but now such insignificant yellow specks , are beginning to gain importance and use]2877-the street where , through the deepening gloom , the lit lamps , but now such insignificant yellow specks , are beginning to gain importance and use — [the street so continually worn by [his]2879-him eager footsteps]2878-the street so continually worn by his eager footsteps , where [she]134-belinda has so often heard them , up and down , up and down , waiting , watching , for hours , if it be past all seemliness and moderation for [him]2879-him to venture a visit , on the bare chance of [her]134-belinda throwing [him]2879-him out one parting smile . All through dinner [she]134-belinda has been dreading the evening — dreading its suspense , the bell that will ring now and again , the intervals that will elapse , and then the blank silence , nothing resulting , showing that it was not [he]2879-him who rang . Well , suspense is over and gone now ; but [she]134-belinda would be glad to have it back again , seeing that it has taken hope with it . "[721-granny] Well , " [she]134-belinda says after a pause , looking up wearily at [[her]134-belinda sister]2366-her sister , who stands beside [her]134-belinda with [her]2366-her sister fair arms folded and [her]2366-her sister white brows bent in an attitude of serious reflection very unnatural to [her]2366-her sister ; "[721-granny] well , what do [you]970-you say now ? Who was right now ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i , " replies [Sarah]135-sarah . "[0-i] [I]0-i am more convinced than ever that [he]971-he left a note or message for [you]970-you , and that it has miscarried . " [Belinda]134-belinda 's shoulders lift themselves slightly in an unbelieving shrug . "[971-he] Notes do not miscarry . " "[971-he] [He]971-he left it with [the servants]972-the servants to send , " pursues [Sarah]135-sarah decidedly , "[971-he] and [they]972-the servants — [you]970-you know what [German servants]973-german servants are — put it into the post or into the fire , to save [themselves]972-the servants trouble . " [Belinda]134-belinda offers no contradiction , but neither does any ray of hope brighten [her]134-belinda dull face at this hypothesis . "[972-the servants] Are [you]970-you quite sure , " asks [Sarah]135-sarah , looking penetratingly in [[her]135-sarah elder]2881-her elder 's face , so as to glean [her]135-sarah answer from it rather than from [her]0-i words , "[970-you] are [you]970-you quite sure that [you]970-you did not snub [him]971-he yesterday at [Wesenstein]15-wesenstein ? [I]0-i know that [you]970-you very often do it without intending it ; that [you]970-you can no more help it than [you]970-you can help drawing breath ; but are [you]970-you sure that [you]970-you did not ? " "[970-you] Snubbed [him]971-he ! good heavens , no ! " [She]134-belinda has writhed [herself]134-belinda half over , and is thrusting [her]134-belinda poor face into the cushioned back of the chair , as if [she]134-belinda wished that [she]134-belinda could for ever bury it there , while the blood seems to be rushing in hot shamed tinglings all over [her]134-belinda body , as [[her]0-i sister]2366-her sister 's words call up before [her]134-belinda in all the vividness of new life that scene in [the wood]2717-the wood , in which snubbing bore so small a part . "[970-you] Then it is perfectly obvious , " replies [Sarah]135-sarah collectedly , and with cool common sense , "[0-i] as [I]0-i told that hornet just now , that [he]971-he has had bad news and been telegraphed for [home]2345-home . [I]0-i hope , " with an accent of wakened anxiety , "[0-i] that it is not the iron that has gone wrong . " "[0-i] [I]0-i hope it is not anything about [[his]971-he father]2550-his father , " says [Belinda]134-belinda , startled by this suggestion out of [her]134-belinda own hot and miserable retrospect ; "[0-i] [he]971-he would never get over it . " "[971-he] Pooh ! " says [Sarah]135-sarah ; "[971-he] [sons]976-sons do not die of [[their]976-sons fathers]977-their fathers ' deaths ; and in fact , as far as [we]978-we are concerned , it would simplify matters a good deal ; [he]971-he would be [[his]971-he own father]562-his own father then . " For a few moments there is a silence , cut into only by the sound of [Punch]186-punch 's snores , regular and long drawn out , through the door . It is [Belinda]134-belinda who , contrary to what [one]373-one would have expected , breaks it . "[980-you] [You]980-you were always telling [me]0-i , " [she]134-belinda says with a hard smile , that yet looks as if it needed only one touch to make it dissolve into bitter tears—"you[980-you] were always telling [me]0-i that [I]0-i was so cold to [him]971-he ; [you]980-you were always advising and urging [me]0-i to be less cold ; perhaps , " with a sort of gasp , "[980-you] perhaps [I]0-i have obeyed [you]980-you too well ; perhaps - perhaps [he]971-he thinks so . " "[980-you] Do [you]980-you mean , " cries [Sarah]135-sarah , with a derisive laugh whose offensive quality is , however , lessened by the soothing gesture of a kind arm thrown at the same moment round [[her]135-sarah afflicted elder]2885-her afflicted elder 's neck , "[980-you] do [you]980-you mean to say that [you]980-you suspect [him]971-he of having taken to [his]971-he heels because [you]980-you gave [him]971-he two civil words and one look that was not a scowl ? If such is the case , [he]971-he is [a valuable admirer]981-a valuable admirer , and the more express trains [he]971-he gets into the better . " But [Belinda]134-belinda is too much cast down to make any rejoinder . "[980-you] [You]980-you will pardon [my]0-i saying so , " continues [Sarah]135-sarah in a counterfeit apology that is contradicted by the lurking mirth in [her]0-i eye , "[0-i] but [he]971-he would not have been nearly so tiresome as [he]971-he was if [he]971-he had not been genuinely in love . If [a man]2618-a man is only playing at love [he]2618-a man can be civil and amusing to [other people]736-other people ; but , " breaking into an unavoidable laugh , "[143-rivers] was poor [David]143-rivers amusing ? [he]143-rivers had [his]143-rivers one solitary ever- lasting idée fixe . [[My]0-i dear soul]984-my dear soul , " passing [her]0-i light hand with a stroking motion down [Belinda]134-belinda 's heaving shoulder , "[0-i] what a trial [he]143-rivers was to [granny]156-granny and [me]0-i ! And — cheer up ! — what a trial [he]143-rivers will be again ! " This is all the consolation , if consolation it can be called , that [Belinda]134-belinda has to take to bed with [her]134-belinda . This is all the consolation with which [she]0-i wakes next morning and exchanges the shadowy muddle of [her]0-i discomfortable visions for the not less discomfortable reality . [She]0-i had slept — to [her]0-i own surprise — through the earlier part of the night ; but in May - time day and night faint into each other ; and though the light is broad and universal , yet the hour is a small one when [she]0-i awakes , with that hopeless decidedness , that irrevocable bursting of the chains of slumber , which tells its unhappy victim that all juggling efforts to overtake the flown blessing will be of no avail . [She]0-i lies on [her]0-i uneasy bed for as long as [she]0-i can bear it ; then , since the hour is still far too early to ring for [her]0-i hot water , and so make public an abnormal condition of mind and body , [she]0-i rises , and throwing on [her]0-i dressing- gown , sits down by the open window and watches the strides of the morning , stepping , clean and young and lucent , across the old and dirty earth . Even [the ugly Bohemian Railway Station]2886-the ugly bohemian railway station and [the stucco houses]2887-the stucco houses come in for a portion of [his]143-rivers kindness . How much more [the little hoary garden plat]2888-the little hoary garden plat and the dew - pearled tulips ! It has been an open question since [the world]643-the world began , whether the loveliness of nature assuages or aggravates the misery of [humanity]2890-humanity in its more miserable moods . [Belinda]134-belinda would subscribe to the latter opinion . It seems to [her]0-i that [she]0-i could better bear the look of the day — that it would not make [her]0-i so angry — if slant rain were slashing [the earth]2891-the earth , or if it were locked in a prison of frost , or wound in a shroud of snow . The splendour of the transparent air ; the trees , just lightly wagging their heads in the early wind ; even the short - tailed starlings , cheerfully walking about while the sun touches up [their]2892-their apparently sombre feathers , and brings out little rainbow colours in them ; each — each has a separate stab for [her]0-i . There were starlings at [Moritzburg]8-moritzburg ; there were tulips in [the inn garden]2893-the inn garden at [Lohmen]30-lohmen : can [she]0-i set [her]0-i eyes upon any one common object that does not bring a memory with it ? [She]0-i has never been of a very bright or hopeful temperament with regard to [her]0-i own future ; not one of [those happy young ones to whom the long life ahead seems swathed in a golden mist]2894-those happy young ones to whom the long life ahead seems swathed in a golden mist . The deep conviction of [her]0-i own paucity of powers of attraction , a conviction which has been with [her]0-i as long as [she]0-i can remember anything — as long as the far - away days of short frocks and coming down to dessert , when [strangers]838-strangers used to pull [Sarah]135-sarah 's long curls and laugh at [her]0-i smart answers — a conviction that for a bright interval has been shaken , now settles down in its cold and humbling certainty again in [her]0-i heart . "[985-he] [He]985-he was not telegraphed for , " [she]0-i says to [herself]0-i , in a tone of surpassing bitterness ; "[985-he] [he]985-he had no ill news ; but [he]985-he was right to go . [I]0-i am not of the stuff of which [the women that men]986-the women that men love are made ! Let [me]0-i try not to forget it again . " The clocks one after another , in [their]2896-their different voices , have just struck eight . [Cramped]205-cramped with long sitting in one position , which [she]0-i has forgotten to change , [she]0-i rises , and is beginning to walk up and down [the little room]2897-the little room when a knock comes , a quick , loud , rattling knock , which , in its lively energy , partakes of the nature of [the person who has executed it]2898-the person who has executed it , and who adds to it an urgent calling : "[134-belinda] [Belinda]134-belinda ! [Belinda]134-belinda ! are [you]134-belinda awake ? " Awake!—is [she]134-belinda awake ? [She]0-i smiles grimly to [herself]0-i . "[0-i] Yes , [I]0-i am awake , " [she]0-i answers in an unwilling voice , that [she]0-i in vain tries to make sound sleepy . "[0-i] Then why do not [you]134-belinda open the door ? " cries [the voice]2575-the voice impatiently , accompanying the question by a long and noisier rattling of the handle . But [Belinda]134-belinda takes no step towards complying . [She]134-belinda wishes for [no one]365-no one 's company , not even [Sarah's]206-sarah's — perhaps [Sarah]135-sarah 's least of all ; for is not [she]206-sarah's [the one person from whom [she]135-sarah has been unable to hide [her]135-sarah humiliation]2901-the one person from whom she has been unable to hide her humiliation ? "[134-belinda] What do [you]134-belinda want ? " [she]0-i asks morosely . "[134-belinda] If [you]134-belinda do not open the door at once , " replies [Sarah]135-sarah , desisting for a moment from [her]135-sarah rattling , so that [her]135-sarah voice may be the more penetratingly heard , "[134-belinda] [I]0-i warn [you]134-belinda that [I]0-i shall open [your]134-belinda note and read it [myself]0-i ! " [Her]134-belinda note ! In one bound [Belinda]134-belinda is across [the room]422-the room , has turned the key , and is palely facing [[her]134-belinda sister]2366-her sister . "[0-i] Who was right ? " cries [Sarah]135-sarah , strutting in , dishevelled , dressing - gowned , triumphant , and holding in [her]135-sarah hand a letter , which [the other]2396-the other silently snatches . "[0-i] [I]0-i was so certain that [he]987-he must have written , that [I]0-i sent [Tommy]163-tommy round to [[his]987-he lodgings]2438-his lodgings the first thing this morning ; and sure enough [they]989-they unearthed this , which [they]989-they had entirely forgotten , and which [we]990-we ought to have received yesterday afternoon . Come it is not a bill this time ! " [Belinda]134-belinda has opened the envelope , and is staring strainingly at the paper . "[987-he] How stupid ! " [she]134-belinda says , passing [her]134-belinda hand across [her]134-belinda eyes . "[987-he] Somehow [I]0-i can not see it . " "[987-he] Is it possible that this is [his]987-he handwriting ? " cries [Sarah]135-sarah , coming to [her]135-sarah aid , and examining with surprise the superscription . "[987-he] What a shocking hand [he]987-he writes ! " "[987-he] Yes ; it is [his]987-he , " says [Belinda]134-belinda , again passing [her]134-belinda hand across [her]134-belinda eyes ; "[987-he] but it is very shaky . Something has happened to alter it very much . [I]0-i think [you]0-i must read it , please . " "[0-i] There does not appear to be any beginning , " replies [Sarah]135-sarah , complying with some alacrity . "[0-i] ' [I]0-i can not come to meet [you]0-i this afternoon . Oh , forgive [me]0-i ! ' ( Then comes a prodigious blot — mixed tears and ink , [I]0-i expect . ) ' [I]0-i have been telegraphed for [home]2345-home . ' ( [I]0-i told [you]0-i so ; then there is something scratched out ; what is it ? " looking at the paper aslant and half shutting one eye . ) "[987-he] ' A f - r - ight - ful cat'—(what , cat ? what is it likely to be ? — catastrophe — that is it , of course ; [he]987-he has put long legs and loops to all the short letters , but [I]0-i can quite make it out , in spite of that)—'a frightful catastrophe ' — ( scored through , [you]0-i know ) . ' [I]0-i do not know what [I]0-i am saying . [God]184-god bless [you]0-i ! ' ( Then more blots.)—'D. R. ' That is all ! " "[184-god] All ! " cries [Belinda]134-belinda , stretching out [her]134-belinda trembling hand for the note . "[184-god] Are [you]0-i sure that there is nothing over the page ? " "[0-i] Not a syllable ! " There is a silence . [Belinda]134-belinda 's eyes are riveted on the few scrawled words — so few — on which all [her]134-belinda future is to be built . Among them is there one which will support the weight of a legitimate hope ? "[987-he] It would have been more to the purpose , " says [Sarah]135-sarah , in a tone of wounded common sense , "[987-he] if [he]987-he had given [us]992-us a hint as to what the catastrophe was , instead of wasting so much ingenuity in making all those unnatural legs and arms to [his]987-he ' a ' s ' and ' c ' s ' and 's ' s. ' " "[987-he] [You]0-i think that there is one really ? that something has happened ? that [he]987-he was telegraphed for ? " asks [Belinda]134-belinda , appealing in wistful fever to [her]134-belinda cool , shrewd junior . "[987-he] Of course [he]987-he was ; of course there has ! " replies [Sarah]135-sarah decidedly . "[0-i] [I]0-i must say , " with a rather satirical look , "[0-i] that [you]0-i have a high opinion of [[your]0-i admirer]993-your admirer ; [he]987-he ought to be flattered by [your]0-i confidence . No ! reassure [yourself]0-i , " striking the untidy blurred page with [her]134-belinda forefinger ; "[0-i] [anyone with pretension to be even an indifferent liar]994-anyone with pretension to be even an indifferent liar would have been ashamed of this . " "[0-i] A catastrophe ! " repeats [Belinda]134-belinda , as though speaking to [herself]134-belinda , and still looking at the note ; "[0-i] what sort of a catastrophe ? [I]0-i think — [I]0-i fear — that it must in some way concern [[his]987-he father]2550-his father . " "[0-i] Well , anyhow , [the poor boy]2450-the poor boy 's character is cleared up , " says [Sarah]135-sarah gaily , sweeping in [her]135-sarah long peignoir to the window , and standing blithely looking out at the tulips and the starlings — as brightly pretty as the former , as robustly cheerful as [the latter]2394-the latter . "[2450-the poor boy] After all , [he]2450-the poor boy has not been driven away by [your]0-i unladylike warmth , as [you]0-i had quite made up [your]0-i mind last night ; and as to [[his]987-he father]2550-his father , if it is [he]2450-the poor boy , [our]998-our grief must be chastened by the thought that [we]998-our have never set eyes upon [him]2450-the poor boy . Well , [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i must not spend the day in [my]0-i dressing- gown , " walking to the door . Neither must [Belinda]134-belinda ; and yet , for long after [[her]134-belinda sister]2366-her sister has left [her]134-belinda , [she]134-belinda sits , still poring over the meagre sheet that is [her]134-belinda first love - letter . [She]134-belinda laughs derisively . Will it be [her]134-belinda last , too ? At that thought [she]134-belinda sets [herself]134-belinda to weary calculations . It is , without stopping — [he]2450-the poor boy will , of course , stop nowhere between [Dresden]2-dresden and [London]10-london — a thirty - six hours ' journey . Probably five or six hours more will be occupied in getting on to [Yorkshire]31-yorkshire . It is a four days ' post from [England]25-england to [Dresden]2-dresden . Even if [he]2450-the poor boy write to [her]134-belinda immediately on arriving — a most unlikely hypothesis — it can not be much less than a week before [she]134-belinda hears . There must be five or six absolutely void black days , that yet will have the same complement of hours in them as the day at [Moritzburg]8-moritzburg or the day at [Wesenstein]15-wesenstein . [She]134-belinda lays [her]134-belinda hot forehead on the cool wooden chair - back . Oh , if [they]2907-they could but be slept through ! But at this moment the entrance of [[her]134-belinda maid]2908-her maid , with the usual paraphernalia of [her]2908-her maid toilet , sufficiently reminds [her]134-belinda that [they]2907-they can not . [They]2907-they can not be slept through ! [They]2907-they must be dressed through , talked through , eaten through , made expeditions through , joked through . Worst of all , [his]2450-the poor boy departure , its cause , [his]2450-the poor boy probable or improbable return , [he]2450-the poor boy [himself]2450-the poor boy , must be continually discussed and worn threadbare in [her]134-belinda hearing . This , indeed , is an evil from which [she]134-belinda suffers for only two days . After that , [he]2450-the poor boy being gone , and never having sought to make [himself]2450-the poor boy specially acceptable to [any member of the little society]2909-any member of the little society save [one]373-one , [he]2450-the poor boy slips from [their]2907-they talk and [their]2907-they thoughts . [She]134-belinda is deeply thankful when [their]2907-they chatter about [him]2450-the poor boy ceases , and yet angry with [them]2907-they for so soon forgetting [him]2450-the poor boy . And meanwhile the days in summer procession pace stately by , full of sap and growth and laughter . The date of the Churchill departure is now fixed for the 5th of June ; and as that period approaches , a freezing panic fear begins to clutch [Belinda]134-belinda more and more tightly in its hold — the fear that [her]134-belinda own going may antedate the arrival of [his]2450-the poor boy letter ; that [he]2450-the poor boy may write to [her]134-belinda here , and the letter not be forwarded . The many tales [she]134-belinda has heard of lives dismally wrecked upon some such small accident throng [her]134-belinda memory . [The house]2521-the house is full of signs of an approaching déménagement ; full of packing , disarranging , bustling . [It]2521-the house is mostly full also of [German officers , who , being aware that [their]2912-german officers , who , being aware that their time for enjoying the society and the wit of their love - worthy sarah time for enjoying the society and the wit of [their]2912-german officers , who , being aware that their time for enjoying the society and the wit of their love - worthy sarah love - worthy [Sarah]135-sarah]2912-german officers , who , being aware that their time for enjoying the society and the wit of their love - worthy sarah is all too quickly passing , are resolved to have nothing to reproach [themselves]2912-german officers , who , being aware that their time for enjoying the society and the wit of their love - worthy sarah with in the way of not having availed [themselves]2912-german officers , who , being aware that their time for enjoying the society and the wit of their love - worthy sarah of it while [they]2912-german officers , who , being aware that their time for enjoying the society and the wit of their love - worthy sarah were able . [Some of [them]2912-german officers , who , being aware that their time for enjoying the society and the wit of their love - worthy sarah]2913-some of them are not unwilling to extend [their]2913-some of them endearments to [the elder sister]2400-the elder sister , seeing [her]2400-the elder sister no longer monopolized by [[her]2400-the elder sister surly fellow - country- man]2915-her surly fellow - country- man ; but [she]2400-the elder sister has received [their]2913-some of them compliments so blankly , that , ashamed of [their]2913-some of them brief infidelity , [they]2913-some of them have clanked hastily back to [[their]2913-some of them first love]2916-their first love , who sees [them]2913-some of them go and return with the same joyous indifference . [Belinda]134-belinda has been innocent of the least intention to snub [them]2913-some of them , but how can [one]373-one receive pretty speeches — any speeches intelligently , when [one]373-one is continually doing a sum in [one]373-one 's head—36 and 5 , 4I ; [I]0-i day from 4 days ; 1 day from 3 days , etc . ? The packing is not of so wholly occupying a nature as to exclude incidental amusements . It does not even forbid a farewell excursion to [Tharandt]160-tharandt ; an excursion planned by [Sarah]135-sarah and [her]135-sarah rout of [Uhlans]193-uhlans ; with some necessary padding of [a lenient chaperon]2920-a lenient chaperon , and [compliant girls]2921-compliant girls . [Belinda]134-belinda has believed [herself]134-belinda equal to sharing it . [Tharandt]160-tharandt is rendered agonizing by no associations . [She]134-belinda has never visited [Tharandt]160-tharandt in [his]2922-his company , but , at the last moment , a trifle robs [her]134-belinda of [her]134-belinda fortitude — the sight of [her]134-belinda cobwebby Wesenstein gown , extended with unconscious tactless cruelty by [[her]134-belinda maid]2908-her maid on the bed . [She]134-belinda throws [herself]134-belinda down , ungovernably sobbing , beside it . It seems like the husk of [her]134-belinda lost happiness . By - and - by [they]2924-they are all gone , and [the house]2521-the house is left to [her]134-belinda and to silence . [It]2521-the house is deserted even by the dogs , who have been taken out driving by [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill ; Slutty , supinely indifferent to view and air , curled at the carriage - bottom , and [Punch]186-punch standing up on [his]186-punch hind - legs , with [his]186-punch forepaws on the carriage - side , like an unsteady heraldic lion . [Belinda]134-belinda laughs a little at the thought of [him]186-punch as [she]134-belinda returns to [the salon]2683-the salon , which is beginning to wear a desolate look , reduced to [its]2683-the salon own lodging - house furniture and shorn of the graces bestowed upon [it]2683-the salon by [the Churchills]207-the churchills ' Indian rugs and Turkish chair - backs . Its new ugliness , meeting [her]134-belinda eye , seems ' to add to the vexation of [her]134-belinda spirit . The sunlight on [the street]458-the street vexes [her]134-belinda too . [She]134-belinda wanders for a while aimlessly about [the room]422-the room , and then drops as aimlessly into a chair . To [an observer]2929-an observer it would seem that [she]134-belinda were quite without occupation . But it is not so . [She]134-belinda is still at work upon that sum . [She]134-belinda has just finished it , or rather [she]134-belinda has just begun it afresh , when an unexpected interruption drives it , not away — nothing , alas ! could do that — but into the background of [her]134-belinda mind . The summer afternoon is at its drowsiest , even the flies buzz inertly along the pane , when [the room]422-the room - door opens and [Professor Forth]136-professor forth looks in . "[0-i] [I]0-i beg [your]999-your pardon , " [he]136-professor forth says formally , "[0-i] but [I]0-i think [[your]999-your page]1000-your page must have been misinformed ; [he]1000-your page tells [me]0-i that [Sarah]135-sarah is not at [home]2345-home . " At the sound of [his]136-professor forth voice , separated by how many seas and continents from [her]0-i thoughts , [Belinda]134-belinda starts to [her]0-i feet ; then , conjuring suddenly up a civil smile , says gently : "[1000-your page] But [I]0-i am afraid [he]1000-your page is not misinformed . [I]0-i am afraid [she]135-sarah is out . Did [you]999-your expect to find [her]135-sarah ? " [He]136-professor forth has entered [the room]422-the room now in [his]136-professor forth hard and graceless academic black , which somehow looks out of character with [the light - coloured room]2932-the light - coloured room and the blazing day . "[999-your] Naturally [I]0-i expected to find [her]135-sarah , " [he]136-professor forth replies sharply , "[135-sarah] since it is by [her]135-sarah own appointment that [I]0-i am [here]2351-here . After evading on various trivial pretexts every meeting proposed by [me]0-i for the past week , [she]135-sarah [herself]135-sarah gave [me]0-i a distinct and definitive rendezvous for this hour and day . [I]0-i am punctual to the moment ! " glancing angrily at the Dresden clock . "[0-i] [I]0-i am sadly afraid that [she]135-sarah has forgotten all about it , " replies [Belinda]134-belinda , bursting into a helpless laugh ; but indeed there is no greater fallacy than that one may not laugh heartily , violently , and not hysterically , when one 's heart is breaking ; "[135-sarah] [she]135-sarah has gone out upon an expedition . " "[135-sarah] [She]135-sarah is always going out upon expeditions , " retorts [he]136-professor forth snappishly . [Belinda]134-belinda sighs ; [her]134-belinda mirth vanished as quickly as it came . [She]134-belinda has no energy to take up the cudgels for [Sarah]135-sarah , of whose conduct [no one]365-no one can think worse than [she]135-sarah does , and of whose meditated villainy [she]134-belinda is guiltily aware . "[135-sarah] [She]135-sarah is young , " [she]134-belinda says lamely . "[135-sarah] [I]0-i can not see that that is any valid apology for a systematic neglect of all the more serious duties of life , " [he]136-professor forth replies fretfully . [He]136-professor forth has walked to the window , where [he]136-professor forth now stands drowned in a bath of golden radiance . Never has [he]136-professor forth looked less lovable ; ill - humour rendering yet more pinched and captious [his]136-professor forth pinched pedant face ; and never has [Belinda]134-belinda felt so charitably towards [him]136-professor forth . "[1003-he] [He]1003-he is not amiable ; [Heaven]153-heaven knows that [he]1003-he is not attractive , " [she]134-belinda says to [herself]134-belinda ; "[153-heaven] so much the worse for [him]1003-he . But [he]1003-he is unhappy ; what better claim could [he]1003-he have upon [my]0-i sympathy ? " "[0-i] Do [you]0-i want [her]135-sarah for anything special ? " [she]134-belinda asks not unkindly , going up and standing beside [him]136-professor forth in the rain of sunbeams in [her]134-belinda large young beauty ; "[0-i] anything in which [I]0-i can help [you]0-i ? " It is obvious that the idea had never occurred to [him]136-professor forth that in [her]134-belinda [he]136-professor forth should find either the ability or the willingness to aid [him]136-professor forth . "[0-i] [You]0-i are very good , " [he]136-professor forth answers stiffly ; "[0-i] the fact is , [I]0-i wanted to throw together a few thoughts upon the Idea of Colour among [the Athenians]1004-the athenians , " glancing at a bundle of notes and papers in [his]136-professor forth hands , "[0-i] and [I]0-i entirely depended upon [Sarah]135-sarah to be [[my]0-i secretary]1005-my secretary . [She]135-sarah is perfectly aware , " with a revived and extreme exasperation of tone , "[135-sarah] of the affection in [my]0-i eyes which precludes the possibility of [my]0-i writing more than a certain number of hours a day , and which keeps [me]0-i here in the middle of term , unavoidably absent from [my]0-i post and [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge . " "[135-sarah] [She]135-sarah is very provoking ! " assents [Belinda]134-belinda soothingly . "[135-sarah] But as far as the writing goes , [I]0-i write a much better hand than [Sarah]135-sarah . [She]135-sarah never would learn , when [we]1006-we were [children]1007-children . [She]135-sarah was always playing monkey - tricks upon [the master]1008-the master all through the lesson . Can not [I]0-i be [[your]0-i secretary]1009-your secretary ? " As [she]0-i speaks , [she]0-i lifts to [his]1008-the master [her]0-i large serious eyes , full of a compassion that is none the less sincere for being slightly tinged with contempt . "[0-i] [You]0-i are very good ! " [he]1008-the master repeats ceremoniously . "[0-i] [I]0-i am aware that [I]0-i have no right to trespass upon [your]0-i valuable time . " "[0-i] There is [no one else to trespass upon it]1010-no one else to trespass upon it , " [she]0-i answers , stifling a sigh . "[0-i] On the contrary , [I]0-i am obliged to anyone who will help [me]0-i to get through it . " As [she]0-i speaks [she]0-i walks towards the writing - table , and quickly and methodically arranging the writing materials , seats [herself]0-i , and in a few moments is penning [her]0-i first sentence from [his]1008-the master dictation . [She]0-i has undertaken [the office]417-the office out of pure good - nature , and at first fulfils it quite mechanically . Gradually , however , as the meaning of the words [she]0-i is writing penetrates through [her]0-i ears into [her]0-i understanding , a slight interest in the subject in hand awakens in [her]0-i . [She]0-i asks a question or two . By - and - by there comes a Greek word . "[0-i] May it be written in English letters ? " [she]0-i asks , glancing up . "[0-i] No ? Well , then [I]0-i am afraid [I]0-i must leave it for [you]0-i to insert . " "[0-i] [You]0-i do not know the Greek character ? " [he]1008-the master asks , with a slight touch of regret in [his]1008-the master tone . [She]0-i shakes [her]0-i head . "[0-i] [I]0-i am afraid [I]0-i must ask [you]0-i , " smiling a little , "[0-i] not to question [me]0-i too closely as to what [I]0-i know . " "[0-i] [I]0-i offered to teach it to [Sarah]135-sarah , " [he]1008-the master says aggrievedly . "[0-i] And [she]135-sarah refused , of course . " "[135-sarah] It is not the want of knowledge , " [he]1008-the master says , beginning to pace gloomily up and down [the room]422-the room , "[135-sarah] that is the irremediable evil . It is the total lack of all desire for knowledge — that is what [I]0-i deplore in [Sarah]135-sarah . " [Belinda]134-belinda has paused in [her]134-belinda writing , [her]134-belinda elbow leant on the table , and idly brushing with the feather of the pen the red curve of [her]134-belinda lips . "[135-sarah] [I]0-i have never known an instance , " continues [he]1008-the master , still pursuing [his]1008-the master irritated walk , "[0-i] of [a young person whose character had undergone so radical a change]1011-a young person whose character had undergone so radical a change in so comparatively short a period of time . " "[0-i] Do [you]0-i think so ? " cries [Belinda]134-belinda , surprised . "[0-i] [She]135-sarah has always been exactly the same as long as [I]0-i can remember [her]135-sarah ! " "[135-sarah] When first [I]0-i made [her]135-sarah acquaintance , " [he]1008-the master goes on , not heeding the interruption , "[0-i] [I]0-i of course became at once aware of [her]135-sarah ignorance — that is patent ; but [she]135-sarah appeared to [me]0-i to be not lacking in intellectual force , nor in a rather remarkable desire for self - improvement . On the very first evening [I]0-i met [her]135-sarah , [she]135-sarah deplored to [me]0-i the deficiency of [her]135-sarah education , and asked [me]0-i in so many words to aid [her]135-sarah in the formation of [her]135-sarah mind . " [Belinda]134-belinda drops the pen . It is not a nearly large enough shield to hide the convulsive mirth that this revelation of [[her]134-belinda sister]2366-her sister 's hideous hypocrisy has called forth . "[135-sarah] [I]0-i still cherish the hope , " continues [he]2937-he , fortunately unaware of the character of [[his]2937-he auditor]2938-his auditor 's emotion , "[135-sarah] that this may be only a phase ; that on [her]135-sarah return to [[her]135-sarah home]1012-her home and [her]135-sarah more regular occupations , freer from these senseless distractions , " with an exaggerated emphasis,"her[135-sarah] mind may resume that soberer bias which , from [my]0-i first impression of [her]135-sarah , [I]0-i can not but believe to be its natural one . " [Belinda]134-belinda , still unable to speak , contents [herself]134-belinda with a gentle head - shake , as commentary and gloss upon which there comes , at the same moment , the sound of a scampering step on the stone stairs , of a loudly singing voice , waking to life again [the dead dumb house]2939-the dead dumb house . In a moment the door flies open , and [the person whose mind is expected so soon to resume its soberer bias]2940-the person whose mind is expected so soon to resume its soberer bias stands before [them]2941-them , [her]135-sarah hat a good deal on one side , from the weight of the flowering may - bough stuck rakishly in it — the may - bough whose strong and almost pungent perfume comes rushing into [the room]422-the room with [her]135-sarah . "[0-i] Are not [you]0-i delighted to welcome [me]0-i back so unexpectedly early ? " cries [she]0-i joyously . "[0-i] But it was so hot , and [[my]0-i soldiers]1013-my soldiers were all so cross and low at the prospect of losing [me]0-i , and [Von Breiden - bach]208-von breiden - bach had a toothache , and so — [Mr. Forth]209-mr. forth ! " suddenly catching sight of [him]209-mr. forth . "[209-mr. forth] Ah ! " with an abrupt change and refrigeration of tone , "[209-mr. forth] of course [you]0-i came about that essay of [yours]0-i ; and , equally of course , [I]0-i forgot all about it . Well , [I]0-i dare say there is no great hurry ! Happily , [the Greeks]1014-the greeks will keep ; [they]1014-the greeks will not run away . " There is an ominous silence . Then — "[1014-the greeks] It is unfortunate , " begins [the Professor]2365-the professor , in a voice trembling with indignation , while the puckers of anger that [Belinda]134-belinda 's mild hand has been smoothing away , again form their network over [his]209-mr. forth face , "[1014-the greeks] that , considering the position in which [we]1015-we stand relatively to [each other]469-each other , [our]1015-we views of life and its significance should be so diametrically — " [Belinda]134-belinda leaves [the room]422-the room . "[0-i] How can [I]0-i ever thank [you]0-i enough for having paved the way for [me]0-i ? " says [Sarah]135-sarah next morning , as [the two sisters]2945-the two sisters sit awaiting breakfast . "[0-i] [I]0-i awoke to - day in such a humble , grateful frame of mind . [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i , ' Thanks to [God]184-god and [[my]0-i good sister]1017-my good sister , [I]0-i am out of [my]0-i difficulty ! ' " "[0-i] Did [you]0-i happen to mention that it was [your]0-i seventeenth ? " asks [Belinda]134-belinda grimly . "[0-i] [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i , " continues [Sarah]135-sarah , feigning deafness , "[0-i] [I]0-i will put on a clean calico gown , and ask [granny]156-granny to let [us]1018-us have some champagne for dinner , to celebrate [my]0-i little innocent festival . Really , joking apart , it was almost worth while to be engaged to [him]1019-him , for the pleasure of having it broken off . Can not [you]0-i understand that ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i have already explained to [you]0-i several times that [I]0-i would rather have been burnt alive than be engaged to [him]1019-him at all , " replies [Belinda]134-belinda trenchantly . But the snub , like [many kindred predecessors]2946-many kindred predecessors , passes airily over [Sarah]135-sarah 's yellow head , and leaves no mark upon [her]135-sarah satisfied serenity . "[0-i] Punch , " [she]134-belinda says , taking the two dogs ' forepaws in [her]134-belinda hands , and looking gravely in [their]1018-us black faces , "[186-punch] [Punch]186-punch , [I]0-i am free ! Slutty , [I]0-i am free ! Go and tell the cats and the parrot ! " [Belinda]134-belinda has sunk back into [herself]134-belinda . [She]134-belinda is wondering feverishly what is making the letters so late . "[0-i] [I]0-i have not even made [an enemy of [him]1019-him]1020-an enemy of him , " pursues [Sarah]135-sarah , loosing the dogs ' paws , and sinking back with a sigh of complacency in [her]135-sarah chair . "[0-i] [I]0-i believe that in [his]1019-him heart [he]1019-him was quite as glad to be out of it as [I.]0-i [He]1019-him was the first of [them]1021-them , " with a slight regretful pout , "[1019-him] who was glad to be off ! " "[1019-him] [I]0-i think [he]1019-him was very glad ! " says [Belinda]134-belinda spitefully . "[1019-him] Say one word more , and [I]0-i will have [him]1019-him back again , " cries [Sarah]135-sarah , roused by this challenge . But [Belinda]134-belinda makes no rejoinder . To [her]134-belinda , [Sarah]135-sarah and [[her]135-sarah light loves]2947-her light loves have become distant and insignificant things . [Her]135-sarah strained ears have caught , or [she]135-sarah thinks so , the sound of a footstep . Of course it is only [Tommy]163-tommy bringing in the breakfast ; but [he]163-tommy may be bringing [her]135-sarah death - warrant or [her]135-sarah evangel , too . It is the first day on which , according to [her]135-sarah calculation of distances , it would be possible for [her]135-sarah to receive a letter from [Rivers]143-rivers . "[0-i] If [you]1022-you had heard , " continues [Sarah]135-sarah , smiling rosily to [herself]135-sarah , "[0-i] the masterly way in which [I]0-i indicated to [him]1019-him that it was only [my]0-i consciousness of inadequacy to fill that high post , which made [me]0-i regretfully retire from it , [I]0-i think that even [you]1022-you would have admired [me]0-i . " "[0-i] Should [I]0-i ? " quite inattentively . "[1019-him] [He]1019-him swallowed it all , " continues [Sarah]135-sarah , growing grave . "[1019-him] Good heavens ! " throwing up [her]135-sarah eyes , "[1023-they] what will not [they]1023-they swallow ? " The sound has died away again . It could not have been even [Tommy]163-tommy . "[0-i] [I]0-i cried a little , " resumes [Sarah]135-sarah , with that glow of modest retrospective satisfaction still diffused all over [her]0-i , extending even to [her]0-i pink cambric gown . "[0-i] Do not ask [me]0-i how [I]0-i did it ; [I]0-i could not even engage to do it again were the same situation to return ; these strokes of genius do not repeat themselves . " [She]135-sarah stops , [her]135-sarah attention diverted into a fresh channel , for at this moment [Gustel]158-gustel throws open the door , and [Tommy]163-tommy enters , [his]163-tommy childish arms extended to [their]2948-their widest stretch to embrace the breakfast tray , upon which , beside coffee - pot and rolls , lies a heap of letters and papers . [Belinda]134-belinda does not stir now that the moment so breathlessly longed for has come ; [she]134-belinda would fain put it off again , shove it away a little further . A paralysis of fear nails [her]134-belinda to [her]134-belinda chair . [She]134-belinda feels an impulse of anger - against [Sarah]135-sarah for doing what [she]135-sarah [herself]135-sarah is incapable of ; for [her]135-sarah quick movement towards the tray , [her]135-sarah hasty turning over of [the family]2949-the family 's correspondence . There is a second 's pause — a pause during which hope still lives : then in a moment it is dead . [Sarah]135-sarah 's voice would tell [her]134-belinda that , even if [her]135-sarah words did not . "[0-i] [I]0-i am afraid there is nothing very interesting for [you]1024-her , " [she]0-i says reluctantly , tossing [her]1024-her three or four letters without looking at [her]1024-her . [Belinda]134-belinda 's heart dies ; then suddenly there flares up a tiny flame of hope in it again . Possibly [Sarah]135-sarah may not recognise [his]1024-her handwriting . Probably it is so disguised and disfigured by trouble and emotion as to be unrecognisable . Was not this the case with [her]135-sarah note ? [She]135-sarah snatches at the letters and looks dizzily from one to the other of the superscriptions . Alas , no ! they are all in the handwriting of [familiar and habitual correspondents]2950-familiar and habitual correspondents . [She]135-sarah has told [herself]135-sarah all night that [her]135-sarah expectations were not highly raised for today ; that to - day is the first day on which it would be possible to hear ; that , being only possible , it is not also probable ; that [her]135-sarah chances are better for to - morrow or the day after . And yet , now that the disappointment has come , it seems to [her]135-sarah ruinous and final . [Her]135-sarah first movement is to dash the letters down on [her]135-sarah lap ; then , with that instinct of self - respect which parts [us]2951-us from [the savage]2952-the savage and the beast , remembering that [Tommy]163-tommy 's round gaze is upon [her]135-sarah , [she]135-sarah picks up one , and shakily unfolding it , lets [her]135-sarah misery - shaded eyes fall on the page . Only for a moment , however ; a fresh thought makes [her]135-sarah drop it and fly to the papers . In a second [she]135-sarah has torn open one of the English journals , the Standard ; and seizing the advertisement sheet , greedily turns to the column of births , deaths , and marriages . [She]135-sarah runs [her]135-sarah eye down the names ; [she]135-sarah will not allow this horrible swimming to blind [her]135-sarah ; [she]135-sarah will read for [herself]135-sarah . "[0-i] [Abbots]210-abbots , [Ackers]211-ackers , [Anson]212-anson , [Baker]213-mrs. baker , [Callcott]214-callcott , [Frith]215-frith , [Forly]46-forly , [Harper]216-harper , [Key]217-key — when do the R 's come ? what a long , long list ! [She]135-sarah can see it clearly ; there is no mistake . "[143-rivers] On the 24th inst . , at [Denver Hall]49-denver hall , [Yorkshire]31-yorkshire , [John Appleby Rivers]162-rivers , [M.P. , aged 54]1026-m.p. , aged 54 . " At the same moment , [Tommy]163-tommy , [his]163-tommy functions ended , shuts the door behind [him]163-tommy .
