"[1026-m.p. , aged 54] [I]0-i knew it , " [she]0-i says , speaking suddenly in a voice that is a little tremulous , a little awed , and yet triumphant . "[0-i] [I]0-i knew it was [[his]162-rivers father]2550-his father ; [he]2550-his father is dead ; [he]2550-his father has committed suicide . [Poor David]219-david ! no wonder [he]2550-his father looked odd . There is a paragraph about it . " "[162-rivers] Committed suicide ! " repeats [Belinda]134-belinda with a gasp , turning as white as the table - cloth , and [her]134-belinda great grey eyes dilating , while the image of [[her]134-belinda poor boy - lover]2954-her poor boy - lover and [his]162-rivers whole - hearted devotion to , [his]162-rivers innocent enthusiasm about [[his]162-rivers father]2550-his father , at which [she]134-belinda had sometimes smiled , superior yet envious , darts painfully back upon [her]134-belinda memory . [Sarah]135-sarah has snatched a table - knife and is rapidly and jaggedly cutting the paper . "[1028-we] ' [We]1028-we regret to announce the death , under peculiarly painful circumstances , of [Mr. John Appleby Rivers]162-rivers , of [Denver Hall]49-denver hall , [Yorkshire]31-yorkshire , who for the last ten years has represented [the Borough of [Denver]51-denver]50-the borough of denver in the Conservative interest in Parliament . [The deceased gentleman]1029-the deceased gentleman had retired to rest on the night of the 25th in [his]1029-the deceased gentleman usual health , but on the following morning [[his]1029-the deceased gentleman valet]1030-his valet , on going to call [him]1029-the deceased gentleman at the accustomed hour , found [his]1029-the deceased gentleman door locked , and could obtain no answer to [his]1029-the deceased gentleman repeated knocks . [The family]2949-the family becoming alarmed , an entrance was effected through the window , when [the unfortunate gentleman]1032-the unfortunate gentleman was found extended lifeless on the floor , with [his]1029-the deceased gentleman throat cut from ear to ear . Medical assistance was at once procured , but in vain , as life had evidently been extinct for some hours . ' " [Sarah]135-sarah pauses with a shudder of disgust , even [her]135-sarah blooming cheek a little paled . "[523-people] Why will [people]523-people cut [their]523-people throats , " [she]135-sarah says complainingly , "[523-people] when there are so many clean ways of dying ? " "[1029-the deceased gentleman] Perhaps [he]1029-the deceased gentleman did not do it [himself]1029-the deceased gentleman , " cries [Belinda]134-belinda , catching breathlessly at this hope . Why do [all newspaper - writers]1035-all newspaper - writers love it ? ' It is surmised that distress of mind , arising from pecuniary embarrassment , was the immediate cause of the rash act . ' " [She]135-sarah stops for a few moments , and there is silence . [Belinda]134-belinda has put [her]134-belinda hands over [her]134-belinda eyes , before which the ghastly sight is conjured up in its red horror . This , then , is what has robbed [her]134-belinda of [him]1029-the deceased gentleman ! This is the spectacle for which [he]1029-the deceased gentleman has exchanged the spring - dressed , sun - warmed [Grosse Garten]1-the grosse garten . [She]134-belinda shivers , and the shiver is followed by a warm rush of passionate pity . "[1029-the deceased gentleman] What will [he]1029-the deceased gentleman do ? How will [he]1029-the deceased gentleman bear it ? Will [he]1029-the deceased gentleman ever get over it ? " [We]2956-we ask [ourselves]2956-we and [each other]469-each other this senseless question , as often as an affliction a little severer than common alights upon one that is known to [us]2956-we ; although experience , a thousand times repeated , has taught [us]2956-we its folly . But below the horror and the compassion , though both are genuine , there lies in [Belinda]134-belinda 's mind a thick , deep stratum of inexpressible relief and joy . It is explained then ! Suspense is ended ; at least for the moment it seems so . There may be a cessation of that weary sum - doing . [She]134-belinda may think again of [the wood at [Wesenstein]15-wesenstein]2958-the wood at wesenstein without writhing . [Her]134-belinda past is restored to [her]134-belinda . " says [Sarah]135-sarah thoughtfully . "[0-i] [I]0-i do not much like that . "[135-sarah] " Yes . "[135-sarah] " Ah , "[135-sarah] with a little sigh of satisfaction , " that is all right then ! The sooner [we]1050-we get to [England]25-england the better , for all reasons . "[135-sarah] [Belinda]134-belinda echoes the sentiment . What is there to keep [her]134-belinda or [her]134-belinda heart here now ? In the place of the drag which a while ago [she]134-belinda would have put upon the days , [she]134-belinda would now use whip and spur to [them]1049-them . If Time were to obey [our]1050-we impulses , in what a strange jerky manner would [he]1051-he proceed ! It is beyond the range of possibility that [she]134-belinda should receive a letter from [him]1051-he here . It would be the height of filial impiety . How dare [she]134-belinda thrust [her]134-belinda trivial self between [him]1051-he and the grandeur of [his]1051-he grief ? How dare one thought of [her]134-belinda cross [his]1051-he mind ere yet [[his]1051-he father]2550-his father is laid in [his]2550-his father bloody and dishonoured grave ? But by the time that [they]1053-they have reached [England]25-england , four more days will have elapsed . [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill has stipulated that the journey shall be accomplished leisurely . Once in [England]25-england , [he]1051-he and [she]134-belinda will at all events be separated by only one day 's post , less than a day 's journey . In [London]10-london there are so many posts in the day . Every two hours does not there come a double knock ? and may not any one of these double knocks possibly — nay , why be irrationally down - hearted ? — probably bring [her]134-belinda salvation ? By dint of continued cherishing , [her]134-belinda hopes soar higher still . Why should [he]1051-he write ? what is there to hinder [his]1051-he coming [himself]1051-he ? In [her]134-belinda heart [she]134-belinda hears [his]1051-he footfall on the stairs ; it will fall more softly on the carpeted [London]10-london steps than on these bare stone ones . Perhaps it will be less springy than of yore ; grief may have made it heavier and slower . [He]1051-he will enter in [his]1051-he black clothes ; [she]134-belinda has never seen [him]1051-he in black , and tries to reconstruct [him]1051-he in this sombre habit . [He]1051-he will not smile , it would not be right that [he]1051-he should ; but [he]1051-he will stretch out [his]1051-he arms to [her]134-belinda — [Tommy]163-tommy being gone . At this point [her]134-belinda face always falls forward into [her]134-belinda hands , and the carnations overrun [their]1054-their borders . [She]134-belinda can no more look at that picture than [she]134-belinda can stare unwinking at the mid - day sun . But though [she]134-belinda struggles earnestly to keep hope sober and low , it is with an elastic step and a bright face that [she]134-belinda treads [the platform of [the Dresden railway station]1056-the dresden railway station]1055-the platform of the dresden railway station on the day and at the hour of [their]1054-their departure . The tickets have been taken ; [their]1054-their own , that of the luggage , Punch 's . [Slutty]157-slutty is small enough to defraud the revenue by travelling in [an ingeniously constructed house of [her]157-slutty own]1057-an ingeniously constructed house of her own , which has the air of a large dressing - bag , and under which [Belinda]134-belinda , [Sarah]135-sarah , and [the maid]1058-the maid take turns to stagger . And now [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill and [Belinda]134-belinda have already seated [themselves]1054-their and arranged [their]1054-their packages . [Sarah]135-sarah still loiters on the step , half [the German army]1059-the german army gathered round [her]135-sarah . [She]135-sarah has asked [them]1059-the german army all to come and see [her]135-sarah off , and [not one]1060-not one but has answered to the call . [Her]135-sarah hands are full of great bouquets that they have not stretch enough to hold . [She]135-sarah is distributing more addresses than [she]135-sarah has time rapidly to pencil . Apparently , [every one of [them]1059-the german army]1061-every one of them is to correspond with [her]135-sarah . [Belinda]134-belinda has no bouquet , and [no one]365-no one has asked for [her]134-belinda direction . Even [her]134-belinda last view of [the fair city]1063-the fair city is obstructed by [Sarah]135-sarah , who has monopolised the window to lean out and kiss [her]134-belinda fingers , crying , " Auf Wiedersehen ! "[135-sarah] until the last glimpse of [her]135-sarah dark - blue , light - blue , and green admirers is lost to sight . And yet it is with a light heart , that sometimes even dances , that [Miss Churchill]152-miss churchill steams away towards [[her]152-miss churchill native shores]1064-her native shores . " Je ne comprends pas comme on peut tant penser à une personne : n'aurai - je jamais tout pensé ? "[152-miss churchill] It is November ; the second November since [the Churchills]207-the churchills ' return from [Dresden]2-dresden . A second summer has raced after a second spring ; and a second autumn is pursuing both . The full tale of eighteen months is complete . [Time]228-time has swung by on [his]207-the churchills mighty wings , which all the centuries are power - less to tire , bearing in [his]207-the churchills arms diverse gifts . To [some]1065-some [he]207-the churchills has brought satisfied ambition ; to some grinding poverty ; to some a surfeit of pleasure ; to [some a mad - house]1066-some a mad - house ; and to some a grave . To many only a bundle of little nagging cares and pigmy pleasures , that passed without much heeding . To [the Churchills]207-the churchills [he]207-the churchills has brought — what ? To [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill a beautiful new râtelier ; to [Sarah]135-sarah , [six new lovers]1067-six new lovers and one new dog ; and to [Belinda]134-belinda , a knowledge of [the postman]1068-the postman 's step , whether distant or near , that [she]134-belinda might defy [any inhabitant of this or [any other street to rival]1070-any other street to rival]1069-any inhabitant of this or any other street to rival . Before [her]134-belinda return [home]2345-home , [she]134-belinda had congratulated [herself]134-belinda upon the convenience and number of the [London]10-london posts . Ere six months are out , [she]134-belinda execrates [their]1072-their frequency . For eighteen months [Belinda]134-belinda has been listening , and not once have [her]134-belinda ears been filled with the sound that they are ever strained to catch . Not once has [Rivers]223-rivers written . Not once has [he]207-the churchills come in person to explain [his]207-the churchills silence . [He]207-the churchills is gone — simply gone out of [her]134-belinda life . That is all ! [He]207-the churchills was free , of course , to come or to go ; as [she]134-belinda tells [herself]134-belinda , [she]134-belinda can not quarrel with [him]207-the churchills for that . The why [she]134-belinda is at issue with [him]207-the churchills is that [he]207-the churchills has taken the taste out of [her]134-belinda life with [him]207-the churchills . For [her]134-belinda [he]207-the churchills has taken the colour out of the sunsets , and the music out of the larks . [She]134-belinda looks at the beauty of [[our]1073-our mother earth]1074-our mother earth with a grudging , sullen eye . The summers with the glories of [their]1075-their roses , the autumns with the glories of their sheaves , are to [her]134-belinda absolutely waste and worthless . " Even if [he]207-the churchills came back to [me]134-belinda , "[134-belinda] [she]134-belinda says to [herself]134-belinda ; " even if [I]134-belinda lived to be ninety , and saw [him]207-the churchills henceforth every day , every minute , until [I]134-belinda die , [I]134-belinda could never fill the emptiness of these days ; [they]2984-they will always have been dead , dead loss ! "[134-belinda] Now and again [she]134-belinda rises up in revolt against the tyranny of the idea that is eating into and corroding [her]134-belinda prime . [She]134-belinda will cut [him]207-the churchills out of [her]134-belinda life ; will cut off that portion of [her]134-belinda life in which [he]207-the churchills had concern , sheer away , like a precipice . " [I]134-belinda did well before [I]134-belinda knew [him]207-the churchills , "[134-belinda] [she]134-belinda says to [herself]134-belinda , with a sort of indignation . " [He]207-the churchills was in [the world]643-the world , and so was [I]134-belinda ; [he]207-the churchills smiled as [he]207-the churchills does now — does [he]207-the churchills smile now , [I]134-belinda wonder?—and [I]134-belinda was none the worse for it . [He]207-the churchills did not blot out the sun ; [he]207-the churchills did not make it uphill work to eat , to speak , to breathe . Let things be as they were then . Why can not [they]2986-they be ? [They]2986-they shall be ! "[134-belinda] For a moment [she]134-belinda is strong and light - hearted ; sings a gay verse of a song ; feels the goodliness of youth . Then a sick qualm comes over [her]134-belinda . It is gone , done with ! and [the whole earth]1076-the whole earth , the whole of life , is empty , hideous , void ! It is November ; the afternoon is drawing towards its close . Tea has been drunk , and [visitors]1077-visitors are gone . The hour of dressing draws nigh . This , however , is a fact that neither [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill nor [Sarah]135-sarah are willing to admit ; [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill because [her]185-mrs. churchill drive has made [her]185-mrs. churchill sleepy , and fire and owl - light are drowsy and soothing ; [Sarah]135-sarah because [she]135-sarah is absorbed in the ingenious , if not useful , employment of painting the large white terrier lately added to [the establishment]1078-the establishment , in coloured stripes and spots to represent [a clown]1079-a clown . [Jane]229-jane is , happily for [herself]229-jane , not [a sensitive dog]1080-a sensitive dog , and submits with stolid good - humour to a process that would penetrate [Slutty]157-slutty 's heart with agonies of undying shame . " [Belinda]134-belinda is late , "[185-mrs. churchill] says [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill , drawing [herself]185-mrs. churchill up into a sitting posture , the first preparatory step towards the unavoidable , dreaded move [upstairs]1081-upstairs . " [I]135-sarah hope [she]134-belinda will not come back until [Jane]229-jane is finished , "[135-sarah] answers [Sarah]135-sarah warmly , hesitating for an instant in the choice of a pigment ; while [Jane]229-jane opens [her]229-jane mouth in a large , bored , patient yawn . "[185-mrs. churchill] [The cherub]1108-the cherub retires , trembling , and [[his]163-tommy mistress]2533-his mistress 's attention returns to the object from which [his]163-tommy entrance had diverted it ; the object which has called both [herself]2533-his mistress and [[her]2533-his mistress granddaughters]1110-her granddaughters hither . It is the washing of the dogs , a function periodically celebrated and revelled in by [Sarah]135-sarah . [Jane]229-jane is already washed ; [she]229-jane is a pushing dog , always putting [herself]229-jane forward , and claiming the chief seats in [the synagogues]1111-the synagogues . Candescently white , cleansed from stain of indigo and ochre , no longer comic , but gravely beautiful , [she]229-jane lies in glory , drying on a blanket . It is now [the martyred Slutty who is in the wash - tub]1112-the martyred slutty who is in the wash - tub , dripping resignedly , while [Sarah]135-sarah 's strong white arm is employed in vigorously scrubbing [her]135-sarah fat back , and the soapsuds are falling into [her]135-sarah dreadfully goggling eyes . [Punch]186-punch is seated in a deep dejection not usual with [him]186-punch a good distance off , well aware that [his]186-punch fate also is hurrying to over- take [him]186-punch , but trying to imagine that [he]186-punch may avoid it by remaining seated in the middle distance , and totally refusing to reply when addressed . [Belinda]134-belinda sits by , occasionally lending a helping hand when [Slutty]157-slutty struggles , and occasionally turning a page of the volume of [Browning]231-browning , which , in pursuance of [her]134-belinda intention of living henceforth by the intellect , lies open on [her]134-belinda knees . [Tommy]163-tommy has again appeared . " If [you]185-mrs. churchill please , ' m , there is [a lady with a tambourine]3037-a lady with a tambourine — "[163-tommy] " [A lady with a tambourine]3037-a lady with a tambourine ! "[185-mrs. churchill] repeats [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill , in an awful voice . " What do [you]185-mrs. churchill mean , [Tommy]163-tommy ? "[134-belinda] [Mr. Forth]209-mr. forth is looking towards the door as [Belinda]134-belinda enters ; and an indescribable air of relief steals over [his]209-mr. forth countenance when [he]209-mr. forth perceives that [she]134-belinda is alone . " [I]209-mr. forth have taken the liberty of calling , "[209-mr. forth] [he]209-mr. forth begins formally ; but [she]134-belinda interrupts [him]209-mr. forth . " [I]134-belinda am glad to see [you]209-mr. forth , "[134-belinda] [she]134-belinda says , with a direct look of cold sincerity . " [I]134-belinda wanted to talk to [you]209-mr. forth . Will [you]209-mr. forth sit down ? "[134-belinda] And yet , now that the opportunity for gratifying that want has come , [she]134-belinda seems for a while to lack the power . According to [his]209-mr. forth chilly wo nt , [he]209-mr. forth has chosen the seat nearest the fire , opposite the window , and [she]134-belinda has placed [herself]134-belinda on the other side . As [she]134-belinda looks in [his]209-mr. forth face , a cataract of agonizing memories pours storming over [her]134-belinda heart . In the throng and bustle of last night , memory had not been half so busy . [She]134-belinda had thought that [she]134-belinda could see [him]209-mr. forth without pain ; with only that dull numbness with which [she]134-belinda sees small and great . But now [she]134-belinda finds that for [her]134-belinda in each wrinkle traced by thought about [his]209-mr. forth eyes — in each pucker of discontent around [his]209-mr. forth lips — there lurks a demon of recollection . [The little wintry , fog - thickened [London drawing - room]1117-london drawing - room]1116-the little wintry , fog - thickened london drawing - room has changed to [the sunny Dresden salon]1118-the sunny dresden salon . [It]1116-the little wintry , fog - thickened london drawing - room is full again of [Sarah]135-sarah 's pungent pleasantries at [[her]135-sarah lover]2402-her lover 's cost , and of [Rivers]223-rivers ' resounding laughs at [them]1120-them . A hundred worthless speeches of [Rivers]223-rivers ' , ridiculing the other 's foibles , [his]209-mr. forth muffetees , [his]209-mr. forth parsimony , [his]209-mr. forth digestion — speeches trivial and merry when spoken , now solemn and woful — rush back upon [her]134-belinda mind . Oh , if [her]134-belinda heart should turn out not to be stone - dead after all ! But it must!—it must!—it shall ! [Her]134-belinda silence has lasted longer than [she]134-belinda is aware , and there is a slight tone of offence — to that , too , a memory is tied — in [[her]134-belinda visitor]1048-her visitor 's voice , as [he]209-mr. forth says : " [I]209-mr. forth hope [I]209-mr. forth have not chosen an inopportune moment for [my]209-mr. forth visit ? "[134-belinda] " [You]134-belinda must be aware , "[209-mr. forth] [he]209-mr. forth answers frigidly , " that the whole tendency of [my]209-mr. forth teaching is to show that the pursuit of knowledge is the only one that really and abundantly rewards the labour bestowed upon it . "[209-mr. forth] " [You]209-mr. forth think so ? " [You]209-mr. forth think that it would be enough — that it would satisfy [one]373-one — that [one]373-one would not need anything beyond ? " Since there is no limit to the domain of [the knowable]3059-the knowable , "[209-mr. forth] [he]209-mr. forth is beginning , when again [she]134-belinda breaks in upon [him]209-mr. forth : " No , no ! of course not ! " How curiously ugly [he]209-mr. forth is ! "[135-sarah] cries [Sarah]135-sarah , chuckling at the recollection . "[134-belinda] cries [Belinda]134-belinda angrily , beginning to walk restlessly about [the room]422-the room after a fashion that [she]134-belinda has adopted during the last year — a fashion that is somewhat trying to [[her]134-belinda housemates]1131-her housemates ' patience . " [I]2366-her sister recognize it ; [I]2366-her sister admit it ; [I]2366-her sister would imitate it if [I]2366-her sister could ! "[2366-her sister] " Since when ? "[135-sarah] asks [Sarah]135-sarah drily . There is something in [her]135-sarah apparently harmless question which jars upon [Belinda]134-belinda 's sick nerves . " It is very hard , "[135-sarah] [she]135-sarah breaks out , reddening , " that [one]373-one should be thrown back and ridiculed here , when one makes any least effort to improve [one]373-one 's self ! What is the use of making any attempt in such an atmosphere as this ? What is the use of struggling — of trying — "[135-sarah] [She]135-sarah bursts into stormy tears , and leaves [the room]422-the room . " [Her]134-belinda temper is becoming impossible ! "[185-mrs. churchill] exclaims [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill , holding up [her]185-mrs. churchill pretty , old white hands . But [Sarah]135-sarah only says , " Poor dear ! "[135-sarah] in a very lenient voice , and kisses all the dogs . The year declines towards its mirk close . Every day a little more is taken from the light and added to the dark . [London]10-london is full and cheerful ; with a pleasanter , friendlier , more leisurely social stir than the overpowering June one . Two or three good pieces are running at [the theatres]1133-the theatres , and the shop - windows are warm with furs . Round [the Churchills]207-the churchills a crop of small dinners and dances has sprung up . The time nears mid - December . [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill 's wish as to the non - repetition of [Professor Forth]136-professor forth 's visit has met with the usual fate of wishes . [He]136-professor forth has come again repeatedly ; so repeatedly that the dogs have ceased barking at [him]136-professor forth , though [they]1134-they are not so hypocritical as to wag [their]1134-they tails on [his]136-professor forth approach ; nor , indeed , does [he]136-professor forth ever , by kind pats or well - chosen civilities , give [them]1134-they any cause to do so . Even [the obtuse Tommy]1135-the obtuse tommy has learned that [he]136-professor forth is to be shown , not into [the drawing - room]3050-the drawing - room , but into [the little back litter - room]1137-the little back litter - room , which has been arbitrarily cleared of [Sarah]135-sarah 's paint- pots , and the promiscuous rubbish in which [her]135-sarah soul delights ; has been furnished with pens , ink , and dictionaries , and raised and dignified by the name of study . For [Belinda]134-belinda 's fervour for learning rages with a feverish heat that might make [a thoughtful looker - on inclined to question its solidity or its continuance]1138-a thoughtful looker - on inclined to question its solidity or its continuance . [She]134-belinda is learning Latin Syntax ; [she]134-belinda is being taught Greek ; [she]134-belinda has undertaken a course of Universal History ; [she]134-belinda devotes [her]134-belinda spare moments to the Elements of Algebra . Very seldom now does [she]134-belinda join [[her]134-belinda family]1139-her family in the evening . Mostly [she]134-belinda remains [downstairs]511-downstairs , writing Latin Exercises , learning Irregular Greek Verbs ; working , working on until late into the night . [She]134-belinda would like never to stop ; to leave no single chink or cranny by which memory may enter . And is the charm working ? Is the remedy beginning to make its healing virtue felt ? This is the question that [she]134-belinda never dares ask [herself]134-belinda . Sometimes , indeed , it thrusts itself upon [her]134-belinda in the sadness of the night . Sometimes the pen drops from [her]134-belinda stiffened fingers , or [her]134-belinda tired brain relaxes its hold upon the hardconned page , and [she]134-belinda groans out to [herself]134-belinda — [she]134-belinda alone awake , with [her]134-belinda melancholy gas - jet burning above [her]134-belinda in the silence of the sleeping house—"Of what use ? what use ? "[134-belinda] Has it given back to life [its]1141-its sweet and wholesome taste ? Has it helped [her]134-belinda to dominate that terrible irritability which makes [no person]1142-no person and no moment safe from some senseless outbreak of [her]134-belinda temper ? Has it conquered that gloom which renders [her]134-belinda the kill - joy of [her]134-belinda little circle . There is not one of these questions that [she]134-belinda can honestly answer in the affirmative . But perhaps there has not yet been time enough to test the efficacy of this cure . [Its]1141-its action will doubtless be slow , but all the more lasting and solid for that . [She]134-belinda must persevere ; it would be madness not to persevere . [She]134-belinda passes [her]134-belinda hand across [her]134-belinda weary , throbbing temples , and catches up the pen again . The clocks strike two , and [she]134-belinda still writes . It is not night now ; it is afternoon . [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill and [Sarah]135-sarah , furred and feathered , with [their]1143-their bonnets nicely tied on , and [their]1143-their faces alight with placid good - humour , have set off in the brougham on [their]1143-their daily career of calls and [shops]1144-shops . [Belinda]134-belinda remains behind in [the little dingy back room]1145-the little dingy back room , with [her]134-belinda copy - books . Not once to - day has [she]134-belinda tasted the wholesome outside air — wholesome with all its blacks , and fog - charged as it is . [She]134-belinda has been alone [here]2351-here the whole day , except for a couple of ten minutes grudgingly snatched for breakfast and luncheon . [She]134-belinda has been alone , but [she]134-belinda is so no longer . [Professor Forth]136-professor forth has just been ushered in to partake [her]134-belinda solitude . [She]134-belinda meets [him]136-professor forth with a complaint . " [I]134-belinda expected [you]136-professor forth yesterday . "[134-belinda] " [I]136-professor forth was detained by [a College meeting]3072-a college meeting , and by other engagements , "[136-professor forth] [he]136-professor forth answers . " [I]136-professor forth hope , "[136-professor forth] ceremoniously , " that [you]136-professor forth were not inconvenienced by the deferring of [my]136-professor forth visit ? "[136-professor forth] " [I]134-belinda was , "[134-belinda] [she]134-belinda answered brusquely . " As it happened , [I]134-belinda wanted [you]136-professor forth badly . [I]134-belinda was completely puzzled by a passage here , "[134-belinda] laying [her]134-belinda hand upon a school edition of " Cæsar 's Commentaries . "[134-belinda] " [I]134-belinda worried over it till [I]134-belinda felt quite dazed and woolly . "[134-belinda] As [she]134-belinda speaks [she]134-belinda draws the volume towards [her]134-belinda , and [they]1147-we both stoop [their]1147-we heads over the page ; [his]1148-he with [its]1148-he old , sparse , colourless hair , thriftily drawn across the baldening crown ; [hers]1149-hers with its unregarded riches of nut - brown . The difficulty dissipated , [she]134-belinda leans back in [her]134-belinda chair . " It is hopeless to make any real progress , "[134-belinda] [she]134-belinda says morosely , " as long as [our]1147-we lessons are so interrupted . How much better it would be if [we]1147-we lived in [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge ! How [I]134-belinda wish [we]1147-we lived in [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge ! "[134-belinda] [She]134-belinda is sitting alongside of [him]1148-he , and does not look at [him]1148-he as [she]134-belinda expresses this wish . It seems to be addressed with a general vagueness to the air . [He]1148-he glances at [her]134-belinda , sidelong and suspiciously ; at the beautiful blooming profile , the discontented mouth , the fine , petulant , small nose , the veiled , unglad eyes . [He]1148-he has almost given up suspecting [her]134-belinda of late , but [her]134-belinda last aspiration has rearoused [his]1148-he distrust . Was not [Sarah]135-sarah once fervent and constant in [her]135-sarah longings to inhabit [a university town]1150-a university town ? " It would make things so much easier , "[134-belinda] [she]134-belinda continues plaintively , quite unconscious of [his]1148-he disquieting doubts . " If [I]134-belinda were in difficulties [I]134-belinda could go straight to [you]1148-he . [I]134-belinda had much rather live in [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge than [here]2351-here . "[134-belinda] [He]1148-he is still observing [her]134-belinda covertly , and makes no answer . " It must be a good life ! [Sarah]135-sarah 's whole attention , indeed , is occupied in bribing [Punch]186-punch , by a sweet biscuit brought up from luncheon , to the performance of the most striking in [his]1180-her guest repertoire of tricks , an affecting representation of death ; which , when contrasted with [his]1180-her guest usual superabundant life , is much admired by [strangers]838-strangers , and indeed by [[his]1180-her guest own family]1186-his own family . It is , however , the one of [his]1180-her guest accomplishments for which [he]1180-her guest [himself]1180-her guest has the least partiality . The command to die has to be reiterated many times before [he]1180-her guest at length rolls reluctantly over on [his]1180-her guest side ; and even then , as [he]1180-her guest looks up every half a second and jumps up every second , a good deal of the repose of death has to be supplied by [the spectator]1187-the spectator 's imagination . " What a climate ! "[185-mrs. churchill] pursues [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill in angry ejaculation . " Good heavens , [Sarah]135-sarah , why do [you]135-sarah let [Jane]229-jane make such a dreadful noise ? "[185-mrs. churchill] [She]185-mrs. churchill may well ask . [Jane]229-jane , seated on [her]229-jane haunches , is volunteering , in a loud series of forward barks , to die , to beg , to trust , to dance — to do anything of which [she]229-jane is utterly incapable , in order to divert to [herself]229-jane the attention monopolised by [Punch]186-punch . Under this head come [the two persons who have so long been standing before [a well - known Hobbema]1210-a well - known hobbema ( [the Giotto]58-the giotto , which was the ostensible cause of [their]1209-the two persons who have so long been standing before a well - known hobbema ( the giotto , which was the ostensible cause of their meeting meeting]1209-the two persons who have so long been standing before a well - known hobbema ( the giotto , which was the ostensible cause of their meeting , has been already inspected ) . [A passer - by]1211-a passer - by might presume that [they]1209-the two persons who have so long been standing before a well - known hobbema ( the giotto , which was the ostensible cause of their meeting were exhaustively criticizing [each individual beauty]1212-each individual beauty , but in point of fact one does not see the picture at all , and [the other]2396-the other thinks that [she]2396-the other does not . In after days , however , [she]2396-the other finds that [she]2396-the other must have done , so plainly comes out , printed on [her]2396-the other mind , the impress of [that long , long straight road]1214-that long , long straight road going away , away ; of those great , tall , wayside poplars , with [their]1215-their perspective of lengthy stems , [their]1215-their high , scant heads raised loftily into the pale sky — such slight , gray - green heads , each one with a different character about it ; of [the man walking along [the road]392-the road to [the distant red - roofed Dutch village]1218-the distant red - roofed dutch village]1216-the man walking along the road to the distant red - roofed dutch village . It has seemed to [Belinda]134-belinda as if [that man]1219-that man must reach [the village]1220-the village before [the Professor]2365-the professor has finished [his]2365-the professor slow speech ; but [he]2365-the professor is not yet [there]2419-there , and [the Professor]2365-the professor has ended . For [he]2365-the professor has spoken , and not Greek . And now [Belinda]134-belinda is speaking . [Her]134-belinda eyes are fixed still with a sort of glassiness on the cool and tranquil canvas of [the long - dead master]1224-the long - dead master ; and the poplars seem almost to sway to [her]134-belinda breath . [Her]134-belinda voice is steady and quiet , though hard . " [I]134-belinda am very glad of what [you]2365-the professor say as to personal affection having no part in [your]2365-the professor motives for asking [me]134-belinda to marry [you]2365-the professor . [You]2365-the professor do not want — love , "[134-belinda] [she]134-belinda makes a hardly perceptible pause before pronouncing the word , " and [I]134-belinda have none to give ; so at all events [we]3124-we start fair . "[134-belinda] [He]2365-the professor makes a sort of gesture of assent . " [I]2365-the professor distrust , and have cause for distrusting , professions of affection , "[2365-the professor] [he]2365-the professor answers drily . Never has it seemed so unlikely as at this moment . " All that [I]2365-the professor ask , all that [I]2365-the professor wish to obtain , is [an intelligent , sympathetic companion]3125-an intelligent , sympathetic companion . "[2365-the professor] " Sympathetic ! "[134-belinda] [she]134-belinda repeats reflectively . " [I]134-belinda am not sympathetic ; [I]134-belinda should be deceiving [you]2365-the professor if [I]134-belinda were to let [you]2365-the professor suppose that [I]134-belinda am . No ! let [us]3126-us be sure that [we]3126-us understand [each other]469-each other ; [I]134-belinda have as little sympathy to give as [I]134-belinda have — love ! "[134-belinda] Again that slight hesitation . " Possibly ! "[1227-he] [he]1227-he answers , with a stiff impatience , looking rather annoyed at [her]134-belinda opposition ; " on [my]1227-he side , [I]1227-he think it right to tell [you]134-belinda of what [you]134-belinda may perhaps be already aware , that the press of [my]1227-he occupations and the condition of [my]1227-he health forbid [my]1227-he indulging in many amusements enjoyed by [other persons]3128-other persons , but from which [I]1227-he shall be compelled to require [you]134-belinda , as well as [myself]1227-he , to abstain . "[1227-he] " [I]134-belinda do not want amusements ! "[134-belinda] replies [Belinda]134-belinda gloomily ; " amusements do not amuse [me]1227-he . " [I]1227-he think [I]1227-he can promise [you]134-belinda that in the life [you]134-belinda will share with [me]1227-he , [you]134-belinda will find no lack of that . [[My]1227-he mother]614-my mother — "[1227-he] " [[Your]1227-he mother]3130-your mother ! "[134-belinda] repeats [Belinda]134-belinda brusquely ; " [she]3130-your mother is still alive then ? "[1227-he] " [She]3130-your mother must be very old , "[134-belinda] says [Belinda]134-belinda thoughtfully , not reflecting on the unflattering inference to be drawn from this remark . " Is [she]3130-your mother — "[134-belinda] [she]134-belinda begins , and then breaks off . "[1219-that man] [he]1219-that man answers , so shortly that [Belinda]134-belinda feels that it is impossible to pursue [her]134-belinda catechism further . " And [you]134-belinda think that the taste — the zest for it will certainly come — certainly ? "[134-belinda] pursues [she]134-belinda eagerly . " Did [you]1232-you ever know a case of its failing ? " "[134-belinda] [You]134-belinda have a good average intelligence , " [he]1232-you answers drily ; "[134-belinda] it would be flattery to imply that [you]134-belinda have more ! " [She]134-belinda speaks with the same unemotional business air as if [she]134-belinda were concluding the purchase of [a piece of land]3141-a piece of land , or of some yards of cloth . [The room]422-the room is , at the moment , empty of anyone but [themselves]3143-themselves . It is near closing - time , and [the sparse visitors]3144-the sparse visitors are trailing off . " As [they]3147-they emerge from [the building]3148-the building [they]3147-they find that rain is falling , a sleety rain to which the undecided snow has turned . It beats in [her]0-i face as [she]0-i walks down the steps ; [she]0-i does not take the trouble to run in order to escape it ; [she]0-i would as soon be wet as dry . It drives in upon [her]0-i even in the hansom , where [she]0-i has refused to allow the glass to be lowered . One can get very fairly well soaked in a hansom if one goes the right way to work . And all along [sleety Pall Mall]60-sleety pall mall , all the sleety way [home]2345-home , [she]0-i is pestered with the sight , the smell , almost the feel , of the wood at [Wesenstein]15-wesenstein ! [She]185-mrs. churchill has always thought [Belinda]134-belinda too tall ; it strikes [her]185-mrs. churchill more forcibly than ever now , as [she]185-mrs. churchill sees [her]134-belinda towering majestically above [her]185-mrs. churchill . [Belinda]134-belinda is too everything , except amusing . "[0-i] Are [you]0-i hinting at [Waterloo Bridge]61-waterloo bridge , by way of improving [our]1248-our spirits ? " [she]185-mrs. churchill asks sarcastically . [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill is not in [her]185-mrs. churchill playfullest mood , by which , almost as much as by [her]185-mrs. churchill large lawn caps , [she]185-mrs. churchill is known to [an admiring public]3152-an admiring public . The weather ; the fact that [several tiresome and not one pleasant person]3153-several tiresome and not one pleasant person have been to call ; the consciousness of guilt towards [Belinda]134-belinda — a consciousness not quite stifled indeed , but diverted into the channel of anger by the smart , and in fact unmeasured rebukes [she]134-belinda has had to submit to from [Sarah]135-sarah — all , all combine to rob [her]134-belinda of [her]134-belinda usual suavity . [Sarah]135-sarah 's rebukes , indeed , would have led to a quarrel could [she]134-belinda afford to quarrel with [Sarah]135-sarah , but [she]134-belinda can not . Upon [her]134-belinda hangs too much of the ease and diversion of [her]134-belinda life . But there is no such motive to prevent [her]134-belinda quarrelling with [Belinda]134-belinda , and [she]134-belinda feels that to do so would be a pleasant relief . "[0-i] [Waterloo Bridge]61-waterloo bridge ! " repeats [Belinda]134-belinda , with a momentary want of comprehension ; then , "[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i see ! " "[0-i] Perhaps [you]0-i mean to announce to [us]1249-us [your]0-i approaching marriage , " suggests [the old lady]2704-the old lady ironically . "[0-i] [You]0-i are going to be married ? " cries [the old lady]2704-the old lady , jumping actively up , and running towards [her]446-the girl ; ennui , ill - humour , and sarcasm together racing away out of [her]2704-the old lady voice , and making place both in it and in [her]2704-the old lady sparkling eyes for a delightful excitement . "[0-i] [You]0-i do not say so ! [[My]0-i dear child]1250-my dear child , [you]0-i have taken [us]1249-us by surprise ! [I]0-i do not know when [I]0-i have been so pleased ! " "[0-i] Do not be in too great a hurry ! " interrupts [Belinda]134-belinda coldly . "[0-i] It is [Professor Forth]136-professor forth ! " [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill 's jaws drop ; the dimpling smiles — [she]185-mrs. churchill still has the remnants of an old dimple or two — vanish from [her]185-mrs. churchill cheek . " "[136-professor forth] If [you]136-professor forth disbelieve [me]0-i , " says [Belinda]134-belinda quietly , "[136-professor forth] [you]136-professor forth had better ask [him]136-professor forth . [He]136-professor forth is coming to - morrow to inquire whether [you]136-professor forth can spare [me]0-i . [I]0-i told [him]136-professor forth that [I]0-i thought [you]136-professor forth could . "[0-i] The matter lies in a nut - shell : [he]136-professor forth wants [a wife]1253-a wife , and [I]0-i want a — " "[247-husband] [Husband]247-husband " [she]134-belinda is going to say , but something in the employ of the word in such a connection strikes [her]134-belinda as shocking and impossible . "[0-i] To what are [you]136-professor forth applying that lying pet maxim of [yours]136-professor forth , [[my]0-i old friend]1254-my old friend ? " asks [Sarah]135-sarah playfully , coming suddenly into [the room]422-the room , rubbing [her]135-sarah little cold hands and approaching [[her]135-sarah grandmother]2703-her grandmother with a conciliatory air . [She]135-sarah feels a vague relief in seeing that [Belinda]134-belinda is at [home]2345-home again . Neither answers ; [Belinda]134-belinda , because [she]134-belinda has no wish to rob [[her]134-belinda grandmother]2703-her grandmother of the pleasure of communicating [her]134-belinda piece of intelligence ; [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill , because a remnant of hurt dignity ties the tongue which [she]185-mrs. churchill is longing to unloose . "[136-professor forth] To what or whom are [you]136-professor forth applying it ? " repeats [Sarah]135-sarah more sharply , glancing suspiciously from one to the other as [she]135-sarah speaks . "[136-professor forth] To [Belinda]134-belinda , " replies [the elder woman]2766-the elder woman , unable any longer to refrain [herself]2766-the elder woman . "[134-belinda] [I]0-i do not know how [you]136-professor forth will like being supplanted , but [she]134-belinda has just been informing [me]0-i , as [you]136-professor forth once before did , that [Professor Forth]136-professor forth is to be [[my]0-i grandson]1255-my grandson . " "[136-professor forth] [He]136-professor forth is not ! " cries [Sarah]135-sarah loudly and angrily , turning scarlet . "[134-belinda] [Belinda]134-belinda , " taking [[her]134-belinda sister]2366-her sister by the shoulder and rudely shaking [her]2366-her sister , "[134-belinda] why do not [you]136-professor forth speak ? why do not [you]136-professor forth contradict [her]134-belinda ? why do [you]136-professor forth allow [her]134-belinda to say such things about [you]136-professor forth ? It is not true ! Say that it is not true ; it is only a canard . [You]136-professor forth have been saying it only to tease [her]134-belinda ; say that it is not true ! " "[136-professor forth] Why should not it be true ? " asks [Belinda]134-belinda , turning [her]134-belinda lovely cold face and [her]134-belinda gloomy eyes up towards [Sarah]135-sarah . [The latter]2394-the latter 's hand drops nerveless from [[her]134-belinda sister]2366-her sister 's shoulder , and [she]134-belinda steps back a pace or two . "[136-professor forth] Then it is true ! " [she]134-belinda says , horrified . "[136-professor forth] [One]373-one would hardly imagine from [your]136-professor forth manner that [you]136-professor forth [yourself]136-professor forth had once been engaged to [him]1257-him , " returns [Belinda]134-belinda drily ; "[136-professor forth] and yet [I]0-i believe that it was so . " "[0-i] More shame for [me]0-i , " cries [the other]2396-the other violently ; "[0-i] but [I]0-i will do [myself]0-i the justice to say that [I]0-i never had the most distant intention of marrying [him]1257-him . " "[0-i] There [we]1258-we differ then , " says [Belinda]134-belinda , slowly rising , and walking with [her]134-belinda cloak over [her]134-belinda arm to the door , "[1258-we] for [I]0-i have every intention of marrying [him]1257-him ; and so , [granny]721-granny , " turning as [she]134-belinda reaches it and calmly facing [them]1258-we both , "[721-granny] as [I]0-i began by saying , [you]721-granny may pack [your]721-granny trunks for [Monaco]57-monaco as soon as [you]721-granny please . " "[0-i] How tiresomely [she]57-monaco harps upon that string ! " cries [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill peevishly ; the more peevishly for the pricks that [her]185-mrs. churchill conscience , albeit a tough one , is giving [her]185-mrs. churchill . "[57-monaco] It is all [your]721-granny doing , " says [Sarah]135-sarah morosely , viciously rattling the fire - irons and boxing the dogs ' ears ; "[721-granny] [you]721-granny have driven [her]57-monaco to it ; sooner or later [I]0-i knew that [you]721-granny would ! " "[721-granny] Pooh ! " replies [the other crossly]3170-the other crossly ; "[721-granny] [she]57-monaco is not so easily driven or led either . If it were for [her]57-monaco happiness , " with a little pious parental air , "[0-i] [I]0-i can not say that [I]0-i should much regret [her]57-monaco marriage ; and if it does really come off — it is a shocking thing , of course , such an amant pour rire , but [she]57-monaco seems bent upon it ; and if it does really come off , " the natural frisky light reilluming [her]57-monaco eyes , "[57-monaco] why then , [[my]0-i dear child]1250-my dear child , there is in point of fact nothing to keep [us]1261-us from [the South]55-the south ! " The morrow has come . [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill has risen refreshed and healthful from pleasing dreams of sunshine and lansquenet . [Sarah]135-sarah has tossed between vexed visions and unwonted wakefulness . And [Belinda]134-belinda ? [Belinda]134-belinda makes no complaint of [her]134-belinda night . [She]134-belinda looks older than when [she]134-belinda went to bed , but the cold is pinching , and for the last year and a half [she]134-belinda has been perceptibly ageing . The morrow has come , and [the Professor]2365-the professor . To - day [he]2365-the professor is not ushered into [the little dark back - room]3172-the little dark back - room , but is led by [a full - buttoned pompous Tommy]3173-a full - buttoned pompous tommy into [the drawing - room]3050-the drawing - room , where [[his]2365-the professor grandmother]3175-his grandmother elect sits ready and alone to receive [him]2365-the professor . Perhaps [they]1261-us have not a great deal to say to [each other]469-each other . At all events the interval is short before the bell is rung and a message given to request [Miss Churchill]152-miss churchill to come down . [She]152-miss churchill is sitting in [[her]152-miss churchill little chilly bedroom]3177-her little chilly bedroom , [her]152-miss churchill cheek pressed against the window - pane and [her]152-miss churchill eyes idly following the dirty sparrows on the leads . Without a moment 's lingering , [she]152-miss churchill obeys . As [she]152-miss churchill enters [the room]422-the room [[her]152-miss churchill betrothed]2378-her betrothed advances to meet [her]152-miss churchill . "[0-i] [I]0-i am happy to be able to inform [you]1262-you , " [he]2378-her betrothed says in [his]2378-her betrothed stiff Donnish voice , "[0-i] that [[your]1262-you grandmother]1233-your grandmother is good enough to say that [she]1233-your grandmother has no obstacle to oppose to [our]1264-our union . " "[1233-your grandmother] [I]0-i told [you]0-i that [she]1233-your grandmother would not , " replies [Belinda]134-belinda calmly ; "[0-i] [I]0-i knew that [she]1233-your grandmother could spare [me]0-i . " The words are simple and simply spoken , with no special stress or significant accent laid upon them ; and yet under them [the old lady]2704-the old lady winces . "[1233-your grandmother] It is no case of ' sparing , ' " [she]0-i says sharply ; "[1233-your grandmother] of course it is a break - up to [our]1264-our little circle ; but [I]0-i have no right to allow personal feeling to influence [me]0-i . [You]0-i are old enough to decide for [yourself]0-i ; [you]0-i are of age ; [you]0-i came of age six months ago . In a case of this kind [a third person]1265-a third person has no business to interfere ; and of course if [you]0-i are sincerely fond of [each other]469-each other — " [Belinda]134-belinda shivers . "[0-i] Fond ! it is no question of fondness ! " [she]0-i says , breathing quick and short , and in a concentrated low voice ; "[1267-a mariage de raison] [you]0-i entirely misapprehend . [I]0-i thought that [Mr. Forth]209-mr. forth had explained to [you]0-i ; it is [a mariage de raison]1267-a mariage de raison ; [we]1264-our marry [one another]657-one another because [we]1264-our can be useful to [each other]469-each other . Is it not so ? " appealing to [him]209-mr. forth with abrupt and uncompromising directness . "[185-mrs. churchill] [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill must be as well aware as [yourself]185-mrs. churchill , " [he]209-mr. forth replies pettishly , "[185-mrs. churchill] that [I]0-i have no reason to wish for exaggerated professions of affection . " "[185-mrs. churchill] Well , [I]0-i will leave [you]0-i to settle it between [yourselves]0-i , " cries [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill rather hastily , gathering up [her]0-i work and making for the door ; eluding , as [she]0-i has made a golden rule of doing through life , any scene that threatened to be disagreeable . "[0-i] [You]0-i will stay to luncheon , of course , [Mr. Forth]209-mr. forth ? " Nodding and smiling , [she]0-i withdraws ; and the dogs , with [their]3181-their usual fine tact , follow [her]0-i — all but [Jane]229-jane . As soon as [she]0-i is gone : "[209-mr. forth] [I]0-i hope , " says [Belinda]134-belinda , fixing [her]134-belinda joyless , unbashful eyes full upon [him]209-mr. forth — eyes with enough coldness in them to freeze a volcano—"that[0-i] there is no misapprehension , that [you]0-i understand [our]1270-our relative positions as [I]0-i do . " "[0-i] [I]0-i believe that there is no necessity to go over the same ground again ! " [he]209-mr. forth answers snappishly . [His]209-mr. forth snappishness does not infect [her]134-belinda . "[0-i] It is better to go over it now while it is yet time , than afterwards , when it would be too late , " [she]134-belinda answers earnestly . [He]209-mr. forth has drawn near [his]209-mr. forth usual magnet , the fire , and is chafing [his]209-mr. forth bloodless hands over it . Perhaps this is the reason why [he]209-mr. forth expresses neither assent nor dissent . "[0-i] [I]0-i want to make it quite clear to [you]0-i , " [she]134-belinda says , still in that same deeply earnest voice , "[0-i] so that [you]0-i may not have cause to reproach [me]0-i afterwards , or think that [I]0-i have dealt unjustly with [you]0-i : [I]0-i have not one grain of love to give [you]0-i , nor ever shall have ! " letting fall each slow word with a weight of heavy emphasis . "[1271-many men] [Many men]1271-many men — [most men]1272-most men — would refuse [a woman]1273-a woman upon such terms . " "[0-i] [We]1274-we can not treat it too exhaustively , " [she]134-belinda answers persistently . "[1274-we] Though [I]0-i can not love [you]0-i — happily for [you]0-i , [you]0-i have no wish that [I]0-i should — [I]0-i will do [my]0-i best by [you]0-i ; [I]0-i will be as useful to [you]0-i as [I]0-i can . From what [I]0-i gather of [your]0-i circumstances [I]0-i imagine that [I]0-i can be very useful to [you]0-i . [You]0-i are not young ; [you]0-i have not good health ; [you]0-i are lonely . " A certain sound of fidgeting from the chair so chillily drawn close to the hearth betrays that there is something in this catalogue of [his]3183-he infirmities not altogether agreeable to [its occupant]3184-its occupant . " As [she]134-belinda finishes speaking [she]134-belinda draws nearer to [him]3183-he , and holds out [her]134-belinda young soft hand , as if to seal with it this frosty bargain . [He]3183-he takes it formally , but does not press it any more than [he]3183-he had pressed [[her]134-belinda grandmother]2703-her grandmother 's . Perhaps [he]3183-he has no inclination . Perhaps [he]3183-he dares not . [Belinda]134-belinda sits down opposite to [him]3183-he ; the light from the window , such as it is , falling full on [her]134-belinda face ; [her]134-belinda hands folded in [her]134-belinda lap , and [her]134-belinda eyes looking straight before [her]134-belinda . There is something so odd and strained in [her]134-belinda attitude that [Jane]229-jane , wellmeaning but injudicious , goes up to [her]134-belinda and rubs [her]229-jane long nose and [her]229-jane pinkrimmed eyes against [her]229-jane knees to cheer [her]134-belinda . "[0-i] Had [[your]1279-you grandmother]1233-your grandmother been able to spare [me]0-i a few more minutes , " says [Mr. Forth]209-mr. forth , in a key in which a slight tinge of umbrage is perceptible , "[0-i] [I]0-i could have wished to enter with [her]1233-your grandmother into some details , upon which , as things now are , [I]0-i have been unable to touch . With regard to the date , for instance , [I]0-i should be unwilling to hurry [you]1279-you unduly , but — " During the whole of [his]209-mr. forth last sentence [she]134-belinda has felt [him]209-mr. forth watching [her]134-belinda narrowly . Is this the touchstone that [he]209-mr. forth is applying to [her]134-belinda sincerity ? Does [he]209-mr. forth expect [her]134-belinda to turn as dishonestly restive as [Sarah]135-sarah had obviously done whenever any suggestion of a like nature had been made to [her]134-belinda ? The idea crosses [her]134-belinda mind with a sort of thin fugitive amusement . "[1279-you] [You]1279-you need not consult [granny]721-granny , " [she]0-i answers coldly ; "[721-granny] [you]1279-you had better arrange it so as best to suit [your]1279-you own convenience . " There is such an evident good faith , such an entire absence of all desire of evasion in [her]0-i look and tone , that [his]209-mr. forth scrutiny relaxes . "[1279-you] It is all one to [me]0-i , " [she]0-i says ; "[1279-you] there is nothing to wait for . " In [her]0-i tone is such a flat , tame hopelessness that [Jane]229-jane redoubles [her]229-jane rubbing against [her]229-jane knees , and accompanies it with an acute , short bark . If that will not put [her]0-i in spirits , nothing will . "[0-i] [I]0-i should , of course , " pursues [Mr. Forth]209-mr. forth , "[0-i] be anxious to leave [you]1279-you sufficient time for such preparations as [you]1279-you may wish to make . " "[0-i] What preparations ? " [she]0-i asks brusquely ; "[0-i] [I]0-i need none . [You]1279-you are past the age , [I]0-i suppose , when marriage festivities would give [you]1279-you much pleasure ; and they would be entirely out of place here . " "[0-i] It is , however , usual , [I]0-i believe , " [he]209-mr. forth answers , in an annoyed tone , "[0-i] to make some slight sacrifices to conventionality on an occasion of this kind ; it is usual — " "[0-i] It is usual to love [one another]657-one another ! " breaks in [she]0-i with a bitter laugh . "[0-i] What is usual with [others]1101-others does not apply to [us]1284-us ; [you]1279-you need not take [my]0-i preparations into [your]1279-you calculations . " [He]209-mr. forth is silent , but [his]209-mr. forth face expresses vexation . " But even now [Professor Forth]136-professor forth does not immediately answer . Perhaps this mode of treating the question of an approaching marriage seems to [him]209-mr. forth even more bafling than [Sarah]135-sarah 's . At last : "[1285-they] It is extremely fortunate for [me]0-i , " [he]209-mr. forth says slowly , and without any perceptible exhilaration of tone , "[0-i] to find [you]1279-you so ready to meet [my]0-i views . " "[0-i] There is nothing to wait for , " repeats [she]1279-you flatly . It seems as if in this phrase there were a dismal charm for [her]1279-you . " "[0-i] Could not it be sooner ? " asks [Belinda]134-belinda curtly . [He]209-mr. forth looks at [her]1279-you in unfeigned astonishment . In [this family]3018-this family is [he]209-mr. forth to experience no medium between disingenuous procrastination and unmaidenly haste ? [I]0-i had thought that the 10th would have left a clear fortnight , before the commencement of term , for whatever journey — " "[0-i] Journey ! " [she]134-belinda interrupts almost rudely , breathing quick . "[0-i] What journey ? do [you]0-i mean a wedding tour ? " with an accent of indescribable shrinking . "[0-i] Why should [we]1287-we make one at all ? why should not [we]1287-we go straight to [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge ? "[134-belinda] The 10th ! " repeats [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill , in a tone into which [she]134-belinda honestly , if not very successfully , tries to infuse a tinge of regret ; "[134-belinda] that is soon ! [Mary Smith]249-mary smith in [Sloane Street]63-sloane street is excellent , is not [she]249-mary smith , [Sarah]135-sarah ? but [she]249-mary smith has already half a dozen wedding orders . " "[249-mary smith] [She]249-mary smith may be spared a seventh , " replies [Belinda]134-belinda , with a bitter small smile . "[249-mary smith] [I]0-i will have no new clothes ! " "[249-mary smith] That means , of course , that [you]134-belinda are not in earnest , " says [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill , with a disappointed refrigeration of tone ; "[249-mary smith] that the whole thing is a fiction . [You]134-belinda might as well have said so at first ! " A flash of hope has come into [Sarah]135-sarah 's sunny eyes as [she]135-sarah looks eagerly at [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister ; but at the expression of [that sister]2367-that sister 's face it at once dies down again . "[134-belinda] Do not be afraid , " says [Belinda]134-belinda quietly , "[134-belinda] it is no fiction ; but [I]0-i will have no new clothes : [you]134-belinda will have the more money to spend at [Monaco]57-monaco . " "[134-belinda] [Monaco]57-monaco ! [Monaco]57-monaco ! But as to [your]134-belinda clothes — " "[134-belinda] As to [my]0-i clothes — simply [I]0-i will not have any , " replies . [Belinda]134-belinda , with a look of imperative decision . "[0-i] [I]0-i should have thought [them]1292-them the one Goshen in [[your]134-belinda desert]1293-your desert , " says [Sarah]135-sarah , with an annoyed laugh ; "[0-i] [them]1292-them and the presents . " "[0-i] Presents ! " echoes [Belinda]134-belinda impatiently ; "[0-i] [I]0-i will have no presents ! " "[0-i] In short , " says [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill sarcastically , "[0-i] [you]134-belinda and [the Professor]2365-the professor will crawl in [a four - wheeled cab]1295-a four - wheeled cab to [a registry - office]1296-a registry - office at eight o'clock in the morning . " "[0-i] If [you]134-belinda substitute [a church]1297-a church for [a registry - office]1296-a registry - office , [you]134-belinda have exactly expressed [my]0-i intention . " There is an aghast silence . [Sarah]135-sarah and [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill look at [one another]657-one another . Something in [their]3198-their interchange of glances grates upon [Belinda]134-belinda . "[134-belinda] [You]134-belinda will never understand , " [she]0-i says , exchanging [her]0-i icy calm voice for one of excessive irritability , such irritability as of late [[her]0-i family]1139-her family has been too well acquainted with , "[134-belinda] and it is no use explaining to [you]134-belinda . [I]0-i am tired of explaining to [you]134-belinda that this is not an ordinary marriage . What is there to make a gala of , and buy new clothes for , in a mere matter of business ? [I]0-i tell [you]134-belinda it is a mere matter of business ; [I]0-i keep dinning it into [your]134-belinda ears , but [you]134-belinda will not understand ! it is a mere matter of business ! " [She]0-i repeats it over and over again , as if to reassure [herself]0-i by the strength and number of [her]0-i own repetitions , and looks round at [[her]0-i two auditors]3200-her two auditors , as if daring [them]3200-her two auditors to oppose any contradiction to [her]0-i assertion . [Neither of [them]3200-her two auditors]3201-neither of them does . It is , indeed , some moments before either of [them]3200-her two auditors finds anything to say . Then — "[1299-you] Have [you]1299-you made this quite clear to [Professor Forth]136-professor forth ? " asks [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill drily . "[1299-you] Quite ! " replies [Belinda]134-belinda excitedly ; "[1299-you] quite ! [I]0-i made it as clear as the sun in [heaven]1300-heaven ; [he]136-professor forth quite understands ; [he]136-professor forth fully agrees with [me]0-i ; [he]136-professor forth is quite of [my]0-i way of thinking . " "[136-professor forth] [He]136-professor forth must be [a very odd bridegroom]1301-a very odd bridegroom , " says [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill sarcastically . "[136-professor forth] It is a marriage of the mind ! " replies [Belinda]134-belinda , still more excitedly , looking round with angry suspicion in search of the ridicule which [she]134-belinda dimly feels may attach to [her]134-belinda last utterance . "[0-i] [I]0-i do not suppose that there is anything very odd in [two people]1302-two people hoping to draw a certain amount of rational happiness from such . " [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill turns away to conceal an ungovernable smile . "[1302-two people] A marriage of the mind ! " repeats [Sarah]135-sarah , with a disgusted accent ; "[1302-two people] well , [I]0-i have heard of [them]1303-them before , but this is the first time that [I]0-i ever had the pleasure of meeting [one]373-one ; and [I]0-i humbly hope it may be the last . " The winter advances ; Christmas comes ; comes , as it not infrequently now comes to [the world 's greatest city]3202-the world 's greatest city , in an almost total darkness ; a choking yellow darkness . The gas has to be lit at ten o'clock in the morning . Drearily it flares , from the imperceptible dawn until the undiscriminated night . Under its and the fog 's pestilent breaths the flowers in the stands wither ; the carefully - cherished puny ferns shrink away into death . Through the suffocating obscurity the church bells ring muffled ; the cabs crawl cautiously at a foot 's pace , and [the omnibuses]3203-the omnibuses cease to run . [None of [the Churchill family]1105-the churchill family]3204-none of the churchill family have been able to get to [church]613-church ; and either by that fact or by the fog [their]1105-the churchill family spirits and tempers are sensibly worsened . [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill likes to go to [church]613-church on Christmas Day ; it is a sort of fetish , the loss of which may entail disadvantage upon [her]185-mrs. churchill , either in [this world]2462-this world or in the next . "[0-i] How anything short of absolute necessity can keep anyone in [England]25-england during the winter months , passes [my]0-i comprehension ! " cries [she]0-i , taking up [her]0-i old cry , and pettishly clicking together the clasps of the prayer - book , in which [she]0-i has been reading the lessons for the day . [Sarah]135-sarah , [[her]0-i only companion]3209-her only companion , makes no reply ; not that [she]135-sarah is absorbed in any occupation , but because the remark appears to [her]135-sarah to be both old and worthless . "[0-i] And [I]0-i am far from feeling sure that [we]1305-we shall ever get away after all , " continues [the elder woman]2766-the elder woman , seeing that [she]0-i may wait in vain for a sympathetic response . "[0-i] [I]0-i feel no sort of confidence in [Belinda]134-belinda , " in an exasperated voice ; "[134-belinda] [she]134-belinda is quite capable of throwing [him]1306-him over at the last moment . What do [you]0-i think ? do not [you]0-i hear that [I]0-i am speaking to [you]0-i ? do not [you]0-i think that [she]134-belinda is quite capable of throwing [him]1306-him over at the last moment ? " "[134-belinda] It shall not be for want of asking if [she]134-belinda does not , " replies [Sarah]135-sarah surlily . "[0-i] [I]0-i really do not see that [you]0-i have any right to put pressure upon [her]134-belinda , " rejoins [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill crossly ; "[0-i] [I]0-i can not see that it is any business of [yours]0-i . Because [you]0-i behaved extremely ill to [him]1306-him , is no reason why [you]0-i should incite [[your]0-i sister]3060-your sister to do the same . In fairness to [him]1306-him , [I]0-i must insist upon [your]0-i not attempting to influence [her]134-belinda one way or the other ! " "[0-i] [You]0-i may insist , " replies [Sarah]135-sarah undutifully , [her]135-sarah soft round face growing dogged and hard ; "[0-i] but as long as [I]0-i have one breath left , [I]0-i shall spend it in trying to hinder [her]134-belinda from such a monstrous suicide . " "[0-i] Suicide ! " repeats [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill angrily ; "[0-i] pooh ! [you]0-i may be very thankful if [you]0-i ever get [anyone]494-anyone to make as good a settlement upon [you]0-i as [he]1306-him has done upon [her]134-belinda ! Suicide , indeed ! " "[0-i] Why do [you]0-i not marry [him]1306-him [yourself]0-i , if [you]0-i are so pleased with [him]1306-him ? " asks [Sarah]135-sarah cynically ; "[0-i] it seems all one to [him]1306-him which of [us]1309-us [he]1306-him marries , so as [he]1306-him gets one of [the family]2949-the family ; it seems to be [the breed]1311-the breed , not [the individual]1312-the individual , that [he]1306-him admires . Marry [him]1306-him [yourself]0-i , and carry [him]1306-him off to [Cannes]24-cannes ; [I]0-i assure [you]0-i that [I]0-i will not move a finger to prevent [you]0-i ! " "[1306-him] [He]1306-him is [a man not without distinction in [his]1306-him own line]1313-a man not without distinction in his own line , " pursues [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill , affecting not to have heard [[her]185-mrs. churchill grand - daughter]1183-her grand - daughter 's last ironical suggestion ; "[1313-a man not without distinction in his own line] though it happens to be a line which [you]0-i are quite incapable of appreciating . [He]1306-him is not handsome , certainly , but there is a good deal of — of , " hesitating for an encomium—"of[1306-him] character in [his]1306-him face . [He]1306-him has made an excellent settlement upon [her]1314-her ; it quite took [me]0-i by surprise . [She]1314-her is twenty - one , and it is [her]1314-her first bonâ - fide offer ; [I]0-i think [you]0-i will not be acting at all [a friend]1315-a friend 's part in making [her]1314-her quarrel with [her]1314-her bread - and - butter . " "[0-i] Whether [I]0-i am acting the part of [a friend]1315-a friend or not , " retorts [Sarah]135-sarah obstinately , marching towards the door , "[0-i] [I]0-i promise [you]0-i that [I]0-i shall carry [my]0-i remonstrances to the altar - foot ; and so would [you]0-i if [you]0-i did [your]0-i duty . [You]0-i may like to know , " firing a defiant parting shot from the door - way , "[0-i] that [I]0-i am going straight to [her]1314-her now to resume the subject . " [She]135-sarah is as good as [her]135-sarah word . [She]135-sarah finds [Belinda]134-belinda where [she]135-sarah knew that [she]135-sarah would find [her]1314-her , in [[her]1314-her little back sitting - room]3212-her little back sitting - room , but not employed as [she]135-sarah had expected . [She]135-sarah had thought to come upon [her]135-sarah stooping over [her]135-sarah eternal copy - books ; but for once they are laid aside . [She]135-sarah is sitting on the hearthrug , the gas glaring above [her]135-sarah and casting its ugly shadows upon [her]135-sarah cheeks , making them look lined and hollow . Strewn about [her]135-sarah is a small litter of old writing - desks , old workboxes , childish relics . On [her]135-sarah lap lies open a morocco pocket - book , over which , on [Sarah]135-sarah 's entrance , [she]135-sarah hastily puts [her]135-sarah hands , as if to conceal it . "[0-i] [I]0-i am setting [[my]0-i house]1317-my house in order , " [she]135-sarah says , looking up with a rather guilty smile . "[0-i] Did [you]1318-you ever see such a squirrel 's nest ? Here is the case of court - plaister that [you]1318-you gave [me]0-i on [my]0-i eighth birthday . Do [you]1318-you remember how fond [we]1319-we were of giving [each other court - plaister]1320-each other court - plaister ? Here is [[the lady]1321-the lady 's companion that [granny]721-granny brought [me]0-i from [Bath]64-bath]1322-the lady 's companion that granny brought me from bath ; [I]0-i remember crying because [she]721-granny brought [you]1318-you such a much better one . Even as long ago as then , " looking pensively at the little rusty old pair of scissors and [the dim bodkin]3213-the dim bodkin , "[721-granny] it began . " "[721-granny] What were [you]1318-you looking at when [I]0-i came in ? " asks [Sarah]135-sarah brusquely , and dropping on [her]0-i knees beside [[her]0-i sister]2366-her sister . [Belinda]134-belinda starts . [Her]134-belinda first impulse is to clasp [her]134-belinda hands in still closer guardianship over [her]134-belinda hid treasure ; but [her]134-belinda next corrects it . "[1318-you] [You]1318-you are quite welcome to see [them]1324-them once more , before [they]1324-them go into the fire , " [she]0-i says quietly , though in the yellow gaslight [her]0-i cheeks crimson . "[0-i] [I]0-i do not know why [I]0-i should hide them ; they are relics of an affection almost as warm and as steady as [granny]721-granny 's . There ! " picking up and holding scornfully between [her]0-i finger and thumb for [Sarah]135-sarah 's inspection one withered flower after another . "[721-granny] That was once a gardenia ; that was a Cape jessamine ; that was a tuberose . How pretty [they]1324-them look ! how sweetly [they]1324-them smell now ! Have [you]1318-you looked enough at [them]1324-them ? Off with [them]1324-them then ! " As [she]0-i speaks , and despite [Sarah]135-sarah 's hand stretched out with involuntary eagerness to check [her]0-i , [she]0-i tosses the little dry skeletons into the fire , where , with a hardly perceptible shrivel and crackle , they for ever disappear . [Belinda]134-belinda watches [them]1324-them with a hard , dry eye . "[1318-you] Are [you]1318-you satisfied ? " [she]134-belinda says , turning to [[her]0-i sister]2366-her sister , and exhibiting the pocket - book extended empty from cover to cover . "[1318-you] There is nothing else in it except [my]0-i love - letter ; it is humiliating to have but one , is not it ? Would [you]1318-you like to read it again before it follows those pretty flowers , or may it go at once ? " "[1318-you] Give it [me]0-i ! " cries [Sarah]135-sarah , snatching the little sheet , which looks older than it really is from obvious hard wear , continual unfolding , blistering tears . "[1318-you] [I]0-i will read it again . Perhaps , reading it in cold blood like this , the meaning may strike one differently ! " "[1318-you] If [you]1318-you wish [I]0-i can spare [you]1318-you the trouble , " says [Belinda]134-belinda bitterly . "[0-i] [I]0-i can say it to [you]1318-you if [you]1318-you wish . " The fire burns low and dull ; and [Sarah]135-sarah rises and stands right beneath the gas , so that no lack of light may hinder [her]135-sarah examination of the document in [her]135-sarah hand . But the rays of a June sun would be in this case of no use . "[0-i] [I]0-i can make nothing of it , " [she]0-i says dispiritedly , giving it back to [its owner]509-its owner ; "[0-i] but do not — do not burn it ! " For a moment [Belinda]134-belinda hesitates , considering with quivering eyelids and trembling lip the small and faded paper . Then in a moment it has followed the flowers ! At first it gives a curling writhe , as if it hurt it to be burnt ; then one or two sentences come out very clear before flying in black film up the chimney . The one that lasts longest and disappears latest is , "[0-i] Oh , forgive [me]0-i ! " After that there is silence . [Sarah]135-sarah has dropped sulkily into an armchair ; and [Belinda]134-belinda has turned again to [her]134-belinda childish treasures , and is beginning to sort and part them . But [her]134-belinda hands move mechanically of their own accord , and with that want of purpose which shows that they are not directed by the brain . When a quarter of an hour has gone dumbly by , [Belinda]134-belinda speaks , in that flat and spiritless voice which is now habitual to [her]0-i : "[0-i] [I]0-i wanted to ask [your]1318-you advice ; [I]0-i want [you]1318-you to give [me]0-i [your]1318-you opinion . Is it necessary — am [I]0-i bound in honour to tell [Professor Forth]136-professor forth ? " [She]134-belinda stops with a sudden sobbing catch in [her]134-belinda breath . "[136-professor forth] If [you]1318-you think that [your]1318-you confidence will be in the least likely to make [him]136-professor forth break [his]136-professor forth engagement , tell [him]136-professor forth by all means ! " replies [Sarah]135-sarah surlily . "[1318-you] Not only tell [him]136-professor forth what there is to tell , but invent a great deal more besides . [I]0-i promise [you]1318-you that [I]0-i will aid [you]1318-you with all the powers of [my]0-i imagination ! " "[0-i] Must [I]0-i really tell [him]136-professor forth ? " groans [Belinda]134-belinda , with an accent of such acute pain that [Sarah]135-sarah 's heart smites [her]135-sarah . "[0-i] Tell [him]136-professor forth ! " [she]0-i cries compassionately . "[0-i] [[My]0-i poor child]1326-my poor child , what is there to tell ? " "[0-i] What indeed ! " acquiesces [Belinda]134-belinda , in bitter humility . But [she]134-belinda looks relieved . "[0-i] Even if there were anything to tell , " [she]134-belinda goes on a moment later—"but[1327-you] , as [you]1327-you justly say , there is nothing , for one is not answerable to [anyone]494-anyone for the freaks of [one]373-one 's own imagination — but even if there were , [he]136-professor forth has no concern with [my]0-i past , has [he]136-professor forth ? It is only from the tenth of next month onwards that [I]0-i am accountable to [him]136-professor forth for [my]0-i actions ! " "[136-professor forth] The tenth of next month ! " repeats [Sarah]135-sarah fiercely . "[136-professor forth] What , is that still the day on which the gallows is to be erected ? " "[1327-you] If [you]1327-you think that by wording it so offensively , [you]1327-you will induce [me]0-i to put it off , [you]1327-you are mistaken , " answers [Belinda]134-belinda , with an access of miserable , sore ill - humour ; "[1327-you] and [you]1327-you know the sooner [I]0-i am ' out of the way'—I am always in the way now — the sooner [you]1327-you can be off to [the South]55-the south ! " "[1327-you] Save [your]1327-you sneers for [granny]721-granny , who deserves [them]1331-them , " answers [Sarah]135-sarah , genuinely hurt . "[0-i] [I]0-i do not . " "[0-i] [I]0-i know [you]1327-you do not ! " cries [the other]2396-the other remorsefully ; "[1327-you] but [you]1327-you were the nearest thing to [me]0-i . It seems , nowadays , as if [I]0-i must put [my]0-i sting into whatever is nearest to [me]0-i ! " "[0-i] That is the right frame of mind in which to be led to the gal — to the altar , is not it ? " retorts [Sarah]135-sarah sarcastically ; and again [they]3218-they are silent . "[0-i] [I]0-i now wish to heaven , " resumes [Sarah]135-sarah devoutly , at the expiration of a heavy interval , "[1332-he] that [I]0-i had married [him]1332-he [myself]0-i . Intensely as [I]0-i should have disliked it , [he]1332-he could not have made [me]0-i as unhappy as [he]1332-he will [you]1327-you . A wineglass holds less than a hogshead ; and the pious hope of an early widowhood , which [you]1327-you will be too conscientious to indulge , would have buoyed [me]0-i up ! " [Belinda]134-belinda 's only answer is a sickly smile . "[1327-you] [You]1327-you would have gone on living with [granny]721-granny and the dogs , " pursues [Sarah]135-sarah , in earnest narrative ; "[721-granny] [she]721-granny would have grown civiller to [you]1327-you when [she]721-granny found that [she]721-granny had [no one else]1334-no one else to depend on , and [she]721-granny really is very good company when [she]721-granny chooses ; and by - and - by , some fine day , [Rivers]162-rivers might have come back . No , no ! " resolutely catching and holding down with [her]135-sarah small , strong wrists the hands that [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister is hurrying to [her]135-sarah tortured face . "[0-i] [I]0-i do not care whether [you]1327-you wince or no ! [I]0-i do not care whether it hurts [you]1327-you or no ; [you]1327-you must and shall hear . Some day — [Rivers]162-rivers — might — have come back again ! [He]162-rivers may come back still ; but it may be after the 10th of January ! " [She]0-i pauses dramatically , and fixes [her]0-i eyes upon the poor quivering features , so barely exposed to [her]0-i piercing scrutiny . There comes no answer but a moaning sigh . "[0-i] [I]0-i can give [you]1327-you no reason for it , " continues [Sarah]135-sarah ; "[0-i] [I]0-i know no more about [him]162-rivers than [you]1327-you do ; but [I]0-i have a conviction — something tells [me]0-i , that there has been some mistake , some hitch , some unavoidable delay ! " "[0-i] An unavoidable delay of eighteen months ! " says [Belinda]134-belinda , with faltering irony . "[0-i] How likely ! " "[0-i] A letter has been lost . " "[0-i] Letters are never lost , " hopelessly . "[0-i] Well , have it as [you]1327-you like ! " cries [Sarah]135-sarah impatiently . "[1327-you] All the same , [my]0-i conviction remains that some day [he]162-rivers will come back again . How glad [you]1327-you will be to see [him]162-rivers ! How pleasant it will be for [you]1327-you to introduce [him]162-rivers to [[your]1327-you husband]1335-your husband , [Mr. Forth]209-mr. forth ! " By a great wrench , [Belinda]134-belinda succeeds in loosing one hand ; but it is a very insufficient shield , and [she]134-belinda has failed in liberating the other , so sturdily held in [Sarah]135-sarah 's small but potent grasp . "[162-rivers] [I]0-i see [him]162-rivers coming into [the room]422-the room with those blazing eyes of [his]162-rivers , " goes on [Sarah]135-sarah , in a sort of prophetic frenzy—"they[162-rivers] were not much like [Mr. Forth]209-mr. forth 's eyes , were they?—and [you]1327-you introducing [them]1337-them to [each other]469-each other : ' [[My]0-i husband]1339-my husband , [Mr. Forth]209-mr. forth ! [Mr. Rivers]162-rivers ! ' [I]0-i envy [you]1327-you that moment ! " But at this [Belinda]134-belinda tears [herself]134-belinda free . "[1327-you] This is too much ! " [she]134-belinda says , in a suffocated voice , and struggling to reach the door . "[1327-you] Let [me]0-i go ! [I]0-i must go ! [I]0-i can bear no more !
