" But [Sarah]135-sarah falls on [her]135-sarah knees , and catches [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister 's gown . "[1327-you] Do [you]1327-you think it is as bad as the reality will be ? " [she]134-belinda asks , in a thrilling , clear voice . "[1327-you] And [you]1327-you will not be able to run away from it ! Do [you]1327-you suppose that there will be a single corner in [the whole earth]1076-the whole earth in which [you]1327-you can take refuge from it ? " Something in [Sarah]135-sarah 's tone has , more than [her]135-sarah detaining gesture , arrested [Belinda]134-belinda 's flight . [Stock]250-stock - still [she]134-belinda stands , in a wretched irresolution , death - pale . "[1327-you] It is too late ! " [she]134-belinda murmurs miserably . "[1327-you] It is not too late ! " cries [Sarah]135-sarah in wild excitement , clasping [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister 's knees ; "[1327-you] it will be too late after the 10th , but it is not too late now . Give it up ! Throw [him]1341-him over ! What will [he]1341-him care ? What harm will it do [him]1341-him ? How much the worse is [he]1341-him for having been thrown over by [me]0-i ? " [Belinda]134-belinda still stands , white and trembling , [her]134-belinda eyes staring stonily out into vacancy . Before [them]3222-them , though [they]3222-them seem to see nothing , stands that dreadful vision conjured up by [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister ; and the sight of it makes every limb shake . "[0-i] It is impossible ! " [she]135-sarah says feebly . "[0-i] It is not impossible ! " asseverates [Sarah]135-sarah , in passionate heat . "[0-i] Give [me]0-i a chance , and [I]0-i will show [you]1341-him whether it is possible or no ! Let [me]0-i tell [him]1341-him . Give [me]0-i that commission as [my]0-i Christmas - box ; it would be the best [I]0-i ever had ! [I]0-i will tell [him]1341-him , " laughing rather hysterically , "[0-i] that it is a constitutional peculiarity of [[our]1342-our family]1343-our family ! " Perhaps it is [Sarah]135-sarah 's laugh that recalls [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister to a more normal condition of feeling . With a long sigh [she]135-sarah comes back to reality . "[0-i] Who would tell [granny]721-granny ? " [she]135-sarah asks , with a sarcastic smile . "[0-i] Who would dare break to [her]721-granny that [she]721-granny was not to be robbed of [[her]721-granny darling]1345-her darling after all ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i would ! " cries [Sarah]135-sarah , with delighted eagerness . "[0-i] [I]0-i know few things in [the world]643-the world that would give [me]0-i a purer pleasure . Let [me]0-i go now , at once ! Strike while the iron is hot ! " jumping up , and moving in [her]135-sarah turn rapidly towards the door . But it is now [Belinda]134-belinda who detains [her]135-sarah . "[721-granny] Pooh ! " [she]0-i says coldly ; "[721-granny] it was only a flight of fancy on [my]0-i part . It would be amusing to give [her]721-granny a fright ; but [she]721-granny has no real cause for alarm . What change has happened that [I]0-i should change ? " in a lifeless tone . "[0-i] [Your]0-i word - painting was so vivid , that for one moment [I]0-i thought [he]1347-he had come back ; but it seems not . [I]0-i think , " with a bitter smile , "[0-i] that if [I]0-i waited for [him]1347-he to come back to [me]0-i , [I]0-i should wait [my]0-i life long . " "[0-i] [I]0-i do not ask [you]0-i to wait [your]0-i life long , " cries [Sarah]135-sarah , redoubling that energy of persuasion which , as [she]135-sarah disppointedly sees , has been hitherto exercised in vain . "[0-i] [I]0-i only ask [you]0-i to wait one month ! Surely , " with a scathing sneer , "[1348-them] the joys that [you]0-i expect are not so poignant but that [you]0-i can afford to defer them for four weeks ! " "[1348-them] Why should [I]0-i defer [them]1348-them ? " asks [Belinda]134-belinda , with a fierce restlessness in eye and gesture . "[1348-them] If [I]0-i had had [my]0-i will , [I]0-i should have been married by now . It is this state of transition which is worst of all ; one is unhinged ; [one]373-one is off [one]373-one 's balance . " [Sarah]135-sarah has again fallen down on the floor before [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister , and is again suppliantly clasping [her]135-sarah knees . "[373-one] One month ! one month ! " [she]135-sarah cries beseechingly . "[373-one] And before the month is out , [you]0-i may be down on [your]0-i knees as [I]0-i am , thanking [God]184-god and [me]0-i for having saved [you]0-i from perdition . One month ! one month ! " [She]135-sarah has pressed [her]135-sarah head against [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister 's gown , and through the woollen stuff [her]135-sarah tears are soaking — [Sarah]135-sarah 's rare tears ! There is such a compelling ring in [her]135-sarah voice that [Belinda]134-belinda 's cold , sick heart throbs beneath it . Again that vision rises before [her]134-belinda , but changed and beautified . [Rivers]162-rivers is coming into [the room]422-the room , but between [him]162-rivers and [her]134-belinda thrusts itself no chill , pedant figure . As [she]134-belinda so stands hesitating , thrilling , in a waking dream , the door of [the room]422-the room does in effect fly open , and [some one]2370-some one enters . Is it [Rivers]162-rivers ? Alas , no ! "[373-one] A merry Christmas to [you]0-i ! " bawls [Miss Watson]147-miss watson , noisily entering , and throwing [her]147-miss watson greeting at [them]3230-them like a paving - stone . "[373-one] [I]0-i have just been up to wish [granny]156-granny a merry Christmas , but [she]156-granny does not seem very bright , eh ? Do [you]0-i think [she]156-granny is breaking at all ? [She]156-granny did not seem up to [her]156-granny usual mark ! " [Sarah]135-sarah has sprung to [her]135-sarah feet , [her]135-sarah habitual aplomb gone , and [her]135-sarah one impulse to hide , at any price , [her]135-sarah tear - stained face from the horny eyes of [the intruder]2853-the intruder . "[156-granny] Why , [you]0-i do not look very bright either ! " cries [the latter]2394-the latter , looking inquisitively from one to the other of [the girls]2500-the girls ' dismal faces . "[156-granny] What is it ? Christmas bills ? Colds ? [You]0-i look as if [you]0-i had a cold ! " concentrating [her]135-sarah whole attention upon [Sarah]135-sarah , whose face is so little used to being inundated with tears that it resents it , and shows the traces more plainly than does one that is frequently bewept . "[0-i] [I]0-i have , " [she]0-i answers , snatching eagerly at the excuse , and violently resuming a part of [her]0-i usual nonchalant self - command ; "[0-i] a terrific cold . [I]0-i have had it for — for years ! If [I]0-i were [you]0-i , [I]0-i would not come near [me]0-i , or [I]0-i shall give it [you]0-i as soon as look at [you]0-i ! " "[0-i] Pooh ! " replies [Miss Watson]147-miss watson doughtily . "[0-i] [You]0-i should take a cold bath all the year round , and wear flannel next [your]0-i skin . Look at [me]0-i ! " "[0-i] Are [you]0-i the result of taking a cold bath all the year round , and wearing flannel next the skin ? " asks [Sarah]135-sarah innocently , stealing a covert glance at [her]135-sarah own foggy image in the little Chippendale mirror over the mantelpiece , to see how far [she]0-i is recovered . But [Miss Watson]147-miss watson does not hear . "[0-i] [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i do not know how [I]0-i ever got [here]2351-here ! " continues [she]0-i , drawing up a chair to the fire , and setting [her]0-i large feet on the fender ; "[0-i] there is not a cab to be had . [I]0-i felt [my]0-i way all round [Berkeley Square]65-berkeley square by the railings . Five or six times [I]0-i was as nearly as possible run over ! " "[0-i] Just heavens , why not quite ? " murmurs [Sarah]135-sarah under [her]135-sarah breath . "[0-i] [I]0-i never remember such a Christmas Day ; do [you]0-i ever remember such a Christmas Day ? [I]0-i have just been asking granny whether , in all [her]1352-her long experience , [she]1352-her ever remembers such a Christmas Day . " "[0-i] If [you]0-i have been appealing to [granny]721-granny 's long experience , " rejoins [Sarah]135-sarah sarcastically , "[0-i] no wonder [you]0-i did not find [her]721-granny very bright ; there is nothing in [the world]643-the world that [she]721-granny hates so much . " "[0-i] [I]0-i told [her]721-granny how ill [I]0-i thought [her]721-granny looking , " goes on [the visitor]1164-the visitor comfortably , rubbing [her]0-i knees , advanced in close proximity to the fire . "[0-i] [She]721-granny tells [me]0-i that it is the climate ; that it is killing [her]721-granny by inches . [She]721-granny seems to have [her]721-granny heart set upon going to [the Riviera]66-the riviera ; why does not [she]721-granny go ? " with another look of acute inquisitiveness darted at [[her]0-i two companions]3235-her two companions . "[721-granny] [She]721-granny spoke of there being some tiresome hitch — something in the way ; what is it — eh ? " "[721-granny] [We]1355-we can not bear to go so far away from [you]0-i , " replies [Sarah]135-sarah impudently , but with a nervous laugh and look towards [[her]0-i sister]2366-her sister ; "[721-granny] that is it . " But a curiosity so robust as [Miss Watson]147-miss watson 's is not to be blunted by a jest . [That great Toledo blade]3237-that great toledo blade is not to be turned aside by [a light rapier]3238-a light rapier . "[721-granny] No question of £ s. d . , eh ? " says [she]135-sarah persistently ; "[721-granny] [the Riviera]66-the riviera grows dearer every year ! No ? Anything about either of [you]0-i , then ? " trying to get a better idea of [Belinda]134-belinda than the rather drooped nape of [her]134-belinda white neck and one homespun shoulder afford ; "[721-granny] any little — little entanglement , eh ? " "[0-i] [You]0-i have hit it ! " cries [Sarah]135-sarah jeeringly ; "[0-i] it is useless to try and conceal anything from [you]0-i : [we]1355-we are endeavouring to arrange a marriage between [me]0-i and [the Archbishop of [Canterburry]67-canterburry]1356-the archbishop of canterburry ; and as [he]1356-the archbishop of canterburry can not conveniently leave [[his]1356-the archbishop of canterburry see]1357-his see , [we]1355-we think it as well that [I]0-i should remain in [the neighbourhood]1358-the neighbourhood . " It is obvious that nothing is to be made of [Sarah]135-sarah ; [the visitor]1164-the visitor turns [her]1164-the visitor attention towards [the other sister]2364-the other sister . "[136-professor forth] Any more Latin exercises , [Belinda]134-belinda ? " [she]1164-the visitor asks in a rallying voice ; "[134-belinda] has [Professor Forth]136-professor forth been helping [you]134-belinda to do any more Latin exercises ? does [he]136-professor forth often come ? do [you]134-belinda see much of [him]136-professor forth ? does [he]136-professor forth ever ask [you]134-belinda to go down to [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge , eh ? " To these questions [Belinda]134-belinda 's answer is so unready that [[her]134-belinda junior]2401-her junior has again to come to [her]134-belinda aid . "[136-professor forth] Of course , " [she]134-belinda answers ironically ; "[136-professor forth] but [he]136-professor forth says [he]136-professor forth will not have [us]1359-we , unless [we]1359-we bring [you]134-belinda too . " "[136-professor forth] As to that , " replies [Miss Watson]147-miss watson , [her]147-miss watson rhinoceros - hide quite unpunctured by the pricks of this angry persiflage , "[136-professor forth] [I]0-i can tell [you]134-belinda [I]0-i have a very good mind to take a run down there . What do [you]134-belinda say to [our]1359-we making up a party ? [we]1359-we would make [him]136-professor forth give [us]1359-we luncheon and take [us]1359-we about ; [they]1360-they are always delighted to give one luncheon and take one about ; and if [we]1359-we can get hold of [Rivers]162-rivers , [we]1359-we will make [him]136-professor forth come too . " [She]147-miss watson looks triumphantly round to collect the suffrages of [[her]147-miss watson companions]1169-her companions as to this project ; but neither is equal to giving utterance to any opinion upon it . "[251-apropos of rivers] [Apropos of Rivers]251-apropos of rivers , " continues [the other]2396-the other , too happy in the sound of [her]0-i own voice to miss the lacking response , and addressing the observation more especially to [Belinda]134-belinda , "[251-apropos of rivers] a very odd thing happened to [me]0-i . [I]0-i had not gone five yards from [[your]134-belinda house]1361-your house the other day , before [I]0-i met [him]136-professor forth . [I]0-i asked [him]136-professor forth at once whether [he]136-professor forth was on [his]136-professor forth way to call upon [you]134-belinda . " "[136-professor forth] And [he]136-professor forth said what ? " asks [Sarah]135-sarah , trying to speak lightly , but with a hurry in [her]135-sarah voice that [she]135-sarah can not still . "[136-professor forth] [He]136-professor forth said ' No . ' " "[136-professor forth] That answer had at least the merit of brevity , " replies [Sarah]135-sarah , laughing forcedly and changing [her]135-sarah position so as to interpose the slight bulwark of [her]135-sarah girlish figure between [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister and [[their]1363-their guest]1128-their guest . "[0-i] [I]0-i asked [him]136-professor forth why not . [I]0-i said , ' Do go ; [they]1362-they expect [you]136-professor forth . ' " "[0-i] That did not show a rigorous attention to truth on [your]134-belinda part , " rejoins [Sarah]135-sarah sharply : "[136-professor forth] [we]1363-their did not expect [him]136-professor forth . But what did [he]136-professor forth say to that ? was [his]136-professor forth answer marked by the same courteous diffuseness as before ? " "[136-professor forth] [He]136-professor forth did not say anything ; [he]136-professor forth walked on very fast and hailed a hansom ; but [I]0-i should not wonder if [he]136-professor forth did come after all , " consolingly . "[0-i] [I]0-i called out to [him]136-professor forth , just as [he]136-professor forth was driving off , to be sure not to forget . Is that the luncheon - bell ? Dear [me]0-i ! how the morning has run away ! [I]0-i suppose , " with [her]0-i loud assured laugh , "[0-i] that [you]134-belinda will give [me]0-i a slice of beef and plum pudding , will not [you]134-belinda , eh ? " After that Christmas morning [Sarah]135-sarah spends [her]135-sarah eloquence in vain . [She]135-sarah may draw what pictures and practise what oratory and cry what tears [she]135-sarah chooses . Of what use is it to draw pictures for , or address appeals to , or weep tears over a stone ? And as far as any malleability or power of receiving impressions from without goes , [Belinda]134-belinda is henceforth a stone . [She]134-belinda accepts all [[her]134-belinda sister]2366-her sister 's appeals in a sullen , dogged silence . Whether [she]135-sarah ever even hears them , [Sarah]135-sarah is ignorant . [She]135-sarah gives no sign of having done so by any least emotion produced by [them]3247-them . [She]135-sarah listens , or seems to listen , with phlegmatic indifference to the sarcasms , vituperations , witticisms , poured from [Sarah]135-sarah 's cornucopia upon [[her]135-sarah future husband]3248-her future husband . [They]3247-them awake in [her]135-sarah neither anger nor pain . [She]135-sarah makes no effort to check them . Apparently [she]135-sarah would as soon hear them as not . But at the end of [them]3247-them , when [Sarah]135-sarah , from pure loss of breath — not , heaven knows , from any lack of goodwill — has paused , things are at precisely the same point as they were when [she]135-sarah began . Beaten and discouraged , [she]135-sarah desists at last . Not , indeed , that [she]135-sarah ever constrains [herself]135-sarah so far as to omit tacking on some abusive adjective to the name of [[her]135-sarah future brother - in - law]3249-her future brother - in - law whenever [she]135-sarah has occasion to mention [him]3249-her future brother - in - law . Nor is it until [she]135-sarah has exhausted every possible expletive that , as far as [she]135-sarah knows , the English language contains , and applied them not only to [him]3249-her future brother - in - law , but to [[his]3249-her future brother - in - law mother]2549-his mother , that [she]135-sarah desists at all . [She]135-sarah relieves [her]135-sarah feelings by putting all the dogs into mourning , tying a piece of black crape round each of [their]3251-their tails ; a proceeding which fills [Punch]186-punch with fury , Slutty with mauvaise honte , and [Jane]229-jane with pride . [Jane]229-jane has that love for finery which is implanted in [many plain persons]3252-many plain persons . With a face set like a flint , [Belinda]134-belinda marches to [her]134-belinda doom . And neither dogs nor [men]2377-men can retard the approach of the date of that doom . There are no preparations to delay it . [She]135-sarah has steadfastly adhered to [her]135-sarah determination to have no new clothes . "[134-belinda] [A wilful woman]1364-a wilful woman will have [her]1364-a wilful woman way ! " [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill says , shaking that head whose eyes seem to grow brighter and [her]134-belinda cheeks pinker and smoother as each day brings [her]134-belinda nearer to the 10th of January and [the South of [France]62-france]1286-the south of france . "[1364-a wilful woman] [I]0-i suppose [you]1365-you know [your]1365-you own affairs best ; and [I]0-i fancy that [you]1365-you will not have much need for dress at [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge . The only time that [I]0-i was [there]2419-there [I]0-i thought [all the women]1367-all the women shockingly fagoté ! " [She]0-i stops and shrugs [her]0-i shoulders at the recollection ; but even as [she]0-i shrugs a smile hovers across [her]0-i lips . [She]0-i is thinking that [her]0-i French tour will be none the worse for having [her]0-i purse made heavier by the weight of [Belinda]134-belinda 's trousseau . "[1367-all the women] [I]0-i am too annoyed about [Belinda]134-belinda , " [she]0-i says on another occasion to [[her]0-i younger granddaughter]3255-her younger granddaughter ; "[0-i] but [you]1368-you know how useless argument is ! [She]134-belinda is as obstinate as [a mule]1369-a mule ; and since [she]134-belinda is determined to be no expense to [me]0-i , [I]0-i was thinking , " [her]0-i eye lightening , "[0-i] of getting one or two things for [ourselves]1370-ourselves . [I]0-i should not wonder if , after all , [I]0-i might manage to let [you]1368-you have that plush cloak trimmed with fishertails that [you]1368-you asked [me]0-i for at [Coralie]252-coralie 's the other day . Come ! what do [you]1368-you say ? " tapping [her]1368-you cheek with an air of fond friskiness . "[0-i] [I]0-i say that [I]0-i will not have it ! " replies [Sarah]135-sarah doggedly ; "[0-i] it is blood - money ! " The settlements are drawn up . [Belinda]134-belinda 's widowhood and [[her]134-belinda younger children]3256-her younger children are provided for . Bought are license and ring . [The latter Professor Forth]3257-the latter professor forth brought one day to be tried on ; and [Belinda]134-belinda , with white , shut lips , pallidly essayed it . There is no bustle of arriving parcels , no wedding presents to be displayed . [Miss Churchill]152-miss churchill has sternly insisted upon an absolute secrecy being observed as regards [her]0-i engagement . [She]0-i can bear to be married , but gifts and congratulations upon [her]0-i marriage [she]0-i could not bear . So that [the comers]3258-the comers and goers to [the little house in — Street]3259-the little house in — street still come and go , without suspicion that anything out of the ordinary course is brewing beneath [its]3259-the little house in — street modest roof . [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill would have preferred that the betrothal should be proclaimed from [the housetops]3260-the housetops . It would give [it]3259-the little house in — street a body and solidity that just at first [she]185-mrs. churchill fears it lacks . An engagement known to all [the world]643-the world is much more difficult of rupture than one to which only [the three or four persons most nearly concerned]3262-the three or four persons most nearly concerned are privy . "[134-belinda] [Belinda]134-belinda is so odd and crotchety , " [she]185-mrs. churchill says one afternoon , as [she]185-mrs. churchill and [Sarah]135-sarah are driving [home]2345-home through [the Park]3264-the park together ; "[134-belinda] why , if [she]134-belinda is in earnest , should [she]134-belinda object to [people]523-people being told ? Do [you]1372-you think there would be any harm in [my]0-i just giving a hint of it to [the Crawfords]253-the crawfords , and [Dalzells]254-dalzells , and [Lady Hunt]255-lady hunt , and — and just [[our]1373-our own intimates]1374-our own intimates ? [They]1375-they will be so hurt at being left out in the cold ; and [I]0-i am sure that [they]1375-they would give [her]134-belinda something handsome . Even if [she]134-belinda does not care for personal ornaments , [they]1375-they might give [her]134-belinda plate ; [I]0-i do not suppose , " with an amused smile , "[1372-you] that there is likely to be much plate in [the Forth family]1376-the forth family ! " "[1372-you] And [you]1372-you think , " retorts [Sarah]135-sarah , with a fiery eye and a curling lip , "[1372-you] that the more [people]523-people [you]1372-you tell about it the more [Belinda]134-belinda will be nailed to keeping it ! Do [you]1372-you think that , after all these years , [I]0-i do not understand [you]1372-you ? " [The elder woman]2766-the elder woman looks rather foolish , and does not repeat [her]2766-the elder woman suggestion . And now , indeed , all necessity for it is at an end . There is obviously no need to tie [Belinda]134-belinda with the cords of convention and public opinion to [her]134-belinda faggot and stake . The 10th of January has come , and [she]134-belinda has as yet shown no sign of flinching . To ensure the greater privacy , the marriage is to take place at nine o'clock in the morning . [Not a soul]3266-not a soul is bidden to it . There are no [bridesmaids]3267-bridesmaids or [groomsmen]3268-groomsmen , [no train of wedding guests]3269-no train of wedding guests . Even [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill , on hearing of [the earliness of the hour]3270-the earliness of the hour , has , like [those wedding guests that [Scripture]256-scripture speaks of]3271-those wedding guests that scripture speaks of , begged to be excused . Perhaps it is not only the raw winter morning from which [she]134-belinda shrinks . Perhaps [she]134-belinda is not particularly anxious to be an ocular witness of that ceremony which [she]134-belinda has certainly speeded with [her]134-belinda prayers . "[1372-you] [I]0-i hope [you]1372-you do not think it unkind of [me]0-i , [[my]0-i child]1378-my child , " [she]0-i says , appearing at [her]0-i dressing - room door in a pretty laced dressing - gown as [she]0-i hears [[her]0-i granddaughter]2705-her granddaughter descending the stairs to [the brougham]3273-the brougham ; "[1372-you] but [you]1372-you know what [a London church]1379-a london church is , and [you]1372-you know what [my]0-i neuralgia is . How nice [you]1372-you look ! " smilingly surveying the dark , homespun suit , so dark and brown as in the shabby light to look quite black , and the rigidly plain close bonnet which [[her]0-i granddaughter]2705-her granddaughter has chosen for [her]2705-her granddaughter wedding garments . [Belinda]134-belinda smiles too — a smile of which [[her]134-belinda grandmother]2703-her grandmother is not particularly fond of thinking afterwards . "[1372-you] Yes , do not [I]0-i ? " [she]134-belinda says—"so[1380-a bride] like [a bride]1380-a bride ! " "[1380-a bride] In point of fact , " continues [the old lady]2704-the old lady rather hurriedly , and not much relishing the tone of this acquiescence in [her]2704-the old lady compliment , "[1380-a bride] [I]0-i shall be far more useful at [home]2345-home ; [I]0-i shall ensure [the house]2521-the house being thoroughly well - warmed for [you]1372-you when [you]1372-you come back ; [you]1372-you shall find roaring fires in [every room]1383-every room ! " "[1384-we] [We]1384-we shall not come back , " replies [Belinda]134-belinda quietly . "[1384-we] Not come back ? " ( with an accent of extreme surprise ) . "[1384-we] [Your]1372-you are going abroad then ? " "[1384-we] No ; but there is nothing to come back for . " "[1384-we] And whose fault is that , pray ? " asks [[her]134-belinda grandmother]2703-her grandmother with an uncomfortable laugh . "[1384-we] If [I]0-i had had [my]0-i way , there would have been plenty to come back for : a good breakfast ; a score of [people]523-people ; speeches ! " "[0-i] But that was not [my]0-i way , " replies [Belinda]134-belinda , again faintly smiling ; "[0-i] and , as [you]0-i say sometimes , tous les goûts sont respectables . [I]0-i am afraid that [I]0-i shall be late if [I]0-i delay any longer ; good - bye , [granny]721-granny . " [She]2703-her grandmother speaks the two last words quite gently and friendly , and holds out [her]2703-her grandmother fair cold cheek to be kissed . [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill is afterwards not much fonder of thinking of the feel of that cheek , than of the look of that smile before spoken of . "[721-granny] [I]0-i wish [I]0-i had not kissed [her]721-granny , " [she]0-i says to [herself]0-i fretfully afterwards , as [she]0-i sits with [her]0-i still pretty feet resting on the well - warmed fender in the privacy of [[her]0-i dressing - room]3278-her dressing - room , when the brougham has rolled away ; "[0-i] it was almost like kissing [a dead person]1387-a dead person ! " And meanwhile , through [the dismal morning streets]3279-the dismal morning streets , dirty with that worst of all dirtiness , dirty snow , and where the lamp - lighters have only just put out the lamps , and would have done better not to put them out at all , [Belinda]134-belinda drives , [[her]134-belinda sister]2366-her sister by [her]134-belinda side . The angry tears are raining down [Sarah]135-sarah 's face , encouraged rather than checked by [[their]3281-their owner]3282-their owner . In [her]135-sarah small warm hands ( for even on a bitter January morning wrath is warming ) lie tightly clasped [Belinda]134-belinda 's cold ones . [The shop - boys]3283-the shop - boys are only just beginning to take down the shutters ; in the haberdashers ' underessed windows , instead of costly fabrics and dainty webs , are to be seen nothing but bare boards and skeleton stands . [The blue - armed housemaids]3284-the blue - armed housemaids are scrubbing the door - steps ; through the squares [the milk - carts]3285-the milk - carts rush . "[0-i] [I]0-i wish [you]1388-you would cry , " says [Sarah]135-sarah presently , from among [her]135-sarah sobs . "[1388-you] Why should [I]0-i ? " replies [Belinda]134-belinda calmly ; "[0-i] it is [my]0-i own doing . " "[0-i] That is the worst of it ! " cries [Sarah]135-sarah passionately . ; "[0-i] if [you]1388-you were doing it for some great cause — to save [granny]156-granny from [the workhouse]1389-the workhouse , or [me]0-i from the scaffold — there would be some sense in it ! there is no sense now ! " There is no sense in it ! The words keep echoing , dancing — set to a teasing tune — in [Belinda]134-belinda 's head for the rest of the way . [They]1390-they reach [the church]803-the church - door . [The carriage]2361-the carriage stops . "[1390-they] [We]1390-they have got to the gallows , it seems ! " says [Sarah]135-sarah , with a fresh burst of sobs ; then , vehemently wringing [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister 's hands , [she]135-sarah cries desperately : "[134-belinda] [Belinda]134-belinda ! it is not too late yet ! there is still time ! it is not too late yet to go back ! " "[0-i] [I]0-i have no wish to go back , " replies [Belinda]134-belinda firmly , though [her]134-belinda voice is low and weak , and [her]134-belinda lips are white ; "[1391-he] why should [I]0-i wish to go back , when it is [my]0-i own doing ? " So [they]1390-they get out . At the door [they]1390-they are received by [a Churchill cousin]3289-a churchill cousin , who , summoned as [[Belinda]134-belinda 's nearest male relative]3290-belinda 's nearest male relative to give [her]134-belinda away , stands awaiting [them]1390-they , cross and shivering . "[1391-he] Has [he]1391-he come ? is [he]1391-he [here]2351-here ? [I]0-i do not see [him]1391-he ! " says [Sarah]135-sarah , with a last flare - up of hope , peering eagerly into [the church]803-the church , where here and there ( only here and there , for [they]1390-they are not nearly all lit ) a gas - lamp displays its dreary yellow flicker on the background of thick morning fog . "[0-i] Yes ; then"—with a sudden collapse into disappointment — "[0-i] then [he]1391-he has not had a paralytic stroke at the last moment , worse luck ! " [They]1390-they walk up [the aisle]3292-the aisle ; a snuffy old pew - opener in a black crape bonnet preceding [them]1390-they ; [Belinda]134-belinda on [[her]134-belinda cousin]3293-her cousin 's arm ; [Sarah]135-sarah , in [her]135-sarah ostentatiously paraded grief , bringing up the rear . [They]1390-they have arrived at the altar , the candles upon which are lit , their wavering light falling upon [an impatient clergyman]3294-an impatient clergyman and [two elderly men]3295-two elderly men ; for [the bridegroom]3296-the bridegroom has brought with [him]3296-the bridegroom [a friend of [his]3296-the bridegroom own age and calling , whom [he]3296-the bridegroom has summoned from [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge to support [him]3296-the bridegroom]3297-a friend of his own age and calling , whom he has summoned from oxbridge to support him . [The Churchill cousin]3298-the churchill cousin has never before seen [the bridegroom]3296-the bridegroom , nor has [[the bridegroom]3296-the bridegroom 's friend]3301-the bridegroom 's friend ever before seen [the bride]3302-the bride . [The opposing parties]3303-the opposing parties now stare at [each other]469-each other in unaffected astonishment . All through the service , [the young Churchill]3305-the young churchill , who had once [himself]3305-the young churchill thrown out feelers in the direction of [Belinda]134-belinda , and had [them]3306-them civilly and firmly at once returned to [him]3305-the young churchill , is setting [himself]3305-the young churchill angrily in imagination by the side of [the bridegroom]3296-the bridegroom , and wondering what the devil [Belinda]134-belinda can have seen in this ugly old curmudgeon to prefer to [himself]3305-the young churchill . All through the service , [[the bridegroom]3296-the bridegroom 's supporter]3309-the bridegroom 's supporter is staring in gaping wonder at [the beautiful broken - hearted - looking girl , who has mysteriously elected to unite [her]3310-the beautiful broken - hearted - looking girl , who has mysteriously elected to unite her fate with that of his old friend fate with that of [his]3296-the bridegroom old friend]3310-the beautiful broken - hearted - looking girl , who has mysteriously elected to unite her fate with that of his old friend ; ruefully reflecting that [she]3310-the beautiful broken - hearted - looking girl , who has mysteriously elected to unite her fate with that of his old friend will bring certain death to [the constitutionals]3311-the constitutionals , and the pipes , and the discussions on the Enclitic de , and such - like light subjects , which [they]3303-the opposing parties have been in the habit of sharing for the best part of the last forty years . All through the service [the bridegroom]3296-the bridegroom is peevishly glancing over [his]3296-the bridegroom shoulder to see whence comes the draught of raw air that , despite the black velvet skull - cap with which [he]3296-the bridegroom has furnished [himself]3296-the bridegroom , [he]3296-the bridegroom feels at baleful play about [his]3296-the bridegroom ears . [Belinda]134-belinda alone looks neither to the right nor to the left . If [she]134-belinda were really the statue which [her]134-belinda fair , still body so closely resembles , [she]134-belinda could not be less conscious than [she]134-belinda is of dank nipping air or curious look . [She]134-belinda appears to listen with close attention , or is it indeed not attention , but the impassiveness of stone ? Only once through all the service does [her]134-belinda face come to life ; and then it is stabbed into life , as one has heard in the grisly dissecting - room tale , of [him]1394-him who , thought dead , was brought back to agonizing momentary life by a knife - thrust ! The knife - thrust that brings [Belinda]134-belinda back to life lies in the words , "[0-i] Forsaking all other , keep [thee]1393-thee only unto [him]1394-him so long as [ye]1393-thee both shall live . " "[0-i] Forsaking all other ! " [She]134-belinda has been spared the trouble of forsaking that other . Has not [he]1394-him been beforehand with [her]134-belinda ? Has not [he]1394-him forsaken [her]134-belinda ? [Sarah]135-sarah , closely watching [her]134-belinda , sees [her]134-belinda ashy features contract in such a spasm of mortal pain , that [she]134-belinda involuntarily starts forward . Is [she]134-belinda going to faint ? If [she]134-belinda faint , and is carried out of [church]613-church , may not [she]134-belinda be saved even yet ? [She]134-belinda is not yet married ! The service is not yet ended ! But the next glance at [her]134-belinda face dispels the momentary hope . [Belinda]134-belinda is not going to faint ; [she]134-belinda has gained back [her]134-belinda rigidity . [She]134-belinda is dead again . It is over now ; over — even to the signing of names in [the vestry]3314-the vestry . [The clergyman]3315-the clergyman offers [his]3315-the clergyman congratulations , but [he]3315-the clergyman does it hastily and abstractedly . [He]3315-the clergyman is thinking whether [he]3315-the clergyman will have time for a good warming and breakfasting before setting off for the funeral at [Kensal Green]68-kensal green , at which [he]3315-the clergyman has to assist . [[The bridegroom]3296-the bridegroom 's friend]3301-the bridegroom 's friend and [the Churchill cousin]3298-the churchill cousin also offer [theirs]3319-theirs ; but [those of the first]3320-those of the first sound incredulous , and those of [the latter ironical]3321-the latter ironical . [Sarah]135-sarah alone keeps utter silence . [The brougham]3273-the brougham stands at the door , the horse fidgety and stung by the cold . [A crossing - sweeper]3323-a crossing - sweeper and [two pinched street children]3324-two pinched street children are watching [the strange wedding - party]3325-the strange wedding - party 's exit . [The bridegroom]3296-the bridegroom , great - coated and comfortered to the end of [his]3296-the bridegroom long nose , is bidding adieu to [[his]3296-the bridegroom ally]3327-his ally . [The bride]3302-the bride turns to [[her]3302-the bride sister]2366-her sister : "[0-i] It is done now ! " [she]3302-the bride says pantingly ; "[0-i] there is no going back from it now ! " "[0-i] None ! " replies [Sarah]135-sarah dully . "[0-i] Say something to [me]0-i , [Sarah]135-sarah ; wish [me]0-i something good ! " [She]0-i has flung [her]0-i arms round [[her]0-i sister]2366-her sister in an épanchement most unusual with [her]2366-her sister . [Her]0-i icy cheek is hard pressed against [[her]0-i sister]2366-her sister 's hot and tear - reddened one . "[0-i] [I]0-i wish [you]1395-you — [I]0-i wish [you]1395-you — " cries [Sarah]135-sarah , stammering , what between [her]135-sarah sobs , the almost ungovernable impulse to invoke upon [[her]0-i sister]2366-her sister a speedy widowhood , and the hopelessness of finding any other wish that will not sound a mockery . "[135-sarah] [You]135-sarah — [you]135-sarah can not find anything to wish [me]0-i ! " says [Belinda]134-belinda tremulously . "[135-sarah] [You]135-sarah are right ; there is nothing . " "[0-i] [I]0-i — [I]0-i wish [you]1395-you , " says [Sarah]135-sarah , driven to desperation by this tone , and clinging convulsively to [[her]0-i sister]2366-her sister as though [ten bridegrooms]3334-ten bridegrooms should not force [them]3334-ten bridegrooms apart—"I[0-i] wish [you]1395-you many happy returns of the day ! " breaking into an hysterical laugh . "[0-i] That is ambiguous ! [I]0-i may attach what meaning [I]0-i choose to it . " These are the last words [Belinda Forth]134-belinda hears , before [the brougham]3273-the brougham whirls [her]0-i away . [The Churchill cousin]3298-the churchill cousin takes [Sarah]135-sarah home in a hansom , and a very unpleasant drive [he]3298-the churchill cousin has , as [she]135-sarah cries violently the whole way , in passionate self - reproach at having found nothing kinder to say . [Belinda]134-belinda has been married three days . [We]3337-we are creatures of habit , as [everyone]3028-everyone knows ; and it is surprising with what quick pliability [we]3337-we find [ourselves]3337-we cutting off and tucking in whatever angles prevent [our]3337-we fitting into any new niche that it may be [our]3337-we fate to occupy . But this process , though rapid , is usually of somewhat longer accomplishment than three days . At all events , [Belinda]134-belinda has not yet got into the habit of being married . There still seems to [her]134-belinda something improbable — nay , monstrous — in the fact of [herself]134-belinda sitting opposite to [Professor Forth]136-professor forth at breakfast in [[their]3339-their Folkestone lodgings]3340-their folkestone lodgings , pouring weak tea for [him]136-professor forth out of a Britannia metal teapot , and sedulously recollecting how many lumps of sugar [he]136-professor forth likes , as [she]134-belinda has already discovered that [he]136-professor forth has an objection to repeating the information . Nor is it less monstrous to be warming [his]136-professor forth overcoat , and cutting [his]136-professor forth newspapers , and ordering [his]136-professor forth dinners with that nice attention to digestibility and economy which [she]134-belinda finds to be expected of [her]134-belinda . [They]3341-them have been enormously long , these three days . It seems to [her]134-belinda as if for months [she]134-belinda has been looking at those hideous ornaments on the drawing - room chimney - piece , and trying to draw the skimp summer curtains that will not draw across the shutterless windows , rattled by the wind . For months [she]134-belinda has been listening to the eternal sighing , sobbing , whistling , howling of that same wind , and to the sea banging on [the cold shore]3342-the cold shore . For months [she]134-belinda has been walking with [Professor]136-professor forth Forth up and down , up and down [the Leas]3343-the leas , six turns this way , six turns that way . For months [she]134-belinda has been writing [his]136-professor forth letters till [her]134-belinda hand ached , and reading aloud to [him]136-professor forth till [her]134-belinda voice cracked . As for the reading and writing , [she]134-belinda can not have too much of them — the more the better ! There is nothing like occupation — a continuous , settled occupation — nothing like occupation for keeping out of one 's head those words of [Sarah]135-sarah 's that ring so foolishly dinning in [her]134-belinda ears , "[0-i] There is no sense in it ! there is no sense in it ! " [She]134-belinda will not listen to [them]3341-them . Even if they are true , of what profit to hearken to [them]3341-them now ? And reading and writing render conversation , too , less necessary . It is certain that , however determinately [anyone]494-anyone may have confined [his]3345-his or [her]3346-her contemplation of [another person]3347-another person 's character to the intellectual side of it , it is impossible to live with [that person]3348-that person without discovering that [he]3345-his or [she]3346-her has another side . [Belinda]134-belinda has already discovered that [[her]134-belinda Professor]3349-her professor has another . It is surprising how much less of [his]136-professor forth conversation has turned during the last three days upon the problems of the mind and the sayings of the mighty dead , than upon the price of coals and the wickedness of [lodging - house servants]3350-lodging - house servants . The first of these topics has led to the proposal that [he]136-professor forth and [[his]136-professor forth bride]3351-his bride shall henceforth content [themselves]3352-themselves with one fire , to be fed with ( if possible ) not more than two coal - boxes per day ; and the second is at present employing [his]136-professor forth tongue , [his]136-professor forth eyes , [his]136-professor forth thoughts . [They]3352-themselves are at breakfast , [Belinda]134-belinda seated behind the Britannia metal teapot , [[her]134-belinda husband]3353-her husband facing [her]134-belinda , a dish of fried bacon before [him]136-professor forth , which latter object is monopolizing the whole of [his]136-professor forth attention . "[0-i] It is beyond the range of possibility , " [he]136-professor forth is saying slowly , "[0-i] that [you]1396-he and [I]0-i can have eaten a pound and a half of bacon in three days , and [I]0-i think [I]0-i noticed that [you]1396-he did not take any yesterday . " "[1396-he] Did not [I]0-i ? " replies [Belinda]134-belinda indifferently ; "[0-i] [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i forget . " "[0-i] And if , " pursues [Mr. Forth]209-mr. forth , [his]136-professor forth eyes ranging with severe scanning from the bacon - dish to the sugar - basin—"if[183-maria] , as [Maria]183-maria just now told [us]1397-our , those few lumps are all that remain of the pound of sugar purchased by [me]0-i yesterday , it is obvious that there must be wholesale theft somewhere ! " "[1398-them] It is very dishonest of [them]1398-them , " replies [Belinda]134-belinda carelessly , putting up [her]134-belinda hand to [her]134-belinda hair , which , no longer tended by [a maid]3354-a maid , feels oddly loose and uncomfortable . "[1398-them] If [you]0-i had allowed [me]0-i to bring [Jennings]257-jennings , [she]1399-she would have looked after everything . " "[0-i] [I]0-i discouraged the idea of [your]1396-he bringing [a maid]3354-a maid , " replies [he]1396-he , nettled ; "[0-i] because [I]0-i considered , and still consider , that it would have made a most unnecessary addition to [our]1397-our expenses . And as to [our]1397-our provisions , " looking carefully round [the room]422-the room , "[0-i] [I]0-i see that there are several cupboards ; there is no reason why they should not be kept — " "[0-i] Bacon kept in a cupboard in [one 's only sitting - room]1401-one 's only sitting - room ! " cries [Belinda]134-belinda , breaking into an indignant laugh ; "[0-i] [you]0-i can not be serious ! " "[0-i] If [you]1396-he are able to suggest any better way of preventing [their]1402-their depredations , [I]0-i shall be happy to hear it , " [he]1396-he answers tartly . "[1396-he] If [they]1402-their ate a flitch a day , " replies [Belinda]134-belinda hotly , and lifting [her]134-belinda disdainful fine nose contumaciously into the air , "[1402-their] [I]0-i should say that it was a small evil compared to [our]1397-our living in the atmosphere of [[a chandler]1403-a chandler 's shop]1404-a chandler 's shop . " [She]134-belinda rises precipitately as [she]134-belinda speaks — to [her]134-belinda , at least , [Folkestone]81-folkestone has not given an appetite — and walks to the window , where , for the rest of the breakfast hour , [she]134-belinda presents a sociable homespun back to the economist at the breakfast - table . It is not the first time during these three days that [she]134-belinda has discovered that [his]1396-he standpoint with regard to little social possibilities or impossibilities is different from [her]134-belinda own . [She]134-belinda had known that [she]134-belinda did not love [him]1396-he , but [she]134-belinda had not known that [he]1396-he wore carpet slippers in [the drawing - room]3050-the drawing - room . A tendency towards slippers in [the drawing - room]3050-the drawing - room , a passion for high tea , accompanied by no change of dress , are not these sufficient to wreck [a bride]1380-a bride 's happiness upon ? But worst of all , perhaps because latest of all , has jarred upon [her]134-belinda this final instance of how widely asunder are [their]1397-our points of view . It jars upon [her]134-belinda still as [she]134-belinda stands by the window after breakfast , sullenly drumming on the pane . In the night snow has fallen , a thin sprinkling meeting even [the sea]517-the sea 's lip , advancing even to where the dull little grey waves set their chill feet ; a shabby sprinkling everywhere : not a good thick cloak of snow , deep and pure , but a scanty rag , through which every footstep shows the hard dark ground . It jars upon [her]134-belinda still , as [she]134-belinda walks to [church]613-church alone — it is Sunday morning — trying to persuade [herself]134-belinda that [she]134-belinda had not felt a movement of gladness on discovering that [he]1396-he had no intention of accompanying [her]134-belinda . [She]134-belinda walks along [the windy cliff]3361-the windy cliff to where [the church]803-the church and [the red vicarage]3363-the red vicarage look out seawards , falling in , as [she]134-belinda goes , with a stream of [people bound to the same goal]3364-people bound to the same goal . It is [a well - fed , comfortable - looking stream flowing prosperously to [[God]184-god 's house]3366-god 's house]3365-a well - fed , comfortable - looking stream flowing prosperously to god 's house ; [smart furry mothers]3367-smart furry mothers holding the hands of [smart furry little children]3368-smart furry little children , [fathers]777-fathers and [tall young daughters]3370-tall young daughters , [husbands]778-husbands and [wives]3372-wives . There is scarcely one , as young as [Belinda]134-belinda , who is companionless . But [she]134-belinda does not think of this . [Her]134-belinda eyes are turned towards [the ocean]3373-the ocean , [that ocean]3374-that ocean for the most part hugged by a close mist , with only one patch of faintish glory — a pale dazzle of dim gold — on which [a small fishing - boat]3375-a small fishing - boat comes sailing , its homely sails transfigured as it goes . [She]134-belinda is saying to [herself]134-belinda , with a heart sinking so deep that [she]134-belinda dare not gauge its profundity : "[1402-their] Is this [the man whose mind [I]0-i have married]1405-the man whose mind i have married ? Is this [the man who is to teach [me]0-i to live by the intellect]1406-the man who is to teach me to live by the intellect ? Is this [the scholar]1407-the scholar and [the sage , whose teaching was to lift [me]0-i out of the circle of [my]0-i narrow interests into the sphere of [the Universal]69-the universal]1408-the sage , whose teaching was to lift me out of the circle of my narrow interests into the sphere of the universal ? " [she]134-belinda asks with contemptuous misgivings ; "[1407-the scholar] this , whose whole soul is occupied by mean parsimonies , and economies of cheese - rinds and candle - ends ? " [She]134-belinda has reached [the church]803-the church , but even inside the consecrated door [she]134-belinda finds that it is still with [her]134-belinda . It comes between [her]134-belinda and the Christmas decorations ; between [her]134-belinda and [the bowing congeeing clergy]3377-the bowing congeeing clergy ; between [her]134-belinda and the prayers . A poor starling has found its way into [the building]3148-the building . [All through the service]3379-all through the service it is flying from side to side , above the heads of [the congregation]3380-the congregation , under the arched roof from window to window . [Children]1007-children turn [their]1007-children heads and [their]1007-children eyes , idly curious to look after it . All through the sermon [she]134-belinda hears the agonized pecking of its poor beak against the pane , in its efforts to escape . [She]134-belinda says to [herself]134-belinda that it is in the same plight as [she]134-belinda . [It]3148-the building , too , entered prison of [its]3148-the building own accord . When the service is ended , [Belinda]134-belinda loiters behind [the rest of [the congregation]3380-the congregation]3382-the rest of the congregation , in order to press half - a - crown into the pew - opener 's hand—(what would [Professor Forth]136-professor forth say to such extravagance?)—and to pour into [his]136-professor forth ear an eager prayer that [he]136-professor forth will set all the church doors and windows open , to give [her]134-belinda starling a chance of escape . But , alas ! what pew - opener can ever let [her]134-belinda out ? As [she]134-belinda passes homewards , [she]134-belinda finds that the day has bettered . The sun has swallowed up the mist , and now shines steadily bright , and even sensibly warm . The little waves are small and mild as summer ones , though the air is still full of penknives . Perhaps it is the increased brightness upon [Nature]259-nature 's face ; perhaps it is the two quiet hours of [her]134-belinda own society , that have braced [her]134-belinda to face with a greater courage the lot [she]134-belinda has chosen , and the fried bacon that typifies it . "[0-i] [I]0-i would do it ! " [she]134-belinda says to [herself]0-i sternly , "[0-i] and now it is done ; now there is nothing for it but to put the best face upon it , and never to own to anyone that [I]0-i would have it undone . There can never again be so bad a piece of [my]0-i life as this ! " ( shuddering ) ; "[1410-his] it is well to have the worst over first , it will be more endurable when [we]1409-they get to [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge . [I]0-i must try to learn how to look at things from [his]1410-his point of view , to count the grains of rice for a pudding , and save the old tea - leaves ! " with a curling lip ; "[1414-they] but [I]0-i will not have the bacon kept in [the drawing - room]3050-the drawing - room ! " [Her]134-belinda resolutions in both respects outlast the day . That to make the best of things has body enough to withstand even the close examination to which [[her]134-belinda husband]3353-her husband subjects the Sunday roast - beef , in order to discover whether it has been robbed of any of its native suet . [He]3353-her husband has a slow munching way of eating , which fidgets [her]134-belinda inexpressibly ; but [she]134-belinda bears that too . [She]134-belinda even resists the temptation to look away from [him]3353-her husband . Since [he]3353-her husband is to munch opposite to [her]134-belinda till death do [them]1409-they part , would it not be wiser to accustom [herself]134-belinda to the sight ? [Her]134-belinda resolution withstands also stoutly all the little trials attendant on [their]1409-they afternoon constitutional . When [they]1409-they emerge upon [the Leas]70-the leas , [they]1409-they see a broad highway of molten copper stretching across [the sea]517-the sea to the lowering sun . [Belinda]134-belinda asks leave to run down the many steps on the clift 's face to [the water]2457-the water 's edge , to set [her]134-belinda feet in the foam fringe , and watch the long swell heaving ocean 's sullen breast ; but [the Professor]2365-the professor will not hear of it . A certain number of brisk turns on [the Leas]3343-the leas — always the same number — is the kind of walk to which alone [he]3353-her husband gives [his]3353-her husband approbation . No stopping to look at the copper sunset , or [the fair ships]3389-the fair ships riding past ; nothing more likely to arrest the circulation and chill the liver . [They]1409-they meet [the same people as [they]1409-they met yesterday and the day before , and as [they]1409-they will meet to - morrow and the day after]3390-the same people as they met yesterday and the day before , and as they will meet to - morrow and the day after ; the same bath - chairs , the same dogs . [The sick , white woman with [[her]3391-the sick , white woman with her attentive burly husband attentive burly husband]3392-her attentive burly husband]3391-the sick , white woman with her attentive burly husband ; [the deformed child]3393-the deformed child ; [the frolic - some colley dogs]3394-the frolic - some colley dogs ; [the frivolous Spitzes]3395-the frivolous spitzes ; [the little blithe Scotch terriers]3396-the little blithe scotch terriers . [Her]134-belinda resolution outlasts even the twilit hour , to [her]134-belinda the most trying of the day . If [she]134-belinda were to consult [her]134-belinda own wishes , there would be no such hour ; no space interposed between the fading of the day - light and the lighting of the gas . But it is in [Professor Forth]136-professor forth 's programme that there shall be such an interval when [he]3353-her husband leans back in [his]3353-her husband armchair , with [his]3353-her husband eyes closed , and does not wish to be spoken to ; whether in meditation or in sleep [she]134-belinda can not tell . There is nothing for [her]134-belinda but to sit opposite to [him]3353-her husband , with [his]3353-her husband idleness , but without [his]3353-her husband repose . The lowered blinds prevent [her]134-belinda looking out upon the first sunset - reddened , and by - and - by [moon - silvered sea]3397-moon - silvered sea . [She]134-belinda can not even distinguish the lustres and the vulgar vases on the chimney - piece . [She]134-belinda can not even stir the fire into such a blaze as to enable [her]134-belinda strong young eyes to read by it ; for to stir the fire makes the coals burn quicker . It is the hour when [the happy young build love - arbours]3398-the happy young build love - arbours out of , and see [brave sweethearts]3399-brave sweethearts in , the red coals . What love - arbour dare [she]134-belinda build ? What [sweetheart]3400-sweetheart dare [she]134-belinda see ? Then come the long hours of reading aloud . They are the most bearable of the day . It does [her]134-belinda resolution the less credit to hold out through them . However , it does hold out . But will it endure through the next day ? If it does , it must indeed be of a stout fibre . For no sooner has the next day risen , than it is clear that there has come one of those rare scourge - days with which [God]184-god sometimes lashes [His]184-god world ; one of those days whose date is remembered , which is held up as a standard in after years for other fell days to measure [themselves]3401-themselves by ; a day that wrecks [ships by fleets]3402-ships by fleets ; that strikes down centenary oaks by scores ; that whelms trains in its snowdrifts ; that stiffens into frozen death the sheep on [the mountain - side]3403-the mountain - side , and [the traveller]3404-the traveller fate - overtaken in [the snow - choked country lane]3405-the snow - choked country lane . Snow often comes stilly ; but to - day it is blowing — blowing mercilessly : not a bluff west wind , good - humouredly roistering , but an inhuman north - easter , the furious sleet driven , raging and sweeping , by its hellish lash . When [Belinda]134-belinda comes down to breakfast , there is [not a soul on the Leas]3406-not a soul on the leas , but [[the luckless baker]3407-the luckless baker 's boy]3408-the luckless baker 's boy butting with bent head against the razor - edged blast . It is scarcely the day which [one]373-one would have chosen to spend in [a flimsily - built seaside summer lodging - house]3410-a flimsily - built seaside summer lodging - house . [[The Forths]3411-the forths ' lodgings]3412-the forths ' lodgings are no better and no worse than [most others of [the class]3414-the class]3413-most others of the class ; with walls about as puny , with woodwork about as warped , with gaps between door and carpet about as wide , with curtains as miserably insufficient as most of [[their]3411-the forths brethren]3415-their brethren . Though every door and window is religiously closed , there is the feeling of being sitting out of doors , only more draughty . Even in [a warm , stoutly - built house]3416-a warm , stoutly - built house one would shiver ; but here ! Well , here the cold is so marrow - piercing , that it usurps to itself the whole attention of the mind . It is not a subordinate , governable cold that by an effort of the will one may forget . It can never be out of the thoughts for one moment ; from the hour of rising , until that of shuddering back to bed again . [The Professor]2365-the professor , always [a chill - blooded creature]3418-a chill - blooded creature , sits all day with [his]2365-the professor knees within the fender , piled with every article of [his]2365-the professor own , and several of [Belinda]134-belinda 's wardrobe . Throwing economy to the winds , [he]2365-the professor has lit the gas , and piled the fire half - way up the chimney ; though whenever fresh coals are put on , a great gust of greenish smoke , furiously beaten back by the blast , comes pouring down the chimney , and suffocatingly flooding [the room]422-the room . [Belinda]134-belinda , cold as [she]134-belinda undoubtedly is , is not near the fire . [She]134-belinda is standing by the window , with a pot of paste and some strips of paper in [her]134-belinda numbed hands , pasting up the apertures in the ill - seasoned shrunk window - frames , through which the wind comes icily whistling and piping . Now and again [she]134-belinda appeals for directions to the heap of wraps beside the hearth , trying to still [her]134-belinda chattering teeth as [she]134-belinda does so , to keep out of [her]134-belinda tone the intense dispiritedness which has invaded [her]134-belinda whole being ; not to listen to the ironical demon voice that whispers in [her]134-belinda ear : "[0-i] This is the honeymoon ; that is [the bridegroom]3296-the bridegroom of [your]1413-your own choosing ! " All day — all day the snow swirls past . All day [the sea]517-the sea — dimly seen , sometimes seen not at all , through the white hurricane — booms and thunders on [the shore]3421-the shore . The snow cleaves to the window - panes , freezes there , darkens yet more [the dismal room]3422-the dismal room . [Not a soul]3266-not a soul puts nose out of doors from the dark dawn to the soon - falling night . When at length [Belinda]134-belinda has finished [her]134-belinda pains - taking pasting - up of the windows , [she]134-belinda asks in a voice of would - be cheerfulness whether the blast is not sensibly lessened ; but receives for answer a melancholy negative . The whirlwind from under the door is such as to laugh to scorn all remedies applied elsewhere . And [one]373-one can not paste up the door . "[0-i] But one may put sand - bags beneath it , " suggests [Belinda]134-belinda , still with that same desperate cheerfulness . "[1414-they] [They]1414-they may have sand - bags in [the house]2521-the house ! [she]1414-they will ring and ask ! " But there are no sand - bags , and [the landlady]3425-the landlady , embittered like [everyone else by the weather]3426-everyone else by the weather , tartly replies that such a thing has never before been asked for in [[her]3425-the landlady house]3427-her house ! However , [Belinda]134-belinda is not yet at the end of [her]134-belinda resources . "[1414-they] [I]0-i think , " [she]134-belinda says , "[0-i] if [you]1416-you would allow [me]0-i to fold up all the newspapers in a tight roll , it might keep out some of the wind . Can [you]1416-you spare them all ? — [Pall Mall]60-sleety pall mall , [Spectator]1417-spectator , Academy , Times ? " Having received permission , [she]134-belinda begins to turn them over , in order to select those most suitable for [her]134-belinda purpose ; [her]134-belinda careless eye unintentionally alighting on a word here and there . The first two that [she]134-belinda catches are [her]134-belinda own late and present surnames . "[134-belinda] Forth — [Churchill]134-belinda . " It is the announcement of [her]134-belinda marriage in the Daily News . [She]134-belinda drops it as if it had bitten [her]134-belinda . The roll of newspapers is about as effective a bulwark against the wind as [a child]2812-a child 's sand - rampart is against [the sea]517-the sea . But since [she]134-belinda has at least done [her]134-belinda best , [Belinda]134-belinda considers that [she]134-belinda has earned the right to sit down by the fire , with [her]134-belinda fur - coat hoisted to [her]134-belinda ears . [She]134-belinda offers to read aloud . "[134-belinda] [I]0-i am obliged to [you]1418-you , " replies [the Professor]2365-the professor morosely , "[1418-you] but , in the present condition of [my]0-i temperature , it would be perfectly impossible for [me]0-i to concentrate [my]0-i attention . " [He]2365-the professor even looks rather injured when [she]134-belinda herself takes up a book . But neither can [she]134-belinda concentrate [her]134-belinda attention . [Her]134-belinda mind strays from the dreary wonder as to whether this enormous day will ever end , to the still more dreary wonder why [she]134-belinda should wish it to end , seeing that it will only lead to another like it . There has been no break since breakfast - time , with the exception of the laying and removing of [their]3431-they early dinner , and the altercation about the sand - bags . [No one]365-no one has been near [them]3431-they , not even [the postman]1068-the postman ! Doubtlessly every line is blocked , and all traffic suspended . The dark has long fallen ; if that , indeed , can be said to have fallen which has reigned more or less all day . The gas has been turned up higher ; the thin curtains drawn , with many futile jerks to the rings that will not run ; the fire is new - built , and a sort of air of pseudo - evening - comfort diffuses itself . [Belinda]134-belinda 's slow pulse begins to beat , and [her]134-belinda blood to circulate a little more briskly . It quickens its pace perceptibly , when — oh blessed [sight!—the lodging - house servant]3434-sight!—the lodging - house servant enters with a pile of letters in [her]3434-sight!—the lodging - house servant chappy hand . Thank God , the line is not blocked after all ! These are the [London]10-london morning letters that should have come at 8 a.m. [She]134-belinda snatches at them eagerly . [They]3431-they can bring [her]134-belinda no great good news , but they make an unspeakably welcome interruption to the uniform dismalness of the long day . [They]3431-they remove the terrible feeling of isolation from [all humankind]3435-all humankind , which hour by hour has been gaining ground upon [her]134-belinda . There is a pile for [the Professor]2365-the professor ; and for [her]2365-the professor a large fat envelope , bulging with enclosures , and directed in [Sarah]135-sarah 's hand . [She]134-belinda draws [her]134-belinda chair more closely to the hearth , and folds [her]134-belinda soft furs warmlier about [her]134-belinda . [She]134-belinda will enjoy [her]134-belinda letters at luxurious leisure . [She]134-belinda unfastens the cover , and the enclosures fall out , six in number ; a note from [Sarah]135-sarah [herself]135-sarah , four letters addressed in well - known and on this occasion warmly - welcomed female hand - writings , and one in an unknown male hand . Is it unknown ? At first it seems so ; but as [she]134-belinda looks there rises in [her]134-belinda memory , from which indeed it is never long absent , the image of another letter , to whose superscription this one , though less ill - written , has surely a strange likeness . [She]134-belinda continues to look at it ; a fear too terrible for words rising in [her]134-belinda heart , and depriving [her]134-belinda of the power of opening it . The fire crackles comfortably . [The Professor]2365-the professor turns the page of [his]2365-the professor letter . It is [his]2365-the professor third ; and [she]134-belinda has not yet opened [her]134-belinda first . "[0-i] [I]0-i hope [you]1419-you have good news from [home]2345-home ? " [he]2365-the professor says politely . "[0-i] [I]0-i — [I]0-i believe so , " [she]134-belinda answers stammering . "[0-i] [I]0-i am not quite sure yet . " [She]134-belinda must conquer this ridiculous hesitation . Probably , certainly , [she]134-belinda is [the victim of hallucination]3438-the victim of hallucination — of an accidental resemblance . The likeness is no doubt confined to the address . As soon as [she]134-belinda sees the letter itself , [she]134-belinda will laugh at [her]134-belinda own foolish fancies . [She]134-belinda tears it open , and tremblingly turns to the signature . There was no hallucination — no accidental resemblance ! [She]134-belinda was right . "[143-rivers] [David Rivers]143-rivers . " For the first moment [she]134-belinda is drowned in a rush of insensate joy , followed in one instant by such an anguish of horror as makes [her]134-belinda for a while unconscious of everything around [her]134-belinda — everything but that rending , burning , searing pain . [He]2365-the professor has written to [her]134-belinda at last ! What has [he]2365-the professor to say to [her]134-belinda now ? To congratulate [her]134-belinda upon [her]134-belinda marriage ? [He]2365-the professor might have spared [her]134-belinda that thrust ! [She]134-belinda will not read it ! [She]134-belinda will burn it unread!—by - and - by — not now!—when [she]134-belinda can do it unobserved . [Her]134-belinda shaking fingers refold the paper , hide it on [her]134-belinda lap beneath the fur , and take up another letter — [Sarah]135-sarah 's . [She]134-belinda goes straight through it , nor till reaching the last sentence does [she]134-belinda discover that not one word of its contents has found entry to [her]134-belinda brain . It is no use ! That letter must be read . It burns [her]134-belinda knee as it lies on it . It is burning , burning all through [her]134-belinda . It is better to know the worst ! But to read it here under [[her]134-belinda husband]3353-her husband 's eyes — [[her]134-belinda husband]3353-her husband 's ! [She]134-belinda casts at [him]2365-the professor one desperate look , and then , suddenly rising , flies out of [the room]422-the room . [He]2365-the professor may call after [her]134-belinda — [she]134-belinda thinks that [he]2365-the professor does so — but [she]134-belinda makes no kind of answer . Up [the draughty stairs]3442-the draughty stairs [she]134-belinda flies into [[her]134-belinda bedroom]2388-her bedroom ; turning the key in the lock , as [she]134-belinda shuts the door behind [her]134-belinda . [The Professor]2365-the professor , relenting , has given [her]134-belinda leave to have a fire [there]2419-there ; but the chimney smokes so furiously that it has had to be long ago let out . [The room]422-the room is piercingly , savagely , truculently cold ; but though [she]134-belinda has been thinking of the cold all day , [she]134-belinda is now not aware of it . How can one be cold with a red - hot iron in one 's heart ? In a moment [she]134-belinda has turned up the gas and lit the candles . It is well to have plenty of light by which to read [one]373-one 's death - warrant . But [she]134-belinda can not spare time to sit down . A frantic haste to possess the contents of that letter which , five minutes ago , [she]134-belinda had thought [herself]134-belinda capable of burning unread , has laid hold of all [her]134-belinda trembling being . Standing , [she]134-belinda reads it ; and this is what [she]134-belinda reads : ' 5 , [Paradise Row]72-paradise row , [Milnthorpe]73-milnthorpe , ' [Yorkshire]31-yorkshire . ' January 10 th . January 10 th ! Why , that was [her]134-belinda wedding - day ! It is not to congratulate [her]134-belinda upon [her]134-belinda marriage , then ; [he]3448-he could not have known it ! "[143-rivers] Thank [God]184-god ! [I]0-i may write to [you]1421-you at last , though [I]0-i do not suppose that it will be much good even now , as [I]0-i am so mad with joy that [I]0-i doubt whether [I]0-i shall be able to make any sense of it . [You]1421-you will have understood — [you]1421-you always understand everything — what has kept [me]0-i from [you]1421-you hitherto . Of course [you]1421-you heard , as [everybody]354-everybody did , of the bankruptcy that preceded and caused [[my]0-i poor father]1423-my poor father 's death . Whatever [you]1421-you may have heard , do not for a moment believe that [he]1423-my poor father was to blame for it . [I]0-i am such a bad hand at writing , that [I]0-i can explain to [you]1421-you better when [we]1424-we meet ; but [I]0-i can not bear [you]1421-you to remain in such an error for a moment longer than [I]0-i can help . [His]1423-my poor father ruin was caused by a sudden and most unexpected rise in iron , just after [he]1423-my poor father had undertaken an enormous contract to deliver many thousand tons of iron rails in [America]74-america at a low price . It was a misfortune that might have happened to [anyone , however long - sighted and cautious]1425-anyone , however long - sighted and cautious . [You]1421-you know what [he]1423-my poor father was to [me]0-i : [I]0-i have often thought since of how [I]0-i must have bored [you]1421-you bragging about [him]1423-my poor father . [You]1421-you may think what that home - coming was to [me]0-i ! Well , if there had been time for it , [I]0-i think [I]0-i should have given in altogether then . Happily for [me]0-i there was not . If [I]0-i broke down , where would [mother]1426-mother and [the young ones]1427-the young ones be ? No sooner was the funeral over , than [we]1428-we discovered that the smash was so complete that , at all events until the affairs could be wound up — a matter probably of several years — there would be scarcely enough for [mother]1426-mother to keep body and soul together . [The boys]1430-the boys must be educated ; three of [them]1430-the boys [quite little chaps]1431-quite little chaps . There was nothing for it but to give up whatever hopes [one]373-one had of [one]373-one 's own ! God alone knows whether or not that was a wrench . [We]1428-we took [a little house in [a dirty back street in [Milnthorpe]73-milnthorpe]1435-a dirty back street in milnthorpe]1434-a little house in a dirty back street in milnthorpe — [I]0-i am writing in [it]1434-a little house in a dirty back street in milnthorpe now ; but to - day [it]1434-a little house in a dirty back street in milnthorpe looks to [me]0-i like [a palace]1436-a palace . [I]0-i was fortunate enough to obtain a clerkship in [a house]457-a house , one of the partners in which had been [an early friend of [[my]0-i father]608-my father 's]1438-an early friend of my father 's ; [a clerkship which , as [I]0-i was always very bad at quill - driving , and the confinement , to which [I]0-i had not been used , knocked [me]0-i up , [I]0-i soon exchanged for a place in the works]1440-a clerkship which , as i was always very bad at quill - driving , and the confinement , to which i had not been used , knocked me up , i soon exchanged for a place in the works . [We]1428-we got on as well as [we]1428-we could : [mother]1426-mother has infinite pluck , and [the young ones]1427-the young ones did [their]1427-the young ones best . Sometimes [I]0-i thought of writing to [you]1443-her . If [you]1443-her had ever answered a note [I]0-i scrawled to [you]1443-her just before [I]0-i left [Dresden]2-dresden , [I]0-i think [I]0-i should have done so ; but [you]1443-her did not : of course [you]1443-her were right . For eighteen months [I]0-i worked without a holiday . Not having been brought up to it , [I]0-i was at such a disadvantage with [the other men]1444-the other men . [I]0-i scraped along from day to day , not daring to look much ahead , until , two posts ago , [we]1428-we received a letter from [the lawyer of [an old and distant connection of [ours]1428-we , of whom [we]1428-we knew little , and expected less , to say that [he]1447-he was dead , and had left £ 30,000 by will , to be divided amongst [us]1428-we]1446-an old and distant connection of ours , of whom we knew little , and expected less , to say that he was dead , and had left £ 30,000 by will , to be divided amongst us]1445-the lawyer of an old and distant connection of ours , of whom we knew little , and expected less , to say that he was dead , and had left £ 30,000 by will , to be divided amongst us . This of course makes a very fair provision for [mother]1426-mother and [the children]1449-the children , and leaves [my]0-i arms free to work for [myself]0-i . [You]1443-her must decide whether [they]1450-they are to work for [you]1443-her too . Is it any wonder that [I]0-i can not write sense ? May [I]0-i come ? When may [I]0-i come ? Do not keep [me]0-i waiting long , or [I]0-i shall come without leave . [Darling]1451-darling ! [darling]1451-darling ! [darling]1451-darling ! [I]0-i suppose that [I]0-i have no right to call [you]1443-her that , but do not be angry ; [I]0-i did not write it ! it wrote itself , and [I]0-i can not scratch it out , it looks so pretty written !
