Love ! have [you]1443-her forgotten [Wesenstein]15-wesenstein ? " [David Rivers]143-rivers . "[1443-her] [She]1443-her has read it through , without a break or a pause , to the signature . There is no more , but yet [she]1443-her still stands looking at it . For one all - happy moment the present is dead to [her]1443-her ; only the past wholly lives . Has [she]1443-her forgotten [Wesenstein]15-wesenstein ? [She]1443-her smiles rosily ; such a smile as has scarcely been seen to visit [her]1443-her face since that very Wesenstein day . " Darling ! [darling]1451-darling ! [darling]1451-darling ! "[1443-her] [She]1443-her counts [them]1455-them . There are three . [He]1456-he says that they look pretty written . [He]1456-he is right : they have a pretty look . A slight noise breaks [her]1443-her trance . It is only [the Professor]2365-the professor poking the fire in [the sitting - room below]1458-the sitting - room below ; a sound plainly audible through the thin flooring . But if it had been the great Trump of [Doom]261-doom , it could not have more effectually blared and shivered away [her]1443-her visions . There is a growing wildness in [her]1443-her eyes , as [they]1459-they retrace the sentences of the just - read letter . It is a good letter . [No woman]1460-no woman need wish to have an honester or a fonder one from [her]1443-her own true love . It has only the one trifling drawback of having come just three days too late . It is scarcely tactful to have thrust itself thus untimely between [her]1443-her and [the husband of]1461-the husband of [her]1443-her choice ! " It is [my]1443-her own choice , "[1443-her] [she]1443-her says ; " there lies the point of the joke ! "[1443-her] and [she]1443-her laughs aloud . Something in the sound of [her]1443-her own laugh frightens [her]1443-her . " Am [I]1443-her going mad ? "[1443-her] [she]1443-her asks [herself]1443-her . As [she]1443-her speaks , [she]1443-her staggers to the window , and throws up the sash ; whether — even in this icehouse atmosphere — gasping for yet more air , or driven by some darker impulse . For the moment the hurricane has lulled . Outside it is all white with snow and moonshine : the moon herself not absolutely visible , too low to cut even [her]1443-her accustomed track upon [the silvered sea]1462-the silvered sea , betrayed only by the sudden pale flash that each loud wave gives in turning over on the strand . Ceaselessly , as it has been snowing all day , the devilish wind has swept [the pavement]1463-the pavement clean and bare . [She]1443-her can see the flagstones ' fierce wet shine immediately beneath [her]1443-her . How hard they look ! and at what a distance below [her]1443-her ! One step from that easily accessible sill , and [she]1443-her will be for ever healed of that pain , than which none worse ever made [dying man in deadly straits]1464-dying man in deadly straits call upon death to set [him]1464-dying man in deadly straits free . But [Death]262-death , [the gentle genius with the reversed torch laying [his]1465-the gentle genius with the reversed torch laying his soft hand , coolly liberating , on the over - weary heart soft hand , coolly liberating , on the over - weary heart]1465-the gentle genius with the reversed torch laying his soft hand , coolly liberating , on the over - weary heart , is not akin to the grisly , gory , murderous phantom that [she]1443-her in [her]1443-her misery invokes . For that dread step even [her]1443-her perfect woe has not yet ripened [her]1443-her . [She]1443-her shivers moaning back from the razoredged outer air , and shuts the window . [She]1443-her sits down by the table , and spreading out the letter before [her]1443-her , reads it deliberately through again . Not a tear dims [her]1443-her dry eye . [They]1466-they say that the worst of a thunder - storm is past when the rain comes . The worst of a human sorrow is past when the tear - rain comes . But [Belinda]134-belinda 's grief is far indeed from having reached that better stage . What would [she]1443-her not give for a few tears , or that this hideous keenness of consciousness might melt away blurred into a merciful swoon ! But [she]1443-her is as far from the one relief as the other . If it had been written one day earlier ! If [she]1443-her had yielded to [Sarah]135-sarah 's passionate persuasions to delay [her]1443-her marriage for one month ! If — if ! There are a hundred ifs ; any one of which might have opened heaven to [her]1443-her ! But not one of [them]1467-them did . " It is [my]1443-her own choice ! "[1443-her] [she]1443-her keeps repeating , half aloud ; and then comes again that terrible impulse to laugh loudly at the ghastly irony of it ! the mirth of it ! [Her]1443-her own choice to be sitting here alone and marrow - chilled — chilled , yet with a red - hot sword slowly turning and turning in [her]1443-her heart ; afraid even to groan aloud , lest [she]1443-her should be overheard , instead of — But the reverse of that picture [she]1443-her dare not face . That is the road that lies straight to madness . [Her]1443-her eye wanders wildly yet again over the page . Even it , in cruelty , seems always to fasten on the fondest phrases : " [I]1443-her am so mad with joy ! "[1443-her] " Is it any wonder that [I]1443-her can not write sense ? "[1443-her] As [she]1443-her looks at the words , written in such pure , glad , good faith , but that seem to stare back at [her]1443-her now in grinning mockery , a great dry sob rocks [her]1443-her whole body to and fro . The pity , lavished hitherto on [herself]1443-her alone , now changes its current , and pours in bitterest flood over [him]1468-him . " Mad with joy ! "[1468-him] until when ? Until casually taking up the newspaper , [he]1468-him reads that on the 10th of January James Forth , [Professor of Etruscan in [the University of [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge]75-the university of oxbridge]1469-professor of etruscan in the university of oxbridge , took to [wife]1470-wife at [St. Jude 's Church]76-st. jude 's church , — [Street]59-— street , [Mayfair]78-mayfair , [Belinda]134-belinda , [elder daughter of [the late John Churchill]263-the late john churchill]1471-elder daughter of the late john churchill , [Esq .]1472-esq . , of [Churchill Park]79-churchill park , [Loamshire]80-loamshire . [He]1468-him will not believe it ! [He]1468-him will think that [some one]2370-some one has inserted it as a joke . In humiliating torrent , and with a retentiveness of memory of which [she]1443-her had not believed [herself]1443-her capable , there rushes back into [her]1443-her mind the stream of hold - cheap jests and jeers and quips , in which [they]1474-they had united the forces of [their]1474-they joint wits , at the expense of [him]1468-him who is now [[her]1443-her husband]3353-her husband ; whom at this moment [she]1443-her hears shovelling coal on the fire in [the room beneath [her]1443-her]1476-the room beneath her . Upon [no one]365-no one 's testimony but [her]1443-her own will [Rivers]143-rivers believe it . And what words can [she]1443-her find in which to tell [him]1468-him ? Again that fierce sobbing shakes [her]1443-her from head to foot ; but [she]1443-her masters it . For a few moments [she]1443-her sits in motionless miserable thinking . Then apparently an idea strikes [her]1443-her ; for [she]1443-her rises , and taking the candle in [her]1443-her hand drags [herself]1443-her to the looking - glass . For a moment [she]1443-her peers haggardly into it . At all events [her]1443-her face is not disfigured by tears ; and [the only person to whose scrutiny it will be subjected]1478-the only person to whose scrutiny it will be subjected is [no very nice observer of its variations]1479-no very nice observer of its variations . Apparently [she]1443-her is satisfied with the result of [her]1443-her consultation , for [she]1443-her moves to the door , and opening and unlocking it , passes [downstairs]511-downstairs and re - enters [the sitting - room]1481-the sitting - room . [Mr. Forth]209-mr. forth is in exactly the same posture as that in which [she]1443-her had left [him]209-mr. forth , except that , having finished [his]209-mr. forth letters , [he]209-mr. forth has been able again completely to entomb [himself]209-mr. forth — hands and all — in [his]209-mr. forth wraps ; out of which only an elderly face — its wrinkles ploughed deeper by cold and crabbediness — now peeps . " Where have [you]1443-her been ? What have [you]1443-her been doing all this time ? "[209-mr. forth] [he]209-mr. forth inquires captiously . " [I]209-mr. forth have been in [[my]209-mr. forth room]3451-my room . "[209-mr. forth] [She]1443-her had dreaded lest there may be something so unusual in the sound of [her]1443-her voice that [he]209-mr. forth may turn round and look at [her]1443-her . But no ! "[209-mr. forth] In a moment [he]209-mr. forth has leapt to the bell and violently rung it ; but as [Maria]183-maria 's movements in responding to it are marked by no greater celerity than usual , there is time for the whole of the following little dialogue before [her]183-maria arrival . " Have [you]209-mr. forth been pasting up the windows ? " "[183-maria] [I]0-i did not take the Daily News ; [I]0-i laid it aside . " [She]0-i does not explain why [she]0-i laid it aside . "[0-i] What do [you]0-i want with the Daily News ? " fretfully , fidgeted by [her]0-i movements . [She]0-i is on [her]0-i knees before the cupboard to which [[her]0-i husband]3353-her husband had planned to confide the custody of [his]3353-her husband bacon , and from which [she]0-i has been unable wholly to exclude jam - pots and pickle - jars . [She]0-i had forgotten that they were there , and the sight of them — unlikely as it would seem that such poor trifles could either add to or take aught from the sum of so great a grief — the sight of them seems to be the last drop that brims [her]0-i cup . In after life it seems to [her]0-i as if nothing had brought [her]0-i so near self - destruction as those picklepots ! What does [she]0-i want with the Daily News ? A desperate impulse seizes [her]0-i . [She]0-i will tell [him]3353-her husband . "[0-i] [I]0-i want it in order to cut out the advertisement of [our]1482-our marriage , to send to — " [She]0-i pauses . The name sticks in [her]0-i throat . " suggests [the Professor]2365-the professor , filling up the blank conjecturally . "[0-i] [I]0-i have already done so . " [Belinda]134-belinda laughs a laugh like the one that had made [her]134-belinda question [her]134-belinda own sanity [upstairs]1081-upstairs . "[0-i] No , not to [[your]0-i mother]3130-your mother ; to — to — an — acquaintance of [my]0-i own ! " [She]134-belinda has found the journal now — found it in the very spot to which [she]134-belinda [herself]134-belinda had — as [one]373-one does — unconsciously tidied it away . In an instant , as if it were printed in [her]134-belinda own red blood , [her]134-belinda eye has flashed upon the announcement ; picked it out from the long list . [Her]134-belinda work - basket , in which lie the scissors with which [she]134-belinda must cut it out , lies on the table at [[her]134-belinda husband]3353-her husband 's elbow . [She]134-belinda stands quietly beside [him]3353-her husband , snipping , snipping delicately , in the gaslight . There must be no jagged edges ; nothing that tells of emotion — nothing that will betray to [him]3353-her husband to whom it is to be sent that each cut of those fine , sharp scissors was into [her]134-belinda own heart . "[0-i] [I]0-i can not think what is the use of occupying [yourself]0-i about it to - night ! " says [[her]134-belinda husband]3353-her husband , venting the ill - humour engendered by [Maria]183-maria 's tardiness in replying to [his]3353-her husband spells upon the nearest object — [as many better men than [he]3353-her husband have done before [him]3353-her husband]3459-as many better men than he have done before him . "[0-i] [The country post]1485-the country post is long gone . Probably all the lines are blocked — " "[0-i] [I]0-i know ! [I]0-i know ! " interrupts [she]0-i harshly ; "[0-i] but [I]0-i had rather get it done to - night ! to - morrow [I]0-i — [I]0-i — may have forgotten ! " [She]134-belinda is back in [[her]134-belinda own room]2768-her own room again , having taken the opportunity to slip out unquestioned , afforded by [Maria]183-maria 's appearance at last — [Maria]183-maria in that reluctant , grudging humour with which [she]183-maria usually offers services , cheered by no hope of final largess ; a hope that [the Professor]2365-the professor has seen fit , immediately upon [his]2365-the professor arrival , to extirpate . [Belinda]134-belinda is in [[her]134-belinda room]2688-her room again alone ; but alone and undisturbed [she]134-belinda knows that [she]134-belinda can not long remain , but that [she]134-belinda will be speedily followed by [Maria]183-maria with coal - box and shavings to re - light the extinct fire . What [she]134-belinda has to do , must be done quickly . [She]134-belinda opens [her]134-belinda writing - case ; takes out envelope and paper ; directs the first , and then writes on the latter , in a large , painstaking , legible hand , "[0-i] From Belinda Forth . " It has not taken one minute in the doing : [Maria]183-maria 's pursuing foot is not yet heard : happily [she]183-maria will be as slow as [she]183-maria can . [Belinda]134-belinda blots it carefully ; then , after steadfastly and with perfect tearlessness considering [her]134-belinda own handiwork for the space of a moment , [she]134-belinda lifts the paper to [her]134-belinda dry lips , and lays a solemn good - bye kiss upon [her]134-belinda own name ; upon the "[134-belinda] [Belinda]134-belinda , " that is carefully avoiding the "[134-belinda] Forth . " [She]134-belinda has no manner of doubt that [he]3463-he will find it there : and who can grudge [them]3464-them such a parting embrace ? Then , without any further delay , [she]134-belinda folds the paper , inserts in it the advertisement , closes and stamps the envelope . It is done ! accomplished ! and now that it is so , an intense restless craving seizes [her]134-belinda , that it should be on its journey . In any case , it can not leave [Folkestone]81-folkestone to - night ; but at least [she]134-belinda might do [her]134-belinda part . [It]3465-it might be committed to the post . The thought of it lying here all night ; meeting [her]134-belinda again in the morning — [God]184-god above [her]134-belinda ! what will that morning waking be ! — is more than [she]134-belinda can face . But to whom can [she]134-belinda confide it ? To [Maria]183-maria ? [That high - spirited person]3466-that high - spirited person would flatly refuse to brave the elements on such a night ; and [neither man nor mouse]3467-neither man nor mouse could blame [her]134-belinda . To [that grimy Gibeonite]3468-that grimy gibeonite — [the boot and shoe boy]3469-the boot and shoe boy ? [He]3463-he would infallibly commit it to [his]3463-he breeches - pocket , and dismiss it from [his]3463-he mind . Why should not [she]134-belinda take it [herself]134-belinda ? There is a pillar - post not twenty yards from [their]3470-their door . The thought has no sooner crossed [her]134-belinda mind than it is half way towards accomplishment . In a moment [she]134-belinda has taken hat and additional furs from [the wardrobe]3471-the wardrobe ; has fastened them on as quickly as [her]134-belinda treambling fingers will let [her]134-belinda , and has stolen [downstairs]511-downstairs , creeping on tiptoe past the sitting - room door ; a needless caution , for [the Professor]2365-the professor , though not at all deaf , has no longer that fineness of hearing which is spared to few of [us]3474-us after forty . Neither does [she]134-belinda , as [she]134-belinda feared [she]134-belinda would , meet [Maria]183-maria and the coal - box . The hall - door is not locked , and opens easily ; rather too easily indeed , for no sooner is it unlatched than a force as of ten thousand [Titans]264-titans violently pushing dashes it back . It is all that [she]134-belinda can do , after repeated efforts , and putting forth [her]134-belinda whole strength , to shut it behind [her]134-belinda . When [she]134-belinda at length succeeds , it closes with a bang that — as [she]134-belinda is aware by former experience — makes every floor leap . Again [she]134-belinda laughs out loud . The temporary moonlit lull is over ; the cloud - rack has sponged out moon and [sea]3475-sea . The great hurricane is awake and in wrath again . There seems to be nothing in all creation but [himself]2365-the professor and [[his]2365-the professor terribler snow - sister]3476-his terribler snow - sister . The air is so full of the white flurry — close and fine as flour — that it makes breathing difficult . [Belinda]134-belinda gasps . [She]134-belinda has to stand still for a moment , that [her]134-belinda feet may grasp firm hold of the ground , else will the north - easter , in one of its furious freaks , take [her]134-belinda bodily off [them]3477-them . Then [she]134-belinda staggers resolutely on again ; a lonely fighter through the raging winter night . Of every slightest lull [she]134-belinda takes advantage to quicken [her]134-belinda pace . Now and again [she]134-belinda turns [her]134-belinda back upon the suffocating snow in order to breathe . But not for one moment does [she]134-belinda repent of having come . [She]134-belinda feels no hostility towards , no fear of , the dreadful elements . Is not [she]134-belinda as desperate as [they]3477-them ? The hand - to - hand fight with [them]3477-them does [her]134-belinda good . It seems to lift some of the lead from [her]134-belinda brain ; to set further away from [her]134-belinda that madness that had loomed so near . But the twenty yards seem more like twenty miles . [She]134-belinda has reached the pillar - post at last — an opportune momentary lifting of the storm revealing to [her]134-belinda its snow - whitened red — has found the aperture , and has dropped into it the letter so carefully , painstakingly kept dry beneath [her]134-belinda cloak . Yes ! it is gone ! gone past recall ! as past recall as the wood at [Wesenstein]15-wesenstein ; as [the friend on whose coffin [we]3479-we have seen fall the first cruel spadeful of earth]3478-the friend on whose coffin we have seen fall the first cruel spadeful of earth . But of this [she]134-belinda has no time to think . A fresh frenzy of the tornado obliges [her]134-belinda to cling half - stunned to the pillar ; and the moment that [she]134-belinda looses [her]134-belinda hold , the snow - wind takes [her]134-belinda in its fearful hands and hurls [her]134-belinda back along [the Leas]70-the leas . For one dread moment it seems to [her]134-belinda that it is about to hurl [her]134-belinda far away over [the cliff]3480-the cliff into the awful lap of the bellowing waves that , even now , [she]134-belinda can hear in the darkness savagely tearing at the great hewn stones of [the quay]3481-the quay . That one instant reveals to [her]134-belinda that the life [she]134-belinda had thought [herself]134-belinda capable of throwing away is still sweet . By a great effort [her]134-belinda feet recover their hold of the ground which has fled from beneath them ; but not until [she]134-belinda has been swept far past [the house to which [she]134-belinda is struggling to return]3482-the house to which she is struggling to return . [Battling]265-battling , blinded , and dizzy ; bewildered by the darkness , and by the hopeless uniformity of [the row of buildings]3483-the row of buildings , it is long before , groping for the door that continually eludes [her]134-belinda , [she]134-belinda at length finds it ; at length [she]134-belinda finds [herself]134-belinda within [its]3482-the house to which she is struggling to return shelter . [Maria]183-maria does not recognise [her]134-belinda at first , so battered and snow - covered is [she]134-belinda ; but [Belinda]134-belinda pays no heed to [her]134-belinda expressions of incredulous astonishment . It is possible that [she]134-belinda may be so deafened by the elemental roar as not to hear [them]3484-them . Without much consciousness of how the intervening stair - flights were climbed , [she]134-belinda finds [herself]134-belinda again in [[her]134-belinda room]2688-her room . The gas is still turned high up , as [she]134-belinda had left it . [Maria]183-maria has at length relit the fire ; there is plenty of light for [her]134-belinda to see [[her]134-belinda bridal chamber]3486-her bridal chamber by . Plenty of light , too , to see the blotting - pad on which [she]134-belinda had so lately blotted the three words of [her]134-belinda billet de faire part . [She]183-maria takes it up , and holds it to the looking - glass . How plainly the three words come out ; not a letter , not a stroke missed ! "[134-belinda] From [Belinda Forth]134-belinda . " [She]134-belinda mutters them over and over under [her]134-belinda breath . "[134-belinda] From [Belinda Forth]134-belinda ! " "[134-belinda] From [Belinda Forth]134-belinda ! " [She]134-belinda is roused by a voice calling from below : "[134-belinda] [Belinda]134-belinda ! [Belinda]134-belinda ! " It is [[her]134-belinda husband]3353-her husband . Let [him]3353-her husband call ! The summons is repeated with more stress and urgency : "[134-belinda] [Belinda]134-belinda ! [Belinda]134-belinda ! " Is not it the voice which will go on calling "[134-belinda] [Belinda]134-belinda ! " through life ? Is not it the voice to which [she]134-belinda [herself]134-belinda has given the right to call [Belinda]134-belinda ; to command [Belinda]134-belinda ; to chide [Belinda]134-belinda ; immeasurably worst of all , to caress [Belinda]134-belinda ? Of what use , then , to break out thus early into senseless , bootless revolt ? [She]134-belinda hastily shakes the powdery snow from [her]134-belinda clothes , drags off [her]134-belinda soaked shoes , twists afresh [her]134-belinda wet and streaming hair , and goes decently and orderly down again ; decently and orderly to all appearance , for who can see the wheels that are whirring in [her]134-belinda head , and the flashes of uneasy light before [her]134-belinda eyes ? [She]134-belinda finds [[her]134-belinda bridegroom]3488-her bridegroom in [his]3488-her bridegroom former attitude : it seems to [her]134-belinda as if [she]134-belinda could have better borne [him]3488-her bridegroom and it , if [he]3488-her bridegroom had changed [his]3488-her bridegroom position ever so little . But no ! [he]3488-her bridegroom is still mumping , round - backed , over the fire . "[0-i] [I]0-i called repeatedly , " [he]3488-her bridegroom says , with a not altogether blamable irritation ; "[0-i] is it possible that [you]1486-you did not hear [me]0-i ? " There is no answer , the wheels in [her]134-belinda head are going so fast . "[1486-you] Where have [you]1486-you been ? what have [you]1486-you been doing ? " "[1486-you] [I]0-i have been out . " "[0-i] Out ! [You]1486-you must be [a madwoman]1487-a madwoman ! " "[1486-you] So [I]0-i sometimes say to [myself]0-i , " replies [she]134-belinda very distinctly , and looking straight at [him]3488-her bridegroom as [she]134-belinda speaks . "[0-i] And may [I]0-i ask , " continues [he]3488-her bridegroom sarcastically , "[0-i] what induced [you]1486-you to choose this peculiarly tempting evening for a stroll ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i went to post [my]0-i letter . " "[0-i] [Pshaw]266-pshaw ! " [She]134-belinda has taken [her]134-belinda former seat opposite to [him]3488-her bridegroom . The north - easter 's lash has whipped up a royal red into [her]134-belinda cheeks , usually so far too pale . "[266-pshaw] There is no accounting for taste , " [she]134-belinda says slowly ; "[266-pshaw] mine has often been blamed . [You]1488-you , at least , have no right to complain of it . Shall [I]0-i read to [you]1488-you ? " As [she]134-belinda speaks , [she]134-belinda takes up the book laid down over - night , and without further permission launches into the first paragraph [she]134-belinda sees . [She]134-belinda has been conscious , on coming into [the now really warm room]3489-the now really warm room out of the frozen stinging air , of an odd sensation in [her]134-belinda head . It feels light and swimming , but [she]134-belinda reads on . Now and then the type waves up and down before [her]134-belinda like the furrows of [a ploughed field]3490-a ploughed field ; but [she]134-belinda reads on . The matter of the book and the matter of [her]134-belinda thoughts are woven hopelessly together like warp and woof , but [she]134-belinda reads on : "[0-i] ' If it could be demonstrated that any complex organ existed which could not possibly have been formed by numerous successive slight modifications ' ( in how many years am [I]0-i likely to die ? ) ' [my]0-i theory would absolutely break down . But [I]0-i can find out no such case . No doubt many organs exist of which ' ( can the worm that never dies sting more sharply than this ? ) ' [we]1489-we do not know the transitional grades . ' " How the print is jigging and bowing ; but it will come straight and still again just now . [She]134-belinda reads on . "[1488-you] Pray repeat that last paragraph ; [I]0-i am unable to follow [you]1488-you ; [you]1488-you are making nonsense of it ! " But instead of complying , [Belinda]134-belinda tumbles the volume noisily down into the fender , and falls off [her]134-belinda chair after it . [Her]134-belinda wish is fulfilled : [she]134-belinda has fainted ! The winter , with its terrible stress and fury , is over and past . [People]523-people sitting in [blooming spring gardens]3492-blooming spring gardens or by widely - opened windows , talk comfortably , with lips no longer chapped , of the great snow - storm , and compare notes as to the amount of personal inconvenience and discomfort to which it had exposed [them]523-people . Anecdotes of the awful night spent in [snow - stopped trains]3493-snow - stopped trains have formed the convenient opening for many a dinner talk ; the anxiety on the part of [each interlocutor]3494-each interlocutor to prove that [he]3495-he or [she]3496-she had suffered more than [the other]2396-the other , leading to intimacy before soup is well over . Of its ferocity and its devil - work few overt traces now remain , except killed laurel bushes and rare thrushes . Out of how many sweet little throats full of music has it pinched the tender life ! But over [its]3498-its wrecks [the sea]517-the sea rolls ; and in [the bottomless sea of [mothers]3501-mothers ' hearts]3500-the bottomless sea of mothers ' hearts [its drowned sailors]3502-its drowned sailors lie buried . And does the analogy between the material and [the spiritual world]3503-the spiritual world hold good ? Does [the sea of oblivion]3504-the sea of oblivion smoothly heave and largely sweep above the soul that went down on that dread night ? Does no spar pierce the flood to show where [that good ship]3505-that good ship foundered ? It would be the opinion of [outsiders]3506-outsiders , who have not visited [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge — if [they]3506-outsiders had formed an opinion at all upon the subject , and were asked for it — that [the inhabitants of [that university town]3508-that university town]3507-the inhabitants of that university town dwell in [grey and ancient houses]3509-grey and ancient houses , time - coloured , and with flavours of old learning still hanging about [their]3507-the inhabitants of that university town massy roof - trees . In point of fact , [their]3507-the inhabitants of that university town lives are passed for the most part in flippant spick and [span villas]3510-span villas and [villakins]3511-villakins , each with [its]3498-its half acre of tennis - ground and double daisies , all so new that [scarcely anyone]3512-scarcely anyone has had time to die [there]2419-there , though [numerous people]3514-numerous people have taken leave to be born [there]2419-there , and forming in [their]3514-numerous people ensemble [an ugly , irrelevant , healthy suburb , that would not disgrace [a cotton city of to - day]3517-a cotton city of to - day]3516-an ugly , irrelevant , healthy suburb , that would not disgrace a cotton city of to - day . It is mid - May , and the hour is one of the afternoon ones ; an hour at which luncheon is already forgotten , though tea still smiles not near . Along [the shining river]3518-the shining river , a mile away , eight - oars , four - oars , skiffs are flashing . [Scores of happy boys]3519-scores of happy boys are tearing down [the path alongside]3520-the path alongside , keeping company with [[their]3519-scores of happy boys boats]3521-their boats , exhorting , admonishing , shouting [themselves]3519-scores of happy boys hoarse . But [their]3507-the inhabitants of that university town noise , though strong are [their]3507-the inhabitants of that university town young lungs , does not reach in faintest echoes to [the quiet drawing - room]3522-the quiet drawing - room , where [the as quiet lady]3523-the as quiet lady sits , head on lily hand , beside the window , staring out at [her]3523-the as quiet lady plot of forget - me - nots and the gold shower of [her]3523-the as quiet lady two laburnum trees . Warm as the day is , a fire burns on the hearth ; a fire whose inconvenient heat [Belinda]134-belinda is languidly trying to counteract by the agency of the fan , slowly waving in [her]134-belinda unoccupied hand . It is too hot even for [Slutty]157-slutty , who , shortly panting in [her]157-slutty sleep , lies cast on [her]157-slutty fat side in a cool corner . Upon [Slutty]157-slutty 's figure , an academic life , and the total absence of the thinning emotion of envy , and of the bad but emaciating passion of jealousy ( an absence caused by the fact of [her]157-slutty being [sole dog of the establishment]3524-sole dog of the establishment , and having no longer any cause for suffering from [Punch]186-punch 's tinselly accomplishments ) has begun to tell . [She]157-slutty could not well look stouter or less intellectual if [she]157-slutty were [one of [the old Fellows of [St. Bridget 's]318-st. bridget]3526-the old fellows of st. bridget 's]3525-one of the old fellows of st. bridget 's . When last [we]3527-we saw [Belinda]134-belinda , [she]134-belinda was lying grovelling among cinders and fire - irons in a fender . Now [she]134-belinda is sitting placid and upright on a window - seat . Is the change that has taken place in [her]134-belinda soul 's attitude as much to [her]134-belinda advantage as that which has effected itself in [her]134-belinda body 's ? Who can tell ? [She]134-belinda is past the age when a smeared face , puckered lips and bawling cries mean grief ; when ruddy cheeks and shouting laughter mean joy . [She]134-belinda does not look particularly happy , perhaps , but which of [us]3527-we is conscious of looking specially radiant as [he]3528-he or [she]3529-she sits alone , with [no one]365-no one to summon to the surface of the skin that latent cheerfulness , of which [few]3531-few have enough to spend it on [ourselves]3527-we alone ? And yet , at this moment , the thoughts passing through [her]134-belinda mind are not disagreeable ones ; scarcely thoughts indeed , lazy summer impressions rather , of the pleasantness of the tiny sky - coloured meadow that lies , all turquoise , under [her]134-belinda eyes , and calls itself [her]134-belinda forget - me - not bed ; of the round mother - swallow 's head , peeping over the nest beneath the eaves . At some further thought or sensation , a slight but definite smile breaks up the severe lines of [her]134-belinda young yet melancholy mouth . At the sound of the opening door , however , in one instant it is dead . "[1488-you] [I]0-i find [you]1490-her unoccupied ! " says [[her]134-belinda husband]3353-her husband , entering and advancing towards [her]134-belinda , with that shuffling gait which plainly tells of slippers ( [she]134-belinda has not then been able to break [him]3353-her husband of carpet slippers ) . "[1488-you] If [I]0-i am unoccupied it is for the first time to - day ! " [she]134-belinda answers coldly . "[1488-you] Since [you]1490-her are at leisure , " [he]3353-her husband pursues — [his]3353-her husband want of surprise at [her]134-belinda frigid tone betraying that it is [her]134-belinda habitual one — "[0-i] [I]0-i have the less scruple in claiming [your]1490-her services . " "[0-i] What is it that [you]0-i want ? " [she]134-belinda asks , lifting [her]134-belinda eyes to [his]3353-her husband face . It is pleasant to be looked full at by [a handsome woman]3533-a handsome woman ; but if [she]3533-a handsome woman has , before looking at [you]0-i , taken care to put as much frost as [they]3534-they can hold into [her]3533-a handsome woman fine blue eyes , the pleasure is very sensibly lessened . "[0-i] What do [you]0-i want ? [We]1491-we can not surely be going to have any more Menander to - day ; and [I]0-i have written all [your]1490-her letters — they lie on [your]1490-her study - table , and [I]0-i have exactly followed [your]1490-her directions as to each . " "[0-i] It is precisely upon that subject that [I]0-i wished to speak to [you]1490-her , " rejoins [he]267-herr schweizer of göttingen , glancing at a paper in [his]267-herr schweizer of göttingen hand . "[0-i] [You]1490-her have by no means succeeded in expressing the exact shade of meaning [I]0-i wished to convey in this letter to [Herr Schweizer of Göttingen]267-herr schweizer of göttingen , with regard to the new ' Fragment of [Empedocles]83-empedocles ; ' and [I]0-i am afraid that [I]0-i must trouble [you]1490-her to re - write it . " "[0-i] And [I]0-i am afraid that [I]0-i must trouble [you]0-i to excuse [me]0-i , " replies [she]0-i quietly , but with asperity ; "[0-i] [my]0-i tale of bricks for today is really complete . " There is a moment 's silence , during which [Belinda]134-belinda turns [her]134-belinda head pointedly away towards the laburnum tree and the emerald grass ; but [the Professor]2365-the professor shows no signs of retreating . "[0-i] If [I]0-i were taking [you]1490-her from any other employment , [I]0-i might hesitate , " [he]2365-the professor says , with peevish pertinacity ; "[0-i] but since [you]1490-her are wholly unoccupied — " "[0-i] [I]0-i am unoccupied at this particular moment , " answers [she]0-i , with an accent of carefully elaborated patience , which , to [the meanest observer]3536-the meanest observer , would betray the depths of [her]0-i impatience ; "[0-i] but in five minutes [I]0-i shall not be unoccupied ; in five minutes [I]0-i set off to [the station]937-the station to meet [Sarah]135-sarah , who , as [you]0-i are aware , is to arrive by [the 4.35 train]1493-the 4.35 train . [You]0-i do not , [I]0-i suppose , wish [me]0-i to take a hansom ? " ( with a faint sarcastic smile of a very different quality from that little one lately addressed to the swallow and the flowers ) , "[0-i] and the day is too warm for it to be possible to walk fast . " At the mention of [Miss Churchill]152-miss churchill , a distinct new crumple of ill - humour has added itself to the already numerous wrinkles of [Mr. Forth]209-mr. forth 's face . "[0-i] [I]0-i am unable to see that any obligation to meet [the train]949-the train lies upon [you]1490-her , " [he]209-mr. forth says obstinately ; "[0-i] [[your]1490-her sister]3060-your sister is eminently well able to take care of [herself]3060-your sister ! " [Belinda]134-belinda shrugs [her]134-belinda shoulders . "[0-i] It is a mere matter of habit , of course , " [she]134-belinda says in a key of low resentment . "[0-i] If [you]0-i have been born in a walk of life in which it is habitual to [you]0-i to push and elbow for [yourself]0-i , of course there is no reason why [you]0-i should not enjoy it ; but [you]0-i must remember that this is not [Sarah]135-sarah 's case ; and since [you]0-i declined to extend [your]0-i hospitality to [[her]135-sarah maid]2908-her maid , [she]135-sarah is alone . " At the end of this conciliatory speech [she]134-belinda stops , and there is a pause , which [the Professor]2365-the professor shortly breaks . "[1490-her] If [you]1490-her think it necessary , " [he]2365-the professor says grudgingly , "[1490-her] [I]0-i am willing to send [a servant]1497-a servant to meet [[your]1490-her sister]3060-your sister ; but [I]0-i must request [you]1490-her to abandon the idea of going [yourself]0-i , by which means [you]1490-her will be left free to render [me]0-i the trifling service [I]0-i require of [you]1490-her . " "[1490-her] [You]1490-her insist upon [your]1490-her pound of flesh , in fact ! " cries [she]1490-her , rising suddenly ; [her]1490-her body trembling , and [her]1490-her great eyes lightening with anger and disappointment . "[1490-her] Well , [you]1490-her are more fortunate than [[your]1490-her prototype]1499-your prototype ! [You]1490-her will get it . " To [his]1490-her death - day , [the German savan]3538-the german savan will never suspect with what hotly raging and rebellious fingers were penned those polite , lucid , and erudite lines upon [Empedocles]83-empedocles ' newly - discovered "[1490-her] Fragment , " which [he]1490-her shortly received . It is long before [the Professor]2365-the professor can satisfy [his]2365-the professor own fastidious ear and captious mind as to the fitness of the phrases to be employed . Many a sheet is angrily torn across by [Belinda]134-belinda ; [many a fresh one]3540-many a fresh one is sullenly begun before [her]1490-her task is ended — before [her]1490-her "[1490-her] guide , [philosopher]1244-philosopher , and [friend]1245-friend , " induing , with [her]1490-her aid — aid given grudgingly and not unasked — [his]1490-her cap and gown , leaves [her]1490-her side to attend a college meeting . Not until the banging of the house - door tells [her]1490-her that [he]1490-her is really gone , does [she]1490-her give [herself]1490-her the indulgence of an enormous sigh . Throwing [herself]1490-her back in the leathern chair , in which [she]1490-her has been sitting at the writing - table , with weary long arms clasped behind [her]1490-her neck , and dogged eyes staring at the flies on the ceiling — "[1490-her] [God]184-god loveth [a cheerful giver]1502-a cheerful giver ! " [she]1490-her says aloud . "[1502-a cheerful giver] [He]1502-a cheerful giver is not much like [God]184-god ! " ( to [a woman]1273-a woman , [the man that [she]1490-her loves]3542-the man that she loves and [the man that [she]1490-her hates]3543-the man that she hates are equally nameless , equally [he]1502-a cheerful giver ) . "[1502-a cheerful giver] So as [he]1502-a cheerful giver gets [his]1502-a cheerful giver pound of flesh , [his]1502-a cheerful giver tale of bricks , what does [he]1502-a cheerful giver care ? " As [she]1490-her speaks , acrid tears issue from their hidden ducts , and brim [her]1490-her eyes ; but [she]1490-her shakes them vehemently away . [She]1490-her will not give to [Sarah]135-sarah 's penetrating eye the chance of seeing that [she]1490-her has wept . "[0-i] [I]0-i will not be pitied ! " [she]1490-her says , rising , and pulling [herself]0-i together ; "[1503-she] [she]1503-she shall not pity [me]0-i ! [no one]365-no one shall ! " [She]1490-her goes away to [[her]1490-her own room]2768-her own room , changes [her]1490-her gown for a fresher one , dresses [her]1490-her hair more becomingly , and practises looking happy in the glass . Before [she]1490-her has nearly perfected [herself]1490-her in this accomplishment , [she]1490-her is driven from it by the sight and sound of a slow fly , rocking top - heavily under a gigantic dress - basket , which is making for [her]1490-her gate . [Sarah]135-sarah is here , and [she]135-sarah will not be at the door to welcome [her]135-sarah . The thought lends wings to [her]1490-her young heels , and the colour and the smile that [she]1490-her has been vainly aiming at , to [her]1490-her cheeks and lips . Five minutes ago [she]1490-her did not think that anything could have caused [her]1490-her such a throb of pleasure as the dear old sound of that jovial high laugh , as the sight of [that Dresden china]2-dresden face and of those monstrously irrational shoes are now giving [her]1490-her . When [they]3545-they lived together , [they]3545-they seldom or never kissed [each other]469-each other . Now [they]3545-they can not hold each other tight enough . Is it only [Sarah]135-sarah that [Belinda]134-belinda is kissing ? Is not [it dead youth]3547-it dead youth , dear love , sweet [Wesenstein]15-wesenstein , too , that [she]134-belinda is so straitly embracing ? Over [the souls of [both sisters]3549-both sisters]3548-the souls of both sisters — [the sad elder]3550-the sad elder and [the radiant younger]3551-the radiant younger — the recollection of [their]3545-they last miserable parting on that hideous January morning has poured ! For a moment or two neither of [them]3545-they could have uttered a syllable , had [you]3552-you paid [them]3545-they a thousand pounds a word . [They]3545-they are brought back to common life by the sound of very small jingling bells , and by a sensation as of something tightly wound round [their]3545-they legs . It is [Punch]186-punch , who , unmindful of the chain that has bound [him]186-punch all the way down from [London]10-london , and delighted to be again in the fresh air and among [friends]3553-friends , is tearing wildly round , offering eager but unreciprocated greetings to [Slutty]157-slutty , who , dodging away from [him]186-punch , shrewish and snarling , practically refuses to admit [him]186-punch as [an acquaintance at all]3554-an acquaintance at all . "[1503-she] Why , [Punch]186-punch ! " says [Belinda]134-belinda , with a rather unsteady laugh , dropping on [her]134-belinda knees , taking the excited little dog under the arms , and looking kindly in [his]186-punch Ethiop face ; "[186-punch] [you]186-punch here ? and who invited [you]186-punch , pray ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i am afraid that [nobody]2422-nobody invited [him]186-punch , " replies [Sarah]135-sarah demurely ; "[186-punch] but [he]186-punch was so sure that it was an oversight , and [he]186-punch says [Jane]229-jane is [no companion]1506-no companion , and [he]186-punch sent so many messages to [Slutty]157-slutty , that [I]0-i thought it was the simplest plan to bring [him]186-punch ; do [you]186-punch mind ? " with the old wheedling in [her]0-i voice and [her]0-i saucy eyes . "[186-punch] Do [I]0-i mind ? " repeats [Belinda]134-belinda , with a reproachful yet apprehensive stress upon the pronoun , passing [her]0-i lips lightly over the top of [his]186-punch tawny head . "[186-punch] Punch ! is it likely [I]0-i should mind ? " "[186-punch] Will [he]186-punch mind ? " inquires [Sarah]135-sarah , speaking very low , and mouthing a good deal , as though labouring under a misgiving that [the person of whom [she]0-i speaks]3555-the person of whom she speaks is in hiding behind the door . "[186-punch] [He]186-punch is not fond of dogs , " answers [Belinda]134-belinda evasively , [her]134-belinda face suddenly darkening as if a light had been blown out in it . "[186-punch] Slutty exists only on sufferance , do not [you]186-punch , [Slutty]157-slutty ? " "[157-slutty] Whew — w ! " says [Sarah]135-sarah , pulling a long face , and with a low whistle ; "[157-slutty] and shall [I]0-i , too , exist only on sufferance , pray ? " [Belinda]134-belinda is saved from the necessity of answering a question , [her]134-belinda reply to which must have been either an incivility or a lie , by the fact that [they]3556-they have now entered [the house]2521-the house , and that [[her]134-belinda sister]2366-her sister 's roving eyes and attention are claimed by other objects . Preceded by the dogs , [Slutty]157-slutty churlishly growling , and [Punch]186-punch animatedly sniffing , [they]3556-they reach [the drawing - room]3050-the drawing - room . "[157-slutty] Not such [a bad room]1507-a bad room ! " says [Sarah]135-sarah patronizingly , looking round ; "[157-slutty] better than [I]0-i expected ; only it wants pulling about . " "[209-mr. forth] [Mr. Forth]209-mr. forth does not like [rooms]1508-rooms pulled about . " [The other]2396-the other breaks into a laugh . "[209-mr. forth] [Mr. Forth]209-mr. forth ! Is it possible that after six months [he]209-mr. forth is still [Mr. Forth]209-mr. forth ? " "[209-mr. forth] What else should [he]209-mr. forth be ? " says [Belinda]134-belinda , with stiff embarrassment ; "[209-mr. forth] [he]209-mr. forth has not yet been raised to the peerage . [He]209-mr. forth is not ' [Lord Forth]269-lord forth ' ! " [[Mr. Forth]209-mr. forth 's wife]3561-mr. forth 's wife laughs grimly . "[209-mr. forth] It will at least have the charm of novelty for [him]209-mr. forth ! " There is such a bitter dryness in the quasi - playfulness of [her]3561-mr. forth 's wife tone that [Sarah]135-sarah stops suddenly short in [her]135-sarah critical survey of the early English chairs , and the Albert Düurer etchings , in which [Oxbridge drawing - rooms]3562-oxbridge drawing - rooms delight ; and focussing [her]135-sarah elder with [her]135-sarah two insistant eyes , says , taking [her]135-sarah the while firmly by both wrists : "[209-mr. forth] Come now ; [we]1509-we are alone ; tell [me]0-i , how does it work ? has it answered ? " But [Belinda]134-belinda shakes off the small strong hands as [Samson]270-samson shook off the tough withes . "[0-i] [You]0-i must see [the rest of [the house]2521-the house]1510-the rest of the house , " [she]0-i cries , beginning to talk rapidly and rather loudly , and absolutely ignoring the question addressed to [her]0-i ; "[0-i] [you]0-i must see [[my]0-i room]3451-my room ; [[your]0-i own room]1513-your own room — [yours]0-i looks upon the tennis - ground . "[0-i] This is — [his]1515-his " ( with a slight hesitation before the pronoun , that shows that only the dread of a repetition of [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister 's ridicule has kept [her]0-i from designating [[her]0-i husband]3353-her husband by the formal style and title which [she]0-i habitually employs towards [him]1515-his ) ; "[0-i] and this ! " "[209-mr. forth] [Mr. Forth]209-mr. forth dislikes the smell of flowers , " replies [Belinda]134-belinda . " But the next moment—"How[0-i] soon do [we]1528-we go ? " cries [she]135-sarah joyously . "[0-i] [[St. Ursula]84-st. ursula 's]1529-st. ursula 's is [the largest college in [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge]1530-the largest college in oxbridge , is it not ? Will [all Oxbridge]1531-all oxbridge be there to meet [the Duke]1532-the duke ? But [I]0-i suppose [you]0-i are all much above setting any store by royalties ! [I]0-i love royalties ; there is nothing too small for [me]0-i to hear about them . " "[0-i] [We]1542-we will change all that , " says [Sarah]135-sarah piously : "[1541-poor boys] the reign of fear is over ; that of love is begun ! " [Belinda]134-belinda has moved to the middle of [the room]422-the room , and is occupied in pulling down the central gas - jet , and lowering the gas , harshly glaring under its globes . "[1540-the undergraduates] And do not [they]1540-the undergraduates admire [you]1543-you either , [par hasard]272-par hasard ? " asks [Sarah]135-sarah , in a voice of affectionate incredulity . " with a gesture of recollection ; "[1540-the undergraduates] now [I]0-i come to think of it , [I]0-i believe that [one young person of an æsthetic tendency]1544-one young person of an æsthetic tendency was once heard to observe that [I]0-i was ' great and still ' ; but that is the only civil speech [I]0-i have reaped in six months , and even that one is perhaps a little ambiguous . " "[0-i] Great and still ! " repeats [Sarah]135-sarah , giggling ; "[0-i] well , at all events [they]1540-the undergraduates shall not say that of [me]0-i ! " [She]0-i is still chuckling , when the opening door admits [[her]0-i brother - in - law]3574-her brother - in - law . "[0-i] [I]0-i appeal to [you]272-par hasard , " [she]0-i says , going boldly up to [him]3574-her brother - in - law . Is it true ? is it possible ? " It is certainly well to be on easy terms with [[your]272-par hasard brother - in - law]3575-your brother - in - law ; but , in a case so exceptional as that of [Miss Churchill]152-miss churchill , it is perhaps hardly wise to address [him]3574-her brother - in - law with an alluring archness that may remind [him]3574-her brother - in - law of former disasters . "[0-i] [I]0-i am afraid that [I]0-i must ask [you]272-par hasard to excuse [me]0-i , " [he]3574-her brother - in - law says sourly , turning on [his]3574-her brother - in - law heel . " There is something in [his]3574-her brother - in - law tone so unequivocally unplayful , thàt [Sarah]135-sarah slinks away snubbed , and for the moment robbed of all [her]135-sarah little airs and graces ; and [Belinda]134-belinda rises with rebellious slowness , flame in [her]134-belinda eye and revolt in [her]134-belinda nether lip , to render the grudging aid demanded of [her]134-belinda . As [her]134-belinda reluctant hand holds the gown for [[her]134-belinda husband]3353-her husband to put on , [they]3577-their both find [themselves]3577-their unintentionally standing plump and full before a rather large mirror , inevitably facing [their]3577-their own figures , thus brought into sudden juxtaposition . [Belinda]134-belinda is in gala - dress . In honour of [the Duke]1532-the duke , and for the first time since [her]134-belinda marriage , [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge is to see [her]134-belinda neck and shoulders . Upon [their]3577-their smooth sea of cream , unbroken by any trifling necklet — a sea that flows unrippled over the small collar - bones — the gas - lamps throw satin reflets ; a little chaplet of seasonable cowslips clasps [her]134-belinda well - set head , and wrath has borrowed love 's red pennon and planted it in [her]134-belinda cheeks . [She]134-belinda looks a magnificent embodiment of youth and vigour , dwarfing into yet meaner insignificance the parched figure beside [her]134-belinda . [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth casts one pregnant look at the two reflections , and then hearing , or feigning to hear , a sound of suppressed mirth behind [her]134-belinda , [she]134-belinda says , in a clear , incisive voice : "[1548-you] What are [you]1548-you laughing at , [Sarah]135-sarah ? Are [you]1548-you admiring [us]1549-they ? Are [you]1548-you thinking what a nice - looking pair [we]1549-they are ? " [She]134-belinda lays a slight but cruel accent on the noun . Pair , indeed ! From [Fate]274-fate 's strangely jumbled bag were never [two such odd ones]3579-two such odd ones sorted out before . [The Professor]2365-the professor has turned sharply away , but not before [[his]2365-the professor wife]713-his wife has had the satisfaction of seeing that [her]713-his wife shot has told ; but [Sarah]135-sarah maintains a scared silence . The fly is late in arriving . Probably it has had many freights to take up and put down on this festal night before [the Forths]275-the forths ' turn comes . At length , however , and just as [Sarah]135-sarah is beginning wistfully to interrogate [her]135-sarah Louis Quinze shoes as to [their]1549-they powers of reaching [St. Ursula]84-st. ursula and H. R. H. on foot , it drives up , and [they]1549-they all get in . Possibly [Belinda]134-belinda , though [she]134-belinda makes no approaches towards a verbal amende , may be remorseful for [her]134-belinda spurt of malevolence . At all events , [she]134-belinda offers no objection to the raising of the window on [her]134-belinda side ; nor does [she]134-belinda , even by a pardonable gasp or two , or an obtruded fanning , resent the insult to the summer night . The lateness of [their]1549-they fly has retarded [them]1549-they so much , that instead of being first at the rendezvous , as is [the Professor]2365-the professor 's usual habit , [they]1549-they see , on reaching [[St. Ursula]84-st. ursula 's]1529-st. ursula 's , [the great quadrangle that [the proudest churchman]3585-the proudest churchman built filled with every carriage and bath - chair that [[Oxbridge]5-oxbridge 's modest mews]3586-oxbridge 's modest mews]3584-the great quadrangle that the proudest churchman built filled with every carriage and bath - chair that oxbridge 's modest mews can boast ; filled , too , with [capped men]3587-capped men and [hooded women]3588-hooded women , hurrying to the goal . [They]1549-they have trodden the low - stepped stone stairs , along whose side lie unwonted banks of green moss that smells of cool , woodland places , planted with young field flowers ; have passed the one slender shaft that , upspringing , bears the vaulted roof , and [its]3589-its loveliest stone fans , and have entered [the lordly hall]3590-the lordly hall , where [Elizabeth Tudor]276-elizabeth tudor once saw [Masks]277-masks , and where [one of the sons of [[her]276-elizabeth tudor latest successor]3592-her latest successor]3591-one of the sons of her latest successor is listening with a courteous patience , probably superior to [hers]276-elizabeth tudor , to such improvements upon the barbarous Mask and obsolete Allegory as the nineteenth century , rich in the spoils of [its eighteen grandfathers]3593-its eighteen grandfathers , can afford [him]3591-one of the sons of her latest successor . In the present instance , the substitute offered is a tale told , not by [an idiot]3594-an idiot , but by [an excessively hot young man]3595-an excessively hot young man , striking occasionally sensational chords on the piano , at which [he]3595-an excessively hot young man is seated upon the raised daïs , where [the "[1548-you] Fellows]3596-the " fellows ' " table is wo nt to stand — a monstrously long tale about [a signalman]3597-a signalman , who , while busied in working [his]3597-a signalman points , sees [[his]3597-a signalman infant]3598-his infant , through some glaring domestic mismanagement , staggering across [the metals]3599-the metals at the precise moment when [an express train]3600-an express train is due . The struggle between [his]3591-one of the sons of her latest successor emotions as [a parent]3601-a parent and as [a pointsman]3602-a pointsman is so mercilessly protracted , that [the audience]3603-the audience , unable to bear the prolonged strain upon [their]3603-the audience feelings , are relieving [themselves]3603-the audience by a good deal of sotto voce , or not quite sotto voce conversation . But [the Prince]3604-the prince sits immovably polite , not permitting [himself]3604-the prince even one aside to [[his]3604-the prince sémillante hostess]3605-his sémillante hostess , who , all loyal smiles , is posed in glory on a chair in the front rank beside [him]3604-the prince . Large as is the assemblage , so nobly proportioned is [the great room]3606-the great room , that there is [no crowd]3607-no crowd . [Every woman]3608-every woman has put on [her]3608-every woman best gown ; and [every woman]3608-every woman has the satisfaction of thinking that [every other woman]3610-every other woman has seen , is seeing , or will fully see it ; not , indeed , to do [them]3608-every woman justice , that this is a consideration much likely to engage the attention of [the Oxbridge ladies]3611-the oxbridge ladies . Thanks to the height of the carved oak roof , whither the vapours can ascend , below it is cool and fragrant . With the one emphatic exception of [the detailer of [the signalman]3613-the signalman 's perplexities]3612-the detailer of the signalman 's perplexities , [scarce one of [the living guests]3615-the living guests]3614-scarce one of the living guests has a more heated air than the brave line of [judges]3616-judges , [bishops]3617-bishops , [philosophers]3618-philosophers , [premiers]3619-premiers — [St. Ursula]278-st. ursula 's dead glories — looking down in painted tranquillity from the walls . "[1550-you] [You]1550-you must introduce [me]0-i to [everybody]354-everybody , and tell [me]0-i who [they]354-everybody are , and what [they]354-everybody have done , so that [I]0-i may say something suitable , " says [Sarah]135-sarah , in a flutter of pleasure , looking beamingly round on the , to [her]0-i , [eccentric throng of black - gowned M.A. 's]3620-eccentric throng of black - gowned m.a. " says [Belinda]134-belinda , in serious dissuasion , "[0-i] or [you]1550-you will be sure to make a mess of it ! " [Sarah]135-sarah shrugs [her]135-sarah white shoulders . [She]135-sarah is so clamorous to be presented to [everyone]3028-everyone , that [Belinda]134-belinda , after patiently pointing out to [her]135-sarah , and , where feasible , making [her]135-sarah personally acquainted with [the owners of many of the local]3622-the owners of many of the local , [all the half - dozen national]3623-all the half - dozen national , and the one or two European reputations that grace [the room]422-the room , at length strikes work . "[1550-you] [You]1550-you are insatiable ! " [she]135-sarah says . "[1550-you] [You]1550-you are as bad as [Miss Watson]147-miss watson ! " "[147-miss watson] Unberufen ! " cries [Sarah]135-sarah , with a shudder that is not all affectation , "[1550-you] do not mention that accursed name ; [I]0-i could have sworn that [I]0-i heard [her]147-miss watson voice just now ! " [The room]422-the room is fuller than it was . About the door , indeed , and the lower part of [the hall]3033-the hall , circulation is still easy ; but who would be content with elbow - room at a lower end , when the sight of [a genuine live English royal Duke]3627-a genuine live english royal duke — [no dubious Serene German]3628-no dubious serene german — is to be fought for at the upper ? "[147-miss watson] And [you]1550-you say that [we]1552-they are not loyal ! " says [Belinda]134-belinda , with that irony now so frequently assumed by [her]134-belinda , as [they]1552-they , too , push and jostle [their]1552-they forward way . [They]1552-they have to push and jostle for [themselves]1552-they . Immediately upon [their]1552-they entry , [[their]1552-they natural pusher]3629-their natural pusher and jostler , [the Professor]2365-the professor , has quitted [them]1552-they for associates more akin in age and conformable in tastes than [the two handsome girls assigned by [a sarcastic Providence]3632-a sarcastic providence to [his]2365-the professor jurisdiction]3631-the two handsome girls assigned by a sarcastic providence to his jurisdiction . As [they]1552-they so work slowly forwards , gaining a step a minute , [they]1552-they are conscious of a disturbed heaving of the wave of humanity behind [them]1552-they — as when [the ocean]3373-the ocean is ploughed by some puissant steamer , or monstrous shark . At the same instant a familiar voice , whose accents [Sarah]135-sarah had already but too truly caught , breaks in brazen certainty upon [their]1552-they ears : "[1550-you] [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i beg a thousand pardons ! but in a crush of this kind it is quite unavoidable . [I]0-i really must beg [you]1553-you to make way for [me]0-i ! [I]0-i am naturally anxious to get to the top of [the room]422-the room , having a personal acquaintance with [the Duke]1532-the duke , or what really amounts to the same thing . " The loud voice grows nearer , the wave - like swell heavier . [She]1556-she is close behind [them]1552-they now . [Belinda]134-belinda has turned white and sick . That dreadful voice ! Even here , on this hot May night , in the thick festal crowd , of what power is it to re - create for [her]134-belinda that miserable fog - stained Christmas morning , on which , in [her]134-belinda madness , [she]134-belinda had allowed a few senseless words uttered by that brutal voice to seal [her]134-belinda doom for [her]134-belinda . " rejoins [the other]2396-the other , hastily putting into practice [her]134-belinda own precept , and burying [her]134-belinda nose in the lilies of [the valley]3636-the valley on [her]134-belinda breast ; "[0-i] perhaps [she]1556-she will not see [us]1557-us ! " But when did [Miss Watson]147-miss watson ever fail to see [anyone]494-anyone ? One final oaring of [her]147-miss watson powerful arm has brought [her]147-miss watson alongside of [them]1557-us . "[134-belinda] [Belinda]134-belinda ! [Sarah]135-sarah ! " [she]147-miss watson cries loudly , seeing that [her]147-miss watson mere presence , although sufficiently obvious , has apparently failed to attract [their]1557-us attention ; "[135-sarah] do not [you]135-sarah know [me]0-i ? [Emily Watson]279-emily watson ? [Dresden]2-dresden ? Has anything been going on ? have [I]0-i lost much?—I could not possibly get [here]2351-here before — quite a sudden thought [my]0-i coming at all . ' [I]0-i said ; ' halve the expense , and double the pleasure ! ' " [She]0-i pauses out of breath , and looks eagerly onwards towards the spot where , beyond [[[his]3604-the prince mother]2549-his mother 's struggling lieges]3639-his mother 's struggling lieges , [the Prince]3604-the prince sits , cool and civil , with [his]3604-the prince suite on [their]3639-his mother 's struggling lieges row of chairs . "[0-i] [I]0-i was so afraid that [the Prince]3604-the prince might be gone , " pursues [she]0-i volubly ; "[0-i] [the royalties]1562-the royalties sometimes go so early , [you]1563-you know . Have [you]1563-you been presented to [him]3604-the prince ? Do [you]1563-you know [him]3604-the prince ? well , enough to present [me]0-i ? No ? Well , then [I]0-i must re - introduce [myself]0-i : [I]0-i have no doubt that a word will suffice to recall [me]0-i to [H.R.H.]281-h.r.h. 's recollection . Royal memories are proverbially good , [you]1563-you know . [I]0-i must get hold of [[his]3604-the prince equerry]1564-his equerry ; [I]0-i know [him]3604-the prince quite well — once crossed over in the same steamer from [Newhaven]85-newhaven to [Dieppe]86-dieppe with [him]3604-the prince . " The last few words are thrown back over [her]0-i shoulder , as [she]0-i has already resumed [her]0-i vigorous fight onwards . With fascinated eyes [they]3641-they watch [her]0-i athlete 's progress to the front . [The human]3642-the human billows part before [her]0-i . [The crowd]3643-the crowd lies behind [her]0-i . [She]0-i has reached [smooth water]2631-smooth water and [the Prince]3604-the prince . [The signalman]3613-the signalman 's troubles are by this time drawing to [their]3641-they close . [[His]3613-the signalman rosy babe]3647-his rosy babe has been found lying smiling on the line ; [the express train]3648-the express train having , contrary to [its]3648-the express train usual habit , passed over [the pretty innocent without inflicting a scratch]3649-the pretty innocent without inflicting a scratch . [Most people]2556-most people draw a long breath ; but whether at [the babe]3651-the babe 's immunity or [their]2556-most people own , who shall decide ? "[1565-her] [She]1565-her is making [him]1566-him shake hands with [her]1565-her ! " says [Sarah]135-sarah , in a shocked voice , standing on tiptoe , and stretching [her]135-sarah neck . It is too true . In defiance of etiquette and despite the horrified look of [the hostess]3652-the hostess , [Miss Watson]147-miss watson is warmly grasping [[her]147-miss watson Duke]3653-her duke 's hand . Against the background of wall and [chairs]3654-chairs [her]1565-her figure stands out plainly silhouetted — fringe , garish evening - dress , and hot red neck ! " "[1565-her] [Sea - sick]1570-sea - sick ! " "[1570-sea - sick] [I]0-i should like to sit down , " says [Belinda]134-belinda , in a spent voice . This is easier said than done . By slow degrees , however , [they]2556-most people succeed in edging out of [the crowd]3643-the crowd ; and are lucky enough to find an unoccupied sofa , upon which [Belinda]134-belinda seats [herself]134-belinda ; and whither , presently , [various of [her]134-belinda acquaintance]3656-various of her acquaintance come and exchange remarks with [her]134-belinda upon the success of the entertainment , the excellence of the supper , the affability of [the Prince]3604-the prince , etc . In one of the intervals between two of these fragments of conversation [she]134-belinda perceives that [her]134-belinda charge has left [her]134-belinda side ; but it requires no very distant excursion of the eye to discover [her]134-belinda standing at the supper - table , an ice in [her]134-belinda hand , having , by the agency of [one of [her]134-belinda just - made acquaintance]3658-one of her just - made acquaintance , effected an introduction to [a good - looking undergraduate]3659-a good - looking undergraduate , who in return is presenting to [her]134-belinda a second , who in [his]3659-a good - looking undergraduate turn will obviously present to [her]134-belinda a third and a fourth . [A little mob of young men]3660-a little mob of young men is beginning to gather round [her]134-belinda . "[134-belinda] [Belinda]134-belinda , " [she]0-i says , "[134-belinda] [I]0-i want to introduce to [you]134-belinda [Mr. Bellairs]282-bellairs , who tells [me]0-i that [he]282-bellairs plays tennis remarkably well " ( an indistinct disclaimer from [the blushing Bellairs]282-bellairs ) ; "[283-stanley] and [Mr. Stanley]283-stanley , who plays very nicely too ; and [Mr. De Lisle]284-mr. de lisle , who thinks [he]284-mr. de lisle would play very nicely if [he]284-mr. de lisle had a little more practice . " [Belinda]134-belinda laughs slightly , amused at the glibness with which [[her]134-belinda sister]2366-her sister has already mastered [[her]134-belinda new admirers]3664-her new admirers ' names . "[284-mr. de lisle] [I]0-i am sure , " [she]0-i says , with a sweet cold smile , "[0-i] that if [you]1571-you care to try [our]1572-their small ground , [I]0-i shall be very — " [She]0-i is [a tall woman]3668-a tall woman , and [her]0-i eyes are on a level with [Bellairs]282-bellairs ' . [She]0-i can , therefore , easily look over [his]282-bellairs shoulder . What sight is it so seen that makes [her]0-i stop suddenly in mid - speech , with a catch in [her]0-i breath ? The pause is but short . Almost before [[her]0-i auditors]3669-her auditors have had time to notice the hiatus , it is filled up . "[0-i] [I]0-i shall be very happy to see [you]1571-you any day [you]1571-you choose to come — to - morrow , any day ! " [Her]0-i words are perfectly collected ; but surely [she]0-i is far , far paler than [she]0-i was when [she]0-i began to speak ; and though [her]0-i sentences are addressed to [the young men]3670-the young men , [her]0-i eyes are wandering oddly beyond them . "[0-i] Upon [my]0-i soul , [I]0-i believe [the woman]1573-the woman is off [her]1573-the woman head ! " [Stanley]283-stanley says confidentially to [Bellairs]282-bellairs , as [they]1574-they walk [home]2345-home together in the moonlight .
