" [She]0-i takes up [her]0-i quill again , as [the servant]3821-the servant leaves [the room]422-the room , but apparently [her]0-i hand shakes to a degree that is beyond [her]0-i control ; for in a moment a great blot has defaced the printed page . "[152-miss churchill] Pray be careful ! " cries [[her]0-i husband]3353-her husband fretfully . "[152-miss churchill] [You]0-i have a hair in [your]0-i pen . " [She]0-i throws it down , and takes another . [The room in which [they]3831-they are sitting]3830-the room in which they are sitting is over [the drawing - room]3050-the drawing - room . Evidently [he]1628-he has been ushered in , and [Sarah]135-sarah has joined [him]1628-he ; for there is a murmur of voices . What are [they]3831-they saying ? What are [they]3831-they likely to be saying ? "[0-i] [You]0-i have spelt allegorical with one l ! " says [the Professor]2365-the professor , in a voice of resentful wonder . "[0-i] Have [I]0-i ? " [she]0-i answers , bewildered and inattentive . "[0-i] And how many ought it to have ? " The voices have grown more distinctly audible . [They]3831-they have left [the drawing - room]3050-the drawing - room ; it is obvious that [Sarah]135-sarah is taking [him]1628-he out into [the garden]2455-the garden — [the pleasant , little , cool garden]3836-the pleasant , little , cool garden , with its blackbird and its broom - bush , and its bees . [She]135-sarah draws a hot , long , envious breath at the thought . "[0-i] [A child of five years old]1631-a child of five years old would have been ashamed to perpetrate so gross a blunder ! " resumes [he]1628-he , taking the sheet from before [her]135-sarah , and indignantly holding it up for reprobation . [She]135-sarah heaves a heavy , furious sigh , and a sombre light comes into [her]135-sarah great , gloomy eyes . From [the garden]2455-the garden is heard a peal of laughter . [Sarah]135-sarah is always laughing . It is well to be merry sometimes , but [Sarah]135-sarah is too much of [a buffoon]3838-a buffoon . "[1631-a child of five years old] In errors so palpable , it is difficult not to see intention , " continues [he]1628-he , exasperated by a silence that is so plainly not repentance — a silence which [she]135-sarah still observes . Another burst of laughter from [the garden]2455-the garden — not [Sarah]135-sarah 's this time ; [a man]2618-a man 's wholesome , unfeigned mirth . [He]2618-a man , too , can laugh , can [he]2618-a man ? "[1631-a child of five years old] [I]0-i should really be disposed to recommend a return to [the writing - master]1632-the writing - master , " says [Mr. Forth]209-mr. forth , still ironically regarding the blurred page . For all answer , [she]135-sarah rises to [her]135-sarah feet , and throws [her]135-sarah pen with violence down upon the floor . "[1632-the writing - master] [Your]0-i machine has broken down for to - day , " [she]135-sarah says , with a pale , rebellious smile . "[0-i] Legible or illegible , writing - [master]1633-master or [no writing - master]1634-no writing - master , [I]0-i will write not one word more to - day ! " It is [Miss Churchill]152-miss churchill 's maxim always to make [herself]152-miss churchill as comfortable , under any given circumstances , as those circumstances will permit ; nor has [she]152-miss churchill failed on the present occasion to live up to [her]152-miss churchill own precept . Beneath the garden wall , where the shade spreads coolest , a fur rug , filched from the drawing - room floor , is extended ; cushions , unlawfully thieved from the drawing - room sofa , mollify the hardness of back of the garden - chairs . Upon the unlikely hypothesis of [her]152-miss churchill conversation running short , [she]152-miss churchill has unearthed all the novels [she]152-miss churchill can find . At [her]152-miss churchill feet the dogs alternately sleep , and gnash [their]3841-their teeth — rarely successful — at the flies . In the sun , close by , stands the parrot 's gilded cage ; so that , if other resources fail [her]152-miss churchill , [she]152-miss churchill may fall back upon [his]3842-his loquacity . In addition to the dogs , at [her]152-miss churchill feet also lies [Rivers]162-rivers , unworthily occupied in tickling the inside of the dozing Slutty 's ear with a flower - stalk . This is the tranquil Arcadian picture that salutes [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth 's eyes as [she]135-sarah issues from [the house]2521-the house . [He]162-rivers has [his]162-rivers back turned towards [her]152-miss churchill ! [He]162-rivers has not cared enough for [her]152-miss churchill coming , even to place [himself]162-rivers so as to watch for it ! How is [she]152-miss churchill to know that it was only a moment ago , in obedience to [Sarah]135-sarah 's orders , and in dread of the remembered penetration of [her]152-miss churchill eyes , that [he]162-rivers had adopted [his]162-rivers present position ? How cool [they]3844-they look ! How much at ease ! What a pity to disturb [them]3844-they ! After all [she]152-miss churchill might as well have finished the proofs . As [she]152-miss churchill draws near [them]3844-they , walking so softly over [the turf]3845-the turf that [they]3844-they are not immediately aware of [her]152-miss churchill , a new burst of laughter fills and grates upon [her]152-miss churchill ears . "[1635-he] [You]1635-he seem very merry , " [she]152-miss churchill says drily . [Sarah]135-sarah exhibits no surprise — as why indeed should she?—at [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister 's advent . With [her]152-miss churchill head thrown back comfortably over [her]152-miss churchill chair , [she]152-miss churchill finishes [her]152-miss churchill laugh luxuriously out , but of [Rivers]162-rivers ' mirth [Belinda]134-belinda need no longer complain . There is not much that could be called mirth in the face that — suddenly leaping to [his]1635-he feet — [he]1635-he turns towards [her]152-miss churchill . What a death's - head [she]152-miss churchill must be to work such an instantaneous transformation in [him]1635-he ! "[1635-he] [You]1635-he seem to be very merry , " [she]152-miss churchill repeats . [She]152-miss churchill is conscious of the resentful dryness of [her]152-miss churchill tone ; of the fagged flush upon [her]152-miss churchill cheeks ; and the sullenness that [she]152-miss churchill has not quite been able to banish from [her]152-miss churchill eyes ; but [she]152-miss churchill is as powerless to correct the one as [the others]418-the others . What has [he]1635-he done to deserve that tone ? Beneath it [he]1635-he stands tongue - tied . "[1635-he] May not [I]0-i know what [your]1635-he joke was ? " [she]152-miss churchill says , struggling not very successfully for a greater amenity of manner ; "[1635-he] why should not it amuse [me]0-i , too ? " "[1635-he] It — it was nothing much ! " [he]1635-he answers deprecatingly ; "[1635-he] [I]0-i do not know why [I]0-i laughed ; it was only"—looking unhappy and ashamed—"that[0-i] [Miss Churchill]152-miss churchill was telling [me]0-i that [Punch]186-punch had once been engaged to the parrot , and that it was broken off because [she]152-miss churchill bit [his]1635-he tail to the bone ! " There is such a contrast between the very mild waggery of this anecdote , and the deep humiliation of the tone in which [he]1635-he narrates it , that [Sarah]135-sarah sets off laughing helplessly again ; but not a muscle of [Belinda]134-belinda 's face moves . "[152-miss churchill] That respectable old jest , " [she]152-miss churchill says , with a slight shrug ; "[152-miss churchill] it has been for many years a family [Joe Miller]292-joe miller ! " "[292-joe miller] It was not a [Joe Miller]292-joe miller to [him]1635-he ! " replies [Sarah]135-sarah , standing up in indistinct defence — indistinct through much laughing — of [her]152-miss churchill pleasantry ; "[292-joe miller] [he]1635-he may pretend now that [he]1635-he did not like it — but [he]1635-he did ! " [Belinda]134-belinda sits down ; but the cloud still lowers on [her]134-belinda brow . To [her]152-miss churchill own heart [she]152-miss churchill says that [she]152-miss churchill does well to be angry . That here , for the first time face to face with the tragedy of [their]3848-their two lives , [he]1635-he should be in a condition to be genuinely amused by so miserable a jest — by any jest ! Nor does the crushing of [his]1635-he merriment please [her]152-miss churchill any better . [She]152-miss churchill , then , is the wet blanket who stifles [his]1635-he jollity . Times are indeed changed ! If [she]152-miss churchill were to leave [them]3848-their , no doubt the peals of laughter would at once break out afresh . But for the present they are effectually stilled . Painfully and sorely conscious of this , [she]152-miss churchill makes another difficult effort to recover [her]152-miss churchill good temper . "[1635-he] [I]0-i think [I]0-i am losing [my]0-i sense of humour , " [she]152-miss churchill says awkwardly ; "[0-i] it must be the effect of [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge air . [Punch]186-punch , will [you]186-punch , too , lose [your]186-punch sense of humour ? " [She]152-miss churchill has lifted the lively little dog up on [her]152-miss churchill knees , and is half hiding [her]152-miss churchill hot face against [his]186-punch . "[186-punch] [He]186-punch is losing something else , is not [he]186-punch ? " says [Rivers]162-rivers , made bold by [her]152-miss churchill gentler tone diffidently to draw a little nigher to [her]152-miss churchill , and to raise [his]186-punch eyes in painful questioning to [hers]152-miss churchill . As [he]186-punch speaks , [he]186-punch lifts [his]186-punch hand and touches the locket habitually worn round the neck , and as habitually tried to be scratched off by [Punch]186-punch ; and from which a lock of hair is at present obviously escaping . "[186-punch] Why , [Punch]186-punch , do [you]186-punch wear locks of hair ? " asks [the young man]504-the young man , laughing nervously . "[186-punch] Whose is it ? Slutty 's , let [us]1636-us hope ! " "[186-punch] It is always coming out , " interposes [Sarah]135-sarah in a disgusted voice ; "[186-punch] the fact is , " lazily drawing [herself]135-sarah up into a sitting posture , and looking round explanatorily , "[523-people] that [people]523-people have a way of giving [me]0-i locks of [their]523-people hair — [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i do not know why — and as [I]0-i can not possibly wear them all , [Punch]186-punch is good enough to wear some of them for [me]0-i ! [Punch]186-punch has worn a great deal of hair in [his]186-punch day , have not [you]186-punch , [Punch]186-punch ? " As [she]135-sarah speaks , [she]135-sarah calls the dog to [her]135-sarah ; and becomes absorbed in the contemplation of [his]186-punch jewellery . "[186-punch] Is it German or English hair , should [you]186-punch think ? " asks [Rivers]162-rivers , almost under [his]162-rivers breath . There is a smile on [his]162-rivers face as [he]162-rivers puts this question ; but a smile with whose mirth [she]135-sarah need not quarrel . In a moment how [the Hussars]191-hussars and [Uhlans]193-uhlans are clanking round [her]135-sarah again ! How the soft wind is pelting [her]135-sarah with cherry flowers ! How the old Schloss is towering up against the German sky ! [She]135-sarah can not answer [him]162-rivers ; but those few words seem to have given [them]3850-them back something of [their]3850-them former intimacy . "[186-punch] Now whose is it ? " says [Sarah]135-sarah reflectively , having taken out the little lock , and being now contemplatively eyeing it with [her]135-sarah head on one side ; "[186-punch] what a memory [I]0-i have ! [Belinda]134-belinda , can [you]134-belinda help [me]0-i ? whose is this lock of hair of [Punch]186-punch 's ? Oh , but it must have been since [your]134-belinda day ; it is not unlike [yours]134-belinda " ( turning to [Rivers]162-rivers , and coolly setting the little tendril against [his]162-rivers hair to compare them ) . "[134-belinda] Did [you]134-belinda ever give [me]0-i a lock of [your]134-belinda hair ? " [He]162-rivers turns with a start . [He]162-rivers has been unwisely allowing [himself]162-rivers to drift into one of [his]162-rivers old speculations , as to whether [any woman]3851-any woman 's ear had ever sat so daintily close to [her]3851-any woman head as does that of [the wife of [Professor Forth]136-professor forth]3852-the wife of professor forth . "[134-belinda] A lock of [my]0-i hair ! " [he]162-rivers cries , jumping up , and falling on [his]162-rivers knees before [Sarah]135-sarah , with an air of exaggerated playfulness ; "[134-belinda] if [I]0-i have not , [I]0-i am quite ready to supply the omission ; whereabouts will [you]134-belinda have it from ? " passing [his]162-rivers hand over [his]162-rivers own crisp curls . "[134-belinda] May [I]0-i take [your]134-belinda scissors , [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth ? " It is the first time that [he]162-rivers has so addressed [her]135-sarah . It is with untold difficulty that the name crosses [his]162-rivers lips , and consequently [he]162-rivers enunciates it with unusual distinctness . It is in reality a cudgelling that [he]162-rivers is administering to [himself]162-rivers for [his]162-rivers late lapse , but to [her]135-sarah it seems a wanton cruelty . "[271-mrs. forth] May [I]0-i take [your]134-belinda scissors , [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth ? " [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth 's head is , however , bent so low over [her]271-mrs. forth work - basket , that apparently [she]271-mrs. forth does not hear . Behind the shelter of that convenient receptacle for tapes and needles , [her]271-mrs. forth hands are trembling and writhing . At [Dresden]2-dresden would [he]162-rivers have talked even in joke of giving [Sarah]135-sarah a lock of [his]162-rivers hair ? Why , [he]162-rivers never even heard [her]271-mrs. forth when [she]271-mrs. forth spoke to [him]162-rivers ! Happily for [Belinda]134-belinda , at this point , [she]271-mrs. forth is summoned to [the house]2521-the house on some trifling errand , which detains [her]271-mrs. forth for ten minutes — ten minutes in which [she]271-mrs. forth is able to resume some hold upon [herself]271-mrs. forth ; and it is well that it is so , for the sight which greets [her]271-mrs. forth is one not calculated to promote [her]271-mrs. forth equanimity . [Sarah]135-sarah has abandoned [her]135-sarah lazy reclining , and is sitting up , and holding [Rivers]162-rivers ' hand ; not indeed , when [one]373-one comes to observe closely , in any very lover - like manner , but as [one who is examining it with an air of the liveliest interest and curiosity]3855-one who is examining it with an air of the liveliest interest and curiosity . "[271-mrs. forth] [I]0-i should be ashamed to own such a hand , " [she]0-i is saying , with [her]0-i accustomed candour ; "[0-i] it is like [a workman]1638-a workman 's hand . " "[1638-a workman] But [I]0-i am [a workman]1638-a workman , " [he]162-rivers answers bluntly . And then [he]162-rivers is suddenly aware of [Belinda]134-belinda 's presence , and snatches it away . "[1638-a workman] It really is quite a curiosity in its way , " says [Sarah]135-sarah in a pleased voice ; "[1638-a workman] it is as hard and horny as [a day - labourer]1640-a day - labourer 's . Do show it to [Belinda]134-belinda ! " [He]162-rivers looks towards [her]135-sarah , hesitating and uncertain . [She]135-sarah has resumed [her]135-sarah former seat , and [her]135-sarah work - basket . "[134-belinda] Do ! " [she]0-i says , trying to speak with [her]0-i newly summoned tranquillity ; and [he]162-rivers holds it out to [her]135-sarah , palm upwards . It is a beautiful hand still , shapely and vigorous , but on it are disfiguring evidences of hard , coarse toil . There is nothing particularly affecting in a work - roughened palm : it is a condition to which are subjected the hands of [ninety - nine out of every hundred of the human race]3856-ninety - nine out of every hundred of the human race ; and yet , as [she]0-i looks at it , [she]0-i has much ado to prevent the tears from springing to [her]0-i eyes . "[1641-you] [You]1641-you know , " [he]162-rivers says , "[1641-you] [I]0-i told [you]1641-you that [I]0-i could not stand the confinement of an office life ! " "[1642-us] [We]1642-us know ? " cries [Sarah]135-sarah , pricking up [her]135-sarah ears . "[0-i] [You]0-i told [us]1642-us ? What do [you]0-i mean ? When have [you]0-i ever had the chance of telling [us]1642-us ? " [He]162-rivers stops — staggered and white . [He]162-rivers had forgotten the presence of [an auditor]3857-an auditor . Nor is [Belinda]134-belinda in a plight to help [him]162-rivers . "[0-i] [I]0-i mean , " [he]162-rivers says floundering , "[0-i] that [I]0-i — [I]0-i intended to tell [you]1641-you ; and so , " hurriedly resuming [his]162-rivers narrative , "[0-i] [I]0-i — [I]0-i went as an ordinary hand in [the iron - works]1643-the iron - works ; and was set to work at the puddling - furnace . " "[1646-they] The puddling - furnace ! " cries [Sarah]135-sarah , delighted with the sound ; "[1646-they] and what is a puddling - furnace , pray ? " repeating the phrase with emphatic relish . "[1646-they] A puddling - furnace is [a furnace where the pig - iron from [the smelting - furnace]1645-the smelting - furnace]1644-a furnace where the pig - iron from the smelting - furnace is worked about at a great heat with iron rakes — rabbles , [they]1646-they call [them]1647-them — and [I]0-i had the honour and pleasure , " with a shy laugh , "[1646-they] of working one of these rakes , until the iron became malleable . " [Belinda]134-belinda 's pretence of work has dropped unheeded on the grass beside [her]134-belinda . "[1646-they] H — m ! " says [Sarah]135-sarah , still agreeably interested ; "[1646-they] no wonder that [your]0-i hands are not so pretty as they might be . And was it very hard work ? " "[732-child] It was not exactly [child]732-child 's play , " [he]3858-he answers drily ; "[732-child] but [they]1646-they gave [us]1649-we high wages ; [they]1646-they were glad to get hold of [a good strong chap like [me]0-i]1650-a good strong chap like me . [We]1649-we had need to be pretty strong ! " "[1649-we] And did [you]0-i work at it all day ? " "[0-i] [We]1649-we were relieved every six or eight hours . [We]1649-we could not have stood it longer on account of the heat ; that was pretty bad ! " [He]3858-he pauses a moment , passing [his]3858-he disfigured hand , half in absence , half in kindness , along [Slutty]157-slutty 's roomy back ; then adds : "[0-i] It is the heat that does it ! As a rule , [puddlers]1651-puddlers do not live long ; it is the heat that does it . " [He]3858-he says it with complete simplicity , neither expecting nor wishing for compassion ; as if to spend eight hours a day in a puddling - furnace were the natural and ordinary sequel of an education at [Eton]87-eton and [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge . So this is how [he]3858-he has spent the twenty months , passed by [her]134-belinda in listening for [the postman]1068-the postman 's knock — in this life - shortening , mind - deadening brute toil ! Well , even so , [he]3858-he has had the best of it ! There is a silence of some moments ' duration , broken by [Sarah]135-sarah , whose sharp ear has caught a sound of footsteps . "[134-belinda] Ha ! " [she]0-i cries with animation , "[134-belinda] here comes [[my]0-i little flock]1652-my little flock ; and , as ill - luck will have it , [I]0-i have forgotten every one of [their]1653-their names . [Belinda]134-belinda ! quick ! help [me]0-i ! — which is which ? " [Belinda]134-belinda lifts [her]134-belinda downcast eyes : lifts [them]1653-their to see [three young gentlemen , whom apparently [the parlour - maid]3861-the parlour - maid , with that contempt for [undergraduates]2561-undergraduates inherent in the native [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge mind]3860-three young gentlemen , whom apparently the parlour - maid , with that contempt for undergraduates inherent in the native oxbridge mind , has left to announce [themselves]3860-three young gentlemen , whom apparently the parlour - maid , with that contempt for undergraduates inherent in the native oxbridge mind , timorously advancing . [They]3860-three young gentlemen , whom apparently the parlour - maid , with that contempt for undergraduates inherent in the native oxbridge mind are evidently not very easy in [their]3860-three young gentlemen , whom apparently the parlour - maid , with that contempt for undergraduates inherent in the native oxbridge mind minds , and are somewhat obviously each pushing [the other]2396-the other to the front . Clearly , [[Professor Forth]136-professor forth 's house]3864-professor forth 's house is [no habitual lounge for [undergraduates]2561-undergraduates]3865-no habitual lounge for undergraduates . A movement of irrational relief thrills through [Rivers]162-rivers ' heart as [he]162-rivers realizes this . "[1653-their] [They]1653-their must indeed be fond of [you]0-i , [Sarah]135-sarah , to have faced [me]0-i ! " says [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth , with a dry smile . "[1653-their] How frightened [they]1653-their look ! as frightened , " with one quick glance at [Rivers]162-rivers , "[0-i] as [you]0-i used to be ! " [She]0-i does not pause to see the effect of [her]0-i words ; but , rising , walks with [her]0-i long slow step to meet [[her]0-i guests]3867-her guests . "[0-i] [I]0-i do not wonder that [they]1653-their are frightened , " says [Sarah]135-sarah in a stage aside to [the young man]504-the young man . "[0-i] Does not [she]0-i look as if [she]0-i were going to ask [them]1653-their to what [she]0-i owes the pleasure of [their]1653-their visit ? If [I]0-i do not fly to the rescue , even now [they]1653-their will turn tail and run ! " But [Sarah]135-sarah for once is mistaken . [They]1653-their have no desire to turn tail and run . It is doubtful , indeed , whether , on [their]1653-their home - ward way , and over [their]1653-their evening cigars , [their]1653-their limited and artless vocabulary of encomium is more strained to find epithets of approval for [Miss Churchill]152-miss churchill than for [[her]0-i austerer sister]3869-her austerer sister . But indeed , to - day , [Belinda]134-belinda is not austere . "[0-i] Why should [she]0-i snub [them]1653-their ? " [she]0-i asks [herself]0-i sadly ; "[0-i] has not [she]0-i had enough of snubbing [people]523-people for all [her]0-i lifetime ? " And so [she]0-i is kind to [them]1653-their — too kind , [Rivers]162-rivers begins presently to think with a jealous pang , as [he]162-rivers sees [her]0-i pouring out tea for [them]1653-their with [her]0-i all - lovely hands ; endowing [them]1653-their with [her]0-i heavenly smile ; lightening [their]1653-their darkness with [her]0-i starry eyes . Nor is [he]162-rivers , even yet , wise enough in love 's lore , or coxcomb enough , to suspect that it is [he]162-rivers [himself]162-rivers — [he]162-rivers sitting by , apparently neglected and overlooked — who has lit the eyes and carved the smile . [Sarah]135-sarah is very kind , too ; but [they]1653-their are rather hurt at the hopeless muddle into which [she]135-sarah has got [their]1653-their names . By - and - by , when well be - tea'd and becaked , [they]1653-their are embarked upon a game of tennis , and the sound of callings and laughings , of balls struck and racquets striking , breaks the Arcadian silence of [that hitherto virgin enclosure]3870-that hitherto virgin enclosure — [Professor Forth]136-professor forth 's tennis - ground . It is too small to admit of more than one set at a time ; and [Belinda]134-belinda , as [a good hostess]3871-a good hostess , despite the warm urgencies of [the now tamed and happy strangers]3872-the now tamed and happy strangers , retires in favour of [[her]134-belinda visitors]3873-her visitors . It boots little to inquire whether the sacrifice cost [her]134-belinda much . "[0-i] Do [you]1655-he play ? " cries [Sarah]135-sarah nonchalantly , flourishing [her]135-sarah racquet under [Rivers]162-rivers ' nose . "[1655-he] No ? Ah ! " with an impudent smile , "[1655-he] [you]1655-he are more at [home]2345-home with [[your]1655-he rake]1657-your rake ! " Though it is morally impossible that [they]3874-they could have understood it , both [Bellairs]282-bellairs and [Stanley]283-stanley are contemptible enough to laugh at this sally ; a fact which would no doubt have made [Rivers]162-rivers disposed to punch [their]3874-they heads , had [he]162-rivers heard [them]3874-they ; but the jest and its prosperity both fall upon deaf ears . Sight and hearing are stopped by the anxious fear : "[1658-her] Is [she]1658-her displeased with [him]1655-he for refusing to play ? Ought [he]1655-he to have played ? Will [she]1658-her now expect [him]1655-he to go ? At parting , will [she]1658-her say any word of further meeting ? " A lump rises in [his]1655-he throat . Not presuming again to take up [his]1655-he place on the grass at [her]1658-her feet — though , after all , it is a privilege that [no one]365-no one grudges even to the dogs — [he]1655-he stands , uncertain and unhappy , before [her]1658-her . If [she]1658-her so wills it , this must be the end . Nor does [she]1658-her seem in any hurry to put [him]1655-he out of [his]1655-he incertitude . Upon [her]1658-her the day 's earlier mood is returning . In what life - giving whiffs comes the kindly wind ! Did ever homely coated bird say such sweet things as does the blackbird from among the cherry - boughs ? and [the little vulgar villa - garden]3876-the little vulgar villa - garden has grown like that of which [Keats]293-keats spake : "[1658-her] Where the daisies are rose - scented , And the rose [herself]1658-her has got Perfume that [on earth]1659-on earth is not ! " [He]1655-he is here before [her]1658-her , waiting one lightest sign from [her]1658-her to lie down at [her]1658-her feet and be trampled on . Is it any wonder that , being [a woman]1273-a woman , [she]1658-her lets three minutes elapse before [she]1658-her gives that sign ? At the end of that time , "[1658-her] Are [you]1660-you at it still ? " [she]1658-her asks abruptly . It is half an hour since the subject was dropped , and [a dozen others]3878-a dozen others have intervened between ; yet [he]1655-he seems to have no difficulty in understanding at once to what [her]1658-her speech alludes . "[1660-you] No , " [he]1655-he answers , with a sigh of relief ( for it is evident that had [she]1658-her wished to be rid of [him]1655-he , [she]1658-her would not have introduced a new , or resumed an old , topic ) , taking possession as [he]1655-he speaks of [[Sarah]135-sarah 's forsaken chair]3879-sarah 's forsaken chair ; "[1660-you] [I]0-i am promoted to be [foreman]1661-foreman . " [He]1655-he pauses for [her]1658-her to comment or congratulate ; but [she]1658-her does neither . [She]1658-her only stitches feverishly on . "[1661-foreman] It struck [me]0-i that the same thing might be done , with much less expense of labour , by machinery , " [he]1655-he continues , with the hurry of one who has no assurance that [he]1655-he is not wearying [[his]1655-he listener]3880-his listener ; "[1661-foreman] and in consequence of this — this invention of [mine]0-i , which [[our]1662-our firm]1663-our firm has taken up , [I]0-i have been promoted to the rank of [foreman]1661-foreman . " [He]1655-he stops so decidedly that [she]1658-her is compelled to make an observation of some kind . "[1661-foreman] And in due time , of course , [you]0-i will be taken into partnership , and marry [[[your]0-i master]1665-your master 's daughter]1666-your master 's daughter , " [she]1658-her says with a difficult flippancy . The blood rushes to [his]1655-he face . [He]1655-he had expected a kinder commentary . Surely no jest ever so ill became [her]1658-her whom , in [his]1655-he eyes , all becomes . There is a silence . The sun 's rays are less vertical , and the dogs have awoke . [Punch]186-punch indeed , under the mistaken idea of being obliging , is officiously retrieving the tennis balls , and being warmly slapped by [the heated players]3881-the heated players for [his]1655-he good nature . "[1666-your master 's daughter] Well , " says [Belinda]134-belinda , with nervous asperity in [her]134-belinda tone , "[1666-your master 's daughter] is there nothing more ? Go on . " "[1101-others] [Others]1101-others have invented [machines of the same kind]1668-machines of the same kind , " [he]1655-he continues spiritlessly , for [her]1658-her jest has taken the heart out of [his]1655-he narration , "[1101-others] but [they]1668-machines of the same kind have turned out either complete failures , or only very partial successes ; if [mine]0-i has better luck , [[our]1669-our firm]1663-our firm holds out hopes of taking out a patent , and giving [me]0-i a small share of the business . " "[0-i] Did not [I]0-i tell [you]0-i so ? " cries [she]1658-her , laughing rather stridently ; "[0-i] why , [my]0-i prophecy is already half - way towards fulfilment . " Again [his]1655-he face burns , but [he]1655-he deigns [her]1658-her no answer . If [she]1658-her can stoop to so unworthy a merriment , [she]1658-her shall at least enjoy it alone . "[0-i] It is evidently all for the best , " [he]1655-he says , trying to catch [her]1658-her callous tone ; "[0-i] it seems that [I]0-i have a kind of turn for [mechanics]1671-mechanics . It was news to [me]0-i that [I]0-i had a turn for anything convertible into money . If — if things had gone smoothly , [I]0-i might have lain down in [[my]0-i grave]1672-my grave without finding out where the bent of [my]0-i genius lay : and that would have been a thousand pities , would not it ? " [He]1655-he ends with a laugh . [Her]1658-her mirth , which had offended [him]1655-he , has long died ; nor has [she]1658-her any answer ready to [his]1655-he question . [Her]1658-her long arms ( even arms can look sad ) lie listless on [her]1658-her lap , and [her]1658-her great veiled eyes see visions . Vanished from before [them]3882-them are [the little square garden]3883-the little square garden and [the tennis - players]3884-the tennis - players . [They]3882-them see only [his]1655-he future life - path stretching before [her]1658-her ; [his]1655-he life growing ever fuller , fuller , fuller of busy , prospering , eager work , with ever less and less room in it for the gap left by [her]1658-her . By - and - by that gap will close altogether . The sooner the better for [him]1655-he ! But for [her]1658-her ? Over [her]1658-her there pours a rush of frantic longing to tear it wide ; to keep it ever , ever yawning . But it will not so yawn always . It will close so that scarce a scar will be left to show where it once was . [He]1655-he is fond of [his]1655-he work already . In how different a spirit [he]1655-he addresses [himself]1655-he to it from that in which , sulky and half - hearted , [she]1658-her turns to [her]1658-her hated toils . A sense of injury and offence against [him]1655-he rises in [her]1658-her heart . [He]1655-he can never have suffered as [she]1658-her has suffered ; [his]1655-he meat has never been ashes , nor [his]1655-he drink tears ! "[1673-you] It is clear that [you]1673-you are [Fortune]294-fortune 's favourite , " [she]1658-her says in a hard voice ; "[0-i] [I]0-i congratulate [you]1673-you . " "[0-i] Thank [you]1673-you , " [he]1655-he answers , deeply wounded ; "[1673-you] [you]1673-you have hit upon the exact phrase that describes [me]0-i . " There is such a sharp pain in [his]1655-he tone , that , though [she]1658-her has been anxiously averting [her]1658-her eyes from [him]1655-he , [they]3885-they must needs seek [his]1655-he in apology . "[1673-you] Forgive [me]0-i , " [she]1658-her says with a remorseful watery smile ; "[1673-you] [you]1673-you know that [I]0-i was always bitter ; and somehow , " [her]1658-her lip trembling , "[1673-you] time has not improved [me]0-i ! " Seeing the sorrowful twitching of that lovely and beloved mouth , [he]1655-he loses [his]1655-he head for a moment . "[1673-you] It would have been nothing from [anyone else]2603-anyone else , " [he]1655-he says , murmuring under [his]1655-he breath ; "[1673-you] but it came ill from [you]1673-you . " [She]1658-her offers no denial . Only [she]1658-her drops [her]1658-her eyes ; and a stealing selfish sweetness laps [her]1658-her senses . Not yet , then , is the gap filled . "[134-belinda] [Belinda]134-belinda ! " cries the voice of [Sarah]135-sarah , suddenly striking in , high and mirthful ; of [Sarah]135-sarah , returned , hot and boastful , from [her]135-sarah finished game . "[134-belinda] Cheer up ! [I]0-i have some good news for [you]134-belinda ! " [Belinda]134-belinda gives a great start . "[134-belinda] Have [you]134-belinda indeed ? " [she]134-belinda says hurriedly ; "[134-belinda] so much the better for [me]0-i . " "[134-belinda] [Mr. Staveley]295-staveley and [Mr. Bellairs]282-bellairs and [Mr.]1675-mr. — " ( [she]134-belinda has not yet mastered the name of [[her]134-belinda third young friend]3886-her third young friend , but audaciously mumbles something that is to stand for it ) , "[134-belinda] and [I]0-i have concocted a little junket for to - morrow . " [She]134-belinda has risen from [her]134-belinda chair and begun to walk about upon the sward . "[0-i] It strikes [me]0-i that [you]134-belinda are not listening to a word [I]0-i say , " says [Sarah]135-sarah , darting a dry look from one to [the other of [the culprits]3889-the culprits]3888-the other of the culprits . " replies [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth , still with that same factitious liveliness . "[134-belinda] [I]0-i should enjoy it of all things ; [I]0-i am so fond of the water , only — " [She]0-i stops abruptly ; [her]0-i rebellious eye wandering to where [Rivers]143-rivers — [he]209-mr. forth , too , has risen — stands aloof , out in the cold ; obviously uninvited , unincluded in the joyous programme . "[0-i] Only [Menander]287-menander , [I]0-i suppose , " says [Sarah]135-sarah , making a face ; "[287-menander] really , at [his]287-menander age , [he]287-menander ought to be able to shift for [himself]287-menander for one day . " "[287-menander] It is not [Menander]287-menander , " replies [Belinda]134-belinda with embarrassment ; "[287-menander] as it happens , [I]0-i have a whole holiday to - morrow . [Mr. Forth]209-mr. forth is going to [London]10-london for the day , to take the chair at an archæological meeting . " "[209-mr. forth] Only what , then ? " looking at [her]1681-her with a point - blank directness that puts [her]1681-her out of countenance . "[209-mr. forth] Only , " [she]1681-her says , and stops again , irresolute . [Reason]286-reason is pouring [her]1681-her cold douche over [her]1681-her , and asking : "[209-mr. forth] Why should [he]209-mr. forth be invited ? What sense would there be in it ? unreason rather , and madness . Has not [she]1681-her supped enough of hemlock for one while ? With how many dreary days and weeks of flat revolt and saltless labour will [she]1681-her already have to expiate this one drunken hour ? Let this be the end ! let this be the end ! " "[209-mr. forth] Only nothing , " [she]1681-her says , with awkward gaiety . "[209-mr. forth] [I]0-i wonder why [you]209-mr. forth hesitated ? " asks [Sarah]135-sarah inquisitively . [I]0-i want to enjoy [myself]0-i ! " [Her]0-i eye sparkles , and [her]0-i cheek flames , as [she]0-i speaks . Is it indeed the expectation of pleasure that has set [them]1684-we both so bravely alight ? [She]0-i throws [herself]0-i with such a fury of interest into all the details of the excursion , that [she]0-i has hardly time or attention to spare for bidding good - bye to [Rivers]162-rivers , who presently comes up to make [his]162-rivers adieux . "[209-mr. forth] Are [you]209-mr. forth going ? " [she]0-i asks indifferently . "[209-mr. forth] Good - bye . " As [she]0-i speaks , [she]0-i lays for one instant [her]0-i hot dry hand in [his]162-rivers cold one . [She]0-i would have bidden even [Bellairs]282-bellairs good - bye more warmly . None but [herself]0-i knows the strength of the temptation that assails [her]0-i to clutch that poor slighted hand before [them]1684-we all ; to lay it on [her]0-i miserable heart ; to drown it in [her]0-i tears , smother it with [her]0-i kisses , and pay [it]3892-it any other tribute of extravagant passionate homage . Least of all does [he]162-rivers suspect it , as [he]162-rivers walks away , decently strangling [his]162-rivers sick despair till [he]162-rivers is out of sight . No sooner is [he]162-rivers gone , and the need for defence ended , than [she]0-i throws away [her]0-i weapons . [Her]0-i attention flags so obviously ; [her]0-i manner relapses so patently from its short summer of animation into its normal frost , that it dawns at length upon [the three boys]3893-the three boys ' intelligence that [they]3893-the three boys are running a good chance of outstaying [their]3893-the three boys welcome , and forfeiting the place that [they]3893-the three boys flatter [themselves]3893-the three boys [they]3893-the three boys have won in [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth 's esteem . [They]3893-the three boys take leave as precipitately as [Sarah]135-sarah 's many last words , commands , espiègleries , jokes , will let [them]3893-the three boys . [She]135-sarah accompanies [them]3893-the three boys to the door ; and [Belinda]134-belinda , since it is more tolerable to move about than to sit still , accompanies [her]0-i . [The sisters]2636-the sisters lean on the low iron gate , and the bland spring evening wraps [her]0-i arms around [them]2636-the sisters . [Belinda]134-belinda has lifted [her]134-belinda gloomy eyes to the laburnum gloriously pendent above [her]134-belinda head . Which happy cluster was it that brushed against [his]1685-he hair last night in the starlight ? "[209-mr. forth] [He]1685-he is not gone yet ! "[1685-he] What is [he]1685-he hanging about for ? " [She]135-sarah has desisted rather suddenly from [her]135-sarah occupation of kissing [her]135-sarah fingers to [her]135-sarah three adorers , who , reluctant to lose one of [her]135-sarah last glances , are backing down [the road]392-the road away from [her]135-sarah . [Belinda]134-belinda 's heart gives a bound . Not quite the end yet , then ! [She]135-sarah has done [her]135-sarah best ! [Her]135-sarah conscience is clear ! but it is not quite the end yet , then ! Can [she]135-sarah be blamed because [he]1685-he still loiters near ? "[0-i] It is no case of civility between [you]0-i and [him]1685-he , " [she]271-mrs. forth says curtly . The flush on [Belinda]134-belinda 's fagged face grows hotter . " "[0-i] Thank [you]0-i ! " cries [the other]2396-the other fiercely , and trembling like a leaf from head to foot . " At the last two words [she]0-i raises [her]0-i voice into a call ; but it is so unsteady and ill - modulated , and [he]1685-he is so comparatively distant , that [one]373-one would hardly expect the sound to carry so far ; but apparently it does , for [he]1685-he starts and looks uncertainly towards [her]0-i , distrusting [his]1685-he own ears . Is it likely that [she]0-i should have called [him]1685-he ? [she]0-i — [[his]1685-he high proud lady]3899-his high proud lady — after such a careless cruelty of good - bye too ! "[162-rivers] [Mr. Rivers]162-rivers ! " [she]0-i repeats , in a voice that is as unsteady as before , but louder . There can be no mistake this time . [He]1685-he can no longer distrust [his]1685-he good - luck ; and in one second , as if [he]1685-he could not obey [her]0-i quickly enough , [he]1685-he is hurrying back . [Sarah]135-sarah lifts [her]135-sarah arms deliberately from the gate , and rubs them gently to remove the slight numbness produced by contact with the cold iron . "[162-rivers] Blessed are [they]1689-they who let well alone ! " [she]0-i says , gently raising [her]0-i shoulders , and turning towards [the house]2521-the house . "[1689-they] [I]0-i have disqualified [myself]0-i for that benediction ; have not [I]0-i , [Slutty]1690-slutty ? " So saying , [she]0-i disappears . [Belinda]134-belinda would have liked to ask [her]0-i to stay , but [her]0-i pride forbids it . Long before [Rivers]162-rivers has reached [her]0-i , [she]0-i has repented of [her]0-i perverse and devil - born impulse . Why has [she]0-i called [him]162-rivers ? What has [she]0-i to say to [him]162-rivers when [he]162-rivers comes ? For the first moment [she]0-i says nothing . "[0-i] [You]0-i — [you]0-i called [me]0-i ? " [he]162-rivers asks , faltering , surprised at [her]0-i silence and [her]0-i strange look . "[0-i] Did [I]0-i ? " [she]0-i says , stammering . "[0-i] Yes — of course [I]0-i did ! [I]0-i — [I]0-i — [you]0-i leave [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge to - morrow ? " "[0-i] Do [I]0-i ? " [he]162-rivers answers blankly . Is this , then , what [she]0-i has called [him]162-rivers back for ?
