"[0-i] [You]0-i must know [your]0-i own plans best , " [she]0-i says , with a forced laugh ; "[0-i] do not [you]0-i leave [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge to - morrow ? " "[0-i] There is no need that [I]0-i should , " [he]162-rivers answers diffidently ; "[0-i] [I]0-i have a week 's holiday ! " [Her]0-i rebel pulses leap . A week ! A whole week ! [She]0-i lifts [her]0-i face , on which the sunset is mirrored , and looks towards [the west]3901-the west . On what a couch of fiery damask roses , dying into daffodil , the sun is laying [himself]162-rivers down ! What a treble sweetness the throstle is putting into [his]162-rivers song as [he]162-rivers addresses [himself]162-rivers to [his]162-rivers rest ! "[0-i] A week ! " [she]0-i says aloud . "[0-i] Does a week in two years seem to [you]1691-you such a long holiday ? " [he]162-rivers asks , rather wounded by what sounds to [him]162-rivers the cold wonder of [her]0-i tone ; "[0-i] it need not be spent here , if — " [He]162-rivers stops abruptly . "[1691-you] If [you]1691-you do not wish it , " would be the sentence 's natural ending ; but so to conclude it would be to suppose an interest , with which [he]162-rivers has no right nor any reason to credit [the wife of [Professor Forth]1604-professor forth]3852-the wife of professor forth , in [him]162-rivers and [his]162-rivers affairs . [She]0-i does not ask [him]162-rivers how [he]162-rivers had meant to finish [his]162-rivers phrase . [She]0-i does not finish it for [him]162-rivers . [She]0-i only stands staring , beneath the level penthouse of [her]0-i milky hands , at the blinding sunset . What a curve [her]0-i lifted elbow makes ! From what a marvel of wrist and forearm does the lawny sleeve fall back ! "[1691-you] Is this what [you]1691-you called [me]0-i for ? " [he]162-rivers asks abruptly ; "[1691-you] to tell [me]0-i that [I]0-i am to go to - morrow ? " For a minute [she]0-i stands irresolute , still looking sunwards ; [[her]0-i outward woman]3904-her outward woman a lovely pattern of harmony , grace , and quiet ; [[her]0-i inward woman]3905-her inward woman , ugly chaos and dark fight . Shall [she]0-i say "[1691-you] Yes " ? To say so would be to more than retrieve [her]0-i late error . Dimly [she]0-i feels that if [she]0-i has one ray of sober reason left [her]0-i , [she]0-i will say "[1691-you] Yes . " [She]0-i heaves a sigh , and lets fall [her]0-i hands . [Her]0-i lips have all but framed the fateful word , when : "[134-belinda] [Belinda]134-belinda ! [Belinda]134-belinda ! " comes an old voice , calling imperatively peevish from [the house]2521-the house . A week ! One poor week ! Only a week ! What can one week matter ? [Her]0-i manner has suddenly changed . "[134-belinda] It is [Mr. Forth]209-mr. forth ! " [she]0-i says hurriedly . "[209-mr. forth] [I]0-i called [you]209-mr. forth back , " reddening like the western cloud - fleeces , and throwing a guilty look over [her]0-i shoulder , "[0-i] to ask [you]209-mr. forth whether , if [you]209-mr. forth were not going to leave [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge to - morrow , [you]209-mr. forth — [you]209-mr. forth would join [our]1692-our party on [the water]2457-the water ? " In other climes , a sunset of suave sublimity usually means that it will be followed by a sunrise as nobly fair . But in [[our]1692-our free isle]3907-our free isle this is not the case . Even the weather will submit to no tyranny , but follows its own wild and freakish will . [You]209-mr. forth may close [your]209-mr. forth eyes upon a distant steady heaven of molten copper and speckless blue ; and open them upon a soaked - blanket sky , half an inch above [your]209-mr. forth head . During the many wakeful patches that vary the sameness of [her]0-i night , [Belinda]134-belinda has full time to repent of [her]0-i evening 's doings ; but not once does it occur to [her]0-i that the weather may possibly intervene to prohibit the excursion . Among all [her]0-i half - sincere plans for evading the expedition , the alternative of a wet day has not once suggested itself ; and when [the morn]3908-the morn comes , dim and sad , the poignancy of [her]0-i disappointment at sight of the dripping bushes and filled flower - cups shows [her]0-i how much of veracity there was in [her]0-i projects of abstinence . Now [she]0-i will have to endure the pang of renunciation , without having enjoyed the merit of self - conquest . And yet it is a lovely rain , not harshly driving , nor rudely strewing [the earth]2891-the earth with a ravin of torn - off petals ; but gently stealing down from the cloud - roof overhead , softly thrusting itself between the blossom - lips , feeding the juicy leaves , healthful , wealthful , beneficent , yet execrated by [two young eyes that are morosely watching it]3910-two young eyes that are morosely watching it . It is execrated by [two old ones]3911-two old ones also . [The Professor]2365-the professor tentatively throws out an idea as to the advisability of telegraphing to [the Archæological Society]88-the archæological society [his]2365-the professor inability to preside over [its]88-the archæological society deliberations . "[0-i] But [you]1694-you are not sugar or salt ! " cries [Belinda]134-belinda impatiently , as [she]134-belinda stands , a comforter thrown over [her]134-belinda arm , and a mackintosh extended to receive [[her]134-belinda husband]3353-her husband 's meagre person ; "[0-i] [you]1694-you will be in [cabs]1695-cabs and [trains]1696-trains all day . " "[0-i] It is not always easy to secure [a cab]1697-a cab at a moment 's notice on a wet day ! " replies [he]1694-you , demurring . "[0-i] As [I]0-i have often explained to [you]1694-you , it is upon trifles that the laws of health depend ; there may be delay enough to allow of [my]0-i getting [my]0-i feet thoroughly wet — a circumstance amply sufficient to throw a chill upon a liver already predisposed . " "[1694-you] But will not [you]1694-you be putting [the Society]1698-the society to great inconvenience ? will not [its members]1699-its members be very much disappointed ? " asks [she]134-belinda , reddening consciously as [she]134-belinda speaks . What is [she]134-belinda saying ? What does [she]134-belinda care whether [they]1699-its members are disappointed or not ? To what depths of disingenuousness has [she]134-belinda — truthful as [she]134-belinda has been hitherto counted [her]134-belinda life long — already descended ? But it may clear — it may clear ! "[0-i] [I]0-i might obviate the difficulty by taking an extra pair of socks in [my]0-i pocket to change at [the Club]1700-the club , " [he]1694-you says thoughtfully ; and then [her]134-belinda spirits rise , for [he]1694-you extends [his]1694-you arms , not to take a parting embrace , but to insert them in the waterproof - sleeves which [she]134-belinda , with wifely alacrity , holds ready to receive them . [He]1694-you is gone . That one main obstacle to [her]134-belinda pleasure is at all events removed . If only it would clear ! [She]134-belinda is no longer half - sincere with [herself]134-belinda . No longer does [she]134-belinda feign a desire to extricate [herself]134-belinda from the entanglement into which [she]134-belinda has plunged , nor a gratitude to [Mother Nature]259-nature for having come to [her]134-belinda aid . Without asking why [she]134-belinda wishes it , [she]134-belinda has concentrated all [her]134-belinda being upon the one mastering desire to see that cloud - curtain raise its trailing corners , transpierced and put to flight by such a sun as yesterday 's . "[0-i] It does not look in the least like lifting ! " [she]134-belinda says , in a tone which [she]134-belinda in vain tries to make sound careless , to [Sarah]135-sarah , as [they]3914-they enter [the drawing - room]3050-the drawing - room after breakfast . "[1701-you] Do [you]1701-you think that there is any chance of its lifting ? " "[1701-you] Not the slightest ! " replies [Sarah]135-sarah placidly . With that adaptability to circumstances which makes life to [her]134-belinda one long feast , [Miss Churchill]152-miss churchill has arranged [herself]134-belinda for a wet day . A small fire — not unwelcome in the rain - chilled atmosphere — brightens the hearth ; and to it [she]134-belinda has — for to [her]134-belinda nothing is sacred — pulled up [the Professor]2365-the professor 's chair : that one of [Mudie]296-mudie 's novels which , by its large type , wide margins , and plenitude of titled names , seems to promise the least strain upon the intellect , in [her]134-belinda hand . "[1701-you] Who would have thought it yesterday ? " says [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth , in a tone of mournful irritation , totally unable to follow [[her]271-mrs. forth philosophic sister]3917-her philosophic sister 's example , and fidgeting uneasily about [the room]422-the room . "[1701-you] Who indeed ? " rejoins [Sarah]135-sarah equably . There is something in the indifferent content of [her]134-belinda voice that jars upon [Belinda]134-belinda 's mood . The dogs have taken [their]3914-they cue from [Miss Churchill]152-miss churchill — [Punch]186-punch has got inside the fender as if it were winter ; the cat lies lazily stretched just outside the parrot 's cage ; and [Polly]183-maria , exasperated by [her]183-maria air of calm security , is walking stealthily , head downwards , along the side of [his]2365-the professor cage , and when [he]2365-the professor has got , as [he]2365-the professor thinks , within reach of [her]152-miss churchill , is stretching out first a vicious hooked nose , and then a long crooked grey hand , to make a grab at [her]152-miss churchill whiskers . [Sarah]135-sarah laughs . "[1701-you] [You]1702-you were so anxious for it yesterday , " says [Belinda]134-belinda , with an irrationally aggrieved accent . "[1702-you] Was [I]0-i ? " answers [Sarah]135-sarah , yawning . "[0-i] [I]0-i am not the least anxious for it now ; [I]0-i am thoroughly comfortable , thank God ! Why do not [you]1702-you come near the fire ? [I]0-i have a hundred questions to ask [you]1702-you ; [we]1703-we have [the house]2521-the house all to [ourselves]1703-we — excuse " ( parenthetically ) "[0-i] [my]0-i reckoning that among [our]1703-we advantages — and [I]0-i have scores of good things to tell [you]1702-you about [Cannes]24-cannes and [granny]156-granny ; [you]1702-you used to be fond of [grannyana]298-grannyana ! " "[1702-you] [I]0-i am not cold , " replies [Belinda]134-belinda , avoiding compliance by seating [herself]0-i where [she]0-i can at once command the window , and evade [[her]0-i sister]2366-her sister 's eyes . "[1705-them] Tell [them]1705-them [me]0-i here . " "[1705-them] Well , [you]1702-you must know , " begins [Sarah]135-sarah , prudently ignoring this ruse , and launching into [her]135-sarah narrative , "[1702-you] that [some Poles]1706-some poles had [the apartment above [ours]1703-we at [the hotel]1708-the hotel]1707-the apartment above ours at the hotel , [[their]1706-some poles salon]1709-their salon was over [[granny]156-granny 's bedroom]1710-granny 's bedroom , and every night , at about ten o'clock , [they]1706-some poles began to dance sarabands , and cancans , and [Highland]299-highland schottisches , and [the Lord]1711-the lord knows what in it ! [You]1702-you know how fond [granny]156-granny is of having [her]156-granny old head danced over when [she]156-granny is courting [her]156-granny beauty sleep . " [She]135-sarah pauses to see whether [[her]135-sarah hearer]3920-her hearer is listening ; it is obvious that [she]135-sarah is not , as for a moment or two [she]135-sarah makes no comment , and then , becoming aware of the silence , breaks into a factitious laugh . "[156-granny] Ha ! ha ! " "[156-granny] What are [you]1712-you laughing at ? " asks [Sarah]135-sarah sharply . "[1712-you] [I]0-i had not come to the point yet . " The other stops , embarrassed . "[1712-you] It — it was very good even so far as [you]1712-you had gone , " [she]135-sarah answers in confusion . "[1712-you] The end was better still , " replies [Miss Churchill]152-miss churchill shortly , taking up [her]152-miss churchill book again ; "[1712-you] but [you]1712-you shall never hear it ! " "[1712-you] How ill - natured ! " cries [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth , advancing eagerly towards the hearth , roused into alarm at [her]0-i own self - betrayal ; "[0-i] and [I]0-i — [I]0-i was so much interested in it , [I]0-i should like [you]1712-you to begin it all over again . " But [Sarah]135-sarah is inexorable . Presently Belinda desists from [her]0-i importunities , and not daring to return to the window , also takes up a book , occasionally from behind its shelter throwing a desperate eye on the weather . It is a hopeless wet day . Once or twice , indeed , there has been a tantalizing thinning of , and movement among , the vapours ; but it has ended only in a more resolute , inflexible fastening upon [the earth]2891-the earth . Eleven — that hour of clearing — has come and gone , and brought no clearing with it . After all , [she]0-i might as well have done [her]0-i plain duty , and sent [him]1712-you away . In that case [she]0-i would at least have had the throbs of an approving conscience to keep [her]0-i up . And what , pray , has [she]0-i now ? [The forenoon]3922-the forenoon is gone ; luncheon is over ; [they]3923-they are again in [the drawing - room]3050-the drawing - room . The novel has long ago dropped from [Sarah]135-sarah 's fingers , and [she]135-sarah has slidden into a warm , infantile slumber . The door - bell , loudly jangling , wakes [her]135-sarah with a jump . "[1712-you] It is [those hateful boys]1713-those hateful boys ! " [she]135-sarah cries petulantly , starting up . "[1713-those hateful boys] Am [I]0-i never to have any peace from [them]1713-those hateful boys ? and [I]0-i was in such a beautiful sleep ! " One glance at [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister 's face — [that sister who has obviously not shared [her]2366-her sister slumbers ; whose watch has been at length rewarded , though by no brightening of the material sky]3926-that sister who has obviously not shared her slumbers ; whose watch has been at length rewarded , though by no brightening of the material sky — tells [her]135-sarah who is among "[1713-those hateful boys] [those hateful boys]1713-those hateful boys . " Perhaps this fact adds a new tinge of ill - humour to [her]135-sarah tone , as [she]135-sarah advances , childishly rubbing [her]135-sarah drowsy eyes with [her]135-sarah knuckles , to meet [[her]135-sarah admirers]2781-her admirers . "[1713-those hateful boys] [You]1715-you woke [me]0-i ! " [she]135-sarah says , pouting . "[1715-you] [I]0-i was in such a beautiful sleep ! " This speech is not calculated to reassure [three timid young gentlemen]3928-three timid young gentlemen , who have already been questioning the wisdom of [their]3928-three timid young gentlemen own procedure , and doubtfully discussing among [themselves]3928-three timid young gentlemen the probabilities as to the mood , whether of summer warmth or December ice , that [they]3928-three timid young gentlemen will find [[their]3928-three timid young gentlemen hostess]826-their hostess in . Upon [Sarah]135-sarah , at least , [they]3928-three timid young gentlemen had counted to stand by [them]3928-three timid young gentlemen . But aid from an unexpected quarter comes to [them]3928-three timid young gentlemen . "[1716-her] Never mind [her]1716-her ! " says [Belinda]134-belinda , with a young and radiant smile of welcome and re - assurance . "[1716-her] What business has [she]1716-her to be asleep ? A wet day ? Yes , it is a wet day ; but what delicious warm rain ! how much good it will do to [the country]468-the country ! [the farmers]1718-the farmers are crying out for rain ! " This is the way in which [she]135-sarah now regards the lately - execrated downpour . Is [he]1716-her not [here]2351-here ? and whether in sunny boat on [flashing river]3931-flashing river , gathering fritillaries in [the water - meadows]3932-the water - meadows , or in little rain - darkened early - [English drawing - room]3933-english drawing - room , is not it now all one to [her]135-sarah ? "[0-i] [I]0-i hope [you]1719-you will forgive [our]1720-we calling so early , " says [Bellairs]282-bellairs , a little relieved , but still not very comfortable in [his]282-bellairs spirits ; "[1720-we] [we]1720-we — [we]1720-we wanted to know what [you]1719-you thought about [the river]463-the river . " "[1719-you] About [the river]463-the river ! " cries [Sarah]135-sarah , still cross and sleepy , casting a sarcastic glance , first at the weather , and then at [the young man]504-the young man ; "[1719-you] are [we]1720-we frogs , or young ducks ? " [He]504-the young man looks so silly , that [Miss Churchill]152-miss churchill laughs , [her]152-miss churchill good - humour at once restored . "[1719-you] Now that [you]1719-you are [here]2351-here , [you]1719-you may as well stay , " [she]152-miss churchill says , in a thoroughly wide - awake voice ; "[1724-they] may not [they]1724-they , [Belinda]134-belinda ? If [we]1720-we depend upon the charms of conversation , [I]0-i shall be asleep again in ten minutes ; why should not [we]1720-we play games ? " "[1720-we] Why not ? " responds [Belinda]134-belinda readily . [Her]134-belinda cheeks are pink , and [her]134-belinda eyes dancing . There is no pastime , however wildly , childishly hilarious , for which [she]134-belinda is not in tune . "[1720-we] Shouting Proverbs ! " suggests [Sarah]135-sarah joyously . "[1720-we] Not know Shouting Proverbs ? " ( with a reproving look at [Staveley]295-staveley , who has murmured this objection ) . "[354-everybody] Why , [everybody]354-everybody shouts , and one guesses ! " ( in lucid explanation ) . "[354-everybody] It makes a tremendous noise ; [I]0-i do not know that it has any other merit . " "[1726-the neighbours] [The neighbours]1726-the neighbours would indict [us]1720-we for a nuisance , " says [Belinda]134-belinda gaily , shaking [her]134-belinda head . "[1726-the neighbours] Russian Scandal ? " "[1726-the neighbours] It does not make noise enough , " says [Sarah]135-sarah ; "[1726-the neighbours] it is nothing but whispering ; [we]1720-we will have no whispering " ( rather curtly , and with an almost imperceptible glance towards [Rivers]162-rivers , in application of the warning ) . "[300-hare and hounds] [Hare and Hounds]300-hare and hounds is not a bad game in [a house]457-a house , " says [Mr. De Lisle]284-mr. de lisle , in a small , shy voice . "[1720-we] [We]1720-we played [Hare and Hounds]300-hare and hounds at [a house]457-a house [I]0-i was staying at the other day ; [we]1720-we ran all through [every room]1383-every room , from [attic]1730-attic to [cellar]1731-cellar ; it was great fun ! " "[0-i] [[Your]0-i friend]573-your friend evidently did not keep [a mother]711-a mother - in - law out of repair [upstairs]1081-upstairs , " replies [Sarah]135-sarah , dismissing at once , though with leniency , this not very bright suggestion ; "[0-i] [we]1720-we do . What does [the company]1194-the company say to [Post]301-post , eh ? " [The company]1194-the company , who are [one and all in the mood for riotous jollity in any form]3936-one and all in the mood for riotous jollity in any form , hail the proposal with one - voiced effusion ; and it is on the point of being carried into execution , when [Miss Churchill]152-miss churchill suggests an improvement upon it . "[1194-the company] Why not dance ? dancing is better than any games ! Surely [some one]2370-some one can play , or even whistle a tune , or set the musical - box tinkling out its one waltz . [Room]1737-room ? Plenty of [room]1737-room ! too much room ! Wheel all the furniture out into [the passage]1038-the passage ! " No sooner said than done . Away trundles [the early English suite of rush - bottomed chairs]3937-the early english suite of rush - bottomed chairs ; away [[the Professor]2365-the professor 's sacred fauteuil]3939-the professor 's sacred fauteuil ! away [Belinda]134-belinda 's work - table ! everything but the piano and the music - stool , to which [little De Lisle]284-mr. de lisle , having weakly admitted that [he]284-mr. de lisle can play a little dance music , is at once ruthlessly nailed . The rain patters , snow - soft outside . The valse strikes up . There is a moment 's hesitation . [Bellairs]282-bellairs and [Staveley]295-staveley , generously unwilling to steal a march upon [each other]469-each other , hang back ; but [Sarah]135-sarah settles the point by frisking up to the one nearest to [her]135-sarah — it is all one to [her]135-sarah with which [she]135-sarah dances ; it happens to be [Bellairs]282-bellairs — and swoops away with [him]282-bellairs smooth and sure as a swallow darting down upon a moth . Without a word exchanged between [them]3941-them , [Belinda]134-belinda finds [herself]134-belinda in [Rivers]162-rivers ' arms . The rain plash - plashes upon the open window 's sill . How long it is since [she]134-belinda has danced ! How madly exhilarating are motion and measure ! Is it in [heaven]1300-heaven or upon [earth]698-earth that that lame waltz is being strummed ? After a turn or two [he]284-mr. de lisle feels [her]134-belinda light and buoyant body grow heavy in [his]284-mr. de lisle embrace . "[1741-your] Stop ! " [she]134-belinda says dizzily ; "[1741-your] [the room]422-the room goes round . " [He]284-mr. de lisle obeys at once ; and fearing lest [she]134-belinda may fall , keeps for one moment [his]284-mr. de lisle arm around [her]134-belinda . "[1741-your] It is so long since [I]0-i danced , " [she]134-belinda says , lifting one white hand to [her]134-belinda giddy eyes ; "[1741-your] so long ! so long ! not since — " [She]134-belinda breaks off . "[1741-your] Not since [your]1741-your — " [He]284-mr. de lisle also breaks off . But [she]134-belinda is none the less firmly and irrevocably [we]1742-we d , because of [his]284-mr. de lisle inability to say "[1741-your] [your]1741-your marriage . " "[1741-your] Not since long before then , " rejoins [she]134-belinda , hurriedly interrupting , with a nervous dread lest [he]284-mr. de lisle may complete the phrase ; "[1741-your] not since — [Dresden]2-dresden . " "[1741-your] But [we]1742-we never danced in — [Dresden]2-dresden , " [he]284-mr. de lisle says , making the same slight pause as [she]134-belinda had done before the name of the , to [them]1742-we , [sacred city]3944-sacred city . "[1741-your] [You]1741-your did not , perhaps , " [she]134-belinda answers with a charming saucy smile — for under the unwonted joyous excitement [her]134-belinda spirits are towering perilously high—"but[0-i] [I]0-i did . [Some Gardereiters]1743-some gardereiters came in one evening , and [I]0-i took a turn with two of [them]1743-some gardereiters ; it was before [your]1741-your day . " Distant as is the epoch alluded to , and satisfactorily as [he]284-mr. de lisle had been persuaded at the time by ocular evidence of the reciprocal indifference of [Belinda]134-belinda and [the Saxon officers]3945-the saxon officers , [he]284-mr. de lisle can not avoid a feeling of biting jealousy and offence against those innocent and both in time and space far off [German valseurs]3946-german valseurs . "[0-i] At least it is [my]0-i day now , " [he]284-mr. de lisle says with emphasis ; and [she]134-belinda offering no contradiction , away [they]1742-we float into [their]1742-we trance again . The valse ends ; [the patient De Lisle]284-mr. de lisle begins to hammer out a galop . [They]1742-we must part ; for [Bellairs]282-bellairs , emboldened thereto by [Sarah]135-sarah 's warm approbation , is inviting [Belinda]134-belinda , and [she]134-belinda dare not refuse . [Rivers]162-rivers dances with [Miss Churchill]152-miss churchill . Why need [he]162-rivers ? Why need [he]162-rivers dance at all ? Why , above all , need [he]162-rivers throw such spirit and animation into [his]162-rivers dancing ? [He]162-rivers looks as if [he]162-rivers were enjoying [himself]162-rivers as much as [Sarah]135-sarah . [Staveley]295-staveley , after having vainly endeavoured to educate [Slutty]157-slutty into [a partner]3947-a partner ( [Slutty]157-slutty , on unwilling hind - legs , and with tail abjectly tucked in , perhaps in the laudable intention of giving [herself]135-sarah a more human air ) , galops bravely by [himself]295-staveley . The galop ends . [The musician]3948-the musician , bringing out of [his]3948-the musician treasures things new and old , treats them to a venerable polka . Once more [he]295-staveley and [she]135-sarah are together ; and in what a different spirit [her]135-sarah light feet now move ! [Bellairs]282-bellairs had found [her]135-sarah but [a disappointing partner]3949-a disappointing partner ; inert , and often begging to be allowed to stop and take breath . In [Rivers]162-rivers ' arms , [her]135-sarah life 's tides are running at their highest . It is [Staveley]295-staveley 's turn to be [[Sarah]135-sarah 's danseur]3950-sarah 's danseur , and [Bellairs]282-bellairs , emulating [[his]282-bellairs friend]3951-his friend 's former example , polks alone . But not altogether with [[his]282-bellairs friend]3951-his friend 's success . For [Punch]186-punch , inspired by a scientific curiosity to investigate the strange phenomena that have appeared on [his]186-punch horizon , unhappily runs between [his]186-punch legs , and brings [him]186-punch to [the earth]2891-the earth with some clamour . [The player]3954-the player stops : [the dancers]3955-the dancers pause . "[0-i] [We]1744-we have had enough of this , " says [Sarah]135-sarah , drawing [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister into the window for an aside , and speaking with some brusqueness ; "[1744-we] it is not fair upon [that poor boy]1745-that poor boy " ( indicating [De Lisle]284-mr. de lisle ) ; "[1745-that poor boy] [he]1745-that poor boy is getting cross , though [he]1745-that poor boy tries not to show it . As [I]0-i have not three legs and arms like [the Isle of Man]302-the isle of man , [I]0-i can not dance with [them]1746-them all at once , and [you]1747-you are not much help ! Let [us]1744-we try something else . " "[1744-we] By all means , " answers [Belinda]134-belinda hurriedly , shrinking away from the reproach that [her]134-belinda conscience tells [her]134-belinda [she]134-belinda so richly deserves ; "[1744-we] anything ! whatever [you]1747-you please ! " "[1747-you] The ball is ended , " says [Sarah]135-sarah authoritatively , returning to [the young men]3670-the young men , and clapping [her]135-sarah hands to enforce silence ; "[1747-you] but if the company pleases it will be immediately followed by some athletic sports . What does [everyone]3028-everyone say to a game of [Blind Man]1749-blind man 's Buff ? " This second proposal is received with an enthusiasm as much hotter than the former as may be expected from the universal loosening of the bonds of shyness and conventionality which has taken place since that former one was first made . [Sarah]135-sarah at once volunteers to be blind - folded ; and in two minutes [she]135-sarah is established in the middle of [the little room]2897-the little room , a Liberty silk handkerchief tied over [her]135-sarah jovial eyes , and [her]135-sarah hands outstretched in futile blind groping and grabbing . The rest of [the party]3959-the party , in the most approved fashion , pull [her]135-sarah gown , tweak [her]135-sarah hair , nip [her]135-sarah sleeve ; but not for long . With one well - directed lunge — so well directed as to rouse an instant loud cry of dishonesty — [she]135-sarah has pounced upon [Bellairs]282-bellairs , who in [his]282-bellairs turn is blind - folded — is in [his]282-bellairs turn tweaked and nipped — and in [his]282-bellairs turn catches [Rivers]162-rivers ; [Rivers]162-rivers catches [Belinda]134-belinda . The fun waxes fast and furious . [They]3960-they have raised every grain of dust latent in the carpet ; [Punch]186-punch is cheering [them]3960-they on by volleys of delighted short barks , while [Slutty]157-slutty sits wretchedly in a corner with [her]157-slutty face to the wall . Most madly mirthful of all — most intemperately gay , out - [Heroding Herod]175-herod , out - doing [Sarah]135-sarah in [her]135-sarah wildest mood , with splendid poppy - cheeks and lightening eyes — is [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth . [She]271-mrs. forth has been old so long — so long ! [She]271-mrs. forth is making up the arrears of [her]271-mrs. forth lost youth . The clamour is at its loudest . Scarcely less blowzed — bawling scarcely less noisily than were [the Primrose family in [neighbour [Flamborough]89-flamborough 's kitchen]3962-neighbour flamborough 's kitchen]3961-the primrose family in neighbour flamborough 's kitchen , when annihilated by the entrance of [Lady Blarney]303-lady blarney and [Miss Caroline Wilhelmina Amelia Skeggs]304-miss caroline wilhelmina amelia skeggs — is the society gathered on that wet May afternoon in [Professor Forth 's decent drawing - room]3963-professor forth 's decent drawing - room . [Belinda]134-belinda , caught for the second time , stands blind - folded in the middle of [the room]422-the room , while shouts of uproarious laughter greet [her]134-belinda vain efforts to gain hold of any of [the assailants who lustily beset [her]134-belinda]3965-the assailants who lustily beset her . All of a sudden , in one instant there is silence . The pushing , and jostling , and nipping have altogether ceased . Without any attempt at resistance [some one]2370-some one is in [her]134-belinda clasp . "[1749-blind man] [I]0-i have got [you]1750-you ! " cries [she]134-belinda , in a voice of jubilant triumph ; "[1749-blind man] who are [you]1750-you ? " and so tears the bandage from [her]134-belinda eyes . It is indeed true that [she]134-belinda is grasping [Rivers]162-rivers ' coat - sleeve in indisputable conquest : but , at the moment that [she]134-belinda verifies this fact , the cause of [his]162-rivers having fallen so easy a prey , the cause of the instantaneous and entire muteness that has fallen upon [the so boisterous little assemblage]3967-the so boisterous little assemblage , breaks in horror upon [her]134-belinda stunned eyes . The door is half open , and through it [Professor Forth]136-professor forth is looking , with an expression hard to qualify upon [his]136-professor forth face , at the entertainment got up with such spirit and success in [his]136-professor forth absence . Not for long , however . In a moment [he]136-professor forth has softly closed the door again and withdrawn . For several moments [they]3968-they stand staring at [each other]469-each other speechless and aghast . [Belinda]134-belinda 's look wanders in consternation from one to other of the faces round [her]134-belinda . Disordered hair , red - hot cheeks , panting breath , rampagious eyes ! [Bedlam]305-bedlam might easily turn out [a saner - looking party]3970-a saner - looking party . In comparison of [them]305-bedlam [[Cornus]306-cornus ' crew]3971-cornus ' crew were [an orderly Philistine band]3972-an orderly philistine band . [The men]3973-the men are bad enough , but [Sarah]135-sarah — but [herself]135-sarah ! [Bacchante]307-bacchante and romp mixed in just and fine proportions as [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister looks , [her]135-sarah stricken conscience tells [her]135-sarah that [she]135-sarah [herself]135-sarah far outdoes [her]135-sarah , though [she]135-sarah dares not ask the looking - glass for confirmation of this conviction ; but during the past mad hour has not [Sarah]135-sarah been tame and mild when compared with [her]135-sarah ? "[1750-you] Had not [we]1751-we better be going ? " says [Bellairs]282-bellairs at last , in a lamb 's voice , in which [no one]365-no one would recognise the hilarious bellow of five minutes ago . "[1750-you] [I]0-i think that there can be no two opinions on that head , " replies [Sarah]135-sarah drily . As [she]135-sarah speaks [she]135-sarah turns to [[her]135-sarah dazed elder]3976-her dazed elder , and lowers [her]135-sarah voice . "[1750-you] Had not [you]1752-he better go and ask [him]1752-he whether [he]1752-he feels inclined to join [us]1751-we ? " [Belinda]134-belinda turns in stupid compliance towards the door . As [she]134-belinda makes [her]134-belinda difficult way through [the little passage]3977-the little passage , blocked with articles of furniture piled one atop of another , [her]134-belinda consternation deepens . [He]1752-he must have had to climb like a cat over [his]1752-he own armchair in order to gain ingress into [[his]1752-he own drawing - room]3978-his own drawing - room ! It is impossible ! It would be adding insult to injury to present [herself]134-belinda before [him]1752-he in [her]134-belinda present dishevelment . [She]134-belinda must needs repair to [[her]134-belinda own room]2768-her own room ; must needs , with intense repugnance , snatch a glance at [her]134-belinda own disordered image in the toilet - glass . The case is even worse than [she]134-belinda had feared . There is even more of the Moenad than [she]134-belinda had apprehended in [her]134-belinda reflection . But there is no time to be lost . Each moment that passes , leaving [her]134-belinda offence unacknowledged , lends it a deeper dye . A brush snatched up and hastily applied to [her]134-belinda revolted hair ; two hand - palms , but they are hot too , held for a moment to [her]134-belinda blazing cheeks in the vain effort to cool them , and [she]134-belinda is off again . Outside [his]1752-he door [she]134-belinda hesitates an instant , listening in scared heart - sinking ; but there is no sound audible within , so , plucking up what courage [she]134-belinda may , [she]134-belinda enters . [He]1752-he is seated at [his]1752-he writing - table , in the leathern chair in which [she]134-belinda has passed such count - less hours of ennui and fatigue , slaving in [his]1752-he service . The thought emboldens [her]134-belinda a little , and [she]134-belinda advances up [the room]422-the room and stands beside [him]1752-he . "[1752-he] May [I]0-i take [your]1753-you place ? " [she]134-belinda asks in a rather faltering voice . "[0-i] [I]0-i am quite ready . " It is a whole minute before [he]1752-he answers . There is no plainer mode of showing resentment than by letting sixty seconds elapse between a question addressed to [you]1753-you and [your]1753-you answer . Then : "[0-i] [I]0-i am obliged to [you]0-i , " [he]1752-he answers woodenly , still writing ; "[0-i] but [I]0-i think that , in its present condition , [your]0-i mind is scarcely capable of serious employment ! " There is something so galling in the implication that [her]134-belinda spirit rises . "[0-i] Do [you]1753-you think that [I]0-i am drunk ? " [she]134-belinda asks violently ; then , recollecting how gravely in the wrong [she]134-belinda has been , [she]134-belinda masters [herself]134-belinda , and says apologetically : "[1753-you] [I]0-i am very sorry ; it was very foolish ; but — but — [I]0-i did not expect [you]1753-you [home]2345-home by [so early a train]1755-so early a train . " [He]1752-he gives a little odious , though perhaps pardonable , laugh . "[0-i] That fact was sufficiently obvious . " "[0-i] [I]0-i am very sorry , " [she]134-belinda repeats again , with uneasy iteration , shifting wretchedly from one foot to the other , as [she]134-belinda stands in [her]134-belinda culpritship before [him]1752-he ; "[0-i] but — but it was so wet , and [we]1756-we could not get out , and — and it was so long since [I]0-i had danced or played at any games ! " There is a wistful accent audible even to [herself]134-belinda in [her]134-belinda voice , and [she]134-belinda looks at [him]1752-he with a sort of forlorn hope that [he]1752-he may be touched by it . If [he]1752-he is , [he]1752-he masters it admirably . "[0-i] Indeed ! " [he]1752-he answers cuttingly . "[0-i] Well , next time that such an impulse seizes [you]0-i , [I]0-i should be obliged by [your]0-i choosing some other spot than [[my]0-i house]1317-my house to turn into [a bear - garden]1758-a bear - garden ! " [She]134-belinda had thought that [her]134-belinda cheeks were already as hot as cheeks could be , but the sudden influx of blood that [his]1752-he words send pulsing into them shows [her]134-belinda [her]134-belinda mistake . Hitherto , shame at and repentance of [her]134-belinda frolic , joined with a sincere desire to make amends for it , have been [her]134-belinda predominant emotions ; now at once they vanish , and give place to a biting sense of injustice and aversion . "[0-i] After all , it was no such great crime , " [she]134-belinda says in a hard voice , in which is no trace of the gentle , humble key of [her]134-belinda earlier utterance ; "[0-i] it was silly , perhaps , " with a burning blush , "[0-i] but it was an innocent enough wet - day amusement ! " "[0-i] It is an innocent wet - day amusement against the recurrence of which [I]0-i shall take measures to secure [myself]0-i , " [he]1752-he replies resentfully . There is something , or [she]134-belinda fancies so , of menacing in [his]1752-he tone , at which [her]134-belinda gorge rises . "[0-i] [You]0-i forget , " [she]134-belinda says , in a low but extremely distinct voice , "[0-i] that [I]0-i am young . If [you]0-i had married [a wife of [your]0-i own age]1759-a wife of your own age , it would have been different ; but [you]0-i must remember that [I]0-i am at the beginning of life , and [you]0-i at the end ! " Having delivered [herself]134-belinda of this amiable reminder , [she]134-belinda walks towards the door , not giving one glance to see how far [her]134-belinda shaft has gone [home]2345-home . On reaching [[her]134-belinda own room]2768-her own room [she]134-belinda breaks into hysterical sobbing . "[1760-he] If [he]1760-he had taken it differently , [he]1760-he might have made [a friend]1315-a friend for life of [me]0-i ! " [she]134-belinda cries . This is , perhaps , putting it a little strongly . [One]373-one would have thought that upon [the most inveterate pleasure - seekers]3984-the most inveterate pleasure - seekers such a cold - water douche could not have been poured without producing a permanently healing effect ; that never again would [the members of the little band]3985-the members of the little band , so disastrously surprised in mid - romp by [the Professor of Etruscan]3719-the professor of etruscan , lift up [their]3985-the members of the little band humbled heads from the dust , into which that one glance of [his]1760-he narrow eye had abased [them]3985-the members of the little band . And yet it is but too true — such is the potency of the spring and youth spirits , when [they]3985-the members of the little band meet in lusty embrace — that before forty - eight hours are over [they]3985-the members of the little band are planning another excursion . A whole long day spent chiefly in [her]134-belinda own society , for [Belinda]134-belinda has had to expiate by working double tides [her]134-belinda short idleness , has convinced [Sarah]135-sarah of the wisdom and necessity of catering for [her]134-belinda own amusement . By some means , whether of writing , or meeting on neutral ground , [she]134-belinda has established a communication with [Bellairs]282-bellairs and [[his]282-bellairs friends]3987-his friends ; and in [their]3985-the members of the little band eager hands , guided by [her]134-belinda commanding spirit , the project of a new expedition for the following day — [i.e.]3988-i.e. , the day but one after [their]3985-the members of the little band being put to the rout — speedily takes shape . It is indeed shorn of [its]3989-its former noble proportions , for it is not likely that [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth will soon be indulged with another whole holiday ; but upon a part — the latter part — of the afternoon [she]134-belinda may , without undue sanguineness , reckon as lawfully [her]134-belinda own ; and now that the evenings are so long , it is of little consequence how late , whether lit by red sun or white moon , [they]3985-the members of the little band return . [Belinda]134-belinda has no share in the formation of the plan . [She]134-belinda knows of it , indeed . Did [she]134-belinda not know of it , would [she]134-belinda not have broken down under the pitiless labours of the interminable day that intervenes between it and its abortive predecessor ? A sort of superstition keeps [her]134-belinda from inquiring as to any of its details . To take for granted that it will happen , will , judging by all precedent and analogy , probably prevent it . Much less dares [she]134-belinda ask whether [Rivers]162-rivers is to be included in it . "[1760-he] [I]0-i do not even know of whom [your]1762-your party consists , " [she]134-belinda says at last , over - night , to [[her]134-belinda sister]2366-her sister , emboldened by the after - dinner twilight , in which [they]3991-they are strolling round and round [the odorous garden plat]3992-the odorous garden plat , and fondly trusting that for once [that sister]2367-that sister 's acuteness may be at fault , and not detect the ill - hidden motive of [her]134-belinda words . "[0-i] Of whom it consists ? " repeats [Sarah]135-sarah carelessly , lifting and spreading out one hand , and striking the fingers , one after one , with the index of the other . "[1762-your] [You]1762-your , " touching the thumb , "[0-i] [I]0-i , [Mr. Bellairs]282-bellairs , [Mr. Staveley]295-staveley , [Mr. De Lisle]284-mr. de lisle . " [She]134-belinda has reached the little finger , and there pauses . "[284-mr. de lisle] [Two ladies]1763-two ladies and [three men]2719-three men ? " comments [Belinda]134-belinda , in tremulous interrogation . [Sarah]135-sarah does not contradict [her]134-belinda . "[284-mr. de lisle] [We]1765-we should have been six last time , " says [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth , after a short silence . "[1765-we] Yes , six , " assents [Sarah]135-sarah . [Belinda]134-belinda 's heart beats low . [She]134-belinda withdraws [her]134-belinda hand from [[her]134-belinda sister]2366-her sister 's arm , upon which it has been resting , ostensibly to hold up [her]134-belinda gown ; but in a moment that gown is again trailing unregarded behind [her]134-belinda . Why has [she]134-belinda been gazing with such elation at the steady roses and ambers of [the west]3901-the west ? Promise - breaking as evening skies are , surely no sky could break such a promise as this ! If what [Sarah]135-sarah implies be true , what does it matter whether that promise be kept or broken ? "[1766-you] [You]1766-you have not asked [Mr. Rivers]162-rivers ? " [she]135-sarah says at last , with abrupt desperation , seeing that [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister volunteers no further information . "[162-rivers] [I]0-i have certainly not asked [him]162-rivers , " replies [Sarah]135-sarah gravely , with a slight stress upon the pronoun . [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth does not perceive the significant accentuation ; and only gathers that [her]271-mrs. forth fears are realized . It is a moment or two before [she]271-mrs. forth can speak . Then , "[0-i] That was civil ! " [she]271-mrs. forth says , in a resentful low key ; "[0-i] but [I]0-i suppose that in the case of [a common workman in an iron foundry]1767-a common workman in an iron foundry — " "[0-i] Stay ! " interrupts [Sarah]135-sarah calmly , "[0-i] before [you]1766-you say anything more , for which [you]1766-you might afterwards be sorry . [I]0-i may as well tell [you]1766-you that [he]162-rivers is invited . [I]0-i had , God knows , no hand in it ; but [Mr. Bellairs]282-bellairs invited [him]162-rivers , and very officious [I]0-i think it was of [him]162-rivers ! " The morning has come . The sunset has been better than its word . No average fair day is this , upon which it simply does not rain , but one that earth , air , and sky from morn to eve vie in nobly decking ; such a day as that one before which [old George Herbert]308-old george herbert poured the nard and spices of [his]308-old george herbert curious sweet verse , which for two hundred years has risen to most hearts and lips on any day of unusual summer splendour . It is certain that this time the weather at least will throw no obstacle in [her]271-mrs. forth way . The forenoon , of hot labour to [the one sister]3997-the one sister , of luxurius cool idling to the other , is past and gone . So is luncheon . The hour for departure draws near . [Sarah]135-sarah is already dressed ; dressed to the last button of [her]135-sarah Paris gloves ; to the last bewitching pinch given to the fantastic rural hat , whose pulling to pieces and rebuilding has largely helped in the beguiling of [her]135-sarah lonely morning . [Belinda]134-belinda , usually punctual , and to - day , as [one]373-one would think , with treble motives for punctuality , has not yet appeared . But just as [the impatient Sarah]135-sarah is turning over in [her]135-sarah mind the advisability of hurrying [her]135-sarah by a call , [she]135-sarah enters . At sight of [her]135-sarah , an exclamation of surprise and remonstrance rises to [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister 's lips . "[162-rivers] Not dressed yet ? " For , indeed , about [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth there is no appearance of festal preparation ; [her]271-mrs. forth head is uncovered ; [she]271-mrs. forth is in [her]271-mrs. forth usual working morning gown — a gown to which traditions of ink and folios seem continually to adhere ; [her]271-mrs. forth steps are languid , and [her]271-mrs. forth eyes dead . "[162-rivers] [I]0-i am not going , " [she]271-mrs. forth answers doggedly , throwing [herself]271-mrs. forth into a chair . "[162-rivers] [I]0-i must give it up ! " "[0-i] Give it up ? " repeats [the other]2396-the other , with an incredulity born of the recollection of [Belinda]134-belinda 's passionately eager watching of the sunset over - night ; "[0-i] why ? " "[0-i] [He]1768-his can not spare [me]0-i , " replies [Belinda]134-belinda , in a dull , level tone ; "[1768-his] [he]1768-his says that [he]1768-his is ill . " "[1768-his] Ill ? what is the matter with [him]1768-his ? "[0-i] It is always either [his]1768-his heart or [his]1768-his liver ; except now and then when it is [his]1768-his spleen ! " "[1769-you] Whichever it is , " says [Sarah]135-sarah bluntly — "[0-i] and [I]0-i suppose [you]1769-you mean to imply that it is not any of them , really — [I]0-i do not see what good [you]1769-you can do ! " "[0-i] [I]0-i can give [him]1768-his [his]1768-his drops , " replies [Belinda]134-belinda , with the same artificial tameness ; then , life coming back in poignant pain into [her]0-i tone : "[0-i] While [you]1769-you are on [the river]463-the river , [I]0-i shall be giving [him]1768-his [his]1768-his drops ! Oh ! " turning over writhingly in [her]0-i chair , and half burying [her]0-i face in the cushion , "[1772-they] what will not [the river]463-the river be to - day ! [You]1769-you will lie under the willows ; [they]1772-they will push [[your]1769-you boat]1773-your boat right under the branches ! [You]1769-you have never done it ; [you]1769-you do not know what it is to lie under the willows on a day like this ! " [She]0-i ends with something not far removed from a sob ; then , sitting upright again , and resentfully regarding [[her]0-i sister]2366-her sister : "[1769-you] [You]1769-you do not seem very sorry : if [one]373-one were of a suspicious disposition , one might almost say [you]1769-you looked glad . " "[1769-you] As usual [you]1769-you are beside the mark , " replies [Sarah]135-sarah calmly . " "[213-mrs. baker] Of course not ! " cries [Belinda]134-belinda , catching eagerly at this suggestion , and with a feeling as of a burden most unaccountably lightened ; "[213-mrs. baker] it would be quite out of the question ! " How comparatively easy it will be to administer [Professor Forth]136-professor forth 's drops , with no simultaneous mental consciousness maddening [her]0-i of the dazzling water , the sheltering grey - green willow - arch , and of [Rivers lying beneath]4003-rivers lying beneath [it]2457-the water , laughing as [Sarah]135-sarah , alas ! knows how to make [him]136-professor forth laugh , stretched in lazy forgetful enjoyment at [her]0-i feet . "[213-mrs. baker] [I]0-i could ask [Mrs. Baker]213-mrs. baker whether [she]213-mrs. baker would take [you]1778-you , " [she]0-i says slowly , in reluctant suggestion ; "[213-mrs. baker] [she]213-mrs. baker is fond of [the river]463-the river , and [she]213-mrs. baker lives only two houses off . " [Belinda]134-belinda writes on : that most unkillable of plants — hope — sending up a little fresh shoot in [her]134-belinda heart ; after all , fate may be kind . [It]4004-it may have sent [Mrs. Baker]213-mrs. baker a previous engagement , a headache — what not ? But fate disdains to be dictated to . "[1780-they] [She]1782-she will be delighted , " says [Sarah]135-sarah , returning in an impossibly short space of time ; [Sarah]135-sarah , who , to ensure the greater security and speed , has insisted upon being [herself]135-sarah [the bearer of the note]4006-the bearer of the note . "[0-i] [I]0-i will go with [you]1783-you as far as the corner , " [she]0-i says feverishly , catching up a shabby garden - hat , and throwing it on [her]0-i hot head as [she]0-i speaks . Before [she]0-i has gone six yards [she]0-i has repented of [her]0-i impulse . There seems to be in these days not one of [her]0-i actions of which [she]0-i does not repent before it is halfway to execution . Why should [she]0-i , of [her]0-i own free will , forcing [him]1783-you to a comparison between [them]4009-them , set [herself]0-i , poor workaday drudge as [she]0-i is , beside [this charming holiday creature]4010-this charming holiday creature — so delicately fine , so infectiously gay ? Even now [she]0-i would go back , but it is too late . [The young men]3670-the young men have caught sight of [her]0-i : in a moment [they]3670-the young men have all met . [Rivers]162-rivers exhales a heavy sight of relief . [He]162-rivers has had bad dreams , and a dragging presage of ill - luck hanging about [him]162-rivers ; but both dreams and presage are as false as dreams and presages mostly are . Had not [they]3670-the young men told [him]162-rivers that [she]0-i would be prevented coming ? and is not [she]0-i here standing in beautiful bodily presence before [him]162-rivers ? " [She]135-sarah addresses [him]162-rivers so decidedly that [he]162-rivers has no alternative but to answer [her]135-sarah , nor does [she]135-sarah again let [him]162-rivers go . Before [Belinda]134-belinda can realize that it is so , [they]1785-we are all off , walking away from [her]135-sarah — away to [the river]463-the river and [the willows]4019-the willows . Without one word of regret for [her]135-sarah absence , without even an inquiry as to the cause of that absence , [he]162-rivers is gone — gone a - pleasuring ! [His]162-rivers face indeed looked blank for a moment , but for how long , pray ? Does it look blank still ? Will it look blank under the willows ? If [her]135-sarah withdrawal from the party had been to [him]162-rivers what [his]162-rivers would have been to [her]135-sarah , would [he]162-rivers have gone at all ? would not [he]162-rivers have framed some excuse for escape at the last moment ? Nor does [she]135-sarah , in [her]135-sarah unjust heart - bitterness , reflect that [he]162-rivers could have taken no surer way of compromising [the woman [he]162-rivers loved]4020-the woman he loved ! Happily perhaps for [her]135-sarah , [she]135-sarah is not long able to give [herself]135-sarah up undisturbed to reflections of the above kind . [She]135-sarah must needs retun without further delay to [her]135-sarah treadmill . It is true that the morning , and the morning 's [Menander]287-menander , are over — ill as is [the Professor]2365-the professor , [he]2365-the professor is not too ill for [Menander]287-menander — but [her]135-sarah afternoon taskwork is still unperformed ; [her]135-sarah daily two hours ' ministrations to [[her]135-sarah imbecile mother - in - law]4022-her imbecile mother - in - law — two hours during which [[that mother - in - law]4023-that mother - in - law 's attendant]4024-that mother - in - law 's attendant is released , and sent out into the fresh air to lay in a stock of ozone and endurance to support [her]135-sarah through the other twenty - two . The thought of [[her]135-sarah fellow drudge]4025-her fellow drudge makes [Belinda]134-belinda remorsefully hasten [her]135-sarah steps . What business has [she]135-sarah , with [her]135-sarah selfish repinings , to defer and shorten [that other drudge]4026-that other drudge 's holiday ? "[162-rivers] Do not hurry back , " [she]135-sarah says good - naturedly , as [she]135-sarah relieves guard . "[162-rivers] It is a lovely day ; take [your]1786-you time and enjoy [yourself]1786-you ; [I]0-i am in no hurry . " Oven - like as is the temperature of [[old Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth 's room]4027-old mrs. forth 's room , [her]135-sarah easy - chair is drawn up close to the blazing fire . The chill of extremest eld is upon [her]135-sarah . [Her]135-sarah mind is so completely gone , that [she]135-sarah is incapable of recognizing or identifying even [the persons]4028-the persons habitually about [her]135-sarah ; nor does [her]135-sarah daily interview with [[her]135-sarah daughter - in - law]4029-her daughter - in - law ever begin with any other phrase than : "[0-i] Who are [you]1786-you , [[my]0-i dear]2421-my dear ? " [Her]135-sarah conversation , which never ceases , consists of this question repeated ad infinitum ; of inquiries after [various long - dead members of [[her]135-sarah family]1139-her family , supposed by [her]135-sarah to be alive and sometimes even in [the room]422-the room]4030-various long - dead members of her family , supposed by her to be alive and sometimes even in the room ; and of information such as that [[her]135-sarah father]4033-her father has been sitting with [her]135-sarah ( if [he]4033-her father were alive [he]4033-her father would be one hundred and sixty years old ! ) , and that it is wonderful how [he]4033-her father keeps [his]4033-her father memory . [Belinda]134-belinda seats [herself]134-belinda beside [her]135-sarah . After all , it requires no great call upon the intellect to repeat at intervals in a slow , loud voice ( for , with the other faculties , hearing too is gone ): "[0-i] [I]0-i am [Belinda]134-belinda ! [Belinda Forth]134-belinda — [[James]243-james 's wife]1788-james 's wife ; [[your]243-james son]1789-your son [[James]243-james 's wife]1788-james 's wife ! " varied occasionally by such answers as these , called forth by appropriate inquires , "[243-james] [He]243-james is dead ! " "[243-james] [He]243-james died twenty - five years ago ! " "[243-james] [Woking Cemetery]90-woking cemetery ! " But between [her]134-belinda mechanical words there is plenty of room to interpolate thoughts that but little match them . "[1791-they] [They]1791-they must have reached [the river]463-the river by now . Have [they]1791-they walked all the way in the same order as that in which [they]1791-they set off ? [He]243-james and [Sarah]135-sarah ahead , and [the rest herding behind]1793-the rest herding behind . Of course [they]1791-they have . Since [both]2453-both are pleased with the arrangement , why change it ? How murderously hot this fire is ! Is it inside [her]134-belinda that it is burning ? [They]1791-they are embarked now . Have [they]1791-they chosen a punt , or a pair - oar ? Perhaps both , since there are six of [them]1791-they . In that case [the party]3959-the party will divide ; but how ? " It is easy to tell , by the writhing of [her]134-belinda hands , in what manner [she]134-belinda pictures that division effected . Virtually , then , it will be a tête - à - tête . It will be alone together that [they]1791-they will lie under the willows ! [Belinda]134-belinda 's attention wanders wide . Twice [she]134-belinda has answered , "[3959-the party] [Woking Cemetery]90-woking cemetery ! " when [she]134-belinda should have answered "[3959-the party] [[James]243-james 's wife]1788-james 's wife " ; and is on the point of repeating the error a third time , when a vague fidgetiness in [[her]134-belinda interlocutor]2747-her interlocutor 's manner — hazily conscious of something gone wrong — recalls [her]134-belinda to [herself]134-belinda . The two hours march by . [The nurse]4035-the nurse has taken [her]134-belinda at [her]134-belinda word , and is extending a little the border of [her]134-belinda liberty . Presently [the Professor]2365-the professor enters : enters to pay that punctual daily five minutes ' visit , which is the share [he]2365-the professor contributes towards the tendance of [[his]2365-the professor parent]4037-his parent . For a wonder , [she]134-belinda knows [him]2365-the professor , without being told who [he]2365-the professor is . "[3959-the party] Where is [[your]1797-your father]1798-your father , [James]243-james ? " is [her]134-belinda first question . "[243-james] Gone , [[my]0-i mother]614-my mother . " "[243-james] Gone ! " ( with great animation and surprise ) , "[243-james] gone where ? " "[614-my mother] To [the Better Land]1800-the better land , [[my]0-i mother]614-my mother " ( very loud ) . "[614-my mother] Oh indeed ! Well , [I]0-i only hope that [they]1802-they are taking good care of [him]1798-your father : if [I]0-i know that [he]1798-your father is well looked after , that is all [I]0-i care for ! " [Belinda]134-belinda gasps . [She]134-belinda has heard it all scores of times before : at first with pitiful wonder ; then with a dreary amusement ; and lastly with the indifferent apathy of use . To - day there seems to be a new and grisly jocularity about it . This then is life ! [A youth of passionately craving and foregoing]4038-a youth of passionately craving and foregoing ; long pursuing and never overtaking ; of hearts that leap for a moment and ache for a year ; of jealousies that poison food and massacre sleep — leading up to an old age of garrulous idiocy ! [She]134-belinda is released at last : set free to amuse [herself]134-belinda as [she]134-belinda best pleases . But of what amusement is a mind in such tune as [hers]134-belinda capable ? [She]134-belinda has taken [her]134-belinda hat in [her]134-belinda hand , and walks along drawing in great gulps of the exquisite evening air ; while [her]134-belinda feet , without [her]134-belinda bidding , lead [her]134-belinda to [the river - side]4039-the river - side . [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge is , as [everyone]3028-everyone knows , rich in [two rivers]4041-two rivers , and it is to [the lesser of [these streams]4043-these streams]4042-the lesser of these streams that [the boating - party]4044-the boating - party has committed itself . It is this lesser stream , also , which for a short part of its course St. [[Ursula]278-st. ursula 's green meadow and pleasant walk border]4045-ursula 's green meadow and pleasant walk border . It is without any acknowledged hope of meeting [them]4043-these streams that [she]134-belinda takes the direction indicated . It is likely that [they]4043-these streams will be so early returning ? Is it likely that [they]4043-these streams , or [any one of [them]4043-these streams]3159-any one of them , will be in much haste to abridge such an excursion ? Tasting , as [she]134-belinda now does , the delicacy of the air ; viewing the homely loveliness of bushed bank and satin - sliding river , [she]134-belinda can the better and more enviously figure to [herself]134-belinda what [its]4047-its charm has been . But the air and the motion do [her]134-belinda good . Beside [her]134-belinda the stream steals along — [a soothing , sluggish companion]4048-a soothing , sluggish companion . No song or rush has it , like the flashing northern becks ; but what green reflections in it ! What long water - weeds , swinging slowly to its slow current ! How the willows — pensive almost as olives in their grave dim leafage — have printed themselves on its quite , silent heart . How riotously green are [the fat low meadows that , all winter long , the floods had drowned]4049-the fat low meadows that , all winter long , the floods had drowned ! Here , [a May - bush]4050-a may - bush has strewn the white largesse of its petals on [the water]2457-the water , and there another , less overblown , stoops to look at its own pink face 's double . There are two cuckoos : one loud and near , one soft and distant , answering each other across [the meads]4052-the meads . Beneath the bank at [her]134-belinda foot , [an undergraduate]4053-an undergraduate lies stretched along [[his]4053-an undergraduate boat]4054-his boat , with [his]4053-an undergraduate book . [Three others in a punt]4055-three others in a punt are waggishly trying to upset [each other]469-each other . [She]134-belinda sits down on a bench and idly watches [them]4055-three others in a punt , till , with shouts of young laughter , [they]4055-three others in a punt float out of sight . [Another punt]4057-another punt , [a canoe , a skiff]4058-a canoe , a skiff , a boat with [ladies]3039-ladies in it . [Her]134-belinda heart jumps . Ah , no ! not [[her]134-belinda ladies]4060-her ladies ! [a boat freighted with hawthorn boughs and guelder - rose branches , that tell of a joyous day 's Maying in [the country]468-the country]4061-a boat freighted with hawthorn boughs and guelder - rose branches , that tell of a joyous day 's maying in the country . Endless young gentlemen in flannels , punting , sculling , lying supine . [She]134-belinda has fallen into a dull comparison between [their]4055-three others in a punt gaiety and [her]134-belinda own gloom , when [her]134-belinda attention is aroused by the sound of a loud voice coming from some bark yet unseen , that is approaching round the corner . [Many of [the boys]1430-the boys]4063-many of the boys ' voices are loud : what is there then in the timbre of this voice that makes [Belinda]134-belinda , at the instant that it strikes [her]134-belinda ear , hastily rise and pursue [her]134-belinda walk ? But [she]134-belinda might as well have remained seated on the bench . A punt has come into sight , guided , with an unskilfulness that seems almost intentional , by [a young man]2723-a young man ; colliding frequently with other punts , bumping with many jars against the bank , and with an ample female form reclining complacently — superior to bumps or jars — in its stern . "[614-my mother] Stop ! stop ! " [she]134-belinda cries , gesticulating with [her]134-belinda umbrella in a way which alone would have been enough to identify [her]134-belinda . "[134-belinda] [Belinda]134-belinda ! [Belinda]134-belinda ! " [All the luxurious young gentlemen]4066-all the luxurious young gentlemen turn [their]4066-all the luxurious young gentlemen heads to look . [One of the white terriers seated by [[their]4066-all the luxurious young gentlemen masters]4068-their masters in [boats]4069-boats]4067-one of the white terriers seated by their masters in boats , sets up [his]4067-one of the white terriers seated by their masters in boats nose and howls . Reluctant and dyed with shame , [Belinda]134-belinda steps to [the water]2457-the water 's edge . "[134-belinda] [George Sampson]270-samson is taking [me]0-i out for a row ! " cries [Miss Watson]147-miss watson , in a tone which can leave [no member of the University]4071-no member of the university ignorant of the fact related ; "[270-samson] [[his]270-samson people]1803-his people have gone back to [London]10-london . [I]0-i can not think what induced [them]1803-his people to shorten [their]1803-his people visit so much ; [they]1803-his people came for a week . Why should not [you]1804-you get in and come with [us]1805-us ? [I]0-i am sure [you]1804-you will be delighted " ( appealing to [[her]0-i swain]4072-her swain ) "[1804-you] if [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth will get in and come with [us]1805-us . [We]1805-us are enjoying [ourselves]1805-us immensely ! " [The unhappy young man]4073-the unhappy young man murmurs something that may be taken for assent . The perspiration of anguish pours from [his]4073-the unhappy young man brow , upon which is written a dogged shame and wrath too deep for words . "[271-mrs. forth] No ? " pursues [the other]2396-the other , in answer to [Belinda]134-belinda 's emphatic negative of [her]0-i proposal . "[271-mrs. forth] [You]1804-you are not so fond of the water as [Sarah]135-sarah , eh ? [She]135-sarah takes to it like a young duck . [I]0-i saw [them]1803-his people setting off this afternoon ; [they]1803-his people looked such a jolly party . [I]0-i offered to join [them]1803-his people , but [they]1803-his people evidently did not hear . Why did not [you]1804-you go with [them]1803-his people ? Not allowed , eh ? " Without looking , [Belinda]134-belinda is hotly aware that a pardonable smile has stolen over the features of [more than one of [the listening boys]4076-the listening boys]4075-more than one of the listening boys , at the publication of [her]134-belinda domestic secrets . There is not one of [them]4076-the listening boys who has not dropped [his]1804-you book . "[0-i] [I]0-i will not keep [you]1804-you any longer , " [she]134-belinda mutters in hasty farewell . But [Miss Watson]147-miss watson has not yet done with [her]134-belinda . "[1804-you] [You]1804-you should have told [the Professor]2365-the professor that [you]1804-you owed it to [your]1804-you conscience to look after [Sarah]135-sarah , " cries [she]134-belinda , laughing resonantly . "[1804-you] Judging by what [I]0-i saw to - day , [you]1804-you would not have been far out ! " [Belinda]134-belinda 's cheek , hot with shame a moment ago , grows pale . The impulse to flee leaves [her]134-belinda ; a contrary impulse , such as draws the palpitating canary to the cage - wires and the cat 's claws , roots [her]134-belinda to the spot . "[1804-you] What do [you]1804-you mean ? " [she]134-belinda asks faltering . "[1804-you] Was she"—lowering [her]0-i voice , so as not to be heard by [anyone else]2603-anyone else , hating [herself]0-i for descending to such a question , and trying to carry it off with a spurious merriment—"was[0-i] [she]0-i — ha ! ha!—flirting very nefariously with [them]1807-them all ? " "[0-i] With [them]1807-them all ! " repeats [the other]2396-the other in loud irony . "[0-i] Pooh ! that would have been nothing ; there is always safety in numbers . [The others]418-the others were nowhere . [Rivers]162-rivers had it all [his]162-rivers own way ! " This is what [Belinda]134-belinda has been angling to hear , and now [she]134-belinda has heard it . It is not then the figment of [her]134-belinda disordered fancy ; it must indeed be ovious to have hit the eyes of [so coarse and casual an observer]4079-so coarse and casual an observer as [Miss Watson]147-miss watson . Nor does the recollection of how much [she]134-belinda had profited by [her]134-belinda former prompt action upon information derived from the same source recur to [her]134-belinda memory . "[162-rivers] [He]162-rivers is a sad dog , is [David]143-rivers , is not [he]162-rivers ? " cries [the other jocosely]4080-the other jocosely ; and then [she]0-i bumps off again in [her]0-i punt , bawling , as [she]0-i floats down [the stream]660-the stream , to [[her]0-i oppressed and silent boatman]4082-her oppressed and silent boatman . "[162-rivers] Le monde n'est jamais divisé pour moi , qu'en deux régions ; celle où elle est , et celle où elle n'est pas . " A week — a whole week — only a week ! There are two opposing ways of looking at this or any other period of time ; one of impatient marvelling at its immensity , the other of gasping consternation at its shortness . It is needless to ask which of these two moods is [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth 's , with regard to [Rivers]143-rivers ' holiday . Only a week ! How many times , during its seven days , does [she]134-belinda , with that all - answering phrase , stop conscience 's mouth ? Of what use for only a week to practise self - government ? of what use for only a week to question , with too nice a closeness , [her]134-belinda heart as to the cause of its leapings and sinkings ? [her]134-belinda temper as to the reason of its endless variabilities ? [her]134-belinda thoughts as to the path [they]4083-they take ? or [her]134-belinda imagination as to the length of its tether ? Only a week ! Too short a space to do anything in but enjoy — to enjoy — to enjoy ! With eyes resolutely shut to the cost — to the heavy score running up , that at the week 's end will have to be paid . Oh , not too short to enjoy in ! It is not all enjoyment . Already , before two days of it are past , it has been marred by irksome labour , by balked expectation , by unreasoning jealousy — a jealousy whose unreason [she]134-belinda [herself]134-belinda , in [her]134-belinda calmer moments , recognises ; which in [Rivers]143-rivers ' presence dies of famine , having less than nothing to live upon , but , once out of the reassurance of [his]162-rivers eyes , revives and bulks big again . Rare indeed is it for one successful excursion not to engender another or several more . The weather holds . [The Professor]2365-the professor 's heart or liver — it is never quite clearly understood which of these organs is affected — has recovered its balance , upset by [[his]162-rivers wife]713-his wife 's Walpurgis day . [Belinda]134-belinda has three consecutive afternoons of freedom — three afternoons of being swiftly pulled down [the river]463-the river , that brave water - way alive with vigorous youthhood — of gaily drinking tea and sucking cider - cup through straws at [little river - side alehouses]4087-little river - side alehouses — of picking the freakish fritillaries in [the meadows]4088-the meadows — of being towed back in dreamy languor at night - fall or star - rise — of loitering homewards with hands full of flag - flowers — of parting at the garden gate . To that parting there comes , each evening , a deeper deadlier sweetness . It does not lie in words . There is not one word that , did [the Professor]2365-the professor protrude [his]162-rivers velvetcapped head from [his]162-rivers bower window , need be withdrawn . [Belinda]134-belinda is living on [[her]134-belinda capital]4090-her capital . At the week 's end [she]134-belinda will be bankrupt ; let [her]134-belinda then be merry while [she]134-belinda may ! Perhaps [Sarah]135-sarah acquiesces in [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister 's view of the unimportance of any course of action that must be compressed into so short a period of time as a week . Perhaps , being in [her]134-belinda way wise , [she]134-belinda recognises the futility of interference . Perhaps [her]134-belinda hands are too full of [her]134-belinda own affairs to have much time or attention to spare for [[her]134-belinda sister]2366-her sister 's ; for seldom has [Miss Churchill]152-miss churchill been in such amorous straits of [her]152-miss churchill own making as at present . The course of allurement which had merely warmed up [the heavy German soldiers]4093-the heavy german soldiers into a pleasant and manageable tenderness , has wrought [three inflammable English boys]4094-three inflammable english boys to a white heat . Daily , and in proportion as [their]4094-three inflammable english boys inconvenient ardour for [Sarah]135-sarah increases , does [their]4094-three inflammable english boys friendship for each other — close and warm to begin with — decline , and tend towards the opposite pole of animosity . On the last expedition but one , [she]134-belinda dare no longer accept a bunch of fritillaries from one , without instantly crowding [her]134-belinda hands with a similar bunch from each of the others . [She]134-belinda can now never drink less than three cups of afternoon tea ; as that affords to [each]4095-each an opportunity of handing [her]134-belinda one . Even [Bellairs]282-bellairs , early convinced of the hopelessness of [his]282-bellairs adoration of [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth , is now wholly [hers]134-belinda , far more wholly indeed than [she]134-belinda at all wishes . "[0-i] [I]0-i am fast getting to hate the sight of [them]1809-them ! " [she]0-i cries , in a tone more nearly approaching tearful vexation than is often to be heard in [her]0-i joyous voice , as [she]0-i and [[her]0-i sister]2366-her sister patrol in [their]1809-them wonted fashion [the garden]2455-the garden , on the morning of the week 's last day . "[0-i] None of [them"—by]4098-them"—by this comprehensive phrase [she]0-i always designates [the noble army of [[her]0-i admirers]2781-her admirers , past and [present—"none[162-rivers] of [them]1809-them]4101-present—"none of them]4099-the noble army of her admirers , past and present—"none of them have ever given [me]0-i half so much trouble ; why can not [they]1809-them understand that it is not the fox [I]0-i care for , but the chase ? " "[1809-them] It will be soon over , " replies [Belinda]134-belinda slowly . [She]134-belinda says it as a consolation to [[her]134-belinda sister]2366-her sister , but the application that [she]134-belinda makes is to [herself]134-belinda . "[1809-them] That is all very fine , " replies [Sarah]135-sarah gloomily ; "[1809-them] but there is still to - day . [You]1810-you know that [we]1811-we are to go on [the New River]91-the new river this afternoon ; and in a weak moment [I]0-i promised that [ugly Bellairs]282-bellairs — but [I]0-i declare , " with a burst of petulance , "[0-i] that [they]1809-them bother [me]0-i so that [I]0-i do not know whether [I]0-i am on [my]0-i head or [my]0-i heels — that [he]282-bellairs should scull [me]0-i in some little cockle - shell — a dinghey , [he]282-bellairs calls it — [he]282-bellairs and [I]0-i , and [nobody by]1812-nobody by , [you]1810-you know , " with a laugh of annoyance ; "[0-i] and [I]0-i positively dare not tell [the others]418-the others . What am [I]0-i to do ? [I]0-i suppose , " with something of [her]0-i old sidling , coaxing manner , "[0-i] that [you]1810-you would not care to break it to [them]1809-them ? " [Belinda]134-belinda smiles ; a bitter smile of recollection . "[1810-you] As [I]0-i was to break to [Mr. Forth]209-mr. forth that [you]1810-you meant to jilt [him]209-mr. forth ? Thank [you]1810-you ! [I]0-i think not ! " It is true that the last day has come ; and the last excursion . All through the previous night , all morning , [Belinda]134-belinda has been dogged by the icy terror — no weaker word suffices — that something may occur to prevent it . [She]134-belinda has asked after [the Professor]2365-the professor 's organs , with a solicitude whose treachery makes [her]134-belinda blush . The very unbearableness of the idea lends it a horrid probability . In this [our]4104-our life are not the things too bad to be faced , those that oftenest happen ? The hour comes — the meeting at the corner ( never again have [the enamoured youths]4105-the enamoured youths ventured across the threshold of [the house]2521-the house [they]4105-the enamoured youths have desecrated!)—the walk to [the river]463-the river . [Sarah]135-sarah has vainly tried to hook [herself]135-sarah on to [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister ; but — [Bellairs]282-bellairs having out - manoeuvred [[his]282-bellairs fellows]2599-his fellows , and compelled [them]2599-his fellows to content [themselves]2599-his fellows with [the chaperone of [a former expedition]4111-a former expedition]4110-the chaperone of a former expedition , civilly invited to complete the party — has dropped resignedly behind with [him]282-bellairs , [her]134-belinda face sufficiently revealing that [she]134-belinda is braced for the worst . [The river]463-the river is reached . In the choosing [the boats]4113-the boats and arranging the cushions a little diversion is effected , which gives [Sarah]135-sarah the opportunity to pluck [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister by the sleeve , and pull [her]2366-her sister aside . "[1814-he] It is all up , " [she]135-sarah says morosely ; "[1814-he] [he]1814-he has been telling [me]0-i as [we]1815-we came along , that if [he]1814-he read [my]0-i eyes aright , [he]1814-he was far from indifferent to [me]0-i ! " "[1814-he] And [you]0-i ? what did [you]0-i say ? " "[0-i] What did [I]0-i say ? " ( in a tone of extreme exasperation , and yet unwilling amusement ) . "[0-i] [I]0-i told [him]1814-he that [he]1814-he had read [them]1816-them awrong ; but"—with a rueful glance at the little craft now being made ready for [her]213-mrs. baker reception—"you[0-i] must perceive that the dinghey has become an impossibility ; what is to be done ? There is not room for [us]1815-we all in the other ; quick ! " For a moment [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth looks before [her]0-i in blank perplexity ; then , all at once , an idea , habited in a sudden lovely blush , rushes into [her]0-i mind . Why not ? Is not it the last day ? But [she]0-i does not at once clothe it in speech . Instead : "[0-i] Can not [you]0-i persuade [Mrs. Baker]213-mrs. baker to take [your]0-i place ? " [she]0-i asks . [Sarah]135-sarah shrugs [her]135-sarah shoulders impatiently . "[213-mrs. baker] [She]213-mrs. baker would not hear of it ; [she]213-mrs. baker is inclined to scream in a punt ! " There is no help for it , then . What other alternative can [she]135-sarah propose ? It is no fault of [hers]135-sarah ; accident , rather — fate — ill - luck ! [She]135-sarah has done [her]135-sarah best . How often during the past week has [she]135-sarah told [herself]135-sarah that [she]135-sarah has done [her]135-sarah best ! "[213-mrs. baker] [I]0-i suppose , then , that [I]0-i must sacrifice [myself]0-i , " [she]135-sarah says hurriedly , and not looking at [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister ; and then , several voices at once calling upon [them]4116-them , [they]4116-them rejoin [the rest of the party]819-the rest of the party . In a moment , as if [some devil]4118-some devil were behind [her]1817-my sister — or what in [her]1817-my sister present frame of mind would seem to [her]1817-my sister both more dangerous and more ugly — some amorous undergraduate , [Sarah]135-sarah has , to ensure [herself]1817-my sister against ambush or surprise , skipped into [the larger boat]4119-the larger boat . "[0-i] [[My]0-i sister]1817-my sister 's courage has failed [her]1817-my sister , " says [Belinda]134-belinda , standing flushed and downcast - eyed on [the bank]4120-the bank . "[1817-my sister] [I]0-i am afraid that [some one]2370-some one will have to scull [me]0-i instead . " [No one]365-no one answers , and [she]135-sarah steps — [some one]2370-some one giving [her]135-sarah a hand — into [the dinghey]4123-the dinghey . [Some one]2370-some one instantly follows [her]135-sarah , and takes up the sculls . It is not till [they]4125-they are well out in [the stream]660-the stream , and not immediately even then , that [she]135-sarah lifts [her]135-sarah eyes . A sort of shame weighs them down . The manoeuvre was none of [hers]135-sarah ; and yet it is by a manoeuvre that [she]135-sarah has secured this final tête - à - tête with [him]2370-some one . [She]135-sarah does not even know whether it is in accordance with [his]2370-some one wishes that [she]135-sarah has acted .
