[He]2370-some one has expressed no pleasure in the arrangement ; perhaps — [her]135-sarah jealousy awaked in a moment from its always light sleep — [he]2370-some one is vexed to have been baulked of [Sarah]135-sarah 's company . Perhaps , even now , [he]2370-some one is silently fighting with [his]2370-some one disappointment . [She]135-sarah snatches a fugitive glance at [him]2370-some one — a glance that , in an instant , is turned away again ; for it has told [her]135-sarah what [she]135-sarah wished to learn . The cause of [his]2370-some one dumbness is one which does not very often make [us]4127-us speechless in this [our]4127-us life . [He]2370-some one can not speak for joy . [She]135-sarah leans back satisfied and smiling . [The New River]91-the new river is narrower , less of [a great highway]4128-a great highway than [the old one]3081-the old one . Here are no imperative Eights , out of whose way [all lesser boats]4130-all lesser boats must clear , under penalty of being apostrophized by a ferocious "[2370-some one] Look ahead , [sir]1569-sir ! " and then run down . And yet there is no lack of company here either , on this splendid summer day . Above , the pale bright sky , holding [her]135-sarah forget - [me]2370-some one - not - coloured shield ; and below , the windings of [the slow broad river]4131-the slow broad river , and [the great expanse of hedgeless meadowland]4132-the great expanse of hedgeless meadowland . The horses , summering there , stand knee - deep in [the stream]660-the stream , eating , or pretending to eat , the weeds ; one having a wet roll of utter enjoyment in [the shallows]4134-the shallows . Sheets of little ranunculus are all ablow , each stiff , straight stem and small white head erect on the water . Countless geese stalk along [the meadow]4135-the meadow , waddling and cropping the grass . Others , like [a white fleet]4136-a white fleet , paddle and dive for water - weeds . Into the midst of [this feathered Armada]4137-this feathered armada [they]4127-us see [the larger boat]4119-the larger boat , which has shot ahead of [them]4127-us , being lustily pulled to give it a fright ; instigated thereto by [Sarah]135-sarah , who under the ægis of [a female friend]4139-a female friend , and with [Bellairs]282-bellairs pulling stroke , and consequently divided from [her]135-sarah by nearly the whole length of [the boat]4140-the boat , has resumed [her]135-sarah usual hilarity , and by voice , gesture , and waved parasol , is encouraging [[her]135-sarah slaves]4141-her slaves . The geese separate , screeching and oaring away ; and [one gosling , overtaken by the prow]4142-one gosling , overtaken by the prow , dives and rises again ten paces away . Both Rivers and [Belinda]134-belinda laugh . There is something healthy and clearing to the moral atmosphere in a joint laugh . [Rivers]143-rivers ' mirth dies into a long sigh of contentment . "[2370-some one] What a day ! " [he]143-rivers says , resting on [his]143-rivers oars , and staring up at the sky . "[0-i] [I]0-i love [the river]463-the river ; how [I]0-i missed it at first ! [I]0-i used to dream about it ! it was one of the things that [I]0-i dreaded dreaming about ! " [She]134-belinda does not ask [him]143-rivers what [the others]418-the others were . Possibly [she]134-belinda is incurious . "[0-i] Perhaps , " [he]143-rivers says , bringing [his]143-rivers eyes down again from the heaven above [him]143-rivers , to the , to [him]143-rivers , better heaven of [her]134-belinda face , "[0-i] perhaps it is worth while to have a holiday only once in two years , to enjoy it as [I]0-i have done [mine]0-i ! " As [he]143-rivers speaks , a slight frown , not of displeasure at [his]143-rivers harmless words , but of reflection and doubt , puckers [her]134-belinda forehead . "[0-i] Are [you]0-i sure , " [she]134-belinda says slowly , "[0-i] that it is quite the first holiday that [you]0-i have had in two years ? " [He]143-rivers looks surprised . "[0-i] Virtually yes . Why ? " "[0-i] Nothing ! " [she]134-belinda answers in confusion ; "[0-i] only [I]0-i happened to hear that [you]0-i were in [London]10-london last winter . " "[0-i] [I]0-i was , " [he]143-rivers answers calmly , though still surprised . "[0-i] [[Our]1821-our firm]1663-our firm sent [me]0-i up on business : that was no holiday . " "[0-i] And [you]0-i — [you]0-i combined business with pleasure ? " [she]134-belinda says , laughing awkwardly . "[0-i] [You]0-i — [you]0-i went to the play ? " Difficult as it is to look [him]143-rivers in the face , while guiltily conscious of the drift of [her]134-belinda question , [she]134-belinda yet eagerly fastens upon [him]143-rivers a glance whose keenness no least tinge of discomfiture can escape . But none such meets [her]134-belinda . [He]143-rivers has resumed [his]143-rivers leisurely rowing , but now stops again . "[0-i] Where [you]0-i there ? " [he]143-rivers cries abruptly . "[0-i] Is it possible that [I]0-i missed [you]0-i ? [I]0-i looked — [I]0-i thought — [I]0-i hoped . " [She]134-belinda shakes [her]134-belinda head . "[0-i] [I]0-i was not [there]2419-there ! [I]0-i was not " ( with a twinge of self - pity , as [she]134-belinda recalls [her]134-belinda then mood)—"I[0-i] was not in a very play - going humour ; but [I]0-i was told by [some one who had seen [you]0-i]1824-some one who had seen you ! " Surely [he]143-rivers will now volunteer the mention of [the lady by whom [he]143-rivers was accompanied]4144-the lady by whom he was accompanied . [She]134-belinda has paused on purpose to give [him]143-rivers the opportunity , but [he]143-rivers does not take it . [He]143-rivers leans on [his]143-rivers sculls , staring before [him]143-rivers in wistful bitter thought . "[1824-some one who had seen you] [You]0-i were with [a lady]3108-a lady , " says [Belinda]134-belinda presently , unable any longer to contain [herself]134-belinda . "[3108-a lady] [A lady]3108-a lady ? " [he]143-rivers says , starting . "[3108-a lady] Was [I]0-i ? — oh , of course , [[my]0-i sister]1817-my sister . [Poor girl]1828-poor girl ! [she]1828-poor girl had not been anywhere for so long , that [she]1828-poor girl was naturally keen about it . [She]1828-poor girl was staying with [an aunt]1829-an aunt , who gave [us]1830-our [our]1830-our stalls ; otherwise , " with a laugh , "[1829-an aunt] in the then state of [our]1830-our finances , [the shilling gallery]1831-the shilling gallery would have been nearer [our]1830-our mark ! " So it is explained . How simple it sounds ! how obvious ! What is there in it , upon which [any but a madwoman]4145-any but a madwoman could have hung distrust or jealousy ? And yet it is upon this cock - and - bull story that [she]1828-poor girl elected to shipwreck [her]1828-poor girl life ! [A sailing - boat]4146-a sailing - boat , lurching and tacking , and heeling over , after the manner of such , and out of whose way [they]4147-they have to get , rouses [them]4147-they both , and [they]4147-they row on . [The larger boat]4119-the larger boat has pulled into the bank , in order to set the two dogs , in whom [Sarah]135-sarah affects to detect symptoms of incipient sea - sickness , on [shore]4149-shore , where [they]4147-they instantly begin to give a great deal of trouble . [Punch]186-punch — a dog of no ballast of mind , entirely losing [his]186-punch head in joy at [his]186-punch enlargement — first frolicsomely nips the sleepy horses ' heels , a civility which [they]4147-they return by viciously lashing out at [him]186-punch ; then chivies the geese , a levity which calls forth from [the husband]4150-the husband and [father]4151-father an awful chastisement of flapping wings , outstretched neck , and dreadfully wide - opened mouth . [Slutty]157-slutty , on the other hand , for reasons best known to [herself]157-slutty has set off galloping in the wrong direction , with [her]157-slutty tail between [her]157-slutty legs . [Her]157-slutty recapture and the recovery and admonishment of [Punch]186-punch take so long , that [the couple in the dinghey]4152-the couple in the dinghey have time to get far ahead , and , rounding a reach of [the river]463-the river , to lose [[their]4152-the couple in the dinghey companions]2568-their companions from sight . On and on [they]4152-the couple in the dinghey float in [their]4152-the couple in the dinghey virtual aloneness , for in nothing do [the two men]4155-the two men punting , or [the happy young fellow]4156-the happy young fellow shooting past in [his]4156-the happy young fellow skiff , disturb [their]4152-the couple in the dinghey solitude . [They]4152-the couple in the dinghey speak ever less and less . Now and again , indeed , silence becomes too oppressive , and [they]4152-the couple in the dinghey speak ; but then speech grows over - pregnant , and [they]4152-the couple in the dinghey fly back to silence . [Both]2453-both are strung up to pleasure 's highest pitch , that pitch for which [they]4152-the couple in the dinghey will have to pay , and know that [they]4152-the couple in the dinghey will have to pay , so extortionately ; for pleasure , like the scorpion , is an animal that carries a sting in its tail . Upon enjoyment is set its keenest edge . The lark , lost in light above [them]4152-the couple in the dinghey , might be [their]4152-the couple in the dinghey spokesman , only that to [their]4152-the couple in the dinghey song , unlike [his]1832-he , there is ever that minor refrain : "[1829-an aunt] The last day ! the last day ! " What a nameless unreckoning elation the warm breeze lends , and the motion and the very throbbing of the gentle water against the passing keel ! [She]0-i pulls up [her]0-i sleeve , and dipping in [her]0-i bared right arm , affects to imitate [his]1832-he gestures , and to oar the stream with it . "[0-i] [I]0-i am helping [you]1832-he , " [she]0-i cries , smiling . "[0-i] [I]0-i , too , am rowing ; do [you]1832-he find any perceptible help ? " [He]1832-he does not reply . [He]1832-he rows slowly on in a dream , [his]1832-he eyes intoxicatedly watching that pendent hand and swaying lily wrist . [He]1832-he always thinks [her]0-i last word or action prettier and better than all its predecessors . But surely [she]0-i can never outdo this . [He]1832-he might borrow [Florizel]309-florizel 's words without a changed syllable . [He]1832-he pulls , still in a dream , beneath the willows . A poplar , shivering perpetually , flutters and trembles against the sky 's perfect azure over [their]4152-the couple in the dinghey heads . Still in a dream , and at [her]0-i orders , [he]1832-he leaves [her]0-i lying pensive and cool on [her]0-i cushions , and scrambles into [the field]4158-the field to fetch flowers for [her]0-i . [He]1832-he comes back with a great nosegay , which [he]1832-he lays in [her]0-i lap : yellow flags , beckabunga , forget - me - nots bigger and bluer than the petted garden ones , a scrap of catch - fly , a handful of stitchworts , powdery purple grasses , all plucked haphazard , and yet gathered into such a perfect posy as no after - arranging , or sorting , or matching of colours could compass . [She]0-i tells [him]1832-he so . Was ever [man]2737-man , for so poor a gift , so royally thanked ? [[Their]4152-the couple in the dinghey companions]2568-their companions have passed [them]4152-the couple in the dinghey again ; the dogs re - embarked , and [the whole company]4161-the whole company singing a gay part - song . No other than "[310-the franklin] [The Franklin]310-the franklin 's Dogge . " How entrancingly sweet and merry sound the nonsensical old words across the water ! [Belinda]134-belinda and [Rivers]143-rivers must needs follow [them]4152-the couple in the dinghey to [the rendezvous]2797-the rendezvous — [the little rural Trout Inn]4163-the little rural trout inn , where [they]4152-the couple in the dinghey are to have tea . It is brought out to [them]4152-the couple in the dinghey , in [an arbour overlooking [the stream]660-the stream]4164-an arbour overlooking the stream , by [a stout wench]4166-a stout wench ; thick bread and butter , great wedges of plain cake , a tea - set where no two articles are of the same make or pattern . [Sarah]135-sarah , having tided over [her]135-sarah Bellairs difficulty , and restored to [her]135-sarah happy - go - lucky confidence of being able to keep the rest of [[her]135-sarah team]4167-her team well in hand , is in delightful spirits . There are [too many other visitors at [the Trout]92-the trout]4168-too many other visitors at the trout to make any more glees advisable ; but [she]135-sarah is good enough to indulge [the company]1194-the company with several quiet performances of a juggling nature , which make no noise , and need attract no attention — such as sticking half - pence into [her]135-sarah eyes , and disposing them ingeniously about [her]135-sarah other features . [Belinda]134-belinda , too , is in wild mirth — as wild as that of the unlucky day of [Blind Man]311-blind man 's Buff . [She]134-belinda is not nearly so clever with the halfpence as [[her]134-belinda sister]2366-her sister ; but in point of mere animal spirits [she]134-belinda almost exceeds [her]134-belinda . When , however , the tea - party and its humours are ended — when , in [their]1194-the company former order , [they]1194-the company are on [their]1194-the company way [home]2345-home again — those factitious spirits drop like a wind at sunset . The feast is all but over : surely , since [the world]643-the world was , never has any been so poignantly relished . In each moment have not [they]1194-the company tasted a hundred years of ordinary tame pleasures ? But it is now nigh being done , and pay - day stands at the door . The light is low and level ; the geese have gone to bed , grey head and yellow nose tucked beneath greay wing . The horses ' shadows stretch , longer than camelopards , across [the meadow]4135-the meadow . There is scarcely any need to use the oars , wind and current helping [them]1194-the company ; [they]1194-the company are floating — oh , how swiftly!—to where the one great dome , and the many spires , momently growing taller , tell where [the fair city]1063-the fair city lies . The last hour of the last day is running out . When that dome and [those spires]4175-those spires are reached , it will have run out . The last hour ! How many things there are to be said in a last hour ! And yet the only phrase that will rise to either of [their]1833-they lips is , "[310-the franklin] It is the last time ! " Even to that [they]1833-they do not give utterance : not until [they]1833-they have slidden more than half - way [home]2345-home . Then , at sight of those rapidly nearing spires — those spires that mean the end — a sort of panic seizes [Belinda]134-belinda : "[310-the franklin] How fast [we]1833-they go ! " [she]134-belinda says half - breathlessly , looking down as if [she]134-belinda would fain stop on the lovely evening water , quickly swishing past with a pleasant low sucking sound ; "[310-the franklin] [we]1833-they shall be [home]2345-home in ten minutes ! " "[310-the franklin] In ten minutes ! " [he]4177-his repeats in a tone half - mazed , as of one not realizing the sense of the words . "[310-the franklin] And it is the last time ! " [she]134-belinda says very low . Still the keel quickly cutting the flood , and the water sucking . Why so fast ? In pity , why so fast ? The very sun — [their]1833-they last sun — seems hurrying more rapidly than [his]4177-his wo nt to [his]4177-his hot rose and cowslip coloured bed . At first [they]1833-they had had days ahead of [them]1833-they — such riches seem incredible — then hours , now minutes , and but few of them ; so few that surely there is not one of them to be wasted ! Perhaps it is this thought that sends such a passion of haste into the words with which [he]4177-his answers [her]134-belinda : "[310-the franklin] Why should it be the last time ? " [She]134-belinda receives the suggestion in dead silence — a silence so dead as to give [him]4177-his time for a cold pang of fear that [he]4177-his has employed these priceless moments in offending [[his]4177-his dear lady]2548-his dear lady , and that [she]134-belinda will part from [him]4177-his in displeasure . If [his]4177-his hand were laid upon [her]134-belinda heart , [he]4177-his would know why [she]134-belinda did not speak . In the last drunken week , [she]134-belinda has not once had the courage to look [her]134-belinda life , that is to be , in the eyes . Who , squandering and rioting in the now , dare ever face the then ? At last [she]134-belinda stammers : "[310-the franklin] How should not it be the last , since [your]1835-he holiday ends to - morrow ? " "[310-the franklin] And am [I]0-i never to have another ? " [He]4177-his is lying on [his]4177-his oars now ; but still [the boat]4140-the boat drifts , drifts . [She]134-belinda shakes [her]134-belinda head with a little unhopeful smile ; though surely no hopeless heart ever leaped and sprang as [hers]134-belinda is doing . "[0-i] Perhaps in another two years ! " [His]4177-his oars are quite out of the water ; [he]4177-his , at least , will have no share in accelerating the end . The drops gently drip from their blades . [Twilight]312-twilight is taking [her]312-twilight first grey steps across [the plains]4180-the plains , and the warm dew falls . Two or three of [their]4181-their dwindling store of minutes are gone before [Rivers]143-rivers speaks . "[0-i] Term will sooon be over , then [you]1835-he will go away , [I]0-i suppose ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i think not — probably not , " [she]134-belinda answers idifferently , an unacknowledged disappointment at the apparent irrelevance of [his]4177-his remark , at [his]4177-his want of insistance upon [his]4177-his former suggestion , chilling heart and voice . "[0-i] [You]1835-he will stay here all through the Long ? " Why is there such a catch in [his]4177-his breath as [he]4177-his asks this question ? What is it to [him]4177-his whether [she]134-belinda goes or stays ? "[1835-he] Most likely . [Mr. Forth]209-mr. forth will go to [Switzerland]93-switzerland ; [I]0-i believe [he]209-mr. forth mostly does ; but [he]209-mr. forth will not take [me]0-i . " "[209-mr. forth] [He]209-mr. forth will leave [you]1835-he [here]2351-here ? " "[209-mr. forth] Yes . " "[209-mr. forth] Alone ? " "[209-mr. forth] Unless [you]1835-he count [[my]0-i mother - in - law]1837-my mother - in - law as society , " with a slight satiric laugh . A pause . A flight of plovers , going bedwards , speck the sky above them . "[1837-my mother - in - law] Will not [you]1835-he — will not [you]1835-he — be lonely ? " "[1837-my mother - in - law] Not more than usual . " "[1837-my mother - in - law] Will not most of [[your]1835-he friends]1838-your friends have gone ? " Again [she]0-i laughs , and [her]0-i laugh is of the same unmerry character as before . "[0-i] With [my]0-i goodwill [they]1838-your friends may all go ; [I]0-i am no great hand at making [friends]3553-friends . " Another pause . The plovers have dwindled to nothing ; [the other boat]4182-the other boat is lost to sight , far ahead . What is [he]1835-he going to say that makes [him]1835-he fidget so uneasily with [his]1835-he unused oars ? "[0-i] It is really no great distance from [Yorkshire]31-yorkshire here . " Again [she]0-i laughs ; but the irony is gone , driven away by a tremor that is even farther from gaiety . "[0-i] [My]0-i geography is not [my]0-i strong point , but [I]0-i should have scarcely thought that they were [neighbouring counties]1840-neighbouring counties . " "[0-i] [Milnthorpe]73-milnthorpe is not more than five hours from [here]2351-here , by [a good train]1842-a good train . " "[0-i] Is not it ? " And then again there is silence . How twilight is taming day 's gaudiness ! but doing it with so lovesome [a mien]4183-a mien , that who can regret the gone greens and blues ? "[0-i] [I]0-i could , " [he]1835-he begins . How dry [his]1835-he throat is ! [He]1835-he would be glad of a draught from [the river]463-the river to moisten it . "[0-i] [I]0-i could — run down — for Sunday — now and then . " It is out now ! For good or for evil , it is said ; and in uncontrollable anxiety [he]1835-he leans forward , the better to read in [her]0-i face how [she]0-i takes it . [She]0-i is as dead silent as [she]0-i had been at [his]1835-he first suggestion of the possibility of [their]4185-their meeting again ; but perhaps [he]1835-he has learnt to interpret that silence better . Must not [she]0-i needs set some order in that riotous heart of [hers]0-i before [she]0-i can speak at all ? Surely [the earth]2891-the earth is mistaken in thinking that night is coming . Is not it the morning that is born ? [His]1835-he hand has lifted a corner of the great night - curtain that has hung , black and impenetrable , before [her]0-i future life . Dare [she]0-i let [him]1835-he lift it all ? "[0-i] Only now and then ! Not often ! " [he]1835-he says in great agitation . "[0-i] If [you]0-i have not a soul to speak to for four months , [you]0-i might not mind seeing [me]0-i now and then — quite now and then ! " Not mind seeing [him]1835-he ! At that [she]0-i can not choose but smile . "[1843-we] [We]1843-we knock off work early on Saturday , and there is [a fast train]1844-a fast train that would take [me]0-i back in good time for Monday morning . " There is such a desperate urgency of asking in [his]1835-he eyes , that [she]0-i dare not look at [him]1835-he . What can [she]0-i answer ? Still that unmastered riot in [her]0-i heart ! and how near [the landing - place]4187-the landing - place is growing ! [All the sail - boats with furled sails and lowered masts]4188-all the sail - boats with furled sails and lowered masts ; all the row - boats gathered [home]2345-home . "[1843-we] It is rather a mad plan ! " [she]0-i says , with a laugh that has a touch of the hysteric . "[1843-we] Is it ? " [he]1835-he answers blankly . "[1843-we] [I]0-i suppose it is . " There are not more than eight boat - lengths to go . In those eight boat - lengths [she]0-i must decide one way or the other ; for [the rest of [the party]3959-the party]819-the rest of the party are gathered in hilarious talk about the landing - place—"Little[1843-we] Byngo " and many other worthy partsongs having wrought one and all to the highest pitch of good - fellowship — waiting for [them]819-the rest of the party . "[1843-we] [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge is not [[my]0-i private property]1845-my private property , " [she]0-i says almost inaudibly , and shaking like a poplar leaf , that is never still ; "[1843-we] [you]0-i have [other friends here beside [me]0-i]1846-other friends here beside me . " "[0-i] [I]0-i have , " [he]1835-he answers , catching at [her]0-i suggestion , with a relief proportioned to the consternation with which [his]1835-he eye has been measuring the half - dozen yards left [him]1835-he in which to plead [his]1835-he cause . "[0-i] Why should not [I]0-i come to see [them]1847-their ? " Nor have either [he]1835-he or [she]4192-she the candour to own to [themselves]1847-their or each other what is perfectly well known to [both]2453-both , that in the Long Vacation [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge will be innocent of the presence of [any one of [those friends]4195-those friends]4194-any one of those friends . This is [their]1847-their real parting . The week and Rivers are both gone . [Belinda]134-belinda 's life has returned to its old channel , [the channel in which it ran before the party at [St. Ursula 's]84-st. ursula]4196-the channel in which it ran before the party at st. ursula 's . The weather has ceased to be a matter of the slightest interest . It is not of the least consequence what weather there is , or whether there is any weather at all ! Done with are all tappings of weather - glasses , watchings of the march of clouds . The door - bell may ring itself off its wire , without making [her]0-i attention swerve by one hair's - breadth from [Menander]287-menander , or interfering at all with the coherence and patience of [her]0-i answers to [[her]0-i mother]4197-her mother - in - law as to the date at which [they]1847-their are going to bury [[that mother - in - law]4023-that mother - in - law 's husband]4199-that mother - in - law 's husband , whose obsequies appear to have been unaccountably deferred for twenty - five years . There is no more talk of water - parties . [Sarah]135-sarah [herself]135-sarah , too late convinced of the peril of those excursions , confines [herself]135-sarah and [[her]135-sarah followers]4200-her followers to safe games of tennis in well - overlooked public places , where [they]1847-their will have no chance of reading [her]135-sarah eyes either right or wrong , or , at all events , of telling [her]135-sarah the result of [their]1847-their readings . [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth 's life has resumed the tame course which it was taking on the day of [Sarah]135-sarah 's arrival ; but how different a spirit now guides it ! Whither have flown the sullen discontent , the dull revolt , the rare mirth that bit , and the frequent irony that pricked and stung ? Now , if [the Professor]2365-the professor be cross , [she]135-sarah shrugs [her]135-sarah shoulders good - humouredly . [He]2365-the professor is old ! [He]2365-the professor means nothing by it ! It is an infirmity . After all , why should [she]135-sarah mind ? How does it hurt [her]135-sarah ? If [he]2365-the professor keeps [her]135-sarah slaving long beyond [her]135-sarah canonical hours in [[his]2365-the professor close study]4202-his close study , why so much the more does [she]135-sarah enjoy afterwards the breath of [the garden]2455-the garden and the white pinks bursting so quickly into spicy bloom ? If [he]2365-the professor complain of [his]2365-the professor affection of heart , liver , or spleen , [she]135-sarah is equally ready to believe in and sympathize with each and all , to suggest remedies , or apply them . Never has [Sarah]135-sarah been more puzzled , or [her]135-sarah sagacity put more at fault , than by [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister 's behaviour . For it is not the mood of a day . The consciousness of being observed and of the necessity for self - control might have lent [her]135-sarah for a while a spurious cheerfulness ; but could it have given [her]135-sarah that easy , unforced serenity which lasts undimmed through [Sarah]135-sarah 's stay — which , indeed , shows every symptom of holding out indefinitely beyond it ? It is not from the post , as [Miss Churchill]152-miss churchill at first suspected , that [she]135-sarah derives [her]135-sarah support . [The postman]1068-the postman 's arrival obviously causes [her]135-sarah not a flutter ; nor does [she]135-sarah exhibit the slightest tendency towards a surreptitious posting of [her]135-sarah own letter's — worst sign that can appear in a connubial heaven . It is not , then , upon a clandestine correspondence that [she]135-sarah is feeding and blooming , so fair and fine . That [an undoubtedly hard - working common hand]4206-an undoubtedly hard - working common hand , or , still more , foreman in [an iron foundry]4207-an iron foundry , would be likely soon to have another leisure week at [his]2365-the professor disposal , seems to [her]135-sarah improbable . That [Belinda]134-belinda can be nourishing any hopes of a visit to [Milnthorpe]73-milnthorpe seems to [her]135-sarah more improbable still . That , satisfied with the sight of [her]135-sarah lost love , [she]135-sarah can have settled down contentedly into the perennial jogtrot of an existence without [him]2365-the professor , seems to [her]135-sarah most improbable of all . [She]135-sarah watches [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister narrowly ; sees [her]135-sarah severe lips surprised now and then into an apparently causeless smile ; catches [her]135-sarah singing under [her]135-sarah breath , as [she]135-sarah waters [her]135-sarah drouthy plants ; sees [her]135-sarah staid walk about [the garden]2455-the garden occasionally inclined to degenerate into a light - hearted run with the dogs . But [she]135-sarah does not surprise [her]135-sarah secret . And meanwhile time goes on . The yearly gaieties with which the summer Term at [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge concludes are over and gone [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth , chaperoning [[her]271-mrs. forth sister]2366-her sister , has taken part in them all — balls , fêtes , theatre ; has seen [the masons]4211-the masons dance in [their]4211-the masons aprons , and heard [the undergraduates]1540-the undergraduates in all the glory of [their]1540-the undergraduates immemorial screeching . [She]271-mrs. forth has taken part in all , and has apparently enjoyed them with a wholesome temperate gaiety ; as far removed from the unnatural elation of [the Blind Man]4213-the blind man 's Buff , as from the inert gloom of the previous period . With Term is to end [Sarah]135-sarah 's visit ; and on the day following [her]135-sarah departure [the Professor]2365-the professor is to shoulder [his]2365-the professor valise for [the Bernese Oberland]95-the bernese oberland . The morning on which [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth is to lose [[her]271-mrs. forth sister]2366-her sister has come . [Sarah]135-sarah is taking [her]135-sarah last stroll round the flower - beds , and across [the square of sward over which [she]135-sarah and [Belinda]134-belinda have walked so many miles]4216-the square of sward over which she and belinda have walked so many miles . [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth has just joined [her]135-sarah , issuing from [the house]2521-the house with the end of a laugh still lingering about [her]2549-his mother mouth and eyes . "[1848-her] [You]1848-her seem amused , " says [the other]2396-the other , turning to meet [her]1848-her . "[1848-her] May [I]0-i be permitted to inquire the cause ? " "[0-i] It is nothing ! " replies [Belinda]134-belinda , bubbling over again with mirth . "[1848-her] It is a shame to laugh at [her]1848-her , only it is so difficult to help it . [Mr. Forth]209-mr. forth has just been reading the Collect for the day to [[his]209-mr. forth mother]2549-his mother ; and at the end [she]2549-his mother said to [him]209-mr. forth , ' [You]209-mr. forth read very nicely , [[my]0-i dear]2421-my dear ; and , when [you]209-mr. forth are a little older , [you]209-mr. forth will read better still ! ' " [Sarah]135-sarah joins in the laugh , but not warmly . "[2549-his mother] And this , " [she]0-i says indignantly , "[2549-his mother] is the companion with whom [you]209-mr. forth are to be left tête - à - tête for four months ! " [Belinda]134-belinda bends [her]134-belinda charming head in a nod of cheerful acquiescence . "[2549-his mother] It is monstrous ! " continues [Miss Churchill]152-miss churchill , with a growing energy of ire . "[2549-his mother] It is beyond belief ! [I]0-i have a good mind , now , at the last moment , to give [him]209-mr. forth a piece of [my]0-i mind ! Where is [he]209-mr. forth ? " glancing threateningly towards the windows of [the house]2521-the house . "[0-i] Let [me]0-i take [him]209-mr. forth redhanded , in the act of packing [his]209-mr. forth portmanteau ! " There is such a doughty purpose in [her]0-i voice and [her]0-i pink porcelain face , that [Belinda]134-belinda , seizing [her]0-i arm in apprehensive detention , cries : "[0-i] Do not ! It would be no use . Do [you]209-mr. forth remember the proverb about putting the finger entre l'arbre et l'écorce ? And [I]0-i — [I]0-i do not want to go with [him]209-mr. forth . " At the last words , [she]134-belinda has turned [her]134-belinda head slightly aside . "[0-i] Do [you]209-mr. forth think that [he]209-mr. forth would be [a pleasant travelling - companion]1851-a pleasant travelling - companion ? " [she]134-belinda goes on rapidly , perceiving that [[her]134-belinda sister]2366-her sister does not make any rejoinder , but only looks at [her]134-belinda searchingly . "[209-mr. forth] Do [you]209-mr. forth remember how ashamed [we]1852-we used to be when [he]209-mr. forth haggled over the groschen at [Dresden]2-dresden ? A tour with [him]209-mr. forth would be one colossal blush . " "[209-mr. forth] It is a choice of evils , of course , " says [Sarah]135-sarah dispassionately . "[209-mr. forth] Perhaps [my]0-i early passion blinds [me]0-i , but , personally , [I]0-i should prefer [him]209-mr. forth . " "[209-mr. forth] Should [you]209-mr. forth ? " "[209-mr. forth] Four months ! " repeats [Miss Churchill]152-miss churchill , in almost awed reflection . "[209-mr. forth] How many times , at a rough calculation , in four months will [you]209-mr. forth tell [her]1853-her who [you]209-mr. forth are ; and that there is a foolish prejudice in favour of burying [people]523-people before [they]523-people have been dead twenty - five years ? " "[1853-her] Perhaps [I]0-i shall end by joining [her]1853-her in the belief that [[my]0-i father - in - law]1855-my father - in - law is still above ground , " replies [Belinda]134-belinda ; but [she]134-belinda says it in a tone of such unassumed equanimity , that again [Sarah]135-sarah regards [her]134-belinda with astonishment . "[209-mr. forth] Four months ! " [she]134-belinda repeats , a third time . "[209-mr. forth] Do [you]209-mr. forth mean to tell [me]0-i that [you]209-mr. forth are not desperate at such a prospect ? " "[209-mr. forth] Of course [I]0-i am — desperate ! " But there is not a touch of desperation , or even of milder sadness , in [her]134-belinda voice . "[209-mr. forth] How do [you]209-mr. forth mean to live thorough it ? " "[209-mr. forth] How do [people]523-people endure existence on these occasions ? " [She]1853-her has knelt on the springy turf , and is cutting , one after one , a score of young and dewy pinks , to comfort [[her]1853-her sister]2366-her sister during [her]1853-her dusty up - journey ; carefully , and with the grudging hand of [a real flower - lover]4222-a real flower - lover , choosing those that are budless : no easy feat , for there is scarcely one that has not a grey - green successor beneath its perfumed wing . "[523-people] Eating , drinking , sleeping , yawning ! " "[523-people] Are [you]209-mr. forth quite sure that [you]209-mr. forth will have no other support ? " asks [Sarah]135-sarah abruptly , and yet slowly . For a moment the garden - scissors in [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth 's hand cease their clipping , and remain suspended and open , like that other pair which snipped [[her]1853-her namesake]4223-her namesake 's love - lock , while a dye as opulent as that of the new peony , whose birth the garden - border this morning greeted , stains even the milk - coloured nape of [her]1853-her stooped neck . "[209-mr. forth] [I]0-i — [I]0-i — do not know what [you]209-mr. forth mean , " [she]135-sarah says coldly ; "[0-i] what — what other support should [I]0-i have ? " "[134-belinda] [Belinda]134-belinda , " says [the other]2396-the other , dropping down on the sward beside [her]135-sarah , and griping [her]0-i shaking hand — scissors , pinks , and all — in [her]0-i own little eager clasp , "[134-belinda] why should not [I]0-i come back and keep [you]134-belinda company ? [I]0-i may not be [a very intellectual companion]1857-a very intellectual companion , but at least [I]0-i have a firmer hold upon [my]0-i few facts than has [[your]134-belinda poor mamma - in - law]1858-your poor mamma - in - law . Let [me]0-i come back ; [we]1859-we will have [Jane]229-jane down , and [Punch]186-punch shall show [her]229-jane the University"—with a not very assured laugh . "[186-punch] Let [me]0-i come ! " But the hands so urgently pressed give no answering pressure . Upon the half - averted face comes no glow of sisterly pleasure or acceptance . A senseless suspicion has flashed across [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth 's mind , that the present proposition on [Sarah]135-sarah 's part may be an impormptu fait à loisir ; that it may have been arranged between [her]271-mrs. forth and [Rivers]143-rivers ; that here may lie the secret of [his]4225-his eagerness to repeat [his]4225-his visit ; that — in fact whatever angry gibberish jealousy may whisper to a mind ripe and ready for its reception . Under pretext of resuming [her]271-mrs. forth pinkcutting , [she]271-mrs. forth has withdrawn [her]271-mrs. forth unwillingly - captured hand ; but [she]271-mrs. forth is no longer careful : the unblown buds fall as freely as the opened flowers . "[186-punch] And give up [Cowes]314-cowes and [Scotland]96-scotland ? " [she]271-mrs. forth says in a dry voice ; "[1860-she] and what would [granny]1860-she say ? " "[1860-she] It would not be of the slightest consequence what [she]1860-she said , " replies [Sarah]135-sarah , smothering bravely a disappointment none the less sharp for being mastered at [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister 's reception of [her]135-sarah proposal . "[1860-she] [You]1861-you are aware that [[my]0-i grandmother]2625-my grandmother 's words have always been to [me]0-i as the idle wind ; which , [I]0-i believe , is one main reason of the sincere regard and respect that [she]1860-she cherishes for [me]0-i . If [granny]156-granny is the only stumbling - block — " "[156-granny] [I]0-i could not think of being so selfish ! " interrupts [Belinda]134-belinda hastily , not allowing [[her]134-belinda sister]2366-her sister to finish [her]134-belinda sentence . "[156-granny] There would be no selfishness if [I]0-i liked it , " says [Sarah]135-sarah persistently ; "[0-i] and — [you]1861-you may wonder at [my]0-i taste , but [I]0-i should like it . " [Belinda]134-belinda has risen from [her]134-belinda knees , and has turned to a damask rose - bush , to lay it under contribution for [her]134-belinda nosegay . "[0-i] It is so perfectly unneccessary , " [she]0-i says , cutting feverishly away ; "[1861-you] [you]1861-you are tilting against [windmills]1863-windmills . [I]0-i make no complaint ; [I]0-i think it no hardship to be alone . [I]0-i am not like [you]1861-you , miserable if [I]0-i am left five minutes to [my]0-i own society ! " There is such a strain of impatience through [her]0-i speech , that [Sarah]135-sarah reluctantly desists , nor are many more words exchanged between [them]4228-them . [The cab]4229-the cab is at the door . The luggage — cursed of [cabmen]4230-cabmen — has been hoisted on the top . [Punch]186-punch is , at [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth 's petition — a petition certainly not backed up by [Slutty]1690-slutty — to be left on a visit to [her]271-mrs. forth . The moment of parting has come . [Sarah]135-sarah apparently wishes that that parting shall take place without [witnesses]4232-witnesses . [She]135-sarah draws [[her]135-sarah sister]2366-her sister back into [the drawing - room]3050-the drawing - room , and shuts the door . "[134-belinda] [Belinda]134-belinda , " [she]2366-her sister says , when [she]2366-her sister has somewhat coldly kissed [her]2366-her sister , looking in [her]2366-her sister face with a gravity that only once or twice before in the course of [their]4235-their lives has [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth seen written on those small gay lineaments . "[134-belinda] [Belinda]134-belinda , [I]0-i wash [my]0-i hands of [you]134-belinda ; [I]0-i would have helped [you]134-belinda if [I]0-i could . [I]0-i have no reason for saying so — [I]0-i know nothing , and [you]134-belinda will tell [me]0-i nothing ; but [I]0-i can not help thinking that [you]134-belinda are going to the devil , and that [you]134-belinda are taking [David Rivers]143-rivers with [you]134-belinda ! " Then , without another word , [she]0-i is gone . Without one last look from the cab window , without a farewell friendly handwave ; forgetting even to bid good - bye to the dogs , or take [their]4235-their messages to [Jane]229-jane , [she]0-i is gone . For some minutes [Belinda]134-belinda remains standing on the exact spot at which [[her]134-belinda sister]2366-her sister had left [her]134-belinda ; remains standing , still and stunned . Then [she]134-belinda suddenly throws [herself]134-belinda into [the Professor]2365-the professor 's armchair , and spreads [her]134-belinda hands over [her]134-belinda face . [She]134-belinda would like not to let a quarter of an inch of it remain uncovered . The light is strong and brutal . [She]134-belinda would like to draw the blinds down and shut the shutters . "[143-rivers] Going to the devil , and taking [David Rivers]143-rivers with [you]134-belinda ! " The blood is singing loudly in [her]134-belinda ears . It seems to take the form of these words . Over and over again . The moment the sentence is ended , it begins afresh . How long [she]134-belinda lies there — outwardly a log , inwardly a shameful fire — [she]134-belinda neither knows nor cares . But after a while a tide of indignation sets in through all [her]134-belinda being , chasing before it the shame , and [she]134-belinda sits up . What disgraceful words for [[her]134-belinda own sister]4238-her own sister to apply to [her]134-belinda ! and what slightest ground , excuse , palliation even , had [she]4238-her own sister for so insulting [her]134-belinda ? Going to the devil ! And pray , what is it to go to [the devil]4239-the devil ? Is it to fulfil with nice scrupulosity every tasteless or even nauseous duty of a most dreary life ? To sing as [she]134-belinda walks [[her]134-belinda treadmill]4240-her treadmill ? To smile patiently over [her]134-belinda oakumpicking ? To forego [her]134-belinda own hot bright youth , and clip down its rich proportions to the meagre pattern of the dry and crabbed age with which it is mismated ? To be [a secretary without pay]4241-a secretary without pay , [a drudge without wage]4242-a drudge without wage , [a souffre douleur without hope of enlargement]4243-a souffre douleur without hope of enlargement , [a prisoner the term of whose incarceration lies in the hands of arbitrary death]4244-a prisoner the term of whose incarceration lies in the hands of arbitrary death ? If this be to go to the devil , then [she]134-belinda is not only going [there]2419-there , but has long ago gone . [She]134-belinda laughs sarcastically , and [her]134-belinda feverish limbs carry [her]134-belinda up and down [the room]422-the room . If [Sarah]135-sarah had given [her]134-belinda time , this is how [she]134-belinda would have answered [her]134-belinda — thus and thus . For a while [she]134-belinda walks to and fro , muttering under [her]134-belinda breath , framing withering sentences of self - exculpation , that must carry conviction to any mind . But that mood , too , passes . As [her]134-belinda wrath — spent and exhausted — subsides , another voice , lower yet more penetrating , takes its place . Going to the devil ! Is going to the devil to have [a husband whose pursuits [you]4248-you abhor , whose infirmities [you]4248-you secretly deride , at whose accidental touch [you]4248-you shiver]4247-a husband whose pursuits you abhor , whose infirmities you secretly deride , at whose accidental touch you shiver ? Is going to the devil to be speeding with disloyal alacrity [that husband]4249-that husband 's departure , to be counting the hours to the end of [[your]4248-you only sister]4250-your only sister 's visit , to be living and feeding and flourishing upon a hope that [you]4248-you dare not look in the face , that [you]4248-you would sooner die than impart to [any soul that breathes]4251-any soul that breathes ? Is this to be going to [the devil]4239-the devil ? [She]134-belinda has again wholly hidden [her]134-belinda face with [her]134-belinda hands . Again the light seems over - strong and pushing . And plain and distinct , beyond possibility of misapprehension , the answer comes—"Yes[143-rivers] ! yes ! yes ! " A couple of hours later [the Professor]2365-the professor lifts a head , a good deal reddened and exasperated by long burrowing in the bowels of a portmanteau , to see [[his]2365-the professor pale wife]4254-his pale wife enter [[his]2365-the professor room]4255-his room . "[143-rivers] [I]0-i came to see whether [I]0-i could help [you]1864-you , " [she]0-i says gently , though in a spiritless flat voice . "[0-i] The idea has occurred to [you]0-i somewhat late in the day , " replies [he]2365-the professor ungraciously . "[0-i] It was fortunate for [me]0-i that [I]0-i did not depend upon [your]0-i offers of assistance , volunteered this morning . " "[0-i] [I]0-i was bidding [Sarah]135-sarah good - bye , " [she]0-i answers apologetically , and without any trace of resentment at [his]2365-the professor tone . "[0-i] [She]135-sarah has been gone exactly three hours and a half , " replies [he]2365-the professor drily , glancing at the clock . [She]0-i offers no further justification , but kneeling down on the floor , lets [her]0-i hands , which tremble perceptibly , stray rather purposelessly over the books strewn upon the carpet . "[135-sarah] Pray , mind what [you]0-i are about ! " [he]2365-the professor cries sharply "[0-i] [you]0-i are doing more harm than good . " "[0-i] [They]1865-they are to go , are not [they]1865-they ? " [she]0-i says , lifting a heavy folio , and looking humbly up at [him]2365-the professor . "[0-i] [I]0-i am obliged to omit [Augustine]315-augustine , Irenæus , and several books of reference , as they would entail very considerable expense upon [me]0-i in excess of weight , " [he]2365-the professor replies , peering down through [his]2365-the professor spectacles at [his]2365-the professor strewn treasures . "[0-i] [I]0-i the less regret it as , since [I]0-i am taking [no secretary]1866-no secretary with [me]0-i — " How very white [her]0-i face is ! Has [she]0-i had some sudden scare ? "[0-i] Why are not [you]0-i taking [a secretary]1239-a secretary ? " [she]0-i asks in a very low voice . "[0-i] Why — why do not [you]0-i take [me]0-i ? " [He]2365-the professor shifts the focus of [his]2365-the professor vision from [Irenaeus]316-irenaeus to [her]0-i face ; but apparently the latter object gives [him]2365-the professor less tranquil pleasure than did the former . "[0-i] [You]0-i have never expressed the slightest desire to accompany [me]0-i , " [he]2365-the professor answers chillingly . [She]0-i hangs [her]0-i head , a guilty conscious ness staining [her]0-i pallor red . "[0-i] Have not [I]0-i ? Perhaps [I]0-i thought that [you]0-i did not want [me]0-i . " There is a deliberate pause before [he]2365-the professor answers , and [her]0-i heart goes down , down . [He]2365-the professor is about to accept [her]0-i offer ! But [his]2365-the professor first words reassure [her]0-i . "[0-i] [I]0-i can see no object that would be gained by such a change of plan , " [he]2365-the professor replies , in a key that plainly shows [his]2365-the professor annoyance at the suggestion having been made . "[0-i] [I]0-i go in search of health ; a quest which [you]0-i , happily for [yourself]0-i , have no need to pursue . " [She]0-i draws a long breath of relief ; but now that the danger of acceptance seems less imminent , [her]0-i scruples return . [Sarah]135-sarah 's stinging phrase begins to ring again in [her]0-i ears . "[0-i] [You]0-i — [you]0-i forget that [I]0-i shall be all alone here , " [she]0-i says , nervously fidgeting with the already packed portion of the portmanteau . "[0-i] [You]0-i will have [[my]0-i mother]614-my mother . " [She]0-i shrugs [her]0-i shoulders . "[614-my mother] [She]614-my mother can hardly be reckoned as [a companion]1869-a companion . " At [her]0-i capricious and untimely opposition , [his]4256-his forehead gathers into vexed wrinkles . "[614-my mother] Since it appears that [[your]0-i own society]1870-your own society has such terrors for [you]0-i , [you]0-i are at liberty to invite [[your]0-i sister]3060-your sister to come and share [your]0-i solitude . " Again the guilty head stoops . "[3060-your sister] [She]3060-your sister — [she]3060-your sister has engagements of [her]3060-your sister own . " "[3060-your sister] So [I]0-i should have imagined , " replies [he]4256-his with a disagreeable smile ; "[3060-your sister] but [you]0-i can scarcely hold [me]0-i responsible for [them]1872-them . " Another pause . [She]0-i is aimlessly wrapping paper round one of the volumes that are not wanted , that are not to be taken eruditely tripping to [the Alps]97-the alps . [She]0-i will make one more effort . If that fail , [no one]365-no one , not even [Sarah]135-sarah , can blame [her]0-i . "[0-i] Does not it strike [you]0-i that [I]0-i shall be very dull here , all by [myself]0-i ? " [she]0-i asks , timorously eyeing [him]4258-he . "[0-i] [I]0-i have always understood , upon [your]0-i own authority , that [you]0-i were indifferent to , if not averse from , amusements , " [he]4258-he answers irritably . "[0-i] Not now — not now ! " [she]0-i cries feverishly . "[0-i] Even if [I]0-i were so formerly , [I]0-i am not now ; and even if [I]0-i were — to be alone for four months ! " "[0-i] [You]0-i exaggerate grossly , " returns [he]4258-he sharply . "[0-i] There are [many residents who do not leave [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge until the end of July]1873-many residents who do not leave oxbridge until the end of july , and [many who return at the beginning of September]1874-many who return at the beginning of september . " "[1875-they] [They]1875-they will do [me]0-i no good , " [she]0-i says excitedly . "[1875-they] How will [they]1875-they help [me]0-i ? " [He]4258-he shrugs [his]4258-he shoulders silently , as who should say that upon one lost in such mazes of inconsequence and irrationality breath would be wasted . "[1875-they] Do [you]0-i remember that [I]0-i am young ? " [she]0-i says , in a hard low voice , rising from [her]0-i knees and approaching [him]4258-he . "[0-i] It is certainly not [your]0-i fault if [I]0-i do not , " replies [he]4258-he peevishly ; "[0-i] for [you]0-i are good enough to remind [me]0-i of the fact often enough . " "[0-i] It is because [you]0-i always act as if [you]0-i forgot it , " retorts [she]0-i , [her]0-i temper rising under [his]4258-he tone . "[0-i] [I]0-i confess that [I]0-i fail to see how [your]0-i juvenility affects the present case , " [he]4258-he says satirically . "[0-i] Do [you]0-i ? " [she]0-i answers with a scorching blush , that seems to burn inside as well as outside [her]0-i . "[0-i] [Some men]1876-some men might think that [I]0-i was too young to be left to [my]0-i own devices ; that [I]0-i — [I]0-i might get into mischief ! " [He]4258-he has taken off [his]4258-he spectacles in order to rub [their]1877-we glasses . [He]4258-he now deliberately replaces them , and regards [her]0-i attentively through them . "[0-i] [I]0-i presume , " [he]4258-he says deliberately , "[0-i] that that last remark is to be regarded as a pleasantry , though [I]0-i fail to see the point of it . " "[0-i] [I]0-i am so much given to pleasantries , " [she]0-i says bitterly . "[0-i] [We]1877-we are so apt to joke with [one another]657-one another : are not [we]1877-we ? " "[0-i] It seemed difficult to treat such an observation seriously , " returns [he]4258-he , in a measured voice of displeasure . "[0-i] What mischief , may [I]0-i ask , are [you]0-i likely to get into , here under the shelter of [[your]0-i own roof]1879-your own roof , and in the quiet performance of [your]0-i regular duties ? [I]0-i can not but think that the alarm under which [you]0-i labour is an unnecessary one . " For all answer , [she]0-i turns abruptly away . The infinitely difficult confession which [she]0-i was half - heartedly struggling to make to [him]4258-he , frozen back by [his]4258-he gibe . "[0-i] [You]0-i have evidently a most flattering confidence in [me]0-i , " [she]0-i says , adopting [his]4258-he tone . "[0-i] [I]0-i do not quite know what [I]0-i have done to deserve it . " As a reply , [the Professor]2365-the professor turns thoughtfully back to [his]4258-he folios , weighing the dispensability or indispensability as [a travelling companion of each]4260-a travelling companion of each , with an air of having dismissed the subject , and of resolutely waiving further consideration of so senseless a matter . [[His]4258-he wife]713-his wife stands dubiously watching [him]4258-he . "[0-i] [I]0-i do not know why [we]1880-we are sneering at [each other]469-each other , " [she]0-i says at last , in a disturbed voice . "[0-i] [I]0-i had not any intention of sneering when [I]0-i came [here]2351-here . [I]0-i came to ask [you]0-i in all — good faith " ( [he]4258-he does not perceive the slight hesitation which prefaces the last two words ) "[0-i] to take [me]0-i with [you]0-i — will [you]0-i ? " To so point - blank an appeal [he]4258-he must provide an answer of some kind ; though nothing can be clearer than that [he]4258-he would rather have relegated the affair to the limbo of a contemptuous silence . "[0-i] [I]0-i am unable to understand [you]0-i , " [he]4258-he says , with slow annoyance . "[0-i] At the last moment , and when [my]0-i plans are fully matured , and could only be remodelled at great inconvenience to [myself]0-i , [you]0-i suddenly appear with a proposal entirely to disintegrate [them]1883-them . Had [you]0-i any good reasons to show — " ( [She]0-i has good reasons enough , [God]184-god wot ! but looking at the unlovely and unloving rigour of [his]4258-he face , [she]0-i feels that to die , to be flayed alive — whatever things in short have been reckoned hardest of endurance since [the world]643-the world was — are but as [child]732-child 's play compared to what the telling [them]1883-them to [him]4258-he would be . ) "[0-i] Since , then , " [he]4258-he continues , with an air of judicial coldness , and not thinking it worth while to finish [his]4258-he former sentence , "[0-i] it is dictated merely by a puerile caprice — " "[0-i] It is not caprice , " [she]0-i stammers urgently , in puissant excitement . "[0-i] If it is not caprice , nothing can be easier than to prove it , " rejoins [he]4258-he coolly , and so turns again on [his]4258-he heel . Behind [his]4258-he back [she]0-i makes a gesture as of one that throws up a game . Is not [he]4258-he in the right ? Has not [he]4258-he a show of reason and justice on [his]4258-he side ? Why not acquiesce without further kicking against the pricks ? But yet something drives [her]0-i to a last attempt . Although thrice baffled , although at each new discomfiture [her]0-i heart has sprung up in joyful relief , [she]0-i will press [her]0-i suit once more . "[1884-you] [You]1884-you know that [women]2468-women never have any reasons to give , " [she]0-i says with a laugh that has borrowed something from its opposite — a sob , and in a gentler voice than that which [she]0-i is wo nt to think soft enough for converse with [him]4258-he ; "[2468-women] but sometimes [their]2468-women instincts lead [them]2468-women right . [I]0-i — [I]0-i think that [you]1884-you had better take [me]0-i with [you]1884-you ! " Envenomed by [her]0-i pertinacity , [he]4258-he wheels round upon [her]0-i viciously . "[1884-you] Perhaps [you]1884-you will be good enough to expose [your]1884-you reasons , " [he]4258-he says , "[1884-you] premising , that is to say , that they are such as [a person of ordinary common sense]1886-a person of ordinary common sense can permit [himself]1886-a person of ordinary common sense to listen to . " "[0-i] [I]0-i should not be much in [your]1884-you way , " [she]0-i says humbly , and going so far — for [her]0-i it is immensely far — as to lay [her]0-i fair hand on [his]4258-he coat - sleeve . "[0-i] Of course [my]0-i society would be no great gain to [you]1884-you , but [I]0-i could make [myself]0-i useful ; [I]0-i could pack and unpack for [you]1884-you ; [I]0-i have learned [your]1884-you ways thoroughly by this time . It would be odd , " with a sad little laugh , "[0-i] if [I]0-i had not ; and if [you]1884-you had one of [your]1884-you attacks [I]0-i could nurse [you]1884-you ! " [She]0-i has made [her]0-i plea , and with eyes that feel dry , and breath that comes short , awaits its prosperity or miscarriage . For a while [he]1884-you eyes [her]0-i with silent suspicion . "[0-i] It would be a most unnecessary expense , " [he]1884-you says at last , shortly . "[0-i] [I]0-i should not expect , [I]0-i should not wish for , any luxuries , " [she]0-i answers , [her]0-i pleading growing , perhaps , the more earnest from [her]0-i consciousness of the intensity of the wish for its ill - success that goes with it . "[0-i] [I]0-i drink no wine , and [I]0-i do not eat much . " "[0-i] [Pshaw]266-pshaw ! " retorts [he]1884-you , with angry ridicule ; "[1884-you] are [you]1884-you simple enough to suppose that [the hotel]1708-the hotel tariffs vary according to the number of mouthfuls [you]1884-you swallow ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i have no objection to travelling third - class ; [I]0-i should never ask for [a sitting - room]1888-a sitting - room ; [I]0-i am quite capable of roughing it , " [she]0-i urges tremulously . "[0-i] No doubt ! no doubt ! " [he]1884-you answers tartly ; "[0-i] all the same , [you]0-i would more than double the expense . " "[0-i] And if [I]0-i did ? " [she]0-i says firmly — for is not this [her]0-i last appeal , and is not [she]0-i bound to make it no pretence , but a real and thoroughly earnest one?—"what[0-i] need that matter to [you]1884-you ? [You]1884-you are well off , and"—lowering [her]0-i voice a little—"you[365-no one] have [no one]365-no one to come after [you]1884-you . " Perhaps the plea is an injudiciously chosen one . [No man]4264-no man likes to be reminded that [he]4264-no man will stand or fall alone ; that [he]4264-no man is without a stake in the generations to come . At all events , on hearing it , [his]4264-no man features assume a look even more acrid than that which they wore before . "[0-i] [I]0-i must request [you]0-i to consider the subject as closed , " [he]4264-no man says with a decision against which there is no appeal . "[0-i] [I]0-i have , for reasons which appear sufficient to [myself]0-i — and [I]0-i ask [no other arbiter]1890-no other arbiter — come to a final decision upon it ; pray let [us]1891-us hear no more of it . " "[1884-you] As [you]1884-you please , " [she]0-i answers , bowing acquiescently a head whose cheeks have suddenly resumed their carnations , and its eyes [their]4265-their young dance ; "[1884-you] [I]0-i suppose , as [you]1884-you say , that [you]1884-you know [your]1884-you own affairs best , but [I]0-i think [I]0-i have heard that there is such a thing as being ' penny wise and pound foolish . ' " [The Professor]2365-the professor has been gone a [parson]4267-parson 's week . For the same period of time [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth has been testing the genuineness of [her]271-mrs. forth appetite for solitude ; nor finding it fail beneath the experiment . Perhaps it is the extreme clearness of [her]271-mrs. forth conscience that upholds [her]271-mrs. forth ; for do not [we]1891-us all know , either by its possession or its lack , that there is [no cheerfuller companion than a clear conscience]4268-no cheerfuller companion than a clear conscience ? nothing that gives such a zest to appetite , or such a point to occupation ? And can [anyone]494-anyone be in fuller possession of this innocent luxury than [Belinda]134-belinda ? Has not [she]0-i craved with meek persistency leave to share [[her]0-i husband]3353-her husband 's travels ? and , reluctantly compelled to abandon this hope , has not [she]0-i provided , with wifely care , for every possible need that may assail [him]3353-her husband on that sanitary excursion , for whose loneliness none can blame [her]0-i ? Did [she]0-i forget [his]3353-her husband Etna ? or [his]3353-her husband eider down ? or [his]3353-her husband air - cushion ? Did [she]0-i , as many [a spouse though otherwise meritorious]4271-a spouse though otherwise meritorious might easily have done , omit [his]3353-her husband tin of digestive biscuits ? Was there lacking from [his]3353-her husband kit at [his]3353-her husband departure one of [his]3353-her husband heart drops , liver pills , spleen boluses ? What but the consciousness of a duty performed both generously and minutely could enable [her]0-i to wave [her]0-i hand at the fly - window with so collected a friendliness ; smile such a serene "[0-i] Bon voyage " to the jewel of which that fly is the casket ? To assume an inconsolable grief would be absurd , and would take [him]3353-her husband in even less than [herself]0-i ; but there is no hypocrisy in crying , "[0-i] A good journey to [you]1892-you ! " As [she]0-i returns up [the gravelled drive]4272-the gravelled drive , [she]0-i stoops to pick up a small stone . How brightly it shines ! "[0-i] Is it a strayed agate or beryl ? " "[0-i] Pooh ! " ( throwing it down again ) , "[0-i] it is only a pebble ; it is only the late shower and the present sun that have turned it into a temporary gem . " But the same rich metamorphosis seems to have taken place in the case of every object upon which [her]0-i eye alights . Did ever bountiful rose - tree show such a wealth of come flowers and coming buds , as the "[0-i] Captain Christy " against the study wall ? Was ever [little Philistine drawing - room so rich in gold motes lustily astride on the sunbeams]4273-little philistine drawing - room so rich in gold motes lustily astride on the sunbeams ? Even the very dogs , the well - known dogs , seem to wear an air of better breeding ; manners of higher finish ; tails of more watchspring curl than on any previous morning . Even the parrot 's profanities — in point of fact , very common - places of blasphemy , uttered with an Oxbridge accent — have won a raciness never before [theirs]4274-they . [She]0-i wanders from [room]1737-room to [room]1737-room , as it were taking possession . Are not [they]4274-they all [her]0-i own , [her]0-i very own now ? Even without the explanation to that effect , which in pure wantonness of spirits [she]0-i has vouchsafed separately to [Punch]186-punch and [Slutty]157-slutty , [they]4274-they seem perfectly to understand that [they]4274-they are now at libetty to rumple the chair - covers , clatter down the fire - irons , oppress the cats as freely as [their]4274-they soul listeth ; that there are no longer any nerves in [the house]2521-the house , any dyspepsia , any learning . Nor does the passage of the hours and days bring with it any sensible alteration in this mood , of either [hers]0-i or [theirs]4274-they . Daily [she]0-i sees [the piled vehicles]4278-the piled vehicles rolling past to [the station]937-the station ; carrying [[her]0-i fellow - townsmen]4280-her fellow - townsmen away to [their]4280-her fellow - townsmen holiday ; stampedes of [whole large small families]4281-whole large small families to [the seaside]4282-the seaside ( the new [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge swarms and perambulates and crawls with [little children , all apparently of the same age to a day]4283-little children , all apparently of the same age to a day ) ; [hardy young couples]4284-hardy young couples winging bold flights to [the North Cape]98-the north cape , or [more modest Dolomites]4285-more modest dolomites . [She]0-i wishes [them]4274-they all a happy time and safe return ; but not a twinge of envy goes with one of [them]4274-they . [Home]2345-home is good enough for [her]0-i ; [England]25-england far enough ; [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge fair enough . Even [Sarah]135-sarah 's parting words , at first so rankling with poisonous sting , grow gradually powerless to hurt . [She]0-i begins to think of them at first with indignation , next with indifference , and at last even with a lofty kind of compassionate forgiveness . "[0-i] It is the speakers of such calumnious utterances , " [she]0-i says to [herself]0-i , without conscious sophistry , "[1893-they] not those to whom [they]1893-they are addressed , whom [they]1893-they injure . " [She]0-i lets [her]0-i mind run with complacency round the circle of [her]0-i accurately fulfilled duties . Is there [one in a thousand who , considering the nature of those duties]4287-one in a thousand who , considering the nature of those duties , would fulfil them as accurately ? Has not [she]0-i , in addition to the tasks imposed upon [her]0-i , for fulfilment during [his]4288-his absence by [[her]0-i husband]3353-her husband , voluntarily undertaken to make a new catalogue of [[his]4288-his library]4290-his library , as a wifely surprise for [him]4288-his upon [his]4288-his return ? Does [she]0-i scamp , by one moment , the time of [her]0-i visits to [[his]4288-his mother]2549-his mother ? Has not [she]0-i rather enlarged them by nearly a daily hour ? Is not [the nurse]4035-the nurse ready to lick [her]0-i feet , for [her]0-i consideration and unselfish sharing of [that nurse]4293-that nurse 's burden ? Does [her]0-i patience ever for an instant fail under [the old lady]2704-the old lady 's senseless catechisms ? Can anything surpass the painstaking discretion with which [she]0-i conducts [the Professor]2365-the professor 's correspondence , left behind [him]4288-his , in [her]0-i charge ? or the respectful punctuality and amplitude of [her]0-i own letters to [him]4288-his ? Nor is [her]0-i self - satisfaction less , when [she]0-i consider [her]0-i pleasures . Might not [every member of [the University]4297-the university]4296-every member of the university , [every inhabitant of [the world]643-the world]4298-every inhabitant of the world , if [he]4288-his saw fit , have leave to pry into each moment of [her]0-i leisure , as of [her]0-i occupations ? The happy gardenings — weeding the border , with the dogs yawning [their]4300-they hearts out beside [her]0-i , in affectionate endurance of a pastime [they]4300-they are so far from participating . Dogs hate gardening ; [they]4300-they see no sense in it . Of what use , pray , to dig a hole , when [you]4301-you have no bone to bury in it ? [The long country walks]4302-the long country walks to [the elm - shaded rural villages]4303-the elm - shaded rural villages , and through [the late June fields]4304-the late june fields , where [man]2737-man has sown [his]2737-man corn and [God]184-god has thrown in [His]184-god poppies ; the return [home]2345-home , poppy - laden , to make [the house]2521-the house one scarlet bower , though it is embellished for only [her]0-i own eye . Never has that eye seemed so open to see . Never has [her]0-i ear seemed to be laid so close to the heart of [the mighty mother]4308-the mighty mother , to hear its beatings . Never till this year had [she]0-i learned all the music that lies even in the trumpeting gnat and the booming evening chafers . Never had [she]0-i grown into such familiar friendship with the woodland birds . All [her]0-i life , of course , [she]0-i has known that the thrush 's song is sweet , and the lark 's exulting ; but not till now — so unobservant are [we]4309-we — has [she]0-i learned surely the songs of [the lesser minne - singers]4310-the lesser minne - singers , [the minor stars of the great concert]4311-the minor stars of the great concert . But this summer , by right perhaps of [her]0-i harmlessness and [her]0-i solitude , [she]0-i has stolen into [their]4312-their intimacy . [She]0-i recognises [them]4312-their lovingly , not only when [they]4312-their sing , but when [they]4312-their converse among [themselves]4312-their . [She]0-i knows the tomtit 's table - talk — like the grating of a tiny saw ; the cock chaffinch 's — all : [she]0-i grows discriminatingly cunning in all [their]4312-their little speech . The dogs enjoy [themselves]4312-their too in [their]4312-their way , though [they]4312-their think that the flowers smell ill ; and that the birds ' noise is ugly and foolish , not to be named in the same breath with the poignant love - songs of the nightly cats . [Slutty]157-slutty , indeed , has suffered one of those disappointments , from which not dogs any more than [men]2377-men are exempt . For four - and - twenty hours [Punch]186-punch has been lost ; and from the more than resignation , evidenced by [her]0-i during [his]186-punch absence , and the acute depression coincident with [his]186-punch restoration , it is but too clear that [she]0-i had hoped [his]186-punch disappearance was a permanent one . [June]317-june nears [her]0-i perfumed close . The second Sunday of [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth 's loneliness has come round . The first was marked by no special incident . [Belinda]134-belinda had not expected that it would be . But , indeed , not even to [herself]134-belinda does [she]134-belinda allow that [she]134-belinda anticipates anything for any Sunday . But yet , on this second Sunday [she]134-belinda rises with such a feeling of irrepressible blithe excitement , that [she]134-belinda must needs casuistically explain it to [herself]134-belinda . The air is so good . The smell of the hay comes now into [the middle of [the town]474-the town]4314-the middle of the town ; into [street]4316-street and [market - place]4317-market - place ; how much more hither , where [she]134-belinda is in the enjoyment of a sort of [suburban pseudo - country]4318-suburban pseudo - country . [She]134-belinda has ever been fond of Sunday . It is always a favourite day with [her]134-belinda ; much more so in [this Sunday city of]4319-this sunday city of innumerable church bells . [She]134-belinda dresses with a resolute abstaining from adding a single adornment , or making any change , however slight , in [[her]134-belinda usual Sunday toilet]4320-her usual sunday toilet . To do so would be to allow that [she]134-belinda had some reason for the alteration . Perhaps , with this motive mingles an unconfessed superstition that to presuppose a pleasure by preparation for it , is the surest way to rob [yourself]4321-yourself of its fruition . [She]134-belinda reads the Lessons for the day to [[her]134-belinda mother - in - law]4322-her mother - in - law , with as reverent a distinctness as if [the poor old lady]4323-the poor old lady could follow [them]4324-them , or were even aware of the nature of the attention . It is a proceeding of whose judiciousness [she]134-belinda [herself]134-belinda has no great opinion ; but it is one of the tasks imposed upon [her]134-belinda by [[her]134-belinda husband]3353-her husband , and which [she]134-belinda would by no means intermit . When [they]4324-them are ended , having told [her]134-belinda the news of [[her]134-belinda husband]3353-her husband 's death , which [she]134-belinda receives with [her]134-belinda usual pleased surprise , [Belinda]134-belinda goes lightly away to put on [her]134-belinda bonnet for [church]613-church . As [she]134-belinda walks along , [her]134-belinda memory grows suddenly occupied with the recollection of that other solitary walk to [church]613-church at [Folkestone]81-folkestone ; of the griding cold ; [the ice - bound earth]4329-the ice - bound earth ; the misery of [her]134-belinda yet more ice - bound heart ; of the wretched prisoned starling to which [she]134-belinda had likened [herself]134-belinda . Not greater is [earth]698-earth 's change than that which is wrought within [herself]134-belinda . But for [her]134-belinda change , what reason is there ? Has the starling then escaped ? The question flashes upon [her]134-belinda with an uneasy start , but is instantly silenced again . The service is one of those brief and modernized ones , that make [us]4331-us marvel at the patience of [our]4331-us earlier days ; yet to [Belinda]134-belinda it seems long . Whether sweetly singing , devoutly kneeling , or attentively listening , [she]134-belinda has no peace from the buzzing thought — never allowed , never looked in the face — but always returning , gnat - like : "[1893-they] When will it be ? Where will it be ? How long will it last ? " It does not leave [her]134-belinda at [the church]803-the church door , but buzzes and teases all along [the sunshiny road]4333-the sunshiny road . It will buzz and tease until it gets its answer . Well , let it ! For is not that answer now given ? At the turn of [the road]392-the road , close at [home]2345-home , free from the stream of [churchgoers]4336-churchgoers , which has flowed in other directions , with no more witness than [a milkman]4337-a milkman swinging unconcernedly along beneath [his]4337-a milkman yoke , there it will be — there it is ! Has not every moment since [their]4338-their parting been but a leading up to and preparation for this moment ? And yet , at the sight of [him]1894-he [she]134-belinda starts , as if it were a surprise , which indeed [she]134-belinda still feigns to [herself]134-belinda that it is . "[1894-he] [You]1894-he here ? " [she]134-belinda says in a voice of airy astonishment , that would be admirably natural did it not quiver , and were it not a little overdone . "[1894-he] Have [you]1894-he fallen from the clouds ? " [His]1894-he answer is not over - ready . [He]1894-he has not yet got over the stupefaction that the first sight of [her]134-belinda after an interval always brings upon [him]1894-he — a stupefaction such as , [they]4338-their say , the sight of [the sea]517-the sea , of [Niagara]99-niagara , of any overwhelmingly great and noble natural object , produces in [him]1894-he who looks upon it for the first time . How much more beautiful [she]134-belinda is than [he]1894-he had remembered [her]134-belinda ! how pious [she]134-belinda looks ! how chaste ! [Probably other women before now]4340-probably other women before now have carried large Prayer - books , and "[1894-he] Ancient and Modern Hymn - books " in [their]4340-probably other women before now left hand , [home]2345-home from [church]613-church ; but it seems to [him]1894-he to be a wondrous feat of grace and holiness , performed for the first and only time in [the world]643-the world 's history . At last : "[1894-he] Are [you]1895-you surprised ? " [he]1894-he asks , still feeling rather dizzy ; "[1895-you] if [you]1895-you remember — " "[1895-you] [I]0-i am afraid that [you]1895-you will find all [[your]1895-you friends]1838-your friends gone down , " [she]0-i interrupts precipitately . "[1895-you] Shall [I]0-i ? " [he]1894-he answers , with an indifference that [he]1894-he makes no attempt to conceal ; "[0-i] probably , no doubt . " Is it [her]0-i large Prayer - book that is making [her]0-i so unapproachable ? "[0-i] Have [you]1895-you come from [Yorkshire]31-yorkshire ? " [she]0-i asks quickly , not allowing a moment of silence to intervene , with the uneasy idea , probably , of keeping the conversation in the polite and distant society key in which [she]0-i has elected to pitch it . "[1895-you] Yes . " "[1895-you] Did not [you]1895-you find it very dusty travelling ? " walking fast , and looking straight before [her]0-i . "[1895-you] [I]0-i came by [a night - train]1897-a night - train . " "[1895-you] Do [you]1895-you like night - travelling ? [I]0-i do not ; but then [I]0-i ca n't sleep . Perhaps [you]1895-you can sleep ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i did not sleep ! " There is a tinge of reproach in the manner in which [he]1894-he pronounces the last words . What has happened to [her]0-i ? Is it to hear these cold platitudes that [he]1894-he has been rushing towards [her]0-i all through the night , chiding the iron wheels for being slow — that [he]1894-he has spent [his]1894-he holiday , and foregone [his]1894-he rest ? Sleep ! With this to - day — this now ahead of [him]1894-he ! Is it likely that [he]1894-he should sleep ? [They]4344-they have reached [her]0-i gate , and there paused . [She]0-i does not ask [him]1894-he to accompany [her]0-i in , nor does [she]0-i make [him]1894-he any hospitable offer whatever . But that [he]1894-he has neither expected nor wished — would have declined on the unlikely hypothesis of [her]0-i offering it . [He]1894-he has no desire to taste of [Professor Forth]136-professor forth 's salt . There is something that tells [him]1894-he that [her]0-i pause before dismissing [him]1894-he will be only a momentary one ; and that if [he]1894-he does not utilize this very present instant , [she]0-i will be gone , and [he]1894-he may return to [Milnthorpe]73-milnthorpe , whence [he]1894-he came , at [his]1894-he leisure . "[0-i] [You]1898-you will enjoy [the country]468-the country air after [your]1898-you [Milnthorpe]73-milnthorpe smoke , " [she]0-i says , [her]0-i hand upon the latch , and with what [he]1894-he knows to be a valedictory smile . "[1898-you] What do [you]1900-you do on Sunday afternoons ? " [he]1894-he asks precipitately ; "[1900-you] do [you]1900-you do anything ? " "[1900-you] Do anything ! " [she]0-i repeats , demurring ; "[1898-you] what do [you]1898-you mean ? " "[1898-you] Do [you]1898-you go to [church]613-church again ? " very hurriedly , and doubling up [his]1894-he hands in [his]1894-he pockets to hinder [their]4345-their yielding to [their]4345-their almost ungovernable impulse to stretch [themselves]4345-their out , and — with [her]0-i will , or against [her]0-i will — there detain [her]0-i . [She]0-i casts a furtive glance towards [the house]2521-the house — a glance that makes in [him]1894-he the fear of [her]0-i flight , and the impulse to check it , yet more nearly beyond [his]1894-he governance . "[1898-you] No — o , " [she]0-i says slowly ; "[1898-you] not often . " "[1898-you] What do [you]1898-you do then ? Do [you]1898-you ever take a walk ? " [He]1894-he has [his]1894-he eye upon [her]0-i . Would it be quite inadmissible , if [she]0-i shows symptoms of leaving [him]1894-he unanswered , to lay one hand quite quietly , so that [she]0-i should be scarcely conscious of it , upon [her]0-i arm ? There is a full minute — sixty seconds well rung — before [she]0-i answers . "[1898-you] Sometimes , as it happens , if it does not rain — if [I]0-i feel inclined . " "[1898-you] And — and — have [you]1898-you any — any specially favourite walk ? " Again [she]0-i looks towards [the house]2521-the house , behind whose closed doors the dogs are plainly heard , telling [her]0-i that [they]4348-they know [she]0-i has come back from [church]613-church , and asking [her]0-i why [she]0-i is dawdling . "[1898-you] No ; none ! " [she]0-i says , lifting the latch . "[1898-you] Of course , " [her]0-i words coming with a sort of shamefaced hurry , "[1898-you] [I]0-i like [the College gardens]1902-the college gardens — [everybody]354-everybody must like [the College gardens]1902-the college gardens ; but , " with a sudden remorse at this concession , "[0-i] [I]0-i very often do not go [there]2419-there , because of the dogs ; [one]373-one may not take the dogs into [them]2419-there . " [She]0-i has opened the gate , and is passing through [it]4350-it . [He]4351-he has only half a minute left . "[373-one] Which is [your]0-i favourite ? Which do [you]0-i like best ? " [he]4351-he cries desperately after [her]0-i . "[0-i] [I]0-i have not any favourite . [I]0-i do not know ; [I]0-i like them all . " [She]0-i has taken out [her]0-i latch - key , and is putting it into the lock . "[0-i] That means that [you]0-i are determined not to tell [me]0-i , " [he]4351-he says , with a tremor of passionate disappointment in [his]4351-he voice ; and so , taking off [his]4351-he hat , turns on [his]4351-he heel . But as [he]4351-he walks slowly down [the road]392-the road , telling [his]4351-he own heart that [he]4351-he has befooled [himself]4351-he — never would [he]4351-he allow that [[his]4351-he high lady]4353-his high lady could befool [him]4351-he — a sort of whisper seems to travel to [his]4351-he ears , "[0-i] Some people like [St. Bridget]318-st. bridget 's best !
