" [Belinda]134-belinda lunches , as usual , alone . The one prime and perhaps sole advantage of solitary feeding is , that [you]4354-you need not eat more than [you]4354-you feel inclined ; that if from any cause [your]4354-you appetite has left [you]4354-you , there is [no one to make comments on that fact]4355-no one to make comments on that fact . If , in addition , [you]4354-you have two pet gluttons on [their]4356-them hind - legs supporting [you]4354-you throughout [your]4354-you repast on either side , and drawing five sharp nails along the back of [your]4354-you hand if [you]4354-you do not seem to be attending to them , not even to [the servant]3821-the servant need [your]4354-you condition of un - hunger be ever revealed . [Punch]186-punch and [Slutty]157-slutty have never yet understood why , on that June Sunday , [they]4356-them were feasted so royally on ribs of roast beef . From the luncheon - table [Belinda]134-belinda passes , according to the usual routine of [her]134-belinda duties , to [[[her]134-belinda mother - in - law]4322-her mother - in - law 's room]4359-her mother - in - law 's room , for [her]134-belinda daily two hours . As it turns out , [they]4356-them are more than two ; for [the nurse]4035-the nurse , relying upon [[her]4035-the nurse employer]4361-her employer 's usual good - natured laxity , outstays [her]4035-the nurse furlough by fully twenty minutes , and returns to find [young Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth , for the first time , unsmiling and impatient of the delay . And yet , when released , [she]134-belinda seems undecided as to the disposition of [her]134-belinda time . The dogs are staring at [her]134-belinda — one sitting , one standing — as if [they]4356-them knew that [their]4356-them fate was hanging in the balance . Can [anyone]494-anyone resist such a litany of goggles as [their]4356-them eyes are uttering ? It would be a crying shame to disappoint [them]4356-them . [She]134-belinda will forego [the trim leisure of [the College gardens]1902-the college gardens]4363-the trim leisure of the college gardens and take [them]4356-them to [the Fields]4365-the fields — [a public promenade where dogs are admitted , and where [perambulators]4367-perambulators push and [Sunday shop - boys]4368-sunday shop - boys]4366-a public promenade where dogs are admitted , and where perambulators push and sunday shop - boys jostle . But [she]134-belinda does not call [them]4356-them or tell [them]4356-them so . After all , it is a pity to spoil [them]4356-them , and to let [them]4356-them take it for granted that [they]4356-them are to accompany [her]134-belinda wherever [she]134-belinda goes . On the whole , it is wiser not to hamper [herself]134-belinda with [them]4356-them . [She]134-belinda will make no fixed plan as to the direction of [her]134-belinda walk ; but will simply follow where whim or chance may lead . And whim and chance , after a little preliminary shamming , gone through to impose upon [herself]134-belinda , lead [her]134-belinda to [St. Bridget 's Gardens]100-st. bridget 's gardens . [An interlacing of elm - arms overhead]4369-an interlacing of elm - arms overhead ; a thick bed of periwinkle below ; on the left [a little classic river]4370-a little classic river , and [an unexpected park with smoky deer]4371-an unexpected park with smoky deer ; on the right [the sacred College meadow]4372-the sacred college meadow , where never vulgar foot may fall , save of the haymakers , who have but lately built the grass and flowers into a scented stack . Above , below , around , tranquillity and solitude . For , loveliest of [the College walks]4373-the college walks as is [[St. Bridget]318-st. bridget 's]4374-st. bridget 's , it is , strange to say , also the least frequented . [Thither]319-thither [the accursed perambulator]4375-the accursed perambulator can not come ; and [thither]319-thither [the holiday clerk]4376-the holiday clerk and [milliner]4377-milliner come not . It is all , or nearly all , [her]134-belinda own . Each Sunday , as [the town]474-the town empties , it will grow more and more [her]134-belinda own . Over [the patterned walk]4379-the patterned walk , where tree and sun have laid [their]100-st. bridget 's gardens chequers as a carpet for [her]134-belinda feet , [she]134-belinda marches leisurely . [She]134-belinda has not hurried upon any other Sunday ; therefore [she]134-belinda will not hurry to - day . [No one]365-no one can or shall be able to say that [she]134-belinda has departed one jot from [her]134-belinda accustomed habits . [She]134-belinda is making for [her]134-belinda usual seat — the one that ordinarily [no one]365-no one disputes with [her]134-belinda . But to - day , as it comes into view , [she]134-belinda perceives that [it]4382-it is already occupied . [The occupant]4383-the occupant must be [a friend]1315-a friend too , since , on catching sight of [her]134-belinda , [he]4383-the occupant comes hasting — young and most glad — to meet [her]134-belinda . Ah — h ! it is not a question of [the Grosse Garten]737-the grosse garten over again . To - day [she]134-belinda is not first . Not that there is any parallel between the cases . Not that [anyone]494-anyone can call this a rendezvous . [He]4383-the occupant does not think it necessary to offer any apology for , or explanation of , [his]4383-the occupant appearance , and passes over , with a silent lenity , [her]134-belinda little futile and ill - done expression of surprise . "[318-st. bridget] So [we]1907-we meet [here]2351-here again ! " "[318-st. bridget] Shall [we]1907-we sit down ? " [he]4383-the occupant says , pointing to the bench whence [he]4383-the occupant has just risen . For an instant [she]134-belinda hesitates , then — "[318-st. bridget] Yes , [I]0-i do not mind , " [she]134-belinda says irresolutely . "[0-i] [I]0-i do not know why [I]0-i should not ; [I]0-i sit [here]2351-here every Sunday . " Is there in this any slightest departure from use or custom ? [He]4383-the occupant seats [himself]4383-the occupant beside , yet not near [her]134-belinda ; for [he]4383-the occupant sees [her]134-belinda frightened eye jealously measuring the interval between [them]4387-them ; to be sure that it is wide enough . How still it is ! Neither human voice nor metal heard from [the city]2752-the city . [Everyone]3028-everyone must be in [church]613-church . Is this really happening ? Perhaps if [he]4383-the occupant speak , if [he]4383-the occupant make [her]134-belinda speak , it will grow more real . "[0-i] So [you]0-i are all alone here ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i have the dogs . " "[0-i] But besides the dogs , [no one]365-no one ? not [[your]0-i sister]3060-your sister ? " "[0-i] Did [you]0-i think that [she]3060-your sister would be [here]2351-here ? did [you]0-i expect to find [her]3060-your sister [here]2351-here ? " asks [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth quickly , while a storm of colour sweeps across [her]134-belinda face . [He]4383-the occupant has no slightest clue to the origin of that red tempest ; [he]4383-the occupant only knows that it has trebled [her]134-belinda beauty . Did [God]184-god ever before create such a wonder of loveliness as [she]134-belinda ? "[0-i] [I]0-i — [I]0-i do not know , " [he]4383-the occupant answers inattentively , a sin towards [her]134-belinda of which [he]4383-the occupant is seldom guilty ; "[0-i] [I]0-i — [I]0-i do not think [I]0-i thought about it . " Wide of the mark , as [we]4391-we usually are in [our]4391-we judgments of [those who have either too much or too little interest for [us]4391-we]4392-those who have either too much or too little interest for us , [she]134-belinda attributes [his]4383-the occupant verbal unreadiness to a cause far removed enough from the real one . "[0-i] [Sarah]135-sarah offered to stay with [me]0-i , " [she]0-i says in an ungenial voice , sitting very upright , and looking rigidly before [her]0-i ; "[135-sarah] but [I]0-i could not be so selfish as to accept such a sacrifice from [her]135-sarah . [I]0-i could not condemn [anyone]494-anyone to a life of such unredeemed dulness as [mine]0-i now is . " There is an acrimony in [her]0-i tone that [he]4383-the occupant knows not how to account for ; but [he]4383-the occupant does not interrupt [her]0-i . As long as [she]0-i will speak , [he]4383-the occupant is ever most gladly silent . Why should the air be disturbed by [his]4383-the occupant coarse and common voice , when it may be enriched by the music of [hers]0-i ? "[0-i] It is by no fault of [my]0-i own that [I]0-i am left alone here , " continues [she]0-i , with some sharpness ; "[0-i] [I]0-i wished to go to [Switzerland]93-switzerland with [Mr. Forth]209-mr. forth . [I]0-i asked [him]209-mr. forth to take [me]0-i . " "[209-mr. forth] And [he]209-mr. forth refused ? " with an accent of the profoundest incredulity . To be asked by [this woman]4393-this woman for leave to bestow [her]4393-this woman company upon [you]4383-the occupant , and to refuse [her]4393-this woman ! And how did [she]4393-this woman ask ? With [her]4393-this woman arms about [his]209-mr. forth neck ? With tears and kisses ? [He]209-mr. forth writhes . "[209-mr. forth] It was not convenient , " [she]4393-this woman answers formally ; "[209-mr. forth] [he]209-mr. forth was unable to make it fit in with [his]209-mr. forth plans . " [The young man]504-the young man 's heart burns within [him]209-mr. forth , with a fire of envious indignation too hot to find vent in words . And yet perhaps a little of it may pierce through [his]209-mr. forth next speech . "[209-mr. forth] [He]209-mr. forth could not make it convenient to take [you]0-i ; and [he]209-mr. forth could not make it convenient to stay with [you]0-i ; and so here [you]0-i are , alone and dull . " There is something in [his]209-mr. forth tone — an irony that has the heat of wrath — that rouses again [her]4393-this woman half - smouldering alarms . "[0-i] [I]0-i am alone , " [she]0-i answers quickly , "[0-i] but [I]0-i am not dull ; [I]0-i never was less dull in [my]0-i life ; the days are not half long enough for [me]0-i . " "[0-i] And yet [you]0-i said — " objects [he]209-mr. forth , bewildered by the staring discrepancy of the statements which have followed so close upon [each other]469-each other 's heels . "[0-i] What does it matter what [I]0-i said ? " interrupts [she]0-i , with a brusque , nervous laugh . "[0-i] If [I]0-i may not contradict [myself]0-i , whom may [I]0-i ? " [An elderly couple]4396-an elderly couple — two of [St. Bridget]318-st. bridget 's rare votaries — have appeared upon [the long straight alley dominated by [Belinda]134-belinda 's bench]4397-the long straight alley dominated by belinda 's bench ; [an alley named after [the short - faced humourist who loved to pace [it]4398-an alley named after the short - faced humourist who loved to pace it]4399-the short - faced humourist who loved to pace it]4398-an alley named after the short - faced humourist who loved to pace it . [Mrs. Froth]320-mrs. froth is glad . [She]320-mrs. froth wishes that [more couples]4400-more couples would come into sight . It is far more sociable . As [they]4396-an elderly couple pass , [she]320-mrs. froth involuntarily raises [her]320-mrs. froth voice in speaking . [She]320-mrs. froth is saying nothing that [she]320-mrs. froth minds either [them]4396-an elderly couple or [anyone else]2603-anyone else hearing . What a comfort it is to have nothing to conceal from [the whole world]2786-the whole world ! As the hours slip by , this happy and confident complacency deepens . But how fast [they]4396-an elderly couple slip away ! [She]320-mrs. froth can not affect to be ignorant of [their]4396-an elderly couple passage , since from [[the Cardinal]101-the cardinal 's high tower]4403-the cardinal 's high tower , rising above the trees , the deep - mouthed bells tell the death of each little quarter . How closely [they]4396-an elderly couple tread upon [each other]469-each other 's heels ! How many of [them]4396-an elderly couple have broken the Sabbath stillness of the mead ? [She]320-mrs. froth ventures not to ask nor think . But why does [she]320-mrs. froth not venture ? It is the same as upon [other Sundays]4405-other sundays , for [she]320-mrs. froth always stays late . It is with a start that at length — seven solemn strokes having beaten the air — [she]320-mrs. froth rises to be gone . "[0-i] It is seven o'clock ! " [she]320-mrs. froth says hurriedly . "[1915-we] [We]1915-we must go , or [we]1915-we shall be shut in . " Shut in , in [this green enclosure]4406-this green enclosure , with the stars for night - lamps , and [this woman]4393-this woman for [fellow - prisoner]4408-fellow - prisoner ! How dare [she]320-mrs. froth make such a suggestion ! It is several minutes before [he]1916-you can fight down the frantic tumult in [his]1916-you heart that [her]320-mrs. froth words have raised , enough to say with sufficient composure : "[1915-we] If [you]1916-you come here every Sunday , [I]0-i suppose that [you]1916-you will be here next Sunday . " "[1916-you] But [you]1916-you will not ! " [she]320-mrs. froth cries vehemently , stopping — [they]1915-we are walking slowly homewards — and facing [him]1916-you . "[0-i] [You]0-i forbid [me]0-i ? " [he]1916-you says in a low voice . [He]1916-you can not rid [himself]1916-you of that vision of [the star - canopied meadow]4409-the star - canopied meadow . "[0-i] [I]0-i forbid [you]1916-you ! " [she]320-mrs. froth answers excitedly ; "[1916-you] yes — yes — yes ! at least , " recollecting [herself]320-mrs. froth , "[1917-your own master] of course [you]1916-you are [[your]1916-you own master]1917-your own master ; [I]0-i have no authority over [you]1916-you ; but if [I]0-i might be allowed to advise , [I]0-i should say , " laughing agitatedly , "[0-i] that it would be a most unnecessary expense — like [my]0-i journey to [Switzerland]93-switzerland . It is ill manners to remind [you]1916-you — but [you]1916-you know [you]1916-you are poor , until the patent is taken out , " smiling feverishly . "[0-i] [I]0-i must not allow [you]1916-you to make ducks and drakes of [your]1916-you money . " "[0-i] The Sunday after ? " [Her]320-mrs. froth answer is long a coming ; for indeed it is preceded by an eager dialogue within [herself]320-mrs. froth , that takes time . If [she]320-mrs. froth prohibit it , so docile is [he]1916-you to [her]320-mrs. froth least word or sign , that [she]320-mrs. froth knows [he]1916-you will acquiesce ; and [she]320-mrs. froth will sit upon [her]320-mrs. froth bench and hear the quarters chime , and see [the tall tower]4410-the tall tower rise , alone . Even when [her]320-mrs. froth reply does come , it is a mere evasion . There is no need to give a direct answer . It is one of those questions which it is better taste to leave unanswered . "[0-i] The Sunday after next ? " [she]320-mrs. froth says with a flighty laugh . "[1918-we] [We]1918-we may be all dead by then ; it is too far off for [me]0-i to trouble [my]0-i head about it ! " "[0-i] Till Eulenspiegel war vergnügt wenn er Berg aufstieg , weil er sich darauf freute , wenn es wieder Berg abgehen würde , und traurig wenn es Berg abging , weil er das Aufsteigen fürchtete — Was wird mir Schlimmes begegnen da ich heute [i]0-i m Gemüth so heiter bin : welche Freude steht mir bevor da mich Traurigkeit so niederdrückt ? " Can it be possible that August is here ? Not even early August — July 's hot equivalent — but late August , that has shaken hands with [September]321-september . The mornings have a taste of autumn , though high summer still rules the noons ; and as [Belinda]134-belinda paces along [her]134-belinda garden walk , the damp dews wet [her]134-belinda gown , and the swinging gossamers tickle [her]134-belinda nose . [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge is at [its]5-oxbridge emptiest . In a week or so [people]523-people will be beginning to return ; but for the present it is [a desert]4412-a desert . It is a pity that [they]523-people should not return to see with what a kingly red pomp [the Virginian creeper]4413-the virginian creeper is decking the sad - coloured beauty of [[their]523-people town]4414-their town . Over [their]523-people worn - grey shoulders [the Colleges]4415-the colleges are throwing a cope of shaded crimson ; and from underneath a necklace of rubies , [the Renaissance porch of [the great University church]4417-the great university church]4416-the renaissance porch of the great university church looks out . And alone , among the waxing autumnal splendour , [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth pursues [her]271-mrs. forth way . Still [she]271-mrs. forth walks to [the rural villages]4418-the rural villages ; still [she]271-mrs. forth gardens ; still [she]271-mrs. forth makes out [her]271-mrs. forth catalogue , and reads aloud [her]271-mrs. forth collects ; and still on Sunday [she]271-mrs. forth sits upon [her]271-mrs. forth bench in [St. Bridget]318-st. bridget 's walk , every alternate Sunday alone , every alternate Sunday not alone . Although no further permission than that recorded has been either asked or given , [she]271-mrs. forth has grown to take it as an accepted fact , that , on every second Sunday , [she]271-mrs. forth shall find [him]4419-him [there]2419-there as surely as [she]271-mrs. forth finds the green elm trees and [the [Cardinal]101-the cardinal 's Tower]4421-the cardinal 's tower . Doubtless the "[1919-a hunter] greenth and blueth , " as [Horace Walpole]323-horace walpole called them , the repose and country fresh air , are an almost necessary tonic to [him]4419-him after the din and labour of [his]4419-him week . If [he]4419-him think them worth the money spent in railway travelling upon [them]4422-their , surely that is [his]4419-him affair , and one in which , without officious ill - taste , [she]271-mrs. forth can not further meddle . There is no slightest mystery about [their]4422-their meetings . [Anyone]494-anyone may know of them . Nor does [she]271-mrs. forth ever fail , in [her]271-mrs. forth letters to [the Professor]2365-the professor , to record among miscellaneous items of news that [she]271-mrs. forth has met [Mr. Rivers]162-rivers . Why then should [she]271-mrs. forth abstain from a pleasure so innocent ? [We]4425-we are creatures of habit ; and [she]271-mrs. forth could not well do without [her]271-mrs. forth Sundays now . At the mere suggestion of such an abstinence [she]271-mrs. forth shivers coldly . [She]271-mrs. forth has pitched [their]4422-their intercourse in a key with which [no one]365-no one can quarrel ; has set [their]4422-their intimacy upon a footing from which it need never swerve . If it were [anyone]494-anyone 's place to object , it would surely be [[her]271-mrs. forth husband]3353-her husband 's ; but so far is [he]3353-her husband from so doing , that [he]3353-her husband has not thought [her]271-mrs. forth communication worth even a comment . [He]3353-her husband has devoted a couple of closely - written pages to directions where [she]271-mrs. forth is to find a volume of Origen ; but apparently [he]3353-her husband could not spare speech or time for a mention of [Rivers]162-rivers . If anything could have lulled [her]271-mrs. forth into a greater security than that which [she]271-mrs. forth already enjoys , it would be this fact . Serene and blooming , with a silent conscience , [she]271-mrs. forth walks entranced through the dreamful days . By a sort of subtlety , such as [Till Eulenspiegel]324-till eulenspiegel 's , [she]271-mrs. forth has grown to look forward to the Sundays on which [he]3353-her husband does not come , because they lead up to those on which [he]3353-her husband does . To - day is one of these latter Sundays , and [she]271-mrs. forth is sitting down to [her]271-mrs. forth solitary luncheon , too happy to eat , when a ring at the front - door makes [her]271-mrs. forth start . Can it be [Rivers]162-rivers ? Unlikely that [he]3353-her husband , who has long tacitly abstained from even meeting [her]271-mrs. forth on [her]271-mrs. forth way [home]2345-home from [church]613-church should present [himself]3353-her husband at a door which [he]3353-her husband has always shown such a silent energy of repulsion against entering . Can it be [[her]271-mrs. forth husband]3353-her husband , unexpectedly restored to [her]271-mrs. forth ? [She]271-mrs. forth turns suddenly very cold . Can it be — There is no use in repeating a question which is already answered . "[1919-a hunter] Just in time ! " cries [Miss Watson]147-miss watson , thrusting aside [the baffled parlour - maid]4432-the baffled parlour - maid and seeming instantly to fill [the whole room]4433-the whole room with [her]271-mrs. forth presence , and [her]271-mrs. forth plaid gown and [her]271-mrs. forth fringe . "[1919-a hunter] What a good smell of roast beef ! [I]0-i am as hungry as [a hunter]1919-a hunter . " [Belinda]134-belinda has risen , leaving [her]134-belinda untouched plate ; the consternation which the sight of [Miss Watson]147-miss watson does and must always inspire , in this case diluted and modified by relief . At all events , [she]134-belinda is not [the Professor]2365-the professor . "[1919-a hunter] [I]0-i can spend a good four or five hours with [you]0-i ! " cries [the guest]4435-the guest , with loud cheerfulness ; beginning to divest [herself]0-i of bonnet , gloves , and pelerine . "[0-i] [I]0-i am on [my]0-i way to [Wrenbury]103-wrenbury , to [the Sampsons]280-the sampsons . [They]280-the sampsons do not expect [me]0-i ; [I]0-i am going to take [them]280-the sampsons by surprise . [They]280-the sampsons have always bragged so much about [[their]280-the sampsons place down in [Blankshire]104-blankshire]1920-their place down in blankshire , that [I]0-i was determined to find out how much truth there was in it ; and the Sunday trains are so awkward that [I]0-i can not get on till late in the afternoon . However , it is an ill wind that blows nobody good . [I]0-i can spend pretty nearly four hours with [you]0-i . " Through [Belinda]134-belinda 's head there darts immediately a calculation . It is now one o'clock . In four hours it will be five o'clock : an hour later , therefore , than that one which usually finds [her]134-belinda pacing down [St. Bridget]318-st. bridget 's walk . [He]4436-he will have to wait a full hour for [her]134-belinda . At this thought a dismay , so disproportionate to the occasion as to frighten even [herself]134-belinda , takes hold of [her]134-belinda . "[0-i] Is not it rather a wild - goose chase ? " [she]134-belinda asks , forcing [herself]134-belinda to speak . "[0-i] How do [you]0-i know that [you]0-i will find [the Sampsons]1921-the sampsons ? Are [you]0-i sure that [they]1921-the sampsons are at [home]2345-home ? " "[0-i] Pooh ! " replies [Miss Watson]147-miss watson carelessly ; "[1923-the housekeeper] if [they]1921-the sampsons are not , [the housekeeper]1923-the housekeeper will give [me]0-i a shake - down . [One]373-one gets to know the ins and outs of [a place]1925-a place better when [the owners]1926-the owners are away . " [Belinda]134-belinda 's only answer is a faint shrug of acute dissent . "[0-i] [I]0-i never ate a better piece of beef in [my]0-i life ! " pursues [Miss Watson]147-miss watson warmly . "[0-i] Goes to [the servants]972-the servants , [I]0-i suppose , eh ? Else [I]0-i can not imagine how [you]0-i would ever get through such a large joint all alone . Why are [you]0-i alone ? No screw loose , [I]0-i hope , eh ? It seems a little odd [your]0-i being [here]2351-here all alone , when [the town]474-the town is such [a desert]4412-a desert . By - the - bye , what is [Rivers]162-rivers doing up here ? " If [her]134-belinda life here , and [her]134-belinda salvation elsewhere , depended upon [her]134-belinda remaining motionless , [Belinda]134-belinda could not help the start which [she]134-belinda can only hope looks slighter than it feels . "[162-rivers] [Mr. Rivers]162-rivers ? " [she]134-belinda repeats stammeringly . "[162-rivers] Yes , [Mr. Rivers]162-rivers , if [you]162-rivers like to call [him]162-rivers so ! " with [her]134-belinda strident laugh . "[162-rivers] [David Rivers]143-rivers ; [[our]1931-our old friend]1932-our old friend , [David Rivers]143-rivers ! Did not [you]162-rivers know that [he]162-rivers was [here]2351-here ? Has not [he]162-rivers been to see [you]162-rivers ? " [Belinda]134-belinda draws a long gasping breath , then answers distinctly : "[162-rivers] No ! " After all it is not a lie — not all a lie ! [He]162-rivers has not been to see [her]134-belinda ; and [she]134-belinda has made a mental reservation as to [her]134-belinda answer applying only to the second clause of [[her]134-belinda companion]780-her companion 's speech . "[162-rivers] H'm ! " says [Miss Watson]147-miss watson , biting [her]147-miss watson nails ; "[162-rivers] that in itself looks odd . " Since this last remark is not a question , and since [she]134-belinda is by no means assured of having even a tolerable mastery over [her]134-belinda voice , [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth allows it to go by uncommented upon . "[162-rivers] What can [he]162-rivers be doing up here ? " continues [the other]2396-the other , still biting [her]147-miss watson nails , and in a tone of the most poignant inquisitiveness . "[162-rivers] The very deadest time of the long vacation ; not a soul to be seen about ! Why , [you]162-rivers might drive [a coach - and - four]1934-a coach - and - four along [the side walk]1935-the side walk from [[St. Ursula]84-st. ursula 's to [King 's]198-the king]1936-st. ursula 's to king 's ! [I]0-i shall never rest till [I]0-i have got to the bottom of it ! " [[Her]0-i guest]1180-her guest 's eyes are riveted upon [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth with such an unwinking energy of stare , that [she]0-i must needs form some halting answer . "[162-rivers] Will not [you]162-rivers ? " [she]0-i says , with a sickly smile ; "[162-rivers] [you]162-rivers had better ask [him]162-rivers ! " "[162-rivers] [I]0-i only wish [he]162-rivers would give [me]0-i the chance , " replies [the other]2396-the other stoutly ; "[162-rivers] but [he]162-rivers knows a great deal too well for that . [I]0-i came face to face with [him]162-rivers in [Church Street]106-church street , and before [I]0-i could get [my]0-i breath [he]162-rivers had slipped away like an eel . If [you]1937-you remember , [we]1938-we used to think [him]162-rivers a little deaf at [Dresden]2-dresden , but [I]0-i never heard that [he]162-rivers was blind , too ! There is always something louche in [a man]2618-a man obviously avoiding [the respectable women of [his]2618-a man acquaintance]1940-the respectable women of his acquaintance , is not there ? " [She]0-i repeats the question with such a pertinacity of inquiry , that [Belinda]134-belinda is obliged to murmur that , "[1937-you] Yes , there is . " When the beef has gone to fulfil that destiny which [Miss Watson]147-miss watson had prophesied for it — [she]0-i , at least , has done full justice to it — [they]1938-we move to [the drawing - room]3050-the drawing - room . "[1937-you] [I]0-i am afraid that [I]0-i must ask [you]1941-her to excuse [me]0-i , " says [Belinda]134-belinda , with formality . "[1941-her] [I]0-i always devote the next two hours to [[my]0-i mother - in - law]1837-my mother - in - law . " "[1837-my mother - in - law] Pooh ! do not mention it , " replies [the other]2396-the other cordially ; "[1837-my mother - in - law] it would be very odd if [such an old soldier as [I]0-i]1943-such an old soldier as i did not know how to make [herself]1943-such an old soldier as i comfortable . Do not trouble to entertain [me]0-i . Books ? magazines ? eh ? " turning over the objects on the table ; "[1837-my mother - in - law] there is no fear but that [I]0-i shall find something to amuse [myself]0-i with ! " Nor is there . At intervals during the two hours [Belinda]134-belinda catches sight of [her]1941-her from the window , bustling round [the garden]2455-the garden , pinching the few plums on the garden wall , trying to look into the windows of [the next houses]4444-the next houses ; hears [her]1941-her opening and shutting doors , pulling out drawers , etc . For a moment a pang of apprehension crosses [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth 's mind . Can [she]1941-her ferret out anything ? any letter ? any paper ? But no ; a smile of pride and reassurance crosses [Belinda]134-belinda 's face . What in all [her]0-i poor archives is there that might not be exposed to the eyes of [the whole world]2786-the whole world ? to the gimlet eyes of ( if imagination could grasp the idea of such a hideous multiplication ) a hundred [Miss Watsons]325-miss watsons ? The two hours are gone . It is a quarter to four ; the time at which [she]0-i usually begins to put on hat and gloves , and saunter , deliberately blissful , towards [St. Bridget]318-st. bridget 's . It is clear that it is not the hour at which [she]0-i will begin to saunter thither to - day . Nothing looks less like departure , more like a prolonged stay , than [Miss Watson]147-miss watson 's bonnetless attitude , plunged recumbent in [the Professor]2365-the professor 's chair . "[0-i] [I]0-i have been having a look round , " [she]0-i says cheerfully ; "[0-i] [I]0-i like to get the bearings of [a house]457-a house . There was one door locked ; [[the Professor]2365-the professor 's sanctum]1946-the professor 's sanctum , eh ? " "[2365-the professor] [He]2365-the professor likes [me]0-i to keep it locked in [his]2365-the professor absence , " replies [[the Professor]2365-the professor 's wife]4448-the professor 's wife icily , "[2365-the professor] as [he]2365-the professor does not wish [his]2365-the professor books and papers to be disturbed . " "[1947-you] [You]1947-you shall show it [me]0-i by - and - by , " returns [Miss Watson]147-miss watson comfortably ; "[1947-you] after all , there is no hurry . [I]0-i have half a mind to stay till [the late train]1948-the late train , and have a bit of dinner with [you]1947-you ; nothing extra ; a cutlet , a grill — whatever [you]1947-you have ordered for [yourself]1947-you . " "[1947-you] It is [a very slow train]1949-a very slow train , " says [Belinda]134-belinda precipitately . "[0-i] [I]0-i wonder what [train]1950-train [Rivers]143-rivers came down by , " continues [the other thought - fully]4449-the other thought - fully ; "[143-rivers] of course [he]143-rivers has only run down for the day . [I]0-i have been thinking it over , and the more [I]0-i look at it the more louche it looks ! " [Belinda]134-belinda has not sat down ; in the forlorn hope , perhaps , that the maintenance of a standing attitude may give a less established tone to [[her]0-i guest]1180-her guest 's presence . [She]134-belinda now hastens to the window , and begins to fidget with the blind - cord , which pulls up and down perfectly , and needs no rearrangement . "[143-rivers] It is [an odd place to choose for an intrigue]1951-an odd place to choose for an intrigue , too , " continues [the other]2396-the other reflectively . "[143-rivers] [I]0-i have always been told that [the men]3973-the men are so strictly looked after ; but perhaps it was its very unlikelihood that made [him]143-rivers pitch upon it , eh ? " Possibly [Belinda]134-belinda makes some answer , and that it is drowned in the rattling of the blind , which [she]134-belinda is feverishly jerking up and down . Every drop of blood in [her]134-belinda body seems to have given its fellow rendezvous in [her]134-belinda face . An intrigue ! Does [he]143-rivers indeed come to [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge for an intrigue ? An intrigue with whom ? An intrigue ! Is that what [other people beside [Miss Watson]147-miss watson]4452-other people beside miss watson would call it ? "[0-i] [I]0-i shall certainly mention it to [[his]143-rivers mother]2549-his mother , [Lady Marion]222-lady marion lovell , when next [I]0-i meet [her]222-lady marion lovell , " says [Miss Watson]147-miss watson resolutely ; "[222-lady marion lovell] [I]0-i do not think that it would be acting [a friend]1315-a friend 's part not to do so . [I]0-i do not actually know [her]222-lady marion lovell , but there is a sort of connection between [us]1955-us ; [I]0-i was at [school]1956-school for six months once at [Brussels]107-brussels with [a cousin of hers]1957-a cousin of hers , and there is no doubt that there is something uncommonly louche about it . " Judging by the frequency with which during the next hour [she]222-lady marion lovell repeats this phrase , it must be a favourite one of [hers]222-lady marion lovell . By five o'clock [its]4453-its recurrence has driven [Belinda]134-belinda to the verge of desperation . It seems to [her]222-lady marion lovell ( though that is a figment of [her]222-lady marion lovell guilty fancy ) that there is a dreadful meaning and significance in the unblinking look at [her]222-lady marion lovell with which each repetition of the word is accompanied . Five o'clock ! [He]1958-you has been waiting for [her]222-lady marion lovell a whole hour beneath [St. Bridget]318-st. bridget 's elms , straining [his]1958-you eyes up the long straight walk . At length : "[0-i] [I]0-i think , " [she]0-i says , looking overtly at the clock — at which [she]0-i has long been stealing covert glances of agonized impatience — "[0-i] that if [you]1958-you wish to catch [this train]1959-this train — and [you]1958-you would find the later one extremely tedious — [you]1958-you should be setting off ! " "[0-i] Should [I]0-i ? " replies [the guest]4435-the guest indifferently . "[0-i] It is of no consequence if [I]0-i am late ; [I]0-i am [a good walker]1960-a good walker , and [I]0-i enjoy running it fine ; [I]0-i see no use in kicking one 's heels at [a station]1961-a station ! " [She]0-i ties on [her]0-i bonnet , and adjusts [her]0-i strong grey fringe with a maddening deliberation ; stops in the middle to examine and inquire the history of a piece of bric - à - brac , which [she]0-i had not before noticed ; and finally ( it is said that [no Englishwoman]4455-no englishwoman ever knows how to take leave ) expends [herself]0-i in an immense farewell speech , from which the word louche is by no means absent . But [she]0-i is gone at last . Before [she]0-i is well round the corner — before there is any real security of [her]0-i not returning , according to [her]0-i usual custom , to pounce afresh upon [her]0-i just - freed prey , [Belinda]134-belinda has fled to [[her]0-i room]2688-her room ; and — [her]0-i trembling preparations hurriedly made — is speeding , like an arrow shot from a bow , to [St. Bridget]318-st. bridget 's . There is no leisureliness about [her]0-i walk to - day ; no feigned indifference , no loitering , no counterfeit indecision , as to [her]0-i goal . To - day [she]0-i can not afford to play [her]0-i little comedy . Is not [she]0-i an hour and a quarter late ? Will [she]0-i find [him]4457-him gone ? Will [he]4457-him still be [there]2419-there ? Will [his]4457-him patience have held out ? In the whole of life , in the whole scheme of nature , there seems to [her]0-i no other question in the least worth answering . [People]523-people look at [her]0-i oddly , [she]0-i thinks , as [she]0-i passes . Hitherto [she]0-i has not minded how many people [she]0-i met , or who knew whither , and to what end , [her]0-i steps were tending . To - day it seems as if [they]523-people all glance meaningly at [her]0-i , as who should read [her]0-i guilty secret in [her]0-i face . Until to - day [she]0-i has never thought it either a secret , or guilty . An intrigue ! That is what [they]523-people call it ! [She]0-i is engaged in an intrigue ; and by some means [they]523-people know it . As [she]0-i enters [St. Bridget]318-st. bridget 's [a couple of humble lovers]4460-a couple of humble lovers meet [her]0-i face to face . As [they]523-people pass [her]0-i [they]523-people happen to expand into a grin , provoked , probably , by some ponderous joke of [their]523-people own making ; but [she]0-i takes it to [herself]0-i . [They]523-people know that [she]0-i is [a married woman hastening to an assignation]4461-a married woman hastening to an assignation . The very birds seem to chirp , and the boughs to rustle meaningly . Well , let [them]523-people ! It will be a dreadful memory to face by - and - by ; but for the moment there is no room for any other question but the one — "[1962-he] Will [he]1962-he be there ? " Before [she]0-i reaches [their]523-people trysting bench it is answered . [She]0-i comes upon [him]1962-he so suddenly , that [she]0-i has no time to tone down [her]0-i pace to a decent saunter . [He]1962-he has seen the speed with which [she]0-i was hasting towards [him]1962-he ; [her]0-i breathlessness , [her]0-i pallor , the desperate anxiety of [her]0-i eyes . There is no use in shamming to - day . But , indeed , [his]1962-he own condition leaves [him]1962-he no right to criticize [hers]0-i . Perhaps [he]1962-he is in even worse case than [she]0-i ; for [she]0-i can speak , and [he]1962-he can not . "[1962-he] [You]1962-he are not gone ! " [she]0-i says with a gasp , such as one might give whose reprieve met [him]1962-he at the scaffold - foot . "[1962-he] [I]0-i thought [you]1962-he would be gone ! " For answer , [he]1962-he grips [her]0-i two hands in [his]1962-he ( never before in all [his]1962-he life has [he]1962-he been [master]1633-master , and for how few poor minutes , but of one ) , and looks at [her]0-i with a white fixity of passion , to whose relief no words come . Even when [they]4463-they are both seated on [their]4463-they bench — [neither ever]4464-neither ever quite knows how [they]4463-they reached [it]4465-it — it is still [she]0-i who speaks ; nor when [she]0-i does so , is it to ask [him]1962-he to release [her]0-i hands . Perhaps in [her]0-i agitation [she]0-i is not aware that they are still in [his]1962-he keeping . "[1962-he] It was [Miss Watson]147-miss watson ! " [she]0-i says , with that gasping staccato utterance , as of one who , after long running , has not yet recovered [his]1962-he wind . "[1963-she] [She]1963-she came — [she]1963-she stayed four hours . [She]1963-she had seen [you]147-miss watson ! " [He]1962-he nods [his]1962-he head in acquiescence . "[1963-she] Yes . " [He]1962-he is plainly incapable of anything beyound a monosyllable . "[1963-she] [She]1963-she asked why [you]147-miss watson came here , " says [Belinda]134-belinda ; the words fluttering out on greatly quickened breath , but still with more coherence . "[1963-she] Yes ? " [One]373-one would say that [he]1962-he were scarcely attending , so distant and dreamful is [his]1962-he voice . [He]1962-he is conscious of nothing but the warmth of those wonderful sweet hands lying in [his]1962-he . If [he]1962-he could realize [Miss Watson]147-miss watson at all , it would probably be with gratitude ; for it is [she]1963-she virtually who has given [them]4467-them to [him]1962-he . "[1963-she] [She]1963-she said , " continues [Belinda]134-belinda , trembling exceedingly , and looking guiltily down on [their]4467-them locked hands , "[1963-she] that [you]147-miss watson must come here for some intrigue . " [She]0-i pauses , and then adds in a whisper , "[1963-she] [She]1963-she must not say that again . " [He]1962-he is attending now . There is a significance both in [her]0-i look and in [her]0-i low words that can not escape [him]1962-he . "[1963-she] What do [you]1963-she mean ? " [he]1962-he says thickly . "[1963-she] [I]0-i mean , " [she]0-i says , still scarcely above a whisper , "[1963-she] that [you]147-miss watson must not come here again . " [She]0-i looks away from [him]1962-he as [she]0-i says it , unwilling , perhaps , to see the immense consternation that [her]0-i fiat will have brought into [his]1962-he face ; but [he]1962-he observes for so long a dead silence , that [she]0-i grows uneasy . Has [her]0-i blow killed [him]1962-he ? or is it possible ( this latter suggestion is a scarcely less bitter one than the former ) that [he]1962-he already acquiesces ? [She]0-i is just making up [her]0-i mind to steal a glance at [him]1962-he , when [he]1962-he speaks , and the tone of [his]1962-he voice tells [her]0-i that [her]0-i first idea of [his]1962-he case was nearer the mark than [her]0-i last . "[0-i] [I]0-i am not to come here again ? " "[0-i] No , [I]0-i think not ; no ! " "[0-i] [I]0-i am not to come to [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge again ? " "[0-i] No . " "[0-i] [I]0-i am not to meet [you]0-i again ? " "[0-i] No . " "[0-i] Not anywhere ? " [She]0-i bows [her]0-i head , unable to speak . "[0-i] Never ? " [She]0-i repeats the gesture . There is such a rising strain of unbelieving agony in [his]1962-he voice , culminating in [his]1962-he last words , that speech has wholly forsaken [her]0-i . "[1964-we] [We]1964-we are to live out the rest of [our]1964-we lives without [each other]469-each other ? " Again that acquiescent motion of the head . "[1964-we] And [you]0-i can bear it?—of course , " correcting [himself]1962-he , with a bitter humility , "[1964-we] why should not [you]0-i ? it is not much for [you]0-i to bear . Well , then , [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i must bear it too ! " [He]1962-he has let go [her]0-i hands , and covered [his]1962-he face with [his]1962-he own . [She]0-i is free to depart . [He]1962-he has always obeyed [her]0-i ; and [he]1962-he is obeying [her]0-i now . What is there to keep [her]0-i ? And yet [she]0-i does not stir . [Her]0-i aching eyes stare vacantly down [the long straight alley]4468-the long straight alley . [Sweet green walk]4469-sweet green walk ! [Dear solemn tower]4470-dear solemn tower ! Kind chattering birds ! Good - bye ! for never , never can [she]0-i bear to look upon any of [you]1967-you again ! [She]0-i stirs restlessly in [her]0-i misery ; and in an instant [he]1962-he has dropped [his]1962-he shrouding hands , and is looking at [her]0-i with a haggard apprehension in [his]1962-he eyes . "[1964-we] Are [you]1966-you going now ? " "[1964-we] Not at once — not this moment , " [she]0-i answers faintly ; "[1964-we] there is no hurry . [I]0-i can stay as long as usual , if [you]1967-you wish . " If [he]1962-he wishes ! [He]1962-he laughs outright in [his]1962-he pain . There is a long , long silence . [St. Bridget 's]318-st. bridget is even emptier than [its]318-st. bridget wo nt . [Not one visitor]4471-not one visitor besides [themselves]4471-not one visitor breaks [its]318-st. bridget entire seclusion . Only [the grave tower - clock]4472-the grave tower - clock deals out time 's little parcels . [She]0-i speaks first . "[0-i] [I]0-i do not want [you]1967-you to be unhappy , " [she]0-i says , with a sort of sob of compassion for [his]1967-you spoilt youth . "[0-i] [I]0-i should like [you]1967-you to be happy . " "[1968-i.] So should [I.]1968-i. Will [you]1967-you show [me]0-i how ? " "[1967-you] Oh , if [I]0-i could ! " [she]0-i cries , in a heart - wrung accent . "[1967-you] Oh , if [we]1969-we could but be as [we]1969-we were before — " [She]0-i stops . "[1967-you] Before [Wesenstein]15-wesenstein ? " [he]1967-you says . The word seems to have roused [him]1967-you out of [his]1967-you lethargy of wretchedness . "[1967-you] [We]1969-we might almost fancy [ourselves]1969-we at [Wesenstein]15-wesenstein , might not [we]1969-we ? It is odd that [we]1969-we have never talked of it since — is not it ? Why should not [we]1969-we talk of it now ? [You]0-i sat on the grass , and [I]0-i lay at [your]0-i feet ! Do [you]0-i recollect ? Yes " ( with a heart - rending inflection ) , "[0-i] [I]0-i see that [you]0-i do . [You]0-i gave [me]0-i [your]0-i hand ! No ! [[my]0-i Ice Queen]1971-my ice queen , [you]0-i would never have given it [me]0-i ! [I]0-i took it and kissed it ; shall [I]0-i show [you]0-i where [I]0-i kissed it ? Just there — and there — and there ! " ( passionately fastening [his]4473-he lips upon palm and fingers ) ; "[0-i] and then — then [I]0-i took [you]0-i in [my]0-i arms ! Can [you]0-i believe it ? — and yet [I]0-i am speaking truth — once [I]0-i had [you]0-i in [my]0-i arms , and [I]0-i let [you]0-i go ! — [I]0-i let [you]0-i go ! Would to [God]184-god " ( with a terrible burst of agony ) "[0-i] that [I]0-i had been struck dead [there]2419-there before [I]0-i let [you]0-i go ! " The storm of [his]4473-he passion has carried [her]0-i away . "[0-i] Would to God [you]0-i had ! " [she]0-i says , frenziedly ; and so unresisting — nay , passionately complying — [she]0-i gives [him]4473-he that two years and a half ago foregone kiss . One kiss ! That is all . One drunk , oblivious moment , and then the awaking ! [She]0-i , but now so consentingly embraced , has wrenched [herself]0-i out of [his]4473-he arms . "[0-i] What — has — happened — to — [us]1973-their ? " [she]0-i says , staggering away from [him]4473-he . But [he]4473-he awakens slowlier than [she]0-i . "[0-i] [You]0-i have owed it [me]0-i , since [Wesenstein]15-wesenstein ! " [he]4473-he cries wildly , and with a sort of triumph . And there is silence . If indeed the loud blood dinning in [their]1973-their ears and hammering [their]1973-their temples can be so called . "[0-i] [I]0-i suppose , " [she]0-i says , after a while , speaking as if speech were a new weapon , and [she]0-i ill at handling it , "[0-i] that — it — has been — coming to this — all along — only — [I]0-i did not — see it . [I]0-i suppose that [no one]365-no one would believe [me]0-i — but [I]0-i did not see it ; did [you]0-i ? " [He]4473-he makes no answer . [He]4473-he is still lapped in the Elysium of that long - promised and at last fulfilled embrace . "[0-i] Is it possible , " [she]0-i says , looking piercingly at [him]4473-he , and with a sombre reproach in [her]0-i voice , "[0-i] that [you]0-i saw all along — [you]0-i knew — [you]0-i thought — " "[0-i] [I]0-i thought nothing ! " [he]4473-he cries , brought back to [his]4473-he senses by the sternness of [her]0-i tone . "[0-i] Oh , [[my]0-i dear]2421-my dear , do [you]2421-my dear think so ill of [me]0-i as to suppose that [I]0-i was willingly leading [you]2421-my dear on ? [I]0-i tell [you]2421-my dear , [I]0-i thought nothing ! [I]0-i only knew , that for two hours in every fortnight [you]2421-my dear allowed [me]0-i to live ! [you]2421-my dear let [me]0-i into the heaven of [your]2421-my dear sweet company!—was not that enough for [me]0-i ? Was [I]0-i likely to look beyond ? " [She]0-i has tottered to the bench , and now sits half - crouched in the corner of it . "[0-i] [I]0-i suppose , " [she]0-i says , shaking [her]0-i head hopelessly , "[0-i] that , in point of fact , [we]1976-we have both been living upon [[our]1976-we Sundays]1977-our sundays . " Then after a pause , with a sort of groan , "[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i thought [we]1976-we might have been trusted ! " [He]1978-you has not sat down again , but stands before [her]0-i in guilty , miserable humility , waiting for [his]1978-you doom . "[0-i] [I]0-i am not very sorry for [you]1978-you , " [she]0-i says , after a while , lifting [her]0-i dull eyes to [his]1978-you face . "[0-i] [You]1978-you are mistaken if [you]1978-you think that [I]0-i pity [you]1978-you very much . [You]1978-you have [your]1978-you work — often before now have [I]0-i been jealous of it , and of the hold it is gaining over [you]1978-you ! This is the best thing that could have happened to [you]1978-you — a sort of thing that [[your]1978-you mother]3130-your mother would rejoice at — the best test after all . No more distractions ! No more senseless outlay in railway journeys ! it is almost as good as being taken into partnership ! " [She]0-i glances up at [him]1978-you at intervals , as [she]0-i plants [her]0-i stabs , to see how much [he]1978-you can bear . [He]1978-you is not yet at the end of [his]1978-you endurance apparently , for [he]1978-you still stands before [her]0-i , bent - headed and ash - white , in motionless patience . "[494-anyone] But will [anyone]494-anyone tell [me]0-i , " [she]0-i says , dropping [her]0-i arms hopelessly to [her]0-i sides , and looking distractedly upwards , as if to win a response from that sky to which [we]4474-we , in trouble never answered , ever look , "[494-anyone] what is to become of [me]0-i ? " [Her]0-i cruelty towards [himself]1978-you [he]1978-you had taken like [a man]2618-a man ; but [her]0-i self - pity is beyond [his]1978-you sufferance . "[0-i] [I]0-i will tell [you]0-i what will become of [you]0-i , " [he]1978-you says in a rapid broken whisper , sitting down again beside [her]0-i . "[0-i] Will [you]0-i let [me]0-i tell [you]0-i ? Are [you]0-i listening ? After all , they are only a few beggarly hours that [we]1981-we have had to live upon : [I]0-i do not know how [we]1981-we have subsisted upon such a pittance for so long . What is there to prevent [us]1981-we — why should not [we]1981-we — " "[0-i] Stop ! " [she]0-i cries hoarsely , thrusting out [her]0-i spread hands , and pushing [him]1978-you away from [her]0-i . "[0-i] [I]0-i know what [you]0-i are going to say ! [I]0-i know it as well as if [you]0-i had already said it . " The terror in [her]0-i eyes , the shrinking gesture , have set [him]1978-you almost beside [himself]1978-you . "[0-i] [You]0-i say that [you]0-i are not at all sorry for [me]0-i , " [he]1978-you says , with a sort of hard sob , and [I]0-i dare say [you]0-i are right ; but [I]0-i must ask [you]0-i to — to — make a little allowance for [me]0-i ! [I]0-i am not in [my]0-i right wits . It was unmanly of [me]0-i — [I]0-i had no right to shock — to outrage [you]0-i . "[0-i] " [I]0-i am not in the least shocked , "[0-i] [she]0-i says with a slow distinctness ; " that shows , [I]0-i suppose , to what a depth [I]0-i must have fallen . [I]0-i stopped [you]1978-you because — because [I]0-i knew that if [I]0-i let [you]1978-you finish [your]1978-you sentence [I]0-i should — not — have — said — no — to [you]1978-you : [I]0-i — should — have — said — yes . "[0-i] [She]0-i pauses , unable to fetch [her]0-i breath . And yet , despite the confession in [her]0-i words of [her]0-i own defeat and [his]1982-him victory , something in [her]0-i air holds [him]1982-him aloof . " But if — "[0-i] [she]0-i goes on presently , fixing [him]1982-him with the terrible appeal of [her]0-i eyes , while [her]0-i face grows sharp and thin—"if [you]1978-you are — what [I]0-i have always thought [you]1978-you — if [I]0-i know [you]1978-you right , [you]1978-you — will — never — finish it ! "[0-i] There is a dead dead silence ; [she]0-i still holding [him]1982-him with that look , until [she]0-i knows that in [her]0-i dreary battle [she]0-i has vanquished . " And now , "[0-i] [she]0-i says with a tearless decision , " go ! [I]0-i did not tell the truth when [I]0-i said [I]0-i was not sorry for [you]1982-him ! Oh , [I]0-i am sorry ! [I]0-i AM ! There ! go!—what is the use of crying ? [I]0-i hate to see [a man]2618-a man cry ! God bless [you]1982-him ! God be with [you]1982-him ! Go ! "[0-i] And [he]1982-him , obedient , goes . " These violent delights have violent ends . "[0-i] " Unser Sommer ist nur ein grün - angestrichener [Winter]326-winter . "[0-i] The lives of [the Professor]2365-the professor , of [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth , of [Sarah]135-sarah — of all those with whom [we]1984-we have had any concern — are poorer by a full year than when [we]1984-we left [them]1985-them . The " Fragments of [Menander]287-menander "[271-mrs. forth] have been given to [the world]643-the world ; and as certainly [not less than three people]1987-not less than three people have read [them]1985-them , [they]1985-them may be said to have been a success . So much so , at all events , as to encourage [the Professor]2365-the professor to delve and grub in the entrails of [the Fathers for new Fragments]1989-the fathers for new fragments . For the present , however , [he]2365-the professor has to delve and grub alone . For the present [[his]2365-the professor secretary]1990-his secretary has broken down ; for the present the pack - horse has sunk down beneath its pack . Doubtless it will soon be set on its legs again , and enabled to resume it ; but , for the present , its back is unladen , and it is turned out to grass . Months of unlightened , hopeless , joyless labour ! [Her]135-sarah only wonder in looking back afterwards upon [them]1991-them is that [they]1991-them did not sooner work [their]1991-them inevitable effect . Months of unrelenting application , of chest - contracting bending over manuscript and proof ; of entire absence of exercise and relaxation — for of [her]135-sarah own will [she]135-sarah has forsworn both . Thought is deader , memory fainter — and for what object but to kill both does [she]135-sarah now live?—in the exhaustion consequent on overwork . Why and for whom should [she]135-sarah spare [herself]135-sarah ? [She]135-sarah will go until [she]135-sarah drops . And [the Professor]2365-the professor , delighted to acquiesce unquestioningly in a metamorphosis so greatly to [his]2365-the professor advantage , always incurious as to interests that lie out of [his]2365-the professor own beat , and with [the professed invalid]1993-the professed invalid 's radical incredulity as to the possibility of [anyone else]2603-anyone else being either sick or weary , drives [his]2365-the professor willing horse merrily along , until one fine day [she]135-sarah falls down between the shafts . How glad [she]135-sarah is when the breakdown comes ! How intensely [she]135-sarah prays that it may be the final one ! But it is not so . By whatever door [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth is to leave [this world]2462-this world , it is certainly not by that of the entire derangement of the nervous system , for which [attentive doctors]1996-attentive doctors unanimously prescribe immediate change , idleness , pleasure . [The Professor]2365-the professor is always angry with [anyone]494-anyone for being ill ; but against a sickness which involves undone work , expensive medicine , and a costly move , [his]2365-the professor indignation is too deep for words . [He]2365-the professor is scarcely more angry with [her]135-sarah , however , for falling sick , than [she]135-sarah is with [herself]135-sarah for recovering . For as long as possible [she]135-sarah has discredited it . [Her]135-sarah physic bottles vex [him]2365-the professor hardly more than do [her]135-sarah returning appetite , restored slumber , waxing flesh , and waning fever , [herself]135-sarah . [She]135-sarah had wished to die ; and [he]2365-the professor , since [she]135-sarah has turned out so unhealthy , would not be sorry to be rid of [her]135-sarah . And so [she]135-sarah lives ; lives to put [him]2365-the professor to the expense of a migration to [the English Lakes]108-the english lakes . [He]2365-the professor seems unable to shake off the idea that [she]135-sarah has done it on purpose . It has been as usual a wet morning , and to the bounds of [the Lowood Hotel on [Windermere]109-windermere [all its impatient guests]2000-all its impatient guests]1999-the lowood hotel on windermere all its impatient guests have been confined . Now that afternoon has come , it has brought with it a sort of doubtful fairness ; more a cessation of storm than anything approaching positive fine weather . [[Wray]327-wray 's Castle , lifting [its]110-wray 's castle , lifting its grey towers grey towers]110-wray 's castle , lifting its grey towers from [[its]110-wray 's castle , lifting its grey towers woods]2001-its woods exactly opposite , has come into sight again . [The Langdale Pikes]2002-the langdale pikes have just shaken the rain - clouds off their notchy crests ; but they hang poised above [them]2002-the langdale pikes , ready at once to descend and clip [them]2002-the langdale pikes . [They]2002-the langdale pikes have still fast hold of [Wetherlam]328-wetherlam , though [their]2002-the langdale pikes lucent lightness shows that the sun is just behind [them]2002-the langdale pikes , and will presently drive [[his]2365-the professor brave bright car]2003-his brave bright car over [their]2002-the langdale pikes vaporous bodies . It is very clear , from the high - flung windows of [a sitting - room on [the second floor]2005-the second floor]2004-a sitting - room on the second floor , and also from the fact of [its]2004-a sitting - room on the second floor being a sitting - room at all , firstly that [Professor Forth]136-professor forth is not in [it]2004-a sitting - room on the second floor , and secondly that it is not [his]136-professor forth . Since [[[his]136-professor forth wife]713-his wife 's sister and [grandmother]2008-grandmother]2007-his wife 's sister and grandmother have thought it necessary to give [her]713-his wife the meeting [here]2351-here , [he]136-professor forth has no objection to [her]713-his wife taking advantage of [[their]2002-the langdale pikes salon]1709-their salon , since [he]136-professor forth is quite unequal to the expense of providing [her]713-his wife with one of [her]713-his wife own . In a horse - hair arm - chair of [that peculiar lodging - house]2011-that peculiar lodging - house build which pinions the arms and forces the head forward , sits [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill , placidly watching [an unlading coach]2012-an unlading coach . At a certain somewhat early period of old age , given an easy temper and an entire absence of feeling , [a person]2445-a person often appears for a few years to stand stationary . Since [we]2014-we last saw [her]185-mrs. churchill , [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill has stood stationary . Not one more has been added to the number of [her]185-mrs. churchill few wrinkles , and [her]185-mrs. churchill old dimple still goes and comes with [her]185-mrs. churchill agreeable smile . On the sofa , by right of [her]185-mrs. churchill invalidhood , [Belinda]134-belinda is lying , with a crop head of little curls ; and out of the window not occupied by [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill , [Sarah]135-sarah is hanging most of [her]135-sarah body , alternately watching with feverish interest , and looking back over [her]135-sarah own shoulder to chronicle the doings of [the family who occupy the floor beneath [them]2016-they , and who , happily for [her]135-sarah , have a balcony upon which [they]2016-they now and then emerge]2015-the family who occupy the floor beneath them , and who , happily for her , have a balcony upon which they now and then emerge . "[135-sarah] " [I]134-belinda will take [your]135-sarah word for it , "[134-belinda] replies [Belinda]134-belinda lazily . " It makes one quite wretched to see such cruelty ! "[185-mrs. churchill] says [Mrs. Churchill]185-mrs. churchill , in a thoroughly comfortable voice , pursuing [her]185-mrs. churchill own subject . " [They]2016-they have been playing battledore and shuttlecock , "[135-sarah] says [Sarah]135-sarah narratively . "[2023-them] [They]2023-them are gone ( not , however , before [Miss Churchill]152-miss churchill has one again put in [her]152-miss churchill head to say urgently , " Mind that [you]2023-them keep a good look - out upon [them]2023-them ! "[152-miss churchill] ) , and [Belinda]134-belinda has [the sitting - room]1481-the sitting - room and all the horse - hair chairs to [herself]134-belinda . Perhaps the better to comply with [[her]134-belinda sister]2366-her sister 's exhortations , [she]134-belinda abandons the sofa , and drawing up [[her]134-belinda grandmother]2703-her grandmother 's chair yet closer to the window , looks dreamily out on [the lake]2027-the lake , from which [the hotel]1708-the hotel is parted only by [the road]392-the road , a quickset hedge , and a strip of grass . Upon [the lower foreground hills]2030-the lower foreground hills opposite — so dark a second ago — what a nation of sunbeams has swooped ! and now , as quickly [they]2023-them are gone again , and only the lawn that slopes to the water has become dazzling - green as any chrysoprase . If [she]134-belinda had died as [she]134-belinda wished , [she]134-belinda would not have seen that chrysoprase - green ; nor the masterless wavelets sucking in riot in among the stakes of [the little pier]2031-the little pier ; nor [the small white yacht]2032-the small white yacht curtseying and congeeing along over [them]2023-them . Is it worth while to have kept alive , in order to be looking at [them]2023-them here — alone ? What a noise [the family below]2033-the family below are making ? What can [they]2033-the family below be doing ? Surely [they]2033-the family below must be engaged in some pastime more violent than [battledore and shuttlecock]2034-battledore and shuttlecock . [They]2033-the family below sound as if [they]2033-the family below were throwing chairs at [each other]469-each other . How plainly [she]134-belinda can distinguish [Bellairs]329-bellairs 's voice . It was at [[St. Ursula]278-st. ursula 's party]2036-st. ursula 's party that [she]134-belinda first heard that voice . It was in answer to some sentence addressed to [her]134-belinda by that voice , that [her]134-belinda own suddenly broke down ; it was while that voice was still in [her]134-belinda ears that [she]134-belinda caught sight once again of [him]2037-him who made [her]134-belinda inattentive to all voices ! [She]134-belinda moves uneasily in [her]134-belinda chair . [She]134-belinda wishes that [Bellairs]329-bellairs had not come . What a sudden spurt of daring glory on the stern necks of [the Langdale Pikes]2002-the langdale pikes ! [She]134-belinda can see [their]2002-the langdale pikes hollow deep clefts , and their scattered verdure , broken through by green rock - masses . [She]134-belinda discovers a waterfall hanging unmoving on [the mountain flank]2039-the mountain flank . How [they]2002-the langdale pikes are giving up [their]2002-the langdale pikes grey secrets to the sun ! It is cruel to be looking at [them]2002-the langdale pikes all alone ! to have to look now and for ever at all fair sights alone ! [She]134-belinda should be used to the thought by now , surely . What is it that is giving [it]2040-it such new and pricking life to - day ? Is it [Bellairs]329-bellairs 's voice ? [She]134-belinda will hear it less , perhaps , if [she]134-belinda have some occupation to distract [her]134-belinda . [She]134-belinda takes up the advertisement - sheet of the Times , lying near [her]134-belinda , on the floor , and throws [her]134-belinda eyes over the Births , Deaths , and Marriages . For months [she]134-belinda has been unable to read the Obituary without envying [every one of [the dead people recorded in it]2042-the dead people recorded in it]2041-every one of the dead people recorded in it : [the old man]2043-the old man gently extinguished at eighty ; [the deeply - mourned wife]2044-the deeply - mourned wife , torn away in [her]2044-the deeply - mourned wife prime ; [the strong man]2045-the strong man violently perishing in flood or field ; [the tiny sister - children]2046-the tiny sister - children swept away within two days of [each other by the hot fever]2047-each other by the hot fever . There is not one among [them]2048-them all that [she]134-belinda does not envy ! [They]2048-them are out of it ! [They]2048-them have done with it ! done with the tangle , done with the heart - break , done with the strife ! [She]134-belinda envies [them]2048-them now . And through [them]2048-them all [she]134-belinda still hears plainly the voice of [Bellairs]329-bellairs . Thank [Heaven]153-heaven , however , [she]134-belinda will not hear it any more for the present . [He]2049-he has gone out . Surely that is [he]2049-he sauntering down to [the little pier]2031-the little pier , with [a smart girl in a red cotton gown]2051-a smart girl in a red cotton gown — a red cotton gown that but now incarnadined [the balcony beneath [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth]2052-the balcony beneath mrs. forth . [He]2049-he is unfastening [a little boat]2053-a little boat ; [he]2049-he is helping [[his]2049-he companion]2574-his companion in ! [Belinda]134-belinda laughs aloud . [Some one]2370-some one has been too quick for [Sarah]135-sarah ! [Some one]2370-some one has stepped down into the dinghey before [her]135-sarah ! The incident gives a lighter turn to [her]134-belinda meditations , and [she]134-belinda drops the obituary , and follows with [her]134-belinda eyes [the little boat]2057-the little boat and [its two occupants]2058-its two occupants , with as eager an attention as [[her]134-belinda sister]2366-her sister might have given it , until it becomes a speck upon the water . [She]134-belinda laughs again . There is a sound of wheels . Is it [[her]134-belinda grandmother]2703-her grandmother and [Sarah]135-sarah returning ? [She]134-belinda longs for [them]2061-them to come back , to have the pleasure of telling [them]2061-them . [She]134-belinda leans [her]134-belinda charming cropped head out of the window . No ! it is [a coach changing horses]2062-a coach changing horses ; next a char - à - banc disgorging its stiff - legged load ; and now , for variety of interest , [a steamer]2063-a steamer is coming churning up to [the little pier]2031-the little pier . Will [anyone]494-anyone get out of [it]2063-a steamer ? [Anyone]494-anyone to form a new element at the table - d'hôte to night , and be speculated about as [one]373-one speculates upon the lives and habits of [those with whom an hotel life]2068-those with whom an hotel life brings [one]373-one into brief and jostling contact ? [The steamer]2070-the steamer is crowded , black with thick - packed heads . But it seems as if [no one]365-no one were minded to alight from [her]134-belinda . Yes , [one man]2072-one man has landed ; [a man now crossing [the pier]2074-the pier with a knapsack on [his]2073-a man now crossing the pier with a knapsack on his back back]2073-a man now crossing the pier with a knapsack on his back ; [a pedestrian tourist]2075-a pedestrian tourist , obviously . If [he]2073-a man now crossing the pier with a knapsack on his back is so , perhaps [she]134-belinda may know [him]2073-a man now crossing the pier with a knapsack on his back — by sight at all events . [She]134-belinda rubs [her]134-belinda eyes . What tricks [they]2079-they play [one]373-one ! Do [they]2079-they see ill , or is there a little something in [the man]3764-the man 's gait that might remind [her]134-belinda of — but no ! it is the sight of [Bellairs]329-bellairs , and the memories [he]3764-the man has roused , that have put such an insanity into [her]134-belinda head . Perhaps sickness has left [her]134-belinda vision weak and deceptive . [He]3764-the man is drawing nearer — very near , past [the strip of grass]2082-the strip of grass , through the wicket , across [the road]392-the road . [She]134-belinda has been thrusting [her]134-belinda head out of window to have a nearer view , and the better to correct [her]134-belinda delusion . But suddenly [she]134-belinda draws it in again , and with a small , choked cry , falls back in the horse - hair chair . It is not corrected ! It is confirmed , and turned into truth and certainty . For a few moments [she]134-belinda lies stock - still . Has [her]134-belinda face caught from [Wetherlam]328-wetherlam and the Pikes some of [their]2079-they stormy illumination ? If [she]134-belinda had died , [she]134-belinda would not have seen [him]3764-the man crossing [that pier]2084-that pier , treading [that path]2085-that path , unlatching that wicket - gate ! It has been hitherto only in [her]134-belinda dreams that [he]3764-the man has ever walked towards [her]134-belinda . [She]134-belinda is glad — oh , glad — that [she]134-belinda did not die ! And what has brought [him]3764-the man hither ? Is it possible that [he]3764-the man has heard of [her]134-belinda presence here , and , unable any longer to endure those torments which had so nearly laid [her]134-belinda low , has fled hither in madness to rejoin [her]134-belinda ? But in a second [she]134-belinda has exonnerated [him]3764-the man from the suspicion . [She]134-belinda has told [him]3764-the man to go , and [he]3764-the man had gone ; and [she]134-belinda knows [him]3764-the man well enough to feel sure that , without [her]134-belinda bidding — cost [him]3764-the man what it might — [he]3764-the man would not return . It is , then , an accident ! a happy , most happy accident ! What pleasant accidents can and may happen ! For an accident [no one]365-no one can be blamed . For an accident [no one]365-no one 's conscience need smite [them]2088-them . All the consequences of an accident may be taken with an easy mind . [Her]134-belinda eyes stray away towards [the high mountains]2089-the high mountains , but once again they are grasped so close in the clouds ' moist arms , that not a glimpse of [crest or ridge]2090-crest or ridge is to be caught . Are not [they]2091-they tired of [their]2091-they centenary — nay , aeon - long fight with the vapours ? Worsted , worsting , will there never be an end to it ? It is like [her]134-belinda fight with [her]134-belinda own heart . Vapours , sunbeams , waterfalls ; to - morrow — to - morrow [she]134-belinda will be looking at [you]2092-you not alone . To - morrow ! But will [he]3764-the man be still here to - morrow ? Unless [she]134-belinda give [him]3764-the man leave to stay ( and how dare [she]134-belinda give that leave ? ) may not [he]3764-the man be off before day - dawn ? By the noise below [her]134-belinda window , [she]134-belinda knows that [another coach]2093-another coach has driven up , and is changing horses . A panic seizes [her]134-belinda . What security has [she]134-belinda that [he]3764-the man may not have halted here for only ten minutes , and be going on by it ? [She]134-belinda springs to [her]134-belinda trembling legs , and returning to the window again , looks out , but this time in hiding behind the curtain . [Two or three of [the passengers]2095-the passengers]2094-two or three of the passengers have got down , and are beginning to climb back into [their]2094-two or three of the passengers places again . Some luggage is being hauled from the roof . [She]134-belinda scans narrowly [the crowded travellers]2096-the crowded travellers , and then draws a long breath . There is not one among [them]2096-the crowded travellers that bears the most fugitive resemblance to [him]3764-the man . [She]134-belinda is reprieved . [He]3764-the man will be [here]2351-here , at all events , till to - morrow . [He]3764-the man will dine , almost certainly , at the table - d'hôte . A hot , excited smile breaks over [her]134-belinda face . [She]134-belinda will have the advantage over [him]3764-the man . [She]134-belinda will expect to see [him]3764-the man ; and [he]3764-the man will not expect to see [her]134-belinda . Will the shock be too much for [him]3764-the man ? Will [he]3764-the man be betrayed by its suddenness into any too evident and overt emotion ? But no ! [He]3764-the man is [a man]2618-a man , now ; strong and self - contained . How much older [he]3764-the man has grown to look ! Even [her]134-belinda one cursory glance has told [her]134-belinda that . A pang of regret for that passionate gone boyhood , which was so absolutely [hers]134-belinda , contracts [her]134-belinda heart . No ! [he]3764-the man will show no emotion . Perhaps [he]3764-the man will turn a shade paler . As for [her]134-belinda , [she]134-belinda will not be pale , neither red . [Her]134-belinda thought breaks off abruptly , dispersed and banished by a knock at the door . Ere [she]134-belinda can cry " Come in ! "[134-belinda] forestalling [her]134-belinda permission of admittance , one of [the heated and hurried hotel waiters]2099-the heated and hurried hotel waiters , chronically rushing from Sunday morning to Saturday night , has entered — has deposited a note before [her]134-belinda , and has disappeared ere [she]134-belinda has time to put any question as to its source and origin . Not that there is much need for such , although only twice before in all [her]134-belinda life has [she]134-belinda seen that handwriting . A mixed memory of the two former occasions rushes storming back upon [her]134-belinda mind ; a memory of the misery of that early summer morning in [Dresden]2-dresden ; of the hell of that [Folkestone]81-folkestone winter evening . [She]134-belinda has come in for a good deal of misery in [her]134-belinda day . [She]134-belinda looks in procrastination at the device on the seal — it is sealed — and at the address . Surely [his]3764-the man handwriting , too , is changed ; more virile , steadier , less emotional . [She]134-belinda holds the note between [her]134-belinda two palms ( how lately [he]3764-the man has held it in [his]3764-the man ! ) in a trembling luxury of delay . It is only the recollection of how soon , how immediately , how at once , [her]134-belinda solitude may be put an end to by the return of [[her]134-belinda sister]2366-her sister and [grandmother]2008-grandmother , that at length decides [her]134-belinda to open it . What can [he]3764-the man have to say to [her]134-belinda ? Not much , whatever it is . It will not take [her]134-belinda long to read . " [I]3764-the man have just seen [your]3764-the man name in the Visitors ' Book ; believe [me]3764-the man , it is by a pure accident that [I]3764-the man am [here]2351-here ; must [I]3764-the man go ? If [I]3764-the man do not see [you]3764-the man at the table - d'hôte [I]3764-the man shall understand that [I]3764-the man must . "[3764-the man] D.R. " Long after [she]134-belinda has mastered its contents — surely not difficult of comprehension — [she]134-belinda remains staring at the page with wide dull eyes : a feeling of blankest disappointment at [her]134-belinda heart . And yet , had [she]134-belinda expected [him]3764-the man , in writing , on a paper committed to a careless hand — a paper that might easily go astray , or be lost — to break out into compromising , culpable endearments ? [She]134-belinda would be outraged by the suggestion . But oh ! it is cruel , cruel of [him]3764-the man to have thrust the weight of the decision upon [her]134-belinda ; to have taken [their]4500-their meeting out of [the province of accident into which [she]134-belinda had joyfully recognised it as having fallen]4501-the province of accident into which she had joyfully recognised it as having fallen ! Since [he]3764-the man has forced choice upon [her]134-belinda , there is but one way in which [she]134-belinda can choose . [He]3764-the man must have known it ! [He]3764-the man must have done it on purpose ! Honourable of [him]3764-the man ? Perhaps ! [Her]134-belinda mind gives a frigid assent . But oh , cold , cold , and most cruel ! [His]3764-the man very face had told [her]134-belinda that [he]3764-the man was changed . [He]3764-the man has grown wise at last . Well , [he]3764-the man shall never know that [she]134-belinda was not as wise as [he]3764-the man . [She]134-belinda has crumpled the paper angrily in [her]134-belinda hand , and begun to walk agitatedly up and down [the room]422-the room , pressing and kneading it with [her]134-belinda fevered fingers . Then [her]134-belinda mood changes , and [she]134-belinda stops and anxiously smooths out the letter again . Perhaps [she]134-belinda is wronging [him]3764-the man . Perhaps in the first stun of that surprise [he]3764-the man has scarcely known what [he]3764-the man wrote ; has not perceived the drift of [his]3764-the man own words . Perhaps , on a closer examination , [she]134-belinda may find , by the tremulousness of [his]3764-the man characters , that [he]3764-the man had not [his]3764-the man wits about [him]3764-the man . But no . There is no tremulousness . Strong and decided is each up and down stroke . [The man who penned that note]4503-the man who penned that note was obviously in fullest possession of [his]3764-the man intellect and mastery over [his]3764-the man nerves . [She]134-belinda is still poring over the few matter - of - fact words , vainly trying to wrench them into a sense that [they]4504-they can not bear , when a high , light laugh , which can not be ascribed to [anyone]494-anyone but [Miss Churchill]152-miss churchill , heard on [the landing outside]4506-the landing outside , makes [her]134-belinda , in guilty haste , thrust the document into [her]134-belinda pocket . It is only just in time ; for there is always a sort of whirlwind suddenness about [Sarah]135-sarah 's entries . "[3764-the man] Well ! " cries [she]0-i , in high excitement , "[2103-he] have [you]2102-you kept a good look - out , as [I]0-i told [you]2102-you ? Has [he]2103-he discovered that [I]0-i am here ? Where is [he]2103-he ? what has [he]2103-he been doing ? " It is a proof how far [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth 's thoughts have been straying from [the young gentleman in question]4507-the young gentleman in question , that at first [she]134-belinda looks back at [[her]134-belinda sister]2366-her sister in blank stupidity , not understanding to what or whom [she]134-belinda alludes . "[2103-he] Who ? " [she]134-belinda says thickly ; "[2103-he] what ? — Oh ! " ( with a forced laugh ; comprehension coming tardily back ) , "[2103-he] of course ! but [I]0-i have bad news for [you]2102-you : [he]2103-he went out at once in a dinghey — [I]0-i do not think [they]2104-they call them dingheys here — but at all events in a little cockboat — with [the girl in red]2105-the girl in red . " "[2103-he] Did [he]2103-he ? " replies [Sarah]135-sarah , simulating the first symptoms of a swoon , and falling in a heap upon the sofa ; "[2103-he] then , [granny]721-granny , cut [my]0-i stay - laces , and burn every goose - quill [you]721-granny can find in [the room]422-the room under [my]0-i nose ; for there is nothing left [me]0-i but to faint ! " [[The Professor]2365-the professor 's room]4510-the professor 's room , as well as [[Belinda]134-belinda 's own]4511-belinda 's own , is at [the top of [the house]2521-the house]4512-the top of the house . [Economy]330-economy , as is well known , has to be sought in [hotels]4514-hotels by climbing ; and [the Professor]2365-the professor has pursued [her]135-sarah to the leads . At [their]2104-they first coming , indeed , the numerous flights of stairs to be surmounted ere attaining [her]135-sarah sloped roof and [her]135-sarah trucklebed , had proved a severe tax upon [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth 's enfeebled strength ; but use and returning health have made them easy . At all events , [Belinda]134-belinda does not now think twice about climbing them , even if no absolute necessity prompt the assent . Is it absolute necessity that , half an hour after [Sarah]135-sarah 's return , finds [her]135-sarah first faintly knocking , and then looking uncertainly into [[[her]135-sarah husband]3353-her husband 's room]4517-her husband 's room . "[2103-he] Who is there ? who is keeping the door open , and creating a draught ? Pray shut it at once ! " cries a crabbed voice from the interior . [She]135-sarah complies by entering . Owing to the confined space allotted to [him]2365-the professor , [the Professor]2365-the professor has to use some nicety of management in the disposition of [[his]2365-the professor property]4519-his property — a disposition which entails the entire going to the wall of [his]2365-the professor toilette arrangements . Both bed and floor are strewn with folios and MS . , which are piled , to the exclusion of basin and ewer , even upon the cramped washhand - stand .
