"[2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood] [She]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood stops abruptly , for [the woman [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood addresses]2317-the woman she addresses has turned ghastly , unaccountably pale . The evening is one of extraordinary stillness . On the satiny water the heavens lie exactly copied , cloud for cloud , clear sky - field for clear sky - field ! That strange pallid effulgence — lessened indeed , fainting away by slow degrees into obscurity — is yet still there ; an effulgence not of the gold and carmines and purples that one usually associates with sunset ; but of a paler , whiter , lunar quality . Again those sobs rise in [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood throat . Oh , lovely , ironical world ! when will [you]2318-you cease jeering [us]2319-us in [our]2319-us misery ? And now it is night . [She]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood has gone to bid [[her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood husband]3353-her husband good - night . "[2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood] " [You]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood can shut the door , "[3353-her husband] replies [he]3353-her husband , with a snarl ; " a thing that , since the beginning of [my]3353-her husband acquaintance with [you]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood , [I]3353-her husband have never known [you]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood do ! and since it is already past [my]3353-her husband usual hour for retiring to bed , [I]3353-her husband will ask [you]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood to shut it upon the outside ! "[3353-her husband] And now the night has to be faced . With what dread has [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood watched the slow declension of the summer evening ; but no dread comes up to the reality , to the miserable endless hours of hand - to - hand fighting with the terrible battalions of thought and remorses , that come up , ever fresh and fresh , against [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood ; that , while all around [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood are softly sleeping , take [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood by the throat in the blackness , and will not let [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood go . To no dream or nightmare , indeed , does [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood give the opportunity to torment [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood , for [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood makes no attempt to sleep . Fully dressed , widely , burningly awake , [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood sits all night writing , writing , writing endless letters of farewell to [him]3353-her husband , who , parted from [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood [only by a flimsy lath - and - plaster partition]2322-only by a flimsy lath - and - plaster partition , lies tossing in the light and uneasy dozes of old age . How many does [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood write ? They must be a score , at least ; prayers for forgiveness , cries of remorse ; and no sooner are they written than [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood tears them all . Prayers for forgiveness of a wrong that is unforgivable ! Cries of remorse for a sin that [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood action shows [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood has not really repented of ! Why insult [him]3353-her husband by such ? The dawn has come by the time that [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood has at length written the three lines which , without reading over — if [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood read them over , [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood knows that [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood would tear them too — [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood feverishly folds and places in an envelope . In them there is neither petition nor repentance . " [I]134-belinda am going to leave [you]3353-her husband for always . [You]3353-her husband can not think that [I]134-belinda have been a worse wife to [you]3353-her husband than [I]134-belinda think [myself]134-belinda . "[134-belinda] [Belinda]134-belinda . " To have toiled all night for such an outcome ! [She]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood walks to the window , feeling stiff and chilled . The morning is bringing all night 's secrets to light . Again [the wooded hill]4813-the wooded hill rises a hand - breadth off ; the little patch of sky that [it]4813-the wooded hill allows [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood to see is putting on day 's blue livery . Well , then , it has come ! There is no going back now ! no more shilly - shallying ! There is nothing for it but to make the best of it ! [She]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood has turned from the window , and accidentally faced [herself]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood in the glass . What a spectacle ! What heavy smouches under the eyes ! What baked white lips ! But in [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood face , is there something else , too ? something new and unqualifiable ? Is it already beginning to assume that pitiful , brazen look , that [women such as [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood wear]4814-women such as she wear ? Well , if it is , what wonder ? If it is , there is no help for it ! The time is so short — so short now ! Surely for that short time [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood can manage to keep thought at bay ? [She]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood moves noiselessly about , busying [herself]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood with this and that . How near the time is now ! At such an hour [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood is to set off . It is within five minutes of that hour . [She]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood has ordered over - night [a carriage]4497-a carriage to convey [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood . It is three minutes past the appointed hour , and [the carriage]2361-the carriage is not yet [here]2351-here . Perhaps there has been some mistake ! Perhaps it was never ordered ! But no sooner has this sickly hope — that is scarcely a hope either — flared up in [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood mind , than it is extinguished again . "[134-belinda] [The carriage]2361-the carriage is ready , [ma'am]1629-ma'am , " says [a waiter]2214-a waiter , approaching [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood . " There is nothing for it but to get in . " And now [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood is off ! The die is cast ! Nothing has happened to prevent [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood . To the last moment [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood has dimly believed that something would happen to prevent [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood . But no ! nothing has ! No fire has fallen from heaven to consume [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood ! No accident has occurred to hinder [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood ! By what small accidents — happening at the last moment — have [other people]736-other people been saved ! No accident comes to save [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood ! Neither [God]184-god nor [man]2737-man cares what becomes of [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood ! The morning is lovely , with morning 's fresh look of newness , as if the ancient hills had but just been turned out of [their]4830-their Maker 's workshop . Lapis - blue is [the lake]2027-the lake , as [a summer lake]4832-a summer lake should be ; and with [its]2027-the lake little islands laughing in summer forest - green upon [its]2027-the lake radiant lap . Over one mountain shoulder , indeed , a few slight cloud - shadows , thrown light as gauzy scarves , still lie . But on [[his]4833-his brothers]4834-his brothers ' granite knees there is strong resolute sunshine , and in [their]4834-his brothers ravines shadows cut hard and black . Oh , cruel world ! Again [you]4835-you are jeering [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood with [you]4835-you beauty ! [Her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood eyes roll wildly round , and thought after thought courses with mad rapidity through [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood head . Little irrelevant incidents out of far - away childhood , fragments of forgotten books , texts of Scripture . "[0-i] [I]0-i will look unto [the hills]2078-the hills from whence cometh [my]0-i help ! " That is what teases [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood most . And yet what applicability is there in it to [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood ? Does any help come from [the hills]2078-the hills to [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood ? Beneath the trees that lip [the lake]2027-the lake , and through whose leafage come ever glimpses of [its]2027-the lake dazzling gaiety , the sweet road winds . Along [it]2027-the lake [some of [the inmates of [the hotel]1708-the hotel]4839-the inmates of the hotel]4838-some of the inmates of the hotel are leisurely walking , and , as [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood passes , look up to nod and smile at [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood . Would [they]4838-some of the inmates of the hotel nod and smile at [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood did [they]4838-some of the inmates of the hotel know whither and on what errand [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood is bent ? What right has [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood to leave [them]4838-some of the inmates of the hotel under such a delusion ? [She]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood must undeceive [them]4838-some of the inmates of the hotel . So distraught is [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood brain that [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood leans out of [the carriage]2361-the carriage to accomplish this lunatic purpose , but [they]4838-some of the inmates of the hotel are already left behind . How fast [the driver]4616-the driver drives ! Why does [he]4616-the driver drive so fast ? [She]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood calls out to [him]4616-the driver to go slower ; and then , with a new and contradictory longing that it should be over , should be irrevocable , bids [him]4616-the driver drive faster again . And still , numberless as sand - grains , quicker than lightning , the thoughts rush through [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood head . It is a sentence out of "[0-i] Sartor Resartus " now that is beating and hammering in [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood brain ; a "[0-i] Sartor Resartus " casually left behind by [some stray guest at [the hotel]1708-the hotel]4843-some stray guest at the hotel , and as casually opened by [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood yesterday . "[1629-ma'am] Love not Pleasure ; Love God : This is the Everlasting Yea ! " Why should it buzz in [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood ears ? What has it to say to [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood ? How short the drive is ! [The roofs of [Keswick]131-keswick]4845-the roofs of keswick are already in sight . That was a short drive , too — the drive to [church]613-church on [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood marriage morning . With what dreadful vividness does it now return in each detail of its pinched and icy misery upon [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood memory ; [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood sitting there in dead despairing obstinacy , and [Sarah]135-sarah sobbing beside [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood , telling [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood that it was not too late ! [Sarah]135-sarah was right . It was not too late then . If [Sarah]135-sarah were here now , would [she]135-sarah still tell [her]135-sarah that it is not too late ? Oh , why is not [she]135-sarah here then ? At every step of [the road]392-the road [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood agony heightens , and a cold sweat stands on [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood forehead . It is not too late ! It is not too late ! This is written in letters of fire all over [the mountains]4760-the mountains ; all over [the lapis lake]4849-the lapis lake and sapphire sky . It is not too late ! How plainly [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood can read the words ! [They]4850-they are taking the character of a command ! It is not too late ! Dare [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood disobey such a mandate ? "[0-i] Stop ! " [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood cries , standing up suddenly , like [one possessed]4851-one possessed . But [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood emotion is so overpowering , and [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood throat so dry , that no sound issues from it . The horse still trots rapidly on . "[0-i] Stop ! " [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood repeats , but once again [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood disobedient organs play [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood false , and the horse trots on . "[0-i] Stop ! " [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood cries frantically , a third time ; and now , at last , [the coachman]477-the coachman hears , and pulls up . "[0-i] Go back ! " [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood says hoarsely , and almost unintelligibly ; "[1629-ma'am] go back to [the hotel]1708-the hotel ! " then , becoming aware , though sight is dim and head giddy , of the unbounded astonishment depicted on [his]477-the coachman face—"I[0-i] — [I]0-i — have forgotten something ! " "[2331-we] [We]2331-we shall lose [the train]949-the train , [ma'am]1629-ma'am , " [he]477-the coachman answers , civilly demurring ; "[1629-ma'am] [we]2331-we have not too much time as it is . " "[1629-ma'am] Go back ! " [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood repeats , huskily ; and then , indeed , wondering , [he]477-the coachman obeys . [She]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood sinks back , and covers [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood face with [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood hands . What has [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood done ? [She]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood forbids [herself]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood to ask or think . But has [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood done it in vain ? If , during [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood absence , [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood letter has been discovered , [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood will have returned in vain . Even if it has not been already discovered , every minute that passes lessens [its]949-the train chance of escape . At this very moment it may be being found , and [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood will have turned back in vain . "[1629-ma'am] How slow [you]2334-you drive ! " [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood cries harshly ; "[1629-ma'am] drive quicker ! quicker ! " How could [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood ever have thought the distance short ? It is immeasurably , unbelievably long ! [The hotel]1708-the hotel is in sight ! [A few people]4854-a few people are standing about the door . Have [they]4854-a few people heard ? Are [they]4854-a few people talking about it ? The fly has stopped . Is [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood in time ? It seems as if there were an ominous silence about the idlers hanging round . Have [they]4854-a few people heard ? [She]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood dare not look [the waiter]2174-the waiter , who comes to help [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood out , in the face . [She]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood staggers past [him]2174-the waiter into [the hall]3033-the hall ; then , by a tremendous effort , steadying [herself]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood , [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood rushes [upstairs]1081-upstairs . Is [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood in time ? Flight after flight [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood mounts , with that question surging in [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood ears . [She]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood has reached [[her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood room]2688-her room — has burst into [it]2688-her room . Is [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood in time ? One glance gives [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood the answer . Yes , [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood is ! Undisturbed , exactly as [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood had left them upon the top of the chest of drawers , lie letter and packet . [She]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood is in time ! Oh , the relief of that thought ! And yet , so complicatedly contradictory are [we]4859-we , that , at the sight so madly desired , a distinct pang of disappointment crosses [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood heart . Had the letter been discovered , there would have been the one and only refuge left [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood , and [no one]365-no one could then have blamed [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood for availing [herself]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood of it . [She]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood starts , shuddering at [herself]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood . Is [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood already repenting of [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood repentance ? What security has [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood that [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood may not again go back from it ? Within [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood there is none ; if there is a security for [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood , it must be one outside [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood . [She]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood has taken the letter into [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood hand , and stands for a few moments motionless ; a desperate determination gaining strength in [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood heart , and painting itself on [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood haggard yet resolute face . Since the letter has not yet been delivered to [him]4861-his , [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood [herself]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood will deliver it . [She]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood will tell [him]4861-his under what circumstances it was written . This shall be [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood expiation . Without giving [herself]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood time for hesitation , [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood moves quickly out of [the room]422-the room , and knocks at [[her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood husband]3353-her husband 's door . There is no answer , and [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood knocks again . Still no reply . Perhaps , though it is not likely , [he]4861-his may be out . So [she]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood enters . No , [he]4861-his is in [his]4861-his usual seat , by [his]4861-his improvised writing - table . [He]4861-his could not have heard . [His]4861-his attitude is not quite [his]4861-his usual one , for [he]4861-his is apparently unoccupied , leaning back in [his]4861-his chair , and with [his]4861-his head bent a little forwards on [his]4861-his chest . [He]4861-his must be thinking , and will probably chide [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood for disturbing [him]4861-his . Well , it can not be helped . [Heaven]153-heaven knows [he]4861-his has cause enough to chide [her]2316-the lady with whom she had been on friendly terms at lowood ! "[1629-ma'am] Can [I]0-i speak to [you]2335-he ? " [Her]0-i voice sounds strangely resonant in [this silent room]2336-this silent room . There is no answer , nor does [[her]0-i husband]3353-her husband show , by any movement or slightest change of position , that [he]2335-he is aware of [her]0-i vicinity . It is very odd . [She]0-i has spoken loudly and distinctly , and [he]2335-he is not deaf . [He]2335-he must be asleep ; and yet , [he]2335-he is not apt to fall asleep in the morning ! A chill terror is creeping over [her]0-i , but [she]0-i tries to shake it off . [Her]0-i nerves are unstrung . Why should not [he]2335-he be asleep ? How apt [old people]3133-old people are to slide into a doze . Conquering the nameless , senseless dread of approaching [him]2335-he that has come over [her]0-i , [she]0-i walks firmly up to [him]2335-he , and laying [her]0-i hand on [his]2335-he arm , stoops and looks into [his]2335-he face . The next instant a sharp shriek rings through [the hotel]1708-the hotel , and when [frightened visitors]2340-frightened visitors and [chamber - maids]2341-chamber - maids , hurrying from all quarters , reach [the room]422-the room , [they]2340-frightened visitors find [Mrs. Forth]271-mrs. forth lying stretched on the floor beside [[her]0-i husband]3353-her husband , as inanimate as [he]2335-he . Only that in time [they]2340-frightened visitors bring [her]0-i round again . As for [him]2335-he , [he]2335-he has for ever vindicated [his]2335-he character from the imputation of being [a malade imaginaire]2119-a malade imaginaire , and the Professorship of Etruscan in [the University of [Oxbridge]5-oxbridge]75-the university of oxbridge is vacant !
